campaign.story:
IF YOU LIVE IN THE EU (and some other countries) PLEASE READ THIS
If your country isn't in the list of places this Kickstarter ships to you can place your order over on my Etsy page: http://sockmuffinstudio.etsy.com/
As you may have heard KS does not provide the option to charge VAT on pledges. This means I cannot accept pledges from certain countries as I'm required to charge VAT for them by law.  All purchases from the Etsy shop will receive the same freebies as those on Kickstarter so you won't miss out on anything! I'm sorry for the trouble.  
There are two things that have been a constant in my life: my love for wolves and the stars - and I like to think that I'm not the only one.
It's probably a bit strange to describe wolves and the vast unknown universe we live in as comforting but that's exactly what I'm going to do anyway. This pin set features wolves accompanied by words that have brought me great comfort in the past, helping me through some rough times.
These 4 'wise wolves' are also joined by their tiny chongus siblings who are just here to look cute and round. Because sometimes 'just cute' is needed. 
In case you wonder why I'm only charging 200 GBP for this many pins - I will be investing some of my own money in this project so you won't have to worry about your favourite design not getting unlocked! 
This campaign is pretty straightforward. Once the funding goal is hit all pins will be unlocked. At the moment I have no plans of making additional stretch goals but if we go well over the funding goal that may change!
The 'Wise Wolf' pins are all 8 GBP and the Tiny Chongus(es?) are 7 GBP.  If you buy 4 or more Wise Wolf pins you will receive 1 Tiny Chongus pin for free. 
Once the campaign finishes you will be able to select which pin(s) you'd like to receive (that includes any freebies!) via a survey. 
If you would like to get any additional pins check out the add-on section. You can see it when you pledge and after you pledge it will show up if you go to select 'edit your pledge'. If you have any trouble with add-ons please contact me and I will get in touch with you to get it sorted :)
All the pins will be hard enamel with gold plating but the sizes are different so please make certain to check those out.

Wise Wolf Pins
 I *said* no stretch goals, but with the overwhelming support on this project I decided to add one more pin after all.  As long as we keep the total above 2100 GBP this pin will be unlocked too!
Tiny Chongus
Please keep in mind that the pin colours may look slightly different on the final product than they appear on your screen. This is due to screen calibration, as well as the way enamel pantones are mixed. Additionally small changes may have to be made to the designs for production. 
In a perfect world I would expect the timeline from the KS going live, to the pins arriving, to look like this:
May: KS goes live!
End of May: KS finishes.
June: KS funds come in so production can start!
July: Expected to see first pin samples.
August: Pins should arrive with me and are quality checked.
September: Rewards are sent out.
As discussed in the Risks and Challenges there may be delays but I promise you to keep everyone in the loop if this arises.
All pledges of 3 or fewer pins will be sent out in jiffy bags. All pledges of 4 or more pins, and any including prints, will be shipped in small cardboard boxes. Suffice to say I will make certain all pins will be carefully packaged to protect them on their journey to you. I will notify everyone when shipping starts.
Please keep in mind that I'm located in the UK and that shipping to addresses outside of the UK can take up to 8 weeks to arrive due to ongoing pandemic.
Your rewards will not be sent with track and trace by default. If you would like to add track and trace please contact me.
I don't like to talk about myself much (and let my work do the talking instead) but it feels weird not to mention at least a little bit! I'm Dee, also known as Eltha or Grumpy Gryphon. I'm a 34 years old fulltime fantasy artist who specialises in pin design and production. If you would to see more of my work you can check me out on Instagram and Twitter @GrumpyGryphon. I also have a website (that I share with my girlfriend, she makes all the plushies!) over at https://www.sockmuffin.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having been in the business of producing enamel pins for over 2 years I have experienced all the highs and lows that come with producing pins and as a result feel like I am prepared to tackle any problems that may arise. Additionally I have run 5 successful Kickstarter campaigns before, so I'm not new to this. 

I have a good working relationship with the factory that will be producing these pins but in case issues arise after all, I have a back-up factory as well. Finally I would like to address that due to the worldwide effects from covid cargo space continues to be extremely limited. I do not expect this to improve before the end of the year. It is possible this may delay the shipment of the pins to me, but I would not expect this to be more than a couple of weeks of delay and I have already taken this extra time into account on the timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We made it! Reward surveys have been sent out!
updates.update_content:
Once again I would like to thank all of your for your support for this campaign. Last night (for me anyway) we finished it, smashing all the goals I had set so now it's time to get started on this project!
So what happens next? First up are the surveys. All reward tiers should have received their survey now, so make certain to check your inbox for an email about that. You may also wish to double check that your pledge payment has gone through as I noticed a fair number of failed pledges, Kickstarter will have sent you an update about that too. 
Please note that it's extremely important that you answer the survey. I will be unable to ship rewards to you unless you fill out the survey because I won't receive your address details until you do. Also it will help me determine how many of each design I have to order ;)

updates.update_userinfo: Why did I use 'too truly' instead of 'too fondly' on that pin?
updates.update_content:
I've received a lot of questions about why my pin design uses too truly. I've addressed it on Twitter but realise I should address it here too!
It's not a mistake and a very conscious decision.
The original version of this poem was published in 1868 and uses too truly. It also had a different title called Twilight Hours.

I know, I know, technically we still have an hour left on the poll to decide on the quote for the pin but with more than half of the backers having cast a vote we have a clear winner (seriously, 82% of you voted for this quote). 

Many of you said this quote gave you hope and I agree! A perfect way to finish this set.

updates.update_userinfo: POLL TIME! Help me decide on the quote for the final pin!
updates.update_content:
Heck, when I said that I will design one (1) more pin if we hit 2.1k GBP I wasn't expecting that we'd hit it, let alone so soon. So, once again, thank you so much for your incredible support!
So, I've set myself down this evening and sketched out the final pin design. I hope all of you like it (and the quote)! My sketches are always a bit rough so ahem, please bear with that. I'll try and get it inked and finished tomorrow. This pin will be available to choose from as a 'Wise Wolf' pin.

updates.update_userinfo: Sketch for one more pin design!
updates.update_content:
Okay so technically I should have made this post 10 minutes after the project went live (I was absolutely blown away by the speed!) but I also wasn't quite sure what to write other than THANK YOU! Sorry, I'm terrible with words, but getting this support on such a personal project means the world to me.
As stated on the page I don't have any stretch goals planned (right now) unless we go well over the initial goal. The exact number is if we hit 2.1k GBP or more in pledges. If we end up hitting this I will look into adding 1 more pin design.

campaign.story:
Our underwear is made with an extremely comfortable 92/8 Polyester/Spandex blend, and lined in the intimate areas with organic cotton for those with more sensitive needs. Think of the comfort of Modal or Bamboo fabrics, with the added benefit of having stunning designs as well. Black, navy and white can get so boring.


Want to take a closer peek at the designs? You can see all 6 we have available here!

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Ok, but who made these though?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Many online clothing stores you see these days operate on a print-to-order basis.

What does that mean? That means that you can slap a design on to their website and put it up for sale right away. No start up costs and no planning whatsoever. It also means you don't get to assure the quality of your product, nor your print. It means you have no idea who made your clothes nor the conditions in which they are manufactured. It means you are likely sending out products to customers with your design on it that are poor quality and badly made. It means you're limited to making whatever they are capable of printing on.

At Nomad Complex, we don't do that. We refuse it.

Every piece of clothing we put out passes through our hands from start to finish. From the concept of the design, to its creation, to the materials used to create our garments, to sampling what the final product will be before it goes out to a customer, to packing and shipping everything ourselves. This way, we know what quality of merchandise you're getting because we've been in charge of it - Every step of the way.

This process foregoes the ease and low setup cost that comes with print to order, however, and to create these quality clothes we turn to Kickstarter to procure the funds to do so. You couldn't have clothes of this quality created on a print to order website - Or at all.

We've already sampled the products. We've done the testing. We've put them through the wash 60 times to ensure the colors won't fade. Now it's time to get them into your hands.

Say NO to cheap quick clothes. Say YES to quality clothes that'll last you for years.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We have tested dozens of material samples and stitching techniques in order to ensure a long-lasting quality in all of our loungewear. Digital sublimation printing ensures a long-lasting print that can stand dozens of washes as well as take heat well in the dryer. We continue our commitment to quality assurance at every step and refuse to ever resort to dropship fulfillment services for our products - Every product you receive is inspected, packed and shipped by our own staff, not a third party.
Reusability and recyclability
All of our clothing is designed to be your new favorite piece. We reject the idea of fast fashion and outfits you wear only once - We embrace the idea that a piece of clothing is something to be loved, cherished forever, worn to death, stitched back up, and passed on to someone else if you no longer wish to have it. That's our mantra.

All of our packaging is minimal - We do not wrap our clothing in harmful plastics. All of our shipping materials are made from 100% recycled materials.
Environmentally friendly factories
We have been working with the same manufacturer since we began our company in 2016, and have personally verified the conditions and quality of the area where our clothing is produced. Not only that, but we've even had a hand in running the presses once or twice ourselves.
Sustainable Distribution
Did we mention our motto of loving your clothes until they die? We mean it. Anyone can buy a certain color of a pair of pants, or they can buy cheap clothes that will only last them a few wears before they get thrown away, but ours are different. They'll stand up to everything you throw at them, and they look so good that you'll never want to give them away. That's how we think of clothes, and we hope you do too.

project_data.project_name: Nomad Complex - Look as good as you feel on the inside

campaign.story:
My name is Katie Croonenberghs and I love exploring nature. Living in the Pacific Northwest I'm always looking out at it admiring the mountains, tall trees and greenery of the land. Beauty can come in many forms, and with this I felt the desire to explore more materials and methods of creating unique collectible and enjoyable nature designs.  It's time to explore wood pins and washi tape.

Taking on the task of creating pin designs that work well in wood - one that has proven to be a challenge beyond what I've done in enamel and metal pins so far - I'm excited to finally reveal this year's collection!


Why Wood?
As a renewable resource the idea of wood pins speaks to me from a place of environmental health and represents not only my love for nature but a greater appreciation of it. I wanted to create something that holds that bond to the wood element, but still has the magic of dragons. 

Washi Tape
Washi is a type of versatile decorative tape made from natural fibers like hemp and bamboo, is biodegradable, can be written on and is easily torn by hand.  It doesn't leave behind a sticky residue so it can be used to decorate pretty much anything! It's the perfect combination of a usable eco-friendly item and artwork in one.
Each washi tape design was painted in watercolor and Inspired by scenes and plants of the Pacific Northwest. It includes Creeping Dogwood, Fir Tree branches, River Rocks and Fern, and Mountain Forest. Scroll down for images of these.

All other stretch goals have been hit! To give us a final push to the finish,  a holographic sticker of "Crescent" will be added free to every pledge if we can reach $10k. Time to share widely so we can reach this freebie! We're already so close :)



The Limited Edition Pin - Gold Leaf 
Actual Photo
I had a concept of wood and gold that I couldn't get out of my head for many months. In January I started researching how to do it, and through many multiple (and many failed) trials, tests and prototypes I finally was able to achieve my vision! 
This year I'm taking a very hands-on approach to creating the Limited Edition pins. Because of the nature of the wood and gold leaf, each pin has several steps needed to achieve the final look - gold leaf applied to the moon and then a layer of clear lacquer to seal it in and intensify the grain of the cherry wood with shine.
Actual Photo
 Because the process of applying the gold leaf and seal is lengthy, the pins this year will be limited to only 50, and will be priced at a level that reflects the amount of hands-on work needed to make them. Please note that because of the nature of the materials and that they're hand embellished, there *will* be small imperfections. This also means that each and every LE pin will also be slightly different and unique!

About the Limited Edition Pin - "Luna"
Extra large 2.5 inches from nose to tail (vertical) and 2.25 inches wide
3 pin posts with butterfly clasps
Made in the USA of cherry wood
Hand-applied gold leaf and lacquer finish
Comes with signed and numbered backing card, given in order of pledge - the earlier the pledge the lower the LE number
Limited to only 50!

** If you wish to receive a Limited Edition pin AND  any open edition pin, you must pledge to the Limited Edition tier (since they are limited), then use the add-on section to add extra pins or washi. See the bottom of the page for more details. Remember you can edit your pledge at any time while the campaign is running.


 The open edition wood pins 
Actual Photo
 This year I'm offering a set of large wood pins with a few enamel pins in addition to unlock. The wood pins are bigger than the enamel pins which give them more impact and show greater detail. All wood pins have been physically proofed to make sure everything is just right. Each wood pin will have 3 pin posts and come with butterfly clasps. Because each piece of wood is unique, there will be slight differences in grain and color between pins.

All pins will have their own matching backing cards that perfectly compliment their design. You may also opt out of backing cards during the survey if going green is your style.

A NOTE ABOUT SIZES: All colored enamel pin designs offered are created within a 2x2 inch square, (except Happy Lucky Dragon is 1.25 inches) while the wood pins are created based on the longest side being 2.5 inches. Because of the manufacturing process, some pins may feel heftier or larger than others due to how wide or narrow the design is, and the wood pins are naturally lighter than the enamel and metal  designs.

The Happy Lucky Dragon pin is a bit smaller than the usual 2 inch pins, but I felt this size difference would be important to create something even a more casual pin wearer and dragon lover could wear every day! The Rose Gold plating is the first to be released with three more colors to unlock.

*The Distill dragons with rainbow metal are soft enamel with clear epoxy added to give the appearance and feel of hard enamel pins. 



To start, there are only three reward tiers to keep things simple! You will be able to add any unlocked open edition pin or washi tape set to any of the tiers. You can edit your pledge at any time while the Kickstarter is running by coming back to this page,  and you will not be charged for anything until the campaign ends on May 8th. During the 'checkout' part of your pledge you will see the option to add as many pins as you like at the special $13 price - specific designs will be chosen during the survey once the Kickstarter campaign is over.
 JUST ADDED: A pre-built tier for the full set of open edition wood pins! You can still add extra pins and washi to this tier.
Washi tapes are 15 mm wide and come in rolls of 10 meters long. Individual rolls will be available for $4 each, so the set will get you a discount for all four. Additional sets are $15.


 HOW TO ADD PINS OR WASHI TO YOUR PLEDGE 
1. Select a reward tier and your shipping country and press Continue.
2. In the next step you'll see the tier you chose plus a list of add-ons you can select! 
You will also be able to add more pins, single washi rolls and any surprise items in the survey after the campaign is over via Backerkit - there's no way to miss out on getting the pin(s) you want, so don't worry! The survey is how you will choose which open edition pin design(s) you want. You may choose from any of the unlocked open edition designs pictured in this campaign and from past campaigns, see the full list below.

As a 2021 Kickstarter special to help kick off the wood pins, the first pin of any style is $15 and all additional pins are only $13! You can add pins to the washi tier as well, and the washi will count as your first "pin" of $15. 

***NOTE: Limited Edition pins are not available for add-ons, so if you wish to get a Limited Edition pin AND any other pin(s), you must pledge to the Limited Edition tier and then use the add-ons section during checkout for extra pins.

Add-ons cannot be added onto the "Pledge Without Reward" tier because it does not collect an address or shipping.

No extra shipping charges no matter how many pins you add! Shipping is a flat $5 for US and $15 for international.
*Shipping countries include: USA, Canada, Germany, Austria, Australia and Norway.



SHIPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL BACKERS
*Due to extreme fluctuations in shipping rates and the added complexities of VAT, this Kickstarter will only be shipping to select countries.  I deeply apologize for this inconvenience and will be setting up a temporary shop on Etsy later this year for shipping to the UK. All open edition pins will be available for world wide shipping on the main website later in 2021 as well.
I am not responsible for any customs, duties, taxes or other fees that may be added to the package as these are set by the countries they are shipped to. These fees are the responsibility of the recipient. Items returned to me due to being unclaimed at customs will not be reshipped without additional shipping charges. Please expect extended shipping times to countries outside of the USA.

Timeline
May 8th - Kickstarter Ends at 8 pm Pacific Time
May 12 - Surveys go out via Backerkit
May 24-27  - Should receive Kickstarter funds by this time
May  - Order pins as soon as funds received and at least 80% of backers have responded to surveys so I know how many of each pin to order.
Pins should arrive around 4 weeks after ordered. Pins will be inspected for quality.
July/August - Pins start shipping. Shipping will be completed by August if all goes to schedule. Limited Edition pins will take an extra 2-3 weeks to ship because they need to go through a multiple step process and drying time before being handled.

Budget
Please feel free to ask if you have any questions or check out our FAQ section.


~~ Check out the official online shop for prints and merch @ Kamakru Art  ~~ Follow me on Social Media ~~ Twitter | YouTube
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All pin designs and washi are complete and getting approved through the manufacturer, with the wood pins having gone through a full prototype process already. There's not much else to do but order the pins! I expect very little in the way of issues for this project, and already am familiar with the process of creating enamel pins. This year I will be using a different manufacturer than last year due to the extremely high level of defects in the pins. I have already seen pins from this new manufacturer so I am confident that there will be few issues.
There is always the possibility of slow downs on the manufacturers side of things, or hiccups with shipping. Any and all updates will be shared so you know exactly what's going on. Once the Kickstarter is complete, the order placed and I receive the pins (roughly 4-6 weeks production time), I have years of experience organizing large scale product orders and shipments including 3 previous Kickstarter campaigns, and have a full scale studio set up to accommodate projects like this.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Fragonard's The Swing, reimagined by Shouty
What if we took art history and made it gay?
Hi! We're Nova and Mali, and we like making collaborative gay art projects. Our goal is to create an art book full of famous works of art you probably recognize, but we're making them gay, trans, and POC inclusive!
You want to see the Birth of Venus but trans? We got you.
Leyendecker but lesbians? We've got that too.
Successfully funded in only two hours, and stretch goals all reached in five hours!
Kickstarter marked us a project they love and we've been featured in the Mary Sue and Fangirlish!
Mock-up of the front and back cover of the book
Our hard cover art book will be in full color, filled to the brim with beautiful reimagined works of art from Ancient Greece to 20th century Rockwell. 
A mock-up of the book's interior, featuring Aadorah's finished piece and Blackdistraction's WIP
The cover has been beautifully painted by Shouty (Shouty_y), reimagining Fragonard's The Swing as a new stunning piece! We've gathered over 60 artists from around the world and each is creating a new piece of art for us.
Our wonderful artists!
Our campaign graphic design was created by our very own Floh (FlohGna) who is also illustrating a piece for the book. Thank you Floh!
This is our second project - we successfully ran Lady Tarot Cards last year (2020), reaching all of our stretch goals and more with nearly $40,000 raised. Quite a few artists from the cards have come over to work on this book too and we're thrilled to have them back.
(Small note: we are out of the tarot cards - we ended up selling them all! We are not planning a reprint at this time as it would take over 500 orders to consider it which is basically an additional KS campaign!)
Some of our tarot cards!
Our tarot cards with their foiled sides and their tuck box
Our Book
Mock-up showing the book's cover
Our book will be 8.5x11 inches and have a soft matte touch hardcover and filled with over 60 different works of art from over 60 artists! This is an ongoing project with art still being created - some designs may change but the overall feel will of course be the same.
All orders of the book will now include 1 holographic print from cleocatart - their piece is based on Leighton's The Fisherman and the Syren.
Mock-up of the interior, showing Vicky's WIP and Pien's finished piece
The Merch
Our merch pack and the shiny bits!
Each merch pack will have:
 1 sticker designed by karlovycross (design coming soon based on Le Flirt a La Rose by LeClerc) (this might end up being a glitter or holographic sticker too!!!!)
 1 metal bookmark designed by mayticks featuring Hades and Persephone, Theseus and a Fury, and Orpheus and Eurydice!
 3 holographic art print 6x9 inches of fidisart's piece based on Mucha's Flirt and two more yet to be determined!
 3 random postcards from a selection of art from the book
 Your choice of 1 of 3 acrylic charms designed by rosefinchie and renstrapp! Rose  designed two charms: one with cave hand paintings and one with Artemisia Gentileschi. The cave painting design is being workshopped into possibly being glow in the dark, and Artemisia is a clear charm! Ren created a design with Venus de Milo and Nike of Samothrace as girlfriends.
 An embroidered patch designed by Mayticks! Her patch features Hades and Persephone...and some innocuous pomegranates.
Some designs are still TBD as our artists complete their work!
Close up view of our shiny shiny bookmark from Mayticks!
Support Levels/Pledge Tiers
Early bird pledge description and graphics
 The first 20 people to pledge for the book and book/merch levels get a discounted price!
These early bird tiers are:
Art book - digital and physical - $35 (plus shipping)
Art book (digital and physical) and merch - $60 (plus shipping)
Pledge levels and graphics!
 Our normal support level tiers are:
Digital book only - $15
Merch only - $30 (plus shipping)
Art book (digital and physical) - $40 (plus shipping)
Art book (digital and physical) and merch - $70 (plus shipping)
2 x Art books and merch - $130 (plus shipping)
A reminder: if we unlock levels below in the stretch goals, those items will be automatically included in your pledges!
Our limited edition tier
Finally, we have one limited edition tier! This tier includes the books and merch PLUS a limited edition linograph print from Mayticks of her version of Klimt's The Kiss (A3 size - 29.7 x 42 cm, 11.75 x 16.5 in). We have 25 prints available!
Art book (digital and physical), Merch, and 1 print - $150 (plus shipping)
Mayticks' lino prints!
We will be using BackerKit for this project and you'll get emails from them later on about shipping addresses. You'll also get a chance to add-on any additional items and a few leftover merch choices from Lady Tarot Cards. Finally, you'll be able to pre-order more copies and merch through there before we launch our online store - when the store launches, the prices will no longer have the discounted KS prices you find here!
Reminder: Kickstarter doesn't charge you unless/until we get funded - that means your card won't be charged until May! You can adjust your pledge or cancel it until May 5. We of course hope you won't cancel a pledge, but understand that things are very tough right now.
This book will not be reprinted - this is a one run deal and we'll order enough to cover the KS orders, our pre-orders in the store, and enough to stock the store for a while. After we run out, that'll be it!
Our Stretch Goals
Graphic showing our unlocked stretch goals!
ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED ON DAY ONE!!!
At $35,000, all the books will have a soft touch matte hardcover!
At $40,000, all merch packs will include your choice of 3 acrylic charms, designed by rosefinchie and renstrapp!
Renstrapp is creating a keychain design with Venus de Milo and Nike of Samothrace as girlfriends, and rosefinchie designed two charms: one with cave hand paintings and one with Artemisia Gentileschi. The cave painting design is being workshopped into possibly being glow in the dark!
At $45,000, all merch packs will include an embroidered patch designed by Mayticks! Her patch features Hades and Persephone...and some innocuous pomegranates.
At $50,000, all merch packs will include 3 holographic prints (1 from fidisarts and 2 others), and all physical orders will include 1 holographic print from cleocatart - their piece is based on Leighton's The Fisherman and the Syren.
NEW STRETCH GOAL!
This campaign has surpassed all of our hopes and is firmly in the WOW category! We're announcing a new stretch goal for $150k - a solid 3D metal keychain featuring Mayticks' Hades and Persephone design!! This would be included with every merch pack, and available for purchase as an add-on after the campaign in the Backerkit survey. Let's get to work sharing this around so we can get these bad bois unlocked!
Mayticks' design for the keychain
Mayticks' keychain!
The Timeline and Funding
Our timeline is of course dependent on a lot of things, including but not limited to: artists finishing their work, products being made in a timely manner, shipping to us with minimal delays, packing and shipping everything (it's just the two of us so it might take a few extra days!), and then shipping out to you!
Ideally, our timeline is as follows:
April - May - Kickstarter campaign runs and the funds get sent to us in May
May - June - Artists complete their pieces
July - August - We compile everything and get things sent to production. Some of the merch is already ready to go - the biggest work will be for us to format the book for print to ensure the highest quality images.
September - November - A nice big window for us to receive and send out the goodies, ideally BEFORE the holiday postal rush.
We will be keeping everyone up to date with updates as we go through the process, especially when we receive products in the mail! This is going to have some really amazing things created and we can't wait to be able to show you.
Our funding process covers the products, shipping, and all the taxes/fees, and everything else is used to pay our artists and mods!
We've been through this rodeo before so we know some backers forget or miss the backer survey when we ask for your address. It is your responsibility to make sure your email is correct so we can send you important updates and messages! We will hold your pledge goodies for six months after we send out the last call message, and we will try our absolute best to get in contact with you - we don't want anyone to miss out. After that six months, we will no longer hold your goodies and cannot offer a refund - we have a very small apartment and we need the space!
Shipping
We will ship anywhere in the world in sturdy cardboard mailers. We are not responsible for lost or damaged packages, and many will take a long time to get to you especially for our international friends. We are also experiencing a much higher volume of orders than we expected so even with the help of a few friends, our packing/sending process will take a little longer - please be patient with us :)
We CAN ship to the UK, even with the new VAT rules, thanks to the project being a book! Shipping is expensive right now with many countries/postal carriers adding extra surcharges to their rates - please be aware of that when you click through to the shipping options. Most packages are $15/30 for domestic (USA) and international packages.
We are not responsible for any additional customs/duties on packages. We will be declaring them as printed matter/books/postcards/bookmarks/etc as appropriate and we of course hope there won't be any issues - the labels will not include any indication of LGBT content.
Our digital book can be emailed easily to anywhere anytime! (after, of course, it's made and ready to send out this fall!)
About us!
Nova and Mali have been married for a few years now and spend most of their free time working with their endless cycle of rescue foster kittens! They ran a successful project during 2020 to create nearly 800 decks of tarot cards and sent them all over the world.
Photo of Mali and Nova from their wedding photos
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risk, assuming we get funded, is timing. Our timeline is a best guess - things can go awry with quality control and shipping to us, causing delays. We will communicate these issues as best we can as they happen, and keep everyone informed.
Lately the shipping scene is a mess. We can't be responsible for lost or damaged packages due to postage negligence.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello wonderful supporters!
Everyone should have gotten an email from Backerkit regarding their surveys for add-ons and shipping addresses! I'm going to include some information for you below about protocol etc :)
IF YOU DIDN'T GET AN EMAIL ABOUT A SURVEY: here is a link you can go to fill it out : https://classicsbutgay.backerkit.com/ for survey recovery! Make sure to update your email if you need to in order to get updates from me! If I can't get in contact with you, I can't get you your stuff.

Hello wonderful supporters!
I finally got all the details ironed out (hopefully) in the backerkit surveys! I just sent out a smoke test - that's to 5% of backers in each pledge level - to test it out! If you got one of those links, please be sure to fill it out ASAP!
If you didn't, hang tight! I need to spool the results from those surveys and make sure I didn't mix anything up. You'll get your survey by early next week at the latest :)
Keep your eyes peeled for those emails!

Hey all! 
Check out this new Kickstarter - just launched! I've been following this artist for quite a while and I believe this will be very important to some of this audience! His work is always high quality and this project is really powerful <3
Protect Disabled Lives + Make Pride Accessible Enamel Pins

Hello everyone! Nova here with a small update!
I finally got the backerkit survey sent off for review at the end of last week - it will take a couple business days for them to get back to me and give me the all clear for launch! I apologize for the delay - I was having some technical difficulties as this is my first time working with them!
You'll be able to order add-ons there! Our pre-order store will launch June 15 and I'll post links for that everywhere of course for anyone who may have missed the campaign.

Hello all!
We're working behind the scenes to make some sweet stuff for you!
A gentle reminder that I do not have your shipping addresses yet and that's because I haven't asked for them! You will be completely in charge of keeping it updated through Backerkit after we've sent out that survey (which won't happen until the end of the month at the earliest). I can't change your address for you because I don't even have access to it!

Hello everyone!
We're still waiting on funds to arrive, but artists are working hard on creating pieces for us!
We're also excited to announce a few things about our hard copy books! We're going to be using PrintNinja and I'm really excited to announce a few surprise details about the books!
Every book is hardcover as unlocked in the campaign stretch goals AND will have A) a dust jacket and B) foil stamped sequential numbers - remember these aren't going to be printed again so your book will be 1 of 4000*.

Hello everyone! As we work hard to get things ready for you in Backerkit, we're running into a lot of FAQ. Rather than continuing to privately answer them, I wanted to take the opportunity to post an update with everything here, and as a thread on twitter (where you should follow us if you're not! @nova_mali)
-----
FAQ

Here we are - the last 24 (well 25 as I'm writing this) hours! We can't wait to get this wrapped up to get closer to production. I'll write a bigger update tomorrow after the campaign ends with more details about what you can expect next!
Best,
Nova and Mali

campaign.story:
Hi, I am Kelpie, a French illustrator who is into fantasy and especially fantasy creatures. 
I have always wanted to create a collection but as you can imagine, it takes a lot of time and especially a lot of money. So to make this big project a reality, I turned to Kickstarter and here I am, telling you about my mythical zodiac and roleplaying my way in. 
I understand you're here to talk about pins, so let's talk about pins.
There will be 12 pins representing the signs of the zodiac in the shape of different mythological creatures. The pins are set around 5x5cm (2x2 inches) but the size may vary accordingly to each design.   
 The pins will be hard enamel pins. Hard enamel pins are smooth and shiny, more durable, and have no raised edges. 
 * Every pin will be mounted on a custom backing card. All the pins are concept mock-ups. The final design may vary.
There will be several stretch goals once we surpass the funding goal. Some will unlock new pins designs, and some will unlock  free goodies that will be added to your pledge! 
So the more of you pledge and share this project, the more rewards you will get with your package! Spread the word, invite your friends, family, pets, everyone!




  There is also the possibility to add extra goodies to your package after you have chosen your pledge !

Shipping costs will be added at each level, depending on your country (France or anywhere else in the world). I have calculated the prices to be as fair and as low as possible. By default, when you select 3+ pins, the tracking option will be included to secure your shippment. 
If you want to add tracking to your mail, please add 1€ (France) or 5€ (world) to your pledge.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risks are production delays due to error during creation, shipping delays, or misprints. Please note that I may also need to rework some designs slightly to ensure that the pin(s) you choose are the best quality possible.
Customs fees may apply when sending your package. I cannot be held responsible for these costs, which remain at your charge, as for a classic purchase. Thank you for your understanding.

Also small delays in shipping may happen if I get a huge number of backers, as I am working alone on this project. But I'll do my best with the help of my little degus assistants!

Don't worry, there is no risk you won't get the pins you've chosen if the design has been unlocked.

And whatever happens, I will keep you informed at each stage of the project so that you can follow the journey of your pins.

Thanks a lot for your support ♥
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Updates for those returning!
Free tiny pin and sticker of your choice to all backers
Shiny and white versions of the bag are now available
New colors of wing inserts including red-winged blackbird and magpie as well as solid colors are available to add on
4 pin designs in 2 colors, 2 mini-pin sets in 2 colors
Hello everyone!
My name is Rachel and I'm back again with a new project. I love birds and pins and figured the next logical step was to make my very own ita bag.
This campaign also includes a bunch of accessories including a plush keychain, hard enamel pin, and a mini-pin set. Stretch goals include freebies, new pin designs, and even special color variants!
Remember - you can pledge now and pay later! Kickstarter does not charge you until the campaign is successful and complete.  Use the new add-on function here on Kickstarter to get exactly the items you want! And you can edit your pledge at any time right up until the end of the campaign. Not sure what you want right now? You can always add more items via Backerkit when surveys go out as well. 
If you have any other questions please don’t hesitate to message me. Also you can check out my previous four successful Kickstarter campaigns or my Etsy shop for examples of my pins.
Please help share and get the word out any way you can - the more goals we reach, the more items, options, and freebies you'll have.
Twitter - Tumblr - Instagram - Reddit

UK BACKERS-  PLEASE USE THIS ETSY LISTING INSTEAD OF PLEDGING HERE! (due to VAT)

Designs
Crow Ita Bag
Ita bags are designed with a clear window for showing off items such as enamel pins, buttons, and whatever you want to stick in there. I wanted this one to be cute, simple, and functional so it can be an everyday use bag.
Bag filled with some of my favorite corvid pins from both myself and other artists!
Crossbody bag in faux leather with screenprinted details
Size of bag front: 10 inches, Height: 7in, Width 3in
Size of inside bag: at it's longest dimensions the inside of the bag is 8x6in and approximately 2.5 inches in width - this size is perfect for a phone, wallet, pens, and other small items but would NOT be able to comfortably fit a Switch, tablet, or larger notepad.  
Gold hardware, inner pocket, and zipper closure
Detachable strap which is adjustable up to 54in total length
Clear window is approx. 7x5in
Comes with 1  removable wing satin insert
We have also unlocked 2 new color variants and wing inserts!
Wing inserts will be available as add-ons at the end of the campaign via the Backerkit survey. I'm still waiting on manufacturer photos but will provide them as soon as I have them.
Unlocked Variants! manufacturer photos coming soon
Make your bird a red-winged blackbird, magpie, or dress it up fancy :)
 Multi-colored inserts in progress! All bags come with their matching insert- black bags get a black insert, white bags get white. Any additional inserts will be available as add-ons through the Backerkit survey. By then we will have pictures of each color design so you can see exactly what you're getting.
Multi-colored wing insert designs printed on fabric
Top of bag showing zipper closure
Back of bag
Inside of bag - contains one pocket for use and one pocket for the wing insert
Bag with wing insert removed
Blushy Crow Plush Keychain
This little guy is so soft and adorable! 
Minky fabric with felt, embroidery, and button eyes
Keychain attachment
4 inches tall, 3 inches wide
Soft & Round
Crow Hard Enamel Pins
You choose which color/pins you would like at the end of the campaign when the survey goes out and can add more at the Kickstarter rate ($12 per 2 inch pin/ $20 per minipin set) via Backerkit.
There are FOUR pin designs unlocked in TWO color variants each totaling 8 pins designed for this Kickstarter. See further below in the Kickstarter for the white/pastel pin variants.  All pins are hard enamel, approximately 2 inches (6cm), and will have 2 posts with rubber backings.
1. Star Carrier Crow
This is an exciting new type of pin for me! It's large, over 2 inches tall (6cm) with a chain and attached star which will dangle below. 
Star Carrier Crow
 2. Deer Skull Raven
This pin will feature several cut-out areas between the raven and antlers. The pastel variant will have a glow in the dark blue skull and antlers!
Deer Skull Raven
3. Crow & Roses
The pastel variant of this pin will have glitter in the flowers!
Crow & Roses in both variants
4. Moon Cutout Crow
These pins feature a crescent moon shaped cutout. 
Moon Crows in both color variants
Minipin Sets
These pins will be manufactured in hard enamel with gold metal for black pins and rose gold for white pins at approximately 3/4in (2cm). All will each have 1 post, since they are tiny, with a rubber backing. See below for both sets in the original black/gold variants. Pictures of the pastel variants can be seen further down the page. 
To make packaging less complex, mini-pin sets of 3 will be kept together without substitutions. The four options are Set 1 (crow head/sitting flying) in black or white as well as Set 2 (skull, feather, foot) in black or white. If you want a specific design not in the set, it will need to be added on separately.
Mini-pin Set 1
Mini-pin Set 2
 Knife birds are also available as single Mini-pins!
Knifebirds!
Every single pin available!
 Backing Cards for Pins & examples
Backing cards make for a nice display. They are 3x3 kraft cardstock with black printing.  They are free but will be optional during the survey for those who may not want the extra packaging. 
Roses & Deer Skull go on the trees, Star carrier and Moon go on the sky, minipin sets and individual minipins go on the feathers
Stickers
The sticker designs match the 2-inch pin designs and will be available in both black and pastel variants as pictured below. Stickers will be 3 inches printed on durable, clear vinyl.
All available stickers
 Goal & Stretch Goals - we blasted 'em. 
Initial Goal - $6000 
This goal covers production for the crow ita bag, plush keychain, pin, and the minipin set. Once we hit it, bags, keychains, and pins are all going into production!
Stretch Goals
$6500: Backing Cards for pins  UNLOCKED! 
$7000: Free sticker to all backers! Plus 3 inch transparent vinyl stickers become available as add-ons for $3 each UNLOCKED!
$7500: New 2 inch Pin Design + Sticker (Deer Skull Raven) UNLOCKED! 
$8000: New 2 inch Pin Design + Sticker (Rose Crow) UNLOCKED!  
New 2 inch Pin Design + Sticker (Moon Crow) UNLOCKED! 
$9500: New Minipin Set of 3 (Feather/Skull/Talon)  UNLOCKED!  
$25,000 Stretch Goal: Shiny Black Bag - UNLOCKED!
$30,000 Stretch Goal: Albino/White Bag - UNLOCKED!
$40,000 Stretch Goal: Alternate inserts - Redwinged Blackbird, Magpie, & solid colors - UNLOCKED!
Insert colors: Red-winged Blackbird, Magpie, Pastel Pink, Pastel Purple, Pastel Blue, Pastel Yellow, Grey... more coming!
Additional regular black and white inserts will be available as well
More info and photos of new bag colors / insert variants coming soon
Sample photos of the new bag colors and multi-color wing inserts will be available prior to the end of the campaign. Sample payment was completed 01Apr and will take approximately 2 weeks to complete. I will keep you updated!
$50,000 Stretch Goal: FREE Tiny pin to all backers! - UNLOCKED!
These teeny tiny pins will be hard enamel at just 1.5cm long! They will also be available to add on. 
"Micro" pins :)
Shipping
You'll see that shipping prices are added on when you choose your backer tier. The prices are based on USPS rates with tracking plus the minor cost of packing materials. 
Orders of pins only will ship in bubble mailers, bags and keychains will ship in poly bags. 
Unfortunately, international shipping is quite expensive for parcels with tracking- I recommend going in together with someone local to you to save on shipping if you are outside of the US.

Timeline
March: Project launches and runs for 30 days
Late April: Project finishes, funds are collected, and surveys are sent out to all backers
May-June: Surveys are completed and manufacturing of all items is initiated
July-August: Items are received by me, quality checked, and packaged for shipping 
August-September: Backer rewards are sent out in waves! Please be aware that while I will ship these out ASAP, shipping times may still be affected by COVID.  
Some notes:
Designs: It's possible that there will need to be slight adjustments to the enamel pin designs due to manufacturing limitations, but I don't foresee this being an issue as the pins have been designed with this in mind.
Colors: Colors may appear slightly different on your monitor from the colors of the actual products. Shouldn't be too much trouble considering most things are black and white though! 
Refund policy: Once the campaign has ended, refunds cannot be given out. Please only back this campaign if you certain you are like the product and you are aware of the timeline and potential shipping time to your location from the US. 
Thank you so much for reading, and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do!
Bag & plush!
that's me :)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is currently a risk of delays due to Covid-19 which may include manufacturing delays, shipping delays to get the manufactured products to me, and ongoing delays with the USPS which could potentially impact getting items to backers quickly.
I've run 4 successful Kickstarters already so I'm well aware and prepared for any hiccups :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pin Pics & Reminder that Backerkit add-ons will be charged tomorrow
updates.update_content:
Hello again!
 First off I wanted to remind everyone who purchased any add-ons via the Backerkit survey that cards will be charged tomorrow, June 1st. This only applies to those who have purchased an add-on via Backerkit! And again if you have any issues accessing your survey, please message me and I can help you get it sorted out.  

Things are moving along nicely! I now have all of the backing cards and stickers in hand ready to go. Pins are shipping to me very soon, and the plush keychains and all of the bags are all in production. Hoping to be able to send out pin-only tiers next month, and then anything that includes the keychain as soon as I have those in hand. Bags are still expected by August and I will keep you updated on those. Enjoy some manufacturer photos of the pins below, I'm very happy with how they turned out!

updates.update_userinfo: 90% of surveys complete - still waiting on 100 people!
updates.update_content:
Hey! 
If you haven't finished your survey yet please do so cause I'm going to begin locking them in 2 days to make sure I have final counts for everything. Also a reminder that cards on file with Backerkit for add-ons won't be charged until June 1st.

Don't have your survey email? Try this link! https://crowllection.backerkit.com/

updates.update_userinfo: Didn't get a survey? Message me!
updates.update_content:
Like the title says - seems like Backerkit was not able to reach everyone's inbox.  Message me and I can send you a direct link to your own survey!

Also I'm going grocery shopping now so I had to ready one of my own bags to use! Here is a Red-winged blackbird in the wild :)

updates.update_userinfo: 2/3 of Surveys Completed! Some survey info & photos :)
updates.update_content:
Hey, thank you so much to everyone who has filled out surveys so far! Please keep it going!
I'm waiting until I have about 80% completion on surveys so I know how of each item I'll need to get into production (mainly bags & pins), so the sooner the better to get them filled out. 
I also took a video of the black & shiny bags outdoors if you'd like to see to help choose your bag - https://twitter.com/corviforms/status/1392582592738770949

FAQ for Backerkit surveys:

updates.update_userinfo: Shiny bag video & Backerkit surveys rolling out!
updates.update_content:
Hey! 

Here's a quick video to show the differences between the black & shiny black bags - thanks for the suggestion, this shows the shine on the bags much better than a photo so I hope this helps!
video here - https://twitter.com/corviforms/status/1392206002120953857

updates.update_userinfo: Bag samples are here & survey is in review!
updates.update_content:
Hello all!
Exciting update - I now have the other bag color samples as well as the printed wing inserts in hand! I've added a bunch of pictures to the end of this message.
Now that I have pictures, I've also finished setting up the surveys in Backerkit. The surveys have to go through review to be checked for any issues before I send them out to everyone, this will only take a few days.

updates.update_userinfo: Chick & Dove bags added! Wing inserts & manufacturer updates
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Surveys will go out in about a week from now as I want to wait for a couple things before sending to make sure everything is accurate. There were also about 40 "dropped" backers from declined cards etc so I also need to have an accurate count of funds before moving forward.

updates.update_userinfo: Interested in yellow chick bags? Manufacturer update & some friend's pins!
updates.update_content:
Hey! 
Are you interested in the yellow chick version of the bag? Or the white bag with the small beak? (which I'm going to be calling a dove)
If there's enough interest, I will be adding both the chick bag and the small beak version of the white bag as options! Please let me know if you'd be interested in getting one by commenting below!

Thank you all so much for the success of this project!!
Over the next day or two you will see an email from Kickstarter about your card on file being charged for your pledge amount. If there is any issue with your card, Kickstarter will remind you to fix it. It takes them about 1 week to process all of the pledges, then another 1 week to send the processed pledge funds to me.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal Reached! 
Feature Film Proof of Concept directed by Jenn Ravenna Tran, co-written by Son M. Reaching. Reaching $125K would allow Jenn to begin pre-production on a new standalone short film that will be used as pitch for a feature film. All funds raised after the next stretch goal will go towards production of the next film project, contingent on the final production needs of Death's Diner (edited 4/11/2021).  
"The Vagabond and the Sea of Stars" (work in progress title) is a mystical short film about otherworldly bonds, and going to the ends of the earth to find one missed connection.
Death's Diner 
Death’s Diner follows two patrons who stumble into a diner, one foggy night, and find that their lives have come to an end. It’s through their conversations with one another and their charismatic waiter that the truth is unravelled.
Death's Diner was filmed in 3 days at the iconic Twede's Diner, the same location as the Double R Diner in Twin peaks. The story was written and created by Son M. The short film was co-produced and directed by Jenn Ravenna Tran. Jenn is also the cinematographer. Death's Diner will be a 10 minute short film.   
It all started with a story thread Son M. had written on Twitter that follows patrons in a diner who have brief conversations about their lives with Death. It was written during a difficult time in their life, past-midnight, and was thought to just be a personal outlet for their feelings. It resonated with a lot of folks, and soon it spread, eventually landing on the timeline of Jenn. Jenn reached out to see if Son wanted to adapt the story into a film, Son replied and the rest was history!
With this Kickstarter, we are hoping cover some of the production costs already spent, as well as post production costs. Principal filming was made possible by Jenn's Patreon savings, as well as some private donations. A stretch goal would be to cover all production costs, after all fees, shipping, and merchandise costs. 
Here are estimate costs based on both our current $25K goal, and if the production was fully covered at $85K.
Green = Already Spent on Production, Some Out of Pocket + Some Private Donations
Red = Needed to Finish Production
Blue = Money We Will Never See
The Film and Digital Rewards
Death's Brew Enamel Pin by Kevin Jay Stanton 
SIGNED Death's Diner Trio Poster by Bex Glendining 
SIGNED Death's Diner Poster by Cathy Kwan
Signed Memento Polaroids of Jenn Ravenna Tran's Photography
 Death's Embrace Art Print by Natalie Hall 
1/1 Edition Monotypes of Jenn Ravenna Tran's Photography. Printed on Gallery Archival Paper. Signed with certificate of authenticity. 
UNLOCKED: NEW 1/1 EDITIONS AND 10/10 LIMITED EDITIONS
Death's Brew - 10/10 Edition
Edge of the World - 10/10 Edition
 ALL 1/1 EDITIONS BELOW HAVE BEEN CLAIMED
Premonition
Theory of Eternity
"Seattle Skyline" and "Disappear"
"Golden Hour"
"Blue Hour"
"End of the Line"
"Time Will Tell"
"The Guardian"
"Dark Magic"
"Obsidian Moon"
"Death's Cat"
"At Peace"
Diner Neon Sign. Own a piece of the film. This appears in Death's Diner and was hung in the window of Twede's Diner, the same location as The Double R Diner in Twin Peaks. 
Main Rewards Breakdown
 REACHED!!! $25K Start Goal to Finish the Film
[UNLOCKED] $40K Almost Half of Production Costs Covered After Merch, Shipping, Fees, and Taxes
[UNLOCKED] $45K Sticker Sheet by Cam Chan Added to Orders $55+
[UNLOCKED] $50K Director and Writer Get Paid!  
[UNLOCKED] $55K Director's Notes: Storyboards, Lighting Plans, Filming Tips for every backer
[UNLOCKED] $60K Some Principal Cast & Crew Receive Bonuses or Increased Rates (note: this has been moved from the original $55K mark to allow for some financial buffer to adequately offer bonuses)
[UNLOCKED] $65K 2nd Kevin Jay Stanton Pin Added to all $50+ orders
[UNLOCKED] $67K More 1/1 Edition Photography Pieces Unlocked (New Stretch Goal)
[UNLOCKED] $70K  Director's Commentary Version of the Film for Every Backer. 
[UNLOCKED] $75K Commission with Retro Futurum for Live Action Film Poster / Postcard
[UNLOCKED] $80K Hire VFX for Exterior Diner Shots
[UNLOCKED] $85K+ Production Costs Fully Covered After Merch, Shipping, Fees, and Taxes. The Director is relieved of all financial burdens. Everything after this amount will be re-invested into Son and Jenn's other projects
[REACHED]! $125K Begin work on a Proof of Concept short film co-written by Son, "The Vagabond and the Sea of Stars" (work in progress title) for Jenn's first feature film. Contingent on the final production needs of Death's Diner (edited 4/11/2021). 
Proof of Concept is planned to be a mystical short film about otherworldly bonds, and going to the ends of the earth to find a missed connection. It will be a romantic travel narrative with elements of grounded fantasy and lofi sci-fi.
Death's Diner was made possible by a team of approximately 40 actors and actresses, producers, film crew, food service people, COVID officers, post-production team, marketing artists, and more. 
The Cast
Lauren Du Pree as OLIVIA She/Her (Actress) Lauren Du Pree is a proud Howard University alumna, actor, vocalist, writer, and filmmaker from Seattle, WA. She believes the lessons we learn during life’s challenges equip us to be a help to others. Art should make us feel a little more seen, a little less alone, and most importantly, it's a tool for positive change. Follow Lauren on Instagram | Twitter | justdupree.com
Yoshi Sudarso as DEATH He/Him (Actor) Yoshi is an Actor based out of Los Angeles. He moved to Southern California at the age of nine. He and his brother, Peter Adrian Sudarso, developed a fanbase on social media through various means, including both becoming the Blue Power Ranger on the long running TV series, "Power Rangers" on different seasons. Yoshi has worked on multiple films and TV shows, including The Maze Runner, Agents of Shield, etc. He debuted his film career in Indonesia as “Suwo” the lead of “Buffalo Boys,” a spaghetti western set in the East, Singapore’s 2018 entry to the Oscars. Follow Yoshi on Instagram | Twitter
Tyler Roy Roberts as KIERRAN He/Him(Actor) Tyler is an actor, writer, director and producer based in Seattle, WA.  He received a Creative Writing degree from Western Washington University and grew up on San Juan Island, WA. Follow Tyler on Instagram | IMDb
Eva Abram as GOD She/Her (Actress) Eva M. Abram is an actor and a traditional storyteller based in Seattle.  She has performed several theatrical roles including Lena Younger - A Raisin in the Sun; Alcandre - The Illusion; and Candylady -  Hoodoo Love.  She was nominated for a Gregory Award Best Supporting Actress - and nominated and won the Gypsy Rose Lee Award Best Supporting Actress for her role as Candylady. Follow Eva on rainwaterstorytelling.com
Rick Du Pree as OLIVIA'S DAD He/Him (Actor) A Seattleite, Rick has appeared on several Seattle stages in community productions over the years. He has appeared in LaChris Jordan’s Sadie’s Kitchen in 2005, Hip-Hop Back to its Roots, and Journey From Spruce Street as part of the Mahogany Project Showcase. Most recently Rick was one of the selected performers for Mirror Stage’s Expand Upon: INCARCERATION and The Narrative. Along with his filmmaker son, Rick is currently working on two documentary film projects featuring Seattle area athletes and the Seattle Chapter Black Panther Party. 
The Crew
Jenn Ravenna Tran She/Her (Director and Cinematographer) Emerging queer Asian-American film director and cinematographer based in Seattle, Washington. Her roots are in the video games industry, but her true passion is in filmmaking, cinematography, and storytelling. She is the director of the short, "And Then" which was also funded on Kickstarter last year. As a director and cinematographer, Jenn's goal is to bring stories to life and connect people to one another through emotive and compelling imagery. Follow Jenn on Twitter | Instagram | jennravennatran.com | Patreon
Son M. She/They (Writer) An Algerian writer who specializes in science-fiction, horror and friendship. They wear multiple hats, working as a comic writer, novelist, screenwriter and narrative designer. They are the Co-Founder and Studio Director of Perfect Garbage, the writer half of SCSMCOMIC and 'Bone Marrow & Other Tunnels to Travel Through', and more. Son hopes to write stories with new perspectives and is willing to fight for that opportunity. Follow Son on Twitter | THE BOGLANDS
Tony Becerra He/Him (Assistant Director/Producer) Tony Becerra has been a Freelance Assistant Director for more than 21 years. Seattle & Los Angeles based, but working world wide on Commercials, feature films, television series like Grey’s Anatomy, Station 19, Pearl Jam 20. He has also expanded his role on set as a producer on series such as JourneyQuest and Co Producer of the Sundance premiere of Fran Kranz's MASS. He has been a long time advocate for more work in Washington believes strongly in inclusion in Film. Follow Tony on Twitter
Kristin Hunt She/Her (2nd Assistant Director) Kristin is an independent artist from Atlanta, GA. Her mediums are poetry & film. She self-published her first chapbook, I’m Much Better on Paper, in 2017, and her poems have been featured in The Write Launch, Reclamation Magazine, and Clover and White literary journal. Her second chapbook was released December 17, 2020, ‘Write or Die.” Follow Kristin on Instagram | Twitter
Beth Farnham She/Her (Producer) Beth works as a producer, creative producer, and production manager. Providing all levels of support for a variety of film, music, arts and events for over 20 years in the entertainment industry. Recent projects include production manager for short films "Lucky Spot" in NYC, production manager for NW feature film "The Gender Flip Card", and field producer of a PBS Japan travel series for RMW Productions. Proud to support the team creating "Death's Diner". Follow Beth on Twitter 
Meg Schmitt They/She/He (Costume Designer) Meg is a costume designer and wardrobe stylist in Seattle who is in possession of a lifetime of sewing experience, ten years working on set, an affinity for thrifting and some envious garment distressing skills. Also inspired by an obsession with color, sci fi, and 20th century fashion history. Follow Meg on Instagram
Blue She/Her (Production Designer) Leila has always loved visual storytelling and truly enjoys bringing tales to life as an Art Director in the Pacific Northwest. Leila’s artistic talents vary as much as her interests, so when she is not on a film set, she might be found swordfighting with the Seattle Knights or at a photo-shoot debuting a new costume - though she’s as frequently the subject of other people’s art as creator of her own. Follow Blue on Facebook | Instagram
Chris Ungco He/Him (Camera Operator & Steadicam) Chris learned a lot about nuance working on Death's Diner and loves it when filmmakers can rely on each other to fly. Ube Films welcomes scripts and treatments from passionate, driven people and we are excited to hear about your next project. We seek to empower BIPOC values and reduce the financial obstacles involved in filmmaking. Follow Chris on Instagram | filmsbyube.com/upcoming
Jeremy Le He/Him (1st AC) Jeremy is an experienced cinematographer, VFX artist, and expert of on-set and post production who co-founded film production company Ismahawk, dedicated to pushing the boundaries of independent visual storytelling. Follow Jeremy on Instagram | Twitter | Youtube | ismahawk.com
Chehades Boulos He/Him (2nd AC) Chehade's a filmmaker from all along the west coast, based out of both Washington and South California. He's a big fan of landscape photography, slice of life films, and vinyl records. Follow Chehades on Instagram | TrafalgarFilms.com | manawave.co
Chris Boulos He/Him (Gaffer) Chris Boulos aka your friendly neighborhood gaffer has been in the film industry for 10 years and loves facilitating a fun environment on set. He’s worked on multi million dollar projects down to small passion projects. He instantly jumped at the chance to work on Deaths Diner after an amazing experience lighting Jenn’s last project “And Then”. Follow Chris on Instagram
Megan Lau They/Them & She/Her (Grip) Megan is a queer, non-binary first generation Chinese-American originally born and raised in the Bay Area. They are a cinematographer, producer and designer who aims to uplift voices of the underrepresented through producing content that welcomes and accepts individuals as a whole. Megan’s work has screened at renowned film festivals from coast to coast within the United States and Canada. Follow Megan on Instagram | Twitter | meganlau.work
Papa Ibrahimadip or Khalil Diop He/Him (Grip) Khalil is a Senegalese DP, Gaffer and Focus puller who has nearly a decade of industry experience working for the Canal + genre at the BBC, and a working directory spanning 3 continents (America  , Europe and Africa). You can follow Khalil on Instagram
Ellie McCutcheon She/Her (BTS Videographer/Photographer/PA) An ever-evolving ‘Jane of all trades’, Ellie spends most of her time as a professional drone pilot and documentary filmmaker. She has proudly worked in a variety of positions on Jenn’s film sets since the very beginning - line producer, producer, assistant director, and now behind the scenes videographer/photographer and extra in Death’s Diner. Follow Ellie on Instagram | elliemccutcheon.com
Megan Bernovich She/Her (PA) Megan Bernovich is Seattle film professional. She has worked with festivals, organizations, and productions across the Pacific Northwest and Texas. Follow Megan on Instagram | Twitter
Aaron Jin Any Pronouns (PA) Aaron is a Seattle-based actor, writer, and aspiring producer. Recently, he acted in the feature Potato Dreams of America (SXSW) and is writing for Seattle Opera's Creation Lab. Follow Aaron on Facebook | Twitter | Instagram
Brian Sloss He/Him (Sound) Brian Sloss is a Seattle based audio engineer specializing in sound for film. His greatest passions in life are building creative relationships with others, and sound. Since film making is a giant team effort, it has allowed Sloss to build creatively fulfilling relationships which also enable him to dive into his passion of sound recording and sound design. Sloss has been working full time in the film industry for the last 6 years. Follow Brian on Instagram | slossaudio.com
PD Hardy He/Him (Editor) PD works in London as an Editor on a wide variety of behind the scenes theatrical content and home entertainment for blockbuster movies, documentaries, and digital content. He got into the film industry because he loves telling stories - and cutting narrative/drama films in his spare time really allows him to scratch that itch! Follow PD on Instagram 
Jon Everist He/Him (Composer) Jon Everist is an award winning and ASCAP nominated composer for games and film. Known for effortlessly fusing the live orchestra with experimental analogue and synthetic textures, Jon’s approach is versatile, collaborative and innovative. Jon started producing and writing music at a young age, influenced by an eclectic mix of styles ranging from electronic music and hip hop to film scores.  Follow Jon on Instagram | Twitter | JonEverist.com
Lena Raine She/Her (Composer) Lena Raine is an award-winning composer known for her work on the video games Celeste, Minecraft, and Sackboy: A Big Adventure among many others. She also releases her own solo albums such as the 2019 album Oneknowing, and the 2016 EP Singularity. Most recently, Lena has scored the upcoming painting adventure game Chicory: A Colorful Tale, releasing in 2021. Follow Lena on Twitter | Instagram | lena.fyi
Troy Edige He/Him (Colorist & Trailer Editor) Troy is a DP and colourist who works globally on short films, documentaries and commercials. His work has been featured on Netflix, HBO and BBC. Follow Troy on Instagram | troyedige.com
Jordin Mitchell He/Him (Art Director) Jordin was the prop master and Art Director on Death's Diner. Follow Jordin on Instagram
Nancy Leonardi She/Her (Hair & Makeup) Nancy is a 30 year Journeyman Makeup Artist. She is a LA/SF 706 and Seattle/Portland cosmetologist makeup & hair Artist working in beauty, SFX, period hair and makeup. She has worked on many productions, Film,TV, Theater, and Commericals. She loves all projects big and small working with talented creative artists collaborating and seeing the work come to life. 
Kai Fischer He/Him (Boom Operator) Kai was essentially a human c-stand during the whole production. An awesome boom op. 
Herman Esau He/Him (Covid Compliance Officer) Herman was our Covid compliance offer to make sure we were following all Covid protocols on set, took our temperatures, and provided PPE.
Kris Hampton He/Him (Covid Compliance Officer Testing) Kris conducted rapid Covid tests and provided PPE. 
Contributing Artists
Cathy Kwan She/They (Illustrator) Cathy is a London-based Illustrator who loves bold colours, patterns and drawing people! Cathy enjoys films, playing games and sticking stickers over their desk. They also create an illustrated web novel, ‘Bone Marrow & Other Tunnels to Travel Through’ with Son M. Follow Cathy on Instagram | Twitter | cathykwanillustration.co.uk 
Bex Glendining She/They (Illustrator) Bex Glendining is a biracial, queer, UK based illustrator and comic artist who loves drawing modern monsters and slice of life. When not working, they can usually be found building gundams, playing video games with friends or buying new plants. Follow Bex on Instagram | Twitter | lgions.com
Kevin Jay Stanton He/Him (Illustrator) Kevin  is a freelance illustrator with a green thumb and penchant for creating more work than one person can handle. He spent his childhood playing a healthy dose of video games, as well as reading a ton of fairytales, mythology, and books on nature. Nowadays he does basically the same thing, but draws them too. Follow Kevin on Instagram | Twitter | kevinjaystanton.com
Natalie Hall They/Them (Illustrator) Spends a majority of their time in Los Angeles, CA painting, drawing, and tattooing. Follow Natalie on Instagram | Tattoo Instagram | NatalieHallArt.com
Cam Chan She/Her (Illustrator) C A M aka baomii is an illustrator with a craving for melon pan. She's fueled by retro anime, cute stationary, and the promise of a midnight snack run. Follow Cam on Instagram | Twitter | camchan.art
Philip Robibero He/Him (Motion Graphics Designer) Phil is a director and motion designer based in New York City. Follow Phil on Instagram | Twitter | phil.work
Retro Futurum (Poster Designer) Ahmad contributed to the title design to one of the poster's for Death's Diner and will be designing the live action variant should we meet our stretch goal. Ahmad is also a film critic Follow Ahmad on Twitter 

Trailer music credit: Duce Williams www.ducewilliams.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Principal filming has already been completed, so the risks are minimal. Our current funding goal gives us a small buffer in the event we have to spend more on post-production, so that we can finish the film no matter what. Pins, and prints are all regularly produced, sold, and shipped by Jenn Ravenna Tran and White Squirrel. Our team is well within our comfort zone.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Angel Investor
support.descp:
Because you REALLY believe in the project!
You will receive every rewards in the campaign and become an Executive Producer on Death's Diner! You will get real-time updates on the project and be able to observe the life cycle of post-production until the film finishes. You will be among the first to watch the final cut of the film along with the rest of the crew. You will be one of the first to be notified of any future film projects. Schedule and world-state permitting, you can also have dinner with the director, Jenn Ravenna Tran and possibly any other available crew members to discuss the film or anything else you wish!
Excludes 1/1 Photography Editions.
