campaign.story:
Explore the mysterious world of Japanese yōkai through a phenomenal 78-card oracle collection based on the traditional Rider-Waite tarot deck. 
                                                           - J.M. Lee, The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance 
This body of art is a culmination of love for ghosts, folklore, and traditional Japanese artwork all blended together with the storytelling of tarot. Every card features a different unique yokai (or two), each chosen to match or reflect the meanings and stories of the cards. Some are playful critters, while others are somber spirits - there's a full array!
Each card was traditionally drawn in sumi ink on rice paper, then scanned and digitally colored for consistency, giving it a not-quite modern and not-quite traditional fresh look. 
The deck will consist of the full 22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor Arcana, broken into four suits of staves, cups, coins, and swords. 
Printed on 350gsm art paper
Gilded edges
Matte linen finish to compliment the traditional look and feel of the illustrations
A small booklet that gives the name and a very brief description of the yokai
2-piece simple rigid lidded box
FSC Certified paper, meaning the paper was environmentally and ethically sourced. 
 These are available in their own tiers, and as add-ons at any other tier.
8x10 Print: A kickstarter exclusive offer -- choose a 8x10 print of ANY of the 78 cards! Only a couple of designs may be available as prints in the future (if any at all), so if there's one you want as a stand alone print, now is your chance! Printed on soft, heavy cotton cardstock with hand cut edges. Will come signed. Larger images can be found here.
*Prints will ship separately from the card decks. Please see info in "add on" section below.
 The Fool Pin: The shiro ukari from The Fool card, simple and dumbfounded as always and ready to start his journey with you. 1.5in tall, antique gold plated hard enamel.
Cotton Cloth: A multipurpose cloth -- use as a tarot cloth, a handkerchief, or a furoshiki (wrap things up). Printed on 100% cotton, 21"x21", featuring a parade of yokai.
The basic rewards are offered in a combination of tiers and as add-ons.
Products are not to scale.
 ADD-ONS 
To add-on any extra items, simply add the item in the "ADD ON" list when making your pledge! This menu will come up after clicking the "continue" button on this campaign page.
Examples: If you want just the deck and enamel pin, pledge for the deck and add the pin into your cart during the pledge. If you want the deck, the cotton cloth, and two pins, pledge for the Souvenir Set and add another pin into your cart.

*Add-on Prints will ship separately from the card decks. This is to minimize the risk of either the card deck or the prints damaging one another when packaged together. 
*Add-on Prints also require an additional shipping fee that must be added to your cart if you are pledging to any tier EXCEPT the Wall Decor (print only) tier. Additional prints (or pins/cloths) can be added to the Wall Decor tier for no additional fee; however the print shipping fee must be applied to any other tier if you are adding any prints.
$8,500 UNLOCKED: Deck Upgrade: Gold Foil design on box. The box will be upgraded to have gold stamped foiling artwork on the outside and inside, and a soft touch matte finish.

$9,800 UNLOCKED: Deck Upgrade: 330 German Core Paper.  Card paper will be upgraded from 350gsm art paper to 330gsm German core paper, which is a more durable, higher quality layered paper with linen finish. 
 $10,000 UNLOCKED: Tengu Pin. The karasu tengu featured on the 9 of Staves in pin form. 2.25" tall with antique gold plating. Will be available to buy solo in the "Just A Buddy" pin tier, and as an add-on to any other tier through the pin add-on. 
Way Overfunded Freebie: all backers with a physical reward will receive a free tanuki sticker!
TIMELINE
The anticipated timeline is as follows:
 Jan-Feb: Raise funds via Kickstarter
 Feb: Collection of funds; orders placed
 March-June: Production*
 June-July: Shipping
*The printer for the deck is currently experiencing long turnaround and shipping times, but those that order only non-deck items may receive their rewards sooner, in April or May. 

UK BACKERS: I cannot fulfill your order!
There's currently an error with Kickstarter that is allowing UK pledges to go through despite none of rewards having UK as an option. I've brought this to Kickstarter's attention and am waiting back to hear from them about this, but for now, please be aware that I can't fulfill orders to UK and any pledges will be refunded and canceled! UK people will have to wait until I have the item in hand in my etsy shop later on in the summer. I'm sorry about the inconvenience, but thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 6th kickstarter. Each have gone smoothly, and as always, backers will be notified ASAP if there are any delays that do pop up.

All of the artwork, merchandise design, and file preparation is complete, and the manufacturers are lined up and ready to go. If any defects in batches are made there will be a delay while it's replaced, but backers will be kept up to date.

SHIPPING: Since I package and ship all my orders by myself, this may take longer or shorter than anticipated depending on how many orders there are!

I cannot be held responsible for any packages that are lost or damaged in transit once they ship. International GST/VAT is not included in the pricing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My name is Allison Theus and I’m a long time concept artist specializing in creature design. You may know me from Instagram, Patreon, Twitter, Facebook, Beast of Oblivion on DeviantArt , and Crispyfishsticks on Tumblr.
In the last decade I've spent some time on game projects such as Warhammer 40k: Dark Millenium Online, Darksiders 2, Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze, and Crowfall. I've also done numerous TTRPG illustrations for Pathfinder and Fantasy Flight Games. Additionally, many may know me as the artist that helped kick off the popular online series 'Extra Credits'.
After perusing some older art I realized it'd been almost a decade since I'd released my last sketchbook. Time certainly flies when you're busy! I have SO MUCH work to show you all - gesture work, sketches, iterations for my personal world-building project, and in-progress larger works. 
Some of this I've shared across my galleries online at one point or another and you might be familiar with it, but much of it has sat in folders and in sketchbooks unseen. My aim is to assemble all of this work into a solid book to share with you!
Over 10+ years of raw sketches and concepts! This book contains loads of personal work from over the last decade. It includes traditional and digital pieces, finished and unfinished works, as well as thoughts around design and iteration and my overall creative process. Like my last book, 'A Book of Mostly Creatures,' it will also touch on the massive personal project I've been visualizing since I first began creating creatures in 1997.
This book showcases traditional and digital sketches, ranging from complete critter nonsense to world-building speed paints and everything in between. It features predominantly new work, a dabble of my IP work, and exclusive artwork that will only be available in this book.
Through this campaign, I will be offering a unique opportunity for backers to acquire a signed copy Mostly Monsters, The Art of Allison Theus, as well as stickers, wallpapers, prints, and even a downloadable copy of my first artbook “A Book of Mostly Creatures” (another 150+ pages of critters!). There’s also a limited number of signed prints, one-of-a-kind sketches, and commissions available. 

All backers, however large or small, will be able to download a video that goes over my process when designing creatures in photoshop!
PLAY

Please note that the number of signed copies of this new book and interior doodles are extremely limited, and will no longer be available once those reward tiers run out! 

This campaign is the only opportunity to get this bundle of books, stretch goals and unique goodies around my work. However, after the campaign ends, Mostly Monsters, The Art of Allison Theus will be made available through my website.
Get ready for more goodies! In the event I reach my funding goal, there are some incredible opportunities for more of my work! I want to give a special thank you to all my backers who were kind (and patient haha) enough to brainstorm some of these goals with me.

All final designs are subject to change, based on the artists' discretion - and I'll do my very best to share finalized imagery and (in the case of the savage bunny pillow and dark fu enamel pin) prototypes via updates. 

Kickstarter gives me a unique opportunity to thank those who are kind enough to help make the book possible, by adding stretch goals and lots of unique extras to the campaign. The more the campaign funds, the more unique and exciting creations I can give the backers!
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, I will be working through all the additional content for backers rewards, stretch goals, and exclusive goodies. Our current timetable is to ship the books out roughly 3 months after the Kickstarter's end.

In order to facilitate speedy and quality publishing, we're also working with PrintNinja! A custom printing company that offers affordable, high-quality offset printing and superb customer service. I'm super excited to collaborate with them on this project, as they produce high quality art books with amazing features.

About a month before we're ready to ship, we’ll be sending out a survey through Kickstarter, asking to confirm your address so we have everyone’s most up-to-date details! When the survey is ready, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, should there be a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will me several weeks to prepare and package all the rewards!

Unforeseen delays that are out of my control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We'll be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time.
In the event of lost orders in the mail (it totally happens!), I’m more than happy to offer to resend the order once for free, or alternatively you will have the option of a refund. 
From what I’ve researched, the logistics for a high number of backers might be more intimidating than anticipated. To that end, I’ve partnered with LiquidLockMedia LLC, who has fulfillment and logistics solutions in place to begin packaging up the rewards as soon as everything is ready. This way, we can ensure that we can process a high number of rewards as quickly as possible, and mitigate any bottlenecks or loose ends. 
Just as well, a very small number of backers don’t fill in the survey at the end of a Kickstarter campaign, which makes it impossible for the processing and shipping of rewards. I pledge to hold all rewards for backers that fail to fill in their survey for 6 months and will make multiple efforts to contact the backers in question to try to successfully deliver their items.
I would love to be able to share this amazing book with you all, and I hope you might consider backing this exciting project to help it become a reality! 

Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are 2 primary challenges of this project - timing and scaling. Strategic planning and sufficient time is needed to put together this book, exclusive content, and generate amazing backer prizes! 

The majority of the content for this book has already been created, and the layout is currently underway. This head start will allow me to proof my work with the publisher ahead of schedule, and give me ample time to mitigate any publishing, packaging, and fulfillment/shipping issues. 

I've also set aside the time needed to complete all signatures, sketches, and commissions so that I can put all of my energy to creating memorable and fantastic rewards for my backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Brace yourself: long update is long!!!

YA'LL.  I am overwhelmingly excited.
LOOK AT THIS THING:

HI FOLKS popping in here with a speedy update!

The hard proof is in print and will hopefully be in my hands in 2-3 weeks! All other specs are pretty much ready to go, and this is the final step prior to the big publish. I'll get to see the paper weight, the cover weight, and just how crispy my work turns out (aka image resolution).  12'' x 12'' is a big book! I keep forgetting. 

In the meantime, I'm finishing up remaining prints and wanted to share the linework that just went down on the Monster Series. Remember these guys?

updates.update_userinfo: Proofing + Publishing Update & Choose Your Fu!
updates.update_content:
IDK about you but this proofing process is certainly a learning curve! All content is done, formatting done, but it looks like I'm still having to resize a few files. The high rez is SO important and this is not a small book! 12 x 12'' is pretty wild! But at least it's just that and nothing too crazy. 

I heard back from the publisher today regarding COVID delays and our timeline, so I wanted to be sure to share for full transparency:

updates.update_userinfo: For my birthday I would like to get through proofing
updates.update_content:
It's been a couple weeks hasn't it? Sorry to keep you all waiting! 

I can't help but laugh at myself a little bit here, after stepping back and reviewing the artbook in all its glory (and stepping away for a bit for my sanity) I had this feeling that something was missing.

updates.update_userinfo: Proofing + Publishing Updates & Sneak Peeks & MOAR STICKERS
updates.update_content: That's right we're officially headed to proofing!! The layouts are ALL complete, the formatting finished, the writing thoroughly dragged out (lol), and it's coming close to taking that next big step. This will be a long one, as proofing will take roughly 2-3 weeks and publishing itself could be 6 to up to 10 weeks (including transit to get to me, so I'm told). I'll be sure to keep everybody updated in case something pops up here, so fingers crossed! This is my biggest published order yet!

updates.update_userinfo: And Now for Some Administrative Updates!
updates.update_content: - ahem -
We made it across the finish line!! The Mostly Monsters campaign is officially over!!!!

updates.update_userinfo: Matched & Our First Stretch Goal Unlocked!
updates.update_content: I'm so stoked! The match period is over and the project got a whopping boost - and we unlocked our first stretch goal!!!!

Omgosh, I got this amazing message that one of my backers is willing to match every donation made over the next 24 hours up to $5,000!

I don't know about you but YEEE! I've no idea what to expect in the last 46 hours but this is so cool.
I'm digging up as many contacts as I can and posting all over in a last ditch attempt to maybe hit that first Stretch Tier! WE'RE SO CLOSE!

campaign.story:
Enter a world of Dark Lies and Darker Truths.  
TALYN - Seed of Darkness, Issue 1 introduces a new graphic novel series created by artist Banished Shadow, and writer/director Caspian Darke. Based on Banished Shadow's widely popular Badassery Women  - an unconventional pantheon of all female characters woven into a dark fantasy world - TALYN is a horror fantasy comic seeking to recreate the cinematic visual art style of the 80s and 90s dark anime classics.
Demi vs Talyn
Talyn is a reckless street-fighter carving out a life in the dangerous Gothic metropolis of Remnant. A city where humans are as dispensable as the trash littering the streets.
Welcome to Remnant by Eduardo Pena
Talyn finds hope and light in her little mischievous sister, Tessa. 
Tessa and Talyn
But when Tessa is abducted by a mysterious ghost-like entity, Talyn is thrust into an uncanny mystery, pushing her dark temper and brash nature to the breaking point. 
Searching for Tessa
If you enjoy imaginative settings of classic anime works Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust and Demon City Shinjuku (Yoshiaki Kawajiri),  the expansive lore and themes of the Dark Souls Series (Hidetaka Miyazaki), and mysterious modern noir films like Girl With the Dragon Tattoo and Se7en (David Fincher), you’ll love TALYN and its highly original cast of characters.
The TALYN Cast

 What is the Project?
Talyn Issue 1

TALYN - Seed of Darkness Issue 1 is a 32-page comic book that sets the stage for an 8 issue series. This is the first issue of Volume 1. We plan on creating three volumes total once the story is all said and done. We are so excited to have you on this journey with us in revealing the world of the Badassery Women you've grown to love. 
Here is a 5-page preview of what the book has to offer.
This is just the first step into a wondrous and dark odyssey.

Introducing New Stories and Creators
Kickstarter is an amazing outlet to support emerging creative voices and unveiling compelling new stories to an under-served audience. 
We’re seeking to build an enthusiastic and engaged community to help bring Banished Shadow’s vision of the Badassery Women to life for all of our shared enjoyment.
Here’s a breakdown of the funds.  
Money raised will go toward the Kickstarter fee (10%) creative team fee (65%), and publishing/printing process, and shipping of the first issue on time (25%).
Any additional fundraising will go toward publishing, producing, and completing future issues.
The first issue of the comic is completed! Funds raised from Kickstarter will go toward delivering the comic into your hands (digital and physical copies) and production and labor costs required to release this and future issues.
In order to keep shipping costs down, pre-orders and pledges do not include shipping fees. Backers will be charged for shipping after the campaign ends. Charges will be based on how many packages are received and the weight of packages.
For international orders, please note that your country may have additional customs fees. We do not collect those. Please review local regulations for more information regarding any additional cost (customs, import taxes, and brokerage fees) necessary to receive rewards. Thank you!
We Walk This Path Together
We have stretch goals in mind to share in the excitement of our debut book with our community. These will be exclusive to those who pre-order through Kickstarter. You guys are integral to bringing the World of Talyn to life and here is our way of saying “thank you”. 
To accompany Banished Shadow’s compelling artwork, co-creator/art director/writer Caspian Darke, writer/producer Geoffrey Vincent, and letterer Micah Myers have banded together tell the story of TALYN: Seed of Darkness.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a Prestige Comic. What does that mean? 
The process required to draw and render a comic in the style of a high quality classic Japanese anime is very labor-intensive. The time can be almost 3-4 times the comic standard to draw/paint each panel, and Banished does this all herself. But the funds from this Kickstarter will allow us to continue this challenging but rewarding creative endeavor. 
Our goal is to develop the entire book series full-time and deliver this epic story to your hands at its highest quality and in a timely fashion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Steam page is up so you can go in and wish list it or just follow along for the journey here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1459500/Atlas_Architect/

This is a world building game that I have been working on for several months now. The idea behind it is that it should be a relaxing and creative experience, every click should uncover a new possibility and there are no wrong moves. Whatever you decide to build will blend seamlessly and the end result will be an organic world. 
The game is functional and currently there is a limited tile set in the game but I am adding more and more content every day. If you choose to back this Kickstarter you will get a windows version of the game in an Early Access state in December that will automatically upgrade to the full version when it is released, which means that you'll get it before the full release so some features that are planned won't be in by December. What you will get is a relaxing experience building an imaginary world. But I want to be very clear that this won't contain the full feature set that is planned for the full game. The benefit of getting it here is that it will be cheaper than buying it on Steam because I won't have to pay the Steam fee for each copy so I thought I'd pass the savings on to all the people that support the project early. You will basically get a Beta version of the build and your input will help guide what features I add and what I focus on when continuing the development of Atlas Architect. Of course you will continue to get all updates and the full game when it releases at no additional costs.


These are the current biomes that are in the game:
Castle
Cities
Deserts
Dead lands
Farmlands
Forests
Islands
Jungles
Grass lands
Mountains
Oceans
Rivers
Roads
Rocky
Ruins
Savannahs
Snow
Swamps
Villages
Volcanoes

And these are planned for future updates (but won't be in the first Early Access Release)
Bridges
Cave Entrances
Dwarven City
Floating Islands
Elven City
Elven Villages
Hills
Lake Towns
Orc Cities
Orc Camps
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks involved here are very small but here they are. You are backing an early access release of the game so there will be bugs and some issues which I will work on fixing as soon as possible. If you'd rather wait for the full release on Steam to get the game, you're very welcome to do so. In that case you can find it here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1459500/Atlas_Architect/
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all of you!

Thanks again for backing the project! All who emailed me about missing keys should have gotten them several days ago! If for some reason you haven't just message me (either through here or danial@rashidiinteractive.com and I'll get it sorted). I think I replied to most emails within a few hours at the most (unless I was asleep). 

It also launched on steam on the 21st so a lot more people have been playing around with it which is fun. I have gotten a lot of good feedback and bugs reported. Since it's Early Access, this is pretty much just start the start. I plan on improving it and adding a lot more fun features in the future. I you are interested, you can check out the road map here and vote on what gets priority:

Hello all backers!

As you hopefully have seen, I have sent out keys to all backers. The keys are set to activate right away when you enter them in Steam so you can go in right now and try out the game. If for some reason you haven't gotten a key, please let me know (the gmail outage yesterday stopped a lot of emails) and I will make sure you get one.

updates.update_userinfo: Continued Gmail outage yesterday stopped a lot of keys being sent out
updates.update_content:
Hi
I wanted to give you a short update and show all the people that supported the kickstarter at the "Witness me!" level. All the people that answered the google forms are in and this is what it currently looks like (Still a work in progress though):

So the Kickstarter is about to end and we even reached the stretch goal that I added so sometime after the game is up on Steam I'll do a live stream where I'll go through the project and answer any questions and we take a look at the source files!

Thanks you to everyone that backed this or shared the campaign with others. I was already really excited to make this and the show of support is so encouraging. Everything is progressing well, the game is basically feature complete at this point and I'm only polishing up the visuals and adding some small nice touches here and there. Saving and loading of levels just got finished yesterday:

Things are progressing well with the game and more and more features are getting in. I added undo yesterday and I'm working on the save system now so that you can save your creations and have lots of them saved, as well as polishing all the different biomes as well. As things are looking now, everything is going well for the launch in December.

A strength with games like this that make creation fun and easy is that it's pretty suitable for kids. I am really hoping that it can be a fun experience building a world for children. One thing that I have been thinking of lately is that it would be awesome to give this game away to places like hospitals or any other situations where children could spend some hours doing something fun instead of being miserable. So I'm looking for some good tips for a way to get this into the hands of kids where it could help their situation. It would be completely free for them and the idea is just to make their lives a bit more fun. I was  planning on contacting a few charities that work with kids but a problem is that it requires a computer and that might make it a bit trickier. So if anyone of you have any tips of how to achieve this, I would be very grateful to hear them. Just send me a message through the Kickstarter and I'll get back to you!

updates.update_userinfo: Time to pick a name for the credits!
updates.update_content:
Hi

I am just blown away by the positive response from all of you! So happy to see that so many are excited to try it out and build your own world! Thanks for supporting this project!

Things are really progressing well and I'm continuing to polish the UI and all the different tiles that will be in the game when it hits Early Access in a little over a month. There have been so many different feature suggestions and cool ideas from a lot of different places. I've added a huge list of things that I plan to add at some point, I will also set up some way of communicating with players and have them vote on the next feature to add from all the things I plan to add.

campaign.story:
Introduction
I am an avid collector of enamel pins and have now worked to bring to life several different pin designs through three previous Kickstarters. I'm also a huge bird person. I want to make pins that resemble your feathered friends!
Remember - you can pledge now and pay later! Kickstarter does not charge you until the campaign is complete. 
Not sure how many pins you want? All pins from this campaign and all of my other pins will be available for all backers to purchase at $12 each at the end of the campaign through BackerKit! 
Help share and get the word out - the more goals we reach, the more options you'll have: Twitter - Tumblr - Instagram - Facebook 
Designs
Each pin will be manufactured in hard enamel with nickel metal at approximately 2 inches. They will have 2 posts for added stability and security with two rubber backings.
Please note that minor changes to design and color may need to be made in order to properly manufacture the pins, but they were designed to be simple with pin manufacturing limitations in mind so I don't expect the final products to look much different than what you see here!

Goal & Stretch Goals
 Initial Goal - $600 - Funded!
The initial goal funds both colors of the Conure Pins - the Sun Conure and Green Cheek! 
Green Cheek and Sun Conure designs
The initial goal will ALSO fund these two new colors of my Knife Parrotlet mini-pins! These pins are add-ons, so if you would like one please add $8 to your pledge. Not sure if you want one yet? No problem! All 4 colors will be available to purchase at the end of the campaign through Backerkit. 
All 4 Knife Parrotlet Minipin Colors
$800: Backing cards - Funded!
ALL pins at ALL tiers will be packaged on 2.5-inch square kraft paper backing cards that I designed especially for this Kickstarter! 
Backing Card Design & Example w/pin
$1000: Budgie - Funded!
Budgie Designs
$1100: Cockatiel - Funded!
Cockatiel Designs
$1400: Lovebird - Funded!
Lovebird Designs
Lovebirds - but blue!
$1800: Quaker Parrot - Funded!
Quaker Parrot Designs
 $ 2200 : Caique - Funded!
Caique Designs
$2600: FREE Speech bubble mini-pins for all pin pledges! - Funded!
Speech Bubble Minipin

 $3000: Senegal Parrot - Funded! 
Senegal Parrot Design
 $3500: Indian Ring Neck - Funded!
Indian Ringneck Designs
 $4000: Eclectus - Funded!
Eclectus Designs with minipin examples

Rewards
- Hard Enamel Pin: any pin from the unlocked designs! Tons of options for amount of pins in the tier levels and an option to add on more pins at $12 each at the end of the campaign. 
- Digital Bird Drawing: A simple custom digital drawing of your favorite bird! This is included in two tiers - one with a pin, and one which is digital art only. These are limited to 20 total so if it's something you are interested in, act quickly! Some examples below:
Little bird drawings :)
Birdy doodles
- Custom Color: Want something that looks EXACTLY like your little pal? With this reward you can choose the colors for any of the unlocked designs. The reward will include 10 of your custom color pins and 10 of any of the other unlocked pins or more of your custom ones! Please be aware I can't make changes to lines, as this will use the same mold as the original design. If you want something entirely unique, check out the next reward...
- Custom Design: Don't see a bird that you want? I can make that for you! I'll work with you to get the exact pin you want. You'll get 20 pins of your design plus 10 pins of any unlocked designs (or 10 more of your custom design if you want!)

Quality examples of my previous pins from the same manufacturer:
Pins from my BEASTARS Kickstarter
Halloween Raven Pins
Funding Breakdown
While plenty of the funding goes towards producing the pins, a LOT gets taken up by Fees and Fulfilling (Shipping) as you can see in the chart shown below.

Timeline
October: Kickstarter launches!
November: Kickstarter ends, funds, addresses, and surveys are collected. Funded designs are sent to manufacturing.
December-Feb: Pins are received, packaged, and quality checked.
Feb-March: Pins are shipped to backers!
Thank you for reading!
Please help spread the word by sharing my posts on Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and Facebook! I <3 You!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk in this campaign is delay or issues from the manufacturer, but I don't expect any issues. I used the same manufacturer for my previous Kickstarter (Beastars Pins) as well as several other designs and they have always been wonderful. Of course delays could always come about due to unforeseen circumstances, such as a pandemic!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Pins are manufactured and on their way to me!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone and happy new year!
Sorry it's been so long since you've heard from me. My plan was to send out an update as soon as the pins were shipped which took a bit longer than I expected. They are now on their way to me and will arrive in the middle of next week! I've added the manufacturer pictures below :)
Once pins are here I plan to give them a thorough quality check, then start work on packaging and shipping. Shipping will be done in waves and all backers will get a tracking number for their items.

updates.update_userinfo: Orders locking on Backerkit & Minipins have arrived!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! 
Emails will send out soon notifying you that you have 48 hours to make any final changes to your order on Backerkit. Please make sure that your address is up to date and you've added anything you'd like. After 48 hours the orders will be locked. If any address changes happen afterwards just be sure to notify me so I don't mail anything to the wrong place. Here's the link to your backerkit survey in case you lost it - https://birdybuddies.backerkit.com/

Ya'll are great - 3/4 of you have already filled out the survey! And thanks for putting up with the hiccups at the beginning. Surveys will lock in 1 week so please make sure your address and info are correct. If you lost your survey or didn't get an email you can access it here - https://birdybuddies.backerkit.com/ 

The pin order has been placed with the manufacturer. This means it's time for the most difficult part for me: waiting. I should have the order shipped to me within 6 weeks. Until then, I'll be making sure everything is in order and working on some bird drawings!

My setup on Backerkit - the surveys and the add-on items - are now approved! The surveys will collect your address, let you choose your pins, and allow you to add any other items you might like. 
A few surveys will begin rolling out randomly tonight as "smoke tests" to ensure that everything is set up properly before it is sent to . Once I can confirm that the surveys are good, they will go out to everyone within the next couple days.

updates.update_userinfo: Campaign is done, pledges collected, surveys go out soon!

Keep an eye out for a survey coming to your email via Backerkit - the faster I get responses, the faster I can place the order with my manufacturer. Take a look at the add-ons as well, I've put a bunch of my other pins up at a discount.

campaign.story:
We’ve all seen shows where someone gets a hold of a time machine, stumbles into a portal, or steps into an alternate reality generator, and the main character is tossed into a space, unlike anything they’ve experienced before. Rick and Morty, Bill and Ted, Futurama, Star Trek. . . you get the picture. Alternate realities are a favorite theme of visual art makers and storytellers -- not only do these concepts give us an out from the insanity of life here on earth, but it gives us wildly creative ways to ask the big cosmic question "what if things were different...?"  
Welcome to World Roulette - an interactive art book about wild worlds and their stories, by 150 incredible creators.
 We (Light Grey Art Lab founder, Lindsay Nohl, gallery manager, Jenny Wells, and Intern Kait Bartlett) decided to make an amazing project that delved into the idea of random world generation. It's part art book, part interactive experience. We asked 150 illustrators, visual development and concept artists, comic artists and creatives to use a virtual "world randomizer" we built -- which scrambled dozens of world attributes and spit out unique, entertaining, and intriguing combinations of factors for their creative pleasures. Each artist took on the challenge of creating a unique and compelling world. The result was an incredible art book filled with exceptional illustrative vignettes of 150 worlds beyond our own and the stories that accompany them.
Then, because we couldn't stop there, we made a highly expanded version of the "Randomizer" -- a creative prompt deck that uses a system of stacking, twisting, and combining cards to create infinite prompts for worldbuilding for worldbuilding, writing, drawing, and creating fodder for infinite RPG campaigns :)
Finally, because we are very, very proud of the creativity and genius that our collaborating artists have when making work - we asked them (and some other worldbuilding professionals from the the videogame, comics, animation, and illustration industries) to share their advice, creative challenges, resources, and pro-tips on how to make the best worlds -- and gathered it in the back of the book to share with you.  
 So we're asking for your help in making this a reality! We've worked super hard gathering the art, writing the book, designing the deck, and making some extra goodies -- and hope you'll help us reach our funding goal so we can share this awesome project with you all! Please help us spread the word! Anything helps! 
 Here's a fun breakdown of all of the fun things you can enjoy if you're up for helping us reach our funding goal! 
• THE WORLD ROULETTE ART BOOK •
For the past few months we've been creating the most amazing book of alternate universes, far-away lands, and fantastic civilizations there ever was. World Roulette is an art book that will whisk you away to a land far-far-away! It's filled to the brim with amazing illustrations and stories by 150 incredible artists and meanders through 10 cosmic epochs, visiting unique fantasy + sci-fi worlds like we had our own cosmic wormhole.
(Artwork above by Rebecca Hu, Morgan Moen, Justin DeVine, Lauren Franklin, and Saleha Chowdhury)
(Artwork above by Alaina Cooper, Steven Sugar, and Miguel Co)
 The book is our pride and joy. It's got 150 incredible pieces of artwork by 150 international artists and stories about each awesome world we visit! The book walks through 10 fanciful historical ages, each with their own twists and turns of fate! 
The first 180 pages are dedicated to full-page black and white illustrations and stories, and after you've had your fill of wandering through the ages, head to the back of the book where we've compiled a "worldbuilding compendium" for those of you that would like to learn about worldbuilding from the best! The back has all sorts of great challenges for creatives, advice on worldbuilding, and pro-tips from the artists that work on the animations, TV shows, comics, games, and books we love.
CONTRIBUTORS JUST ANNOUNCED!
We’ve saved one of the best announcements for last! We’ve partnered with over 40 worldbuilding professionals (AND IF WE HIT OUR STRETCH GOAL OF 24K, WE’LL BE ABLE TO DEDICATE MORE SPACE TO THE GREAT CONTRIBUTIONS!) to bring you an incredible guide to worldbuilding and the theories, methodologies, and processes used by creatives that have brought us some amazing, memorable worlds in animation, TV, feature film, comics, games and more.
The back of the book holds the secrets to building better, more engaging worlds -- so if you’re an artist, writer, or otherwise, looking to sharpen your skills or get some insight into the many methods of worldbuilding, this book is for you!

Challenges, essays, and advice from the pros include:  Redefining Mundanity: Compelling Design for Everyday Items, How You Know a Good Idea, Tools and Resources/Finding Ways to Handle Problems in Design, Designing a Surprising Place: Worldbuilding to Reject the World We Live In, Questioning Social and Political Norms, Death is a Good Place to Start, Architecture, Land and Cities, Props and Dead Space, Developing Languages and Conlanging for Worlds, and much more.

WORLDBUILDING COMPENDIUM CONTRIBUTORS:
(more to come!)
 Aidan Vitti, Costume Designer & Fabricator
 Campbell Whyte, Comic Artist, Co-Founder Milktooth School of Art and Stories
 Claire Hummel, Art Director & Concept Artist, Valve
 Colin Foran, Chief Creative Officer, Neon Media
 Crystal Chang, Art Director, Wizards of the Coast
 Emily Abeydeera, Illustrator / Concept Artist / Author
Evan Palmer, Character Design Lead, Centaurworld, Netflix 
 Faith Schaffer, Background Designer and Vis Dev artist for Animation
 Izzy Burton, Background Lead, Netflix
 J.M. Lee, Staff Writer & Creative Consultant, Jim Henson's The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance, Netflix
 Joana Neves, Illustrator & Concept Artist and MediaMonks
 Julia Scott, Illustrator, Sequential Artist and Concept Development
 Steven Sugar, Lead Background Designer, Disney's The Owl House and Cartoon Network's Steven Universe
 Stu Livingston, Director / Storyboard Artist / Cartoonist
•     Syd Weiler, Illustrator / Animator / Vis Dev Artist
 Victoria Ying, Visual Development artist/ Author and Cartoonist
 Adam S Doyle, Artist & Illustrator
 Chelsea Harper, Freelance Illustrator, Character Designer, Storyboard Artist & Nanowrimo Veteran
 Chuck Lukacs, Illustrator, Educator, Author of Fantasy Genesis Series
 Daron Nefcy, EP of development at Nickelodeon Animation Studio, Creator of Star vs. The Forces of Evil for Disney Television
 Devon Bragg, Character Designer, Prop Designer and Background Painter
 Eduardo Vieira, Freelance Illustrator & Character Designer
 Falk Haensel, Illustrator
 Grace Fong, Narrative Designer on Magic: The Gathering, Cover Art Illustrator
 Jeremy McHugh, Visual Storyteller
 Jillian Spina, Comic Creator & Illustrator
 Joe Wright, Vagabond Craftsperson
 Jonathan Ying, Game Designer Fantasy Flight Games
 Josh Zentner, Freelance Illustrator & Concept Artist
 Justin Yu, Illustrator
 Kate Gottfredson, Illustrator and Concept Artist
 Kate Pfeilschiefter, Visual Developer, 2D/3D Creatures
 Kelly Wagner, Freelance Illustrator, Product Development Art Manager / Director for Kids Clothes
 Lauren Emmons, Children's Book Illustrator
 Max Dlabick, Comic Artist & Illustrator
 Mélanie Daigle, Animator, Director & Budding Author / Illustrator
 Monica Davila, Storyboard Director
 Paula Lucas, Game Art Lead
 Reed Underwood, Fiction Writer
 Roxie Viscarra, Co-Founder at Anthrox Studio
 Sarah Gonzales, Lead Character Artist, KO_OP
 Stephanie Webster, Artist & Designer
 Xiao Qing Chen, Themed Entertainment Concept Designer

 • THE WORLD ROULETTE RANDOMIZER DECK •  
The World Roulette Randomizer is a deck of 80 double-sided cards featuring attributes / catalysts / concepts & dynamics for developing robust, incredible worlds! This is a highly expanded version of the randomizer used to create the World Roulette Art Book!
Here's a little sneak peek of the prototype for the Randomizer Deck!
 We love good creative projects at Light Grey -- so we decided to design an expanded version of the tool we provided the World Roulette Art Book participating artists! The Randomizer Deck uses hundreds of world attributes, catalysts, concepts and dynamics that can be shuffled and combined together to fuel any worldbuilding project. This deck uses simple mechanics of layering, twisting, and combining cards to prompt dynamic idea generation for building robust, intriguing, believable worlds! The 80-card, double-sided deck comes with how-to instructions and helpful layouts for how to combine any number of cards for infinite possibilities and is great for artists, writers, and creative RPG Dungeon Masters!
  • THE "FOUR REALMS" ENAMEL PINS •
Each of the four realms has it's own awesome enamel pin! All pins are gold + either white or black and backed by its corresponding World Roulette backer card.
 Magic? Mysticism? Treasure? Secrets? We like all of these things. The "Four Realms" enamel pins showcase themes from the World Roulette book in stylish, pin form. Stick it on your bag and show your allegiance to the realm of your choice... 
 • THANK YOU • WALLPAPERS • VINYL STICKER •
We'll personally write you a note and thank you for helping us, get you a copy of two awesome wallpaper designs for your phone / desktop, plus send you an exclusive World Roulette "Infinite Worlds" sticker designed by Lindsay Nohl
  Light Grey Art Lab founder, Lindsay Nohl designed the cover, the randomizer, the pins, and the in-between art in the World Roulette Book. Get a few fun extras from Light Grey featuring her work (including a World Roulette personalized thank you postcard, a vinyl "imagine infinite adventures" sticker, and two digital pattern wallpapers (of the Blight and the Long Sleep for your phone and desktop when you back any tier $25 and up! 
 • ARCHIVAL PRINTS •  
(Artists left to right JB Casacop, Vincent Boyer, Emily Walus, Shawn Pedralba, Jessica Bishop, James Firnhaber, Ashley Mackenzie, Kiki Kita, Billy Budgen)
All of these gorgeous pieces & many, many more are included in the World Roulette Book -- but if you want to grab a specific piece to hang lovingly on your walls, here's your chance! You can check out all of the awesome artwork on shop.lightgreyartlab.com to choose your favorite piece(s) for any of the print tiers. 
There are 150 amazing pieces of artwork looking for great homes! If you are interested in backing a tier with a print, we'll be custom printing these for you at Light Grey Art Lab using archival paper and inks and proceeds go directly to the artists of your choice! The World Roulette exhibition is on display in Minneapolis through the duration of the Kickstarter and we're proud to be displaying all 150 amazing works online and in our brick and mortar gallery! ** If you choose a tier with a customizable option, we'll be contacting you at the end of the Kickstarter with a survey so you can let us know your choices! The prints are also available outside of the Kickstarter via the Light Grey Art Lab online shop: shop.lightgreyartlab.com 
**NEW TIER!** We just added a great new tier with signed prints by 6 great artists!
 There are tons of ways to support the project! Thanks so much for helping us reach our Kickstarter goal! Anything helps!
 $20K Foil Cover + Clothbound Book Book upgrade --  If we reach this goal, all books will introduce a natural book cloth cover with a gold foil and black foil stamp. Let’s make this book shine!
$24K EVEN MORE Worldbuilding Content! We've inquired with some really incredible folks about contributing their wisdom -- which means more advice, great challenges, creative prompts, and thoughts on worldbuilding by industry professionals. We'll gather it all into a great season of PODCASTS WITH PROS + BEHIND THE SCENES INTERVIEWS with industry professionals to share with all Kickstarter backers in the $25 and above!
***More Stretch Goals will be announced if we unlock these tiers!   
 We’ll need your help achieving the Kickstarter Goal! All of the funds go directly into making these projects a reality --  We've worked super hard to get everything designed, now we just need to make it physical! Your pledges go towards book production, prototyping, design, and publication, as well as the not-so-fun parts such as fees, freight, and taxes. 
SHIPPING & FULFILLMENT
     Currently, we’re adding worldbuilding challenges, interviewing artists, doing final edits, and showcasing some of the great work in the project! We’ll keep you posted throughout the process and let you know about new features and stretch goals! You can also follow along @lightgreyartlab on social media.
We will be shipping all packages nationally using USPS priority mail - which comes with tracking and insurance. International orders will be shipped first class with tracking.
After the Kickstarter is complete, we’ll be sending off the production files for the book, deck, and stretch goals. As long as our shipment arrives on time, we will receive the books and products by mid-November and hope to start shipping awards at the beginning of December. 
For those that select digital tiers, $5 or $10, you’ll receive a big email from the Light Grey Team with your rewards and updates in November. Thank you so much!
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••  
 
Light Grey Art Lab is a gallery and art events space in Minneapolis, Minnesota, that focuses on bringing all types of artists and designers together to exhibit, participate, learn, and share experiences. We are a fiscally sponsored nonprofit through Springboard for the Arts. We believe that art culture should be accessible to everyone and that it should be easy for creatives to celebrate and grow their practice.
We love to make big things happen! Though we are an illustration-heavy gallery, we adore and support an interdisciplinary approach to 'making,' in that we frequently look for alternative and interesting ways to engage the creative community. Whether it's through a printed or an online project, we promote the theory that all artists are multi-faceted, idea-centric individuals whose creativity goes well beyond the visible technical aspects of the piece into the experiential side of art-appreciation. In addition to gallery experiences, we also host creative residencies, art camp programs, and art camp international programs to areas such as Iceland, Norway, Scotland, Japan, and various National Parks through the United States.
LIGHTGREYARTLAB.COM
We have a history of making collaborative projects -- our past publications include COSMOS Tarot & Oracle Deck,The Light Grey Tarot, In Place book, Girls: Fact + Fiction book, Rolemodels: Battle for Vyk’Tornaahl Card Game, Great Personality dating sim inspired by Myers-Briggs Personality Types, and Dream Arcade a 28-level platformer game made in collaboration with Microsoft.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The World Roulette book & deck are nearly finished -- we are about 95% done with the design, editing, and additional content, and all artwork is complete; there is no risk of the project being unfinished. All stretch goal products and content have also been designed, and there is no risk they will be incomplete.

The biggest risk for this project would be a delay in shipping due to Covid-19 or slowed service with USPS. If the books and products arrive late to our gallery, it may take us a little longer to package and send our rewards. 

Light Grey Art Lab is just three of us (Lindsay + Jenny + Kait) so we will keep you updated on shipping status and any changes along the way. Without a delay, art books and rewards will be shipped out the first week of December in hopes that they will arrive for Christmas.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hello everyone! We got word last week from the printer that the book should have been finished being assembled sometime this weekend and we are waiting for the final information regarding shipping timing to the gallery! We just wrote the printer a moment ago requesting an update and we expect some photos of the final books and an ETA on when we can expect it -- which we should receive a reply any moment now. Thank you again for your patience! We are hoping you're all doing well and can't wait to get you your packages! We really appreciate the support and your understanding! We'll post an update as soon as we get word regarding the ETA! Thanks so much!

Hi Everyone!
A huge thanks for your patience -- we cannot wait to ship this beautiful book and products out to all of you! We just received another proof this week to approve artwork printing. Publishing is always slower than you image, but right now things are extra slow with shipping and the pandemic. We appreciate your understanding! We are hoping the rest of the items arrive in late April and we will finish shipping out the boxes. 

What else are we up to at Light Grey Art Lab? We have a big series of online classes and workshops coming this spring! They are typically Thursdays and Saturdays.

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
We hope you are doing well and staying safe in the New Year!
We are sending a quick update for World Roulette Kickstarter Rewards. This week, the Randomizer decks arrived at the gallery -- we are so excited to share this project with you! The decks are 80 cards, double-sided with infinite creative prompts, keywords, and questions to get your artwork and storytelling underway! The enamel pins have also arrived at the gallery and look amazing! You can see more

Hello everyone! Just wanted to send a quick update for the production / shipping progress for all of the World Roulette bits and bobs! A few folks asked about whether or not the items will be shipped before the holidays and though we have our fingers crossed, we aren't sure yet about the exact arrival times for when everything will be here, so we can't guarantee that it'll be available to send out before then. We did get a heads up from a few of the manufacturers that things are a bit delayed (in general, not necessarily with our projects) with COVID, which is understandable, BUT so far we've seen samples and they look great!!!. We have given feedback on the proofs, and hope to get the final word for when production will be done and ready to send our way! We are crossing our fingers that it'll be a speedy process!

Hello everyone!
I hope you're doing well and finding a minute of rest these days! I just wanted to send a quick update to let you know that we've received a few of the smaller paper rewards already and are beginning to assemble packages in preparation for the big items when they are ready. We have been in communication with all of the different printers / manufacturers and all is going well! This is just a mini update for where we are as of today!

campaign.story:
Sylvia Ritter is a digital artist from Germany. You might recognize her from her Ubuntu Animals series, her ongoing tarot card series or her popular weekly speedpaintings. Sylvia's artworks have been commissioned by festivals and record labels, musicians, and book authors, as well as publishers and game companies. Click here for Sylvia Ritter's full portfolio.
Premiering When Winter is Nearing
Ready by the coldest time of the year when they are most welcome (details further down), Sylvia Ritter's jigsaw puzzle could have you gather around the table with friends or family to decipher the big picture together -- or you might want to figure it out all on your own, snugly wrapped in your favorite blanket, with a hot beverage by your side.
But good times don't end when the work is done! Once solved, puzzles can be framed and hung like paintings, allowing you to present (and your guests to enjoy) detailed and vibrant illustrations through an intricate jigsaw puzzle texture all year round.
Disco Dingo
Two Transcending Friends
What picture will you choose? Will you elect exuberant Disco Dingo to watch over us, dropping hot funkadelic beats that chase the doom & gloom away? Or will you let quiet and enigmatic The Star tend to the lush mystical island of our collective dreams?
The Star
Exquisite Detail, Expertly Made
Puzzle pieces are expertly color printed with a matte finish, stamped from long lasting but recyclable hard paperboard and air tight packaged by a renowned German board game manufacturer, guaranteeing quality, durability, and an all-around smooth puzzle-solving experience.
The Star - Detail 1
The Star - Detail 2
Disco Dingo Jigsaw Puzzle - Detail 1
Disco Dingo Jigsaw Puzzle - Detail 2
Technical Details
1000 Pieces
  Assembled picture is approximately 700 x 500 mm / 27,5 x 19,7 inch in size.
  120 g Chromopaper on 1.155 g laminated hard paperboard.
  Depending on choice of reward, a) a loosely packed in a factory-sealed see-through polyethylene bag ("The Essential") or, in addition, b) boxed in a varnished hard paperboard box, approximately 373 x 273 x 55 mm in size.
  Ships with a Color Picture Postcard and a Certificate of Authenticity.
   Reward Structure
Depending on how many jigsaw puzzles you want, and how much you want to pledge, both editions are offered in various forms as rewards. While "The Essential" only covers the puzzle pieces but costs a little less, we consider "The Elegant" to be the complete package, with each puzzle coming in a beautiful matching box.  
The Elegant Box Editions
Shipping Date
Our rewards will be ready for shipment and sent out by 16. November 2020 to ensure they will arrive just in time for the holidays.
Shipping to the USA and some other countries could be delayed due to COVID-19 related restrictions.
Express shipping methods (for an additional shipping fee) can be arranged individually if desired, after the campaign ends.
Backers outside of the EU: please inquire about customs duty charges that may possibly apply to imports to your country.
One Speedpainting per Milestone
For every major milestone reached during the campaign, Sylvia Ritter will paint and publish a brand new speedpainting wallpaper in full HD resolution (like the examples below), for personal desktop use:
 Milestone Alpha (€3750 raised): First Speedpainting
   Milestone Beta (€7500 raised): Second Speedpainting
   Milestone Gamma (€11250 raised): Third Speedpainting
   Milestone Delta (€15000 raised): Fourth Speedpainting
  Speedpainting 03062020 - Milestone Example
Speedpainting 24122019 - Milestone Example 2
Return Policy
Should there be a problem with your puzzle, you must return it within 30 days (starting date of receipt) to receive a replacement. For the proper returning procedure, please follow the directions on the packing slip. Exchanges cannot be processed after 30 days past date of receipt.
Still have questions? Please don't hesitate and ask! I’ll add answers to the FAQ section of this page.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've ordered several prototypes and puzzled each design. They will be produced in Europe, therefore there won't be any time delays due to customs. Manufacturing will take 9-10 weeks. This will be my second campaign. My first crowdfunding project "The Wakeful Hoodie" was successfully funded on Indiegogo in October 2018. As previously mentioned shipping to the USA and some other countries could be delayed due to Corona.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everybody.
I regret to inform you that we have to cancel and postpone our Jigsaw Puzzle Kickstarter campaign until 2021.
When we prepared the Kickstarter campaign, the manufacturer for the puzzles assured us that they were ready to take new orders starting August. When I contacted the manufacturer yesterday to ensure that the order would go into production on time, they told us that the situation changed. They claim they are now over capacity and booked out until the end of the year. Therefore, the jigsaw puzzles can not be produced and delivered on time.

Hello everybody!
Yippi Yippi Yeah! We've reached the first milestone. As promised here is the first speedpainting :)
https://www.deviantart.com/sylviaritter/art/Speedpainting-15082020-852085059
Thank you for your support and have a great weekend!

Please note The Essential (2x) and The Elegant (2x) rewards can be a mix of both puzzles!! We can't correct the reward text anymore. It should say "Two 1000 piece jigsaw puzzles of your choice":

campaign.story:
Hello there!  We are The Werewolf Collaboration - focusing on creating snarling, howling and mauling creatures, working with multiple artists and turning them into beautiful illustrations to create a small collective zine!
Our goal is to create a fun non-profit zine featuring 18 artists who have all created their own gorgeous werewolf works to show off and raise awareness for great causes. 
About the Zine:
The Zine is a small, A5 perfect bound booklet, featuring a double page spread of the featured artists and their werewolf creations.
About The Werewolf Collaboration
We are a team of three artists, all working on our own projects, but wanting to help give back a little, we decided to build this project to help others get involved and produce something fun!
Meet the Team:
Sarah Mason
Sarah is a full-time freelance illustrator from the Midlands, UK.  She focuses on art that revolves around the weird, wonderful and macabre, and creates a burst of colour and contrast.  She has made 4 successful Kickstarters in the past.
Sketchbuck
Sketchbuck is an artist from Lancashire, United Kingdom. They specialise in character illustration and animal watercolours.
FeatheryFlukes
Pharah (aka FeatheryFlukes) is a part time artist residing in West Yorkshire. Their biggest passion is drawing the weird and wonderful, specialising in monsters of all kinds.
------
FEATURED ARTIST LIST:
| BEARHYBRID | BEARLYFELINE | BEASTSOULART | BIGROUNDLION | BLINDCOYOTE | 
| EUQINIMODART | GRASSSHORES | JINXSIS | JOHIS | KIND7ED | MAGICALMOSS |
| MXMORGGO | TAINTEDSWEETMEATS | TAKAMATSU | WOLFSKULLJACK |
------
REWARDS:
To keep things as simple as possible, rewards are set to just three tiers - a donation tier, a digital PDF tier and a physical copy tier.
We have decided that this time around there will be no stretch goals and no extras, as this is a first large collaboration, we want to simplify it as best as we can.  Should this be a success, we plan on making this an annual project where we will inject more time and resources into!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All artists are currently close or have already completed their art for this small project - between the three of us there is enough experience from running our own Kickstarters to predict any risks and challenges we may face.

As Covid-19 is still quite an issue internationally, we cannot guarantee an exact time frame of when your zines will get to you - given that Royal Mail is heavily backlogged with parcels, it can take a lot longer than usual time frames - please be patient if some delays do occur!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone - just to answer a few messages we have been receiving and for the sake of clarity, here's a new update with regards to shipping:
All orders have been sent out, if you responded to the survey then it should be on it's way to you.  There will be no tracking information provided as the shipment costs were for International Standard - but rest assured they should be on their way to you.

Hello!  Apologies for the silence on here, but we wanted to reassure you that all orders have been posted and all parcels should be and already have made their way to their new homes already!

If you have ordered from outside of the UK, please be patient as it may take longer than usual to get to you due to COVID.  

But everything is complete, we are now just ensuring those who have yet to respond to the survey please do and once we've fully completed every order, we will then be completing this Kickstarter and donating the remaining funds to the two chosen charities!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys are out - check your emails!
updates.update_content:
Hey there all, 
This is just a quick poke to let you know surveys have been sent and to check your emails - we plan to get everything ready and packed this weekend, so the sooner you send us back your confirmed addresses, the better for us to get your zine out to you faster!
We hope you're all doing well, keeping safe and looking forward to getting your books!

Hello there friends!
We have fantastic news; everything has now been sent off and we are now just waiting for the books to be printed and delivered.  How exciting!  If you're a backer, make sure to check your messages as there is a link to the PDF version of the zine that you can now access and take a look at, yourselves!
If you missed out on the zine, that's okay!  You can head on over to the gumroad here: https://gum.co/VWIaUe to purchase a PDF version.  All money that comes in from sales of the zine will go towards the same charities!

Hello everyone!
This is just a quick update to let you all know what's going on. We have sent the zine artwork off to the publisher and are just awaiting some proofs back from them before we go into production.
We hit a few obstacles, hence why this process is taking a little longer than expected. But rest assured, things are still going ahead as planned.

Hey there everyone!  We just wanted to say a huge thank you supporting this project, it means the world to us that so many of you wanted to help support the project and the causes linked to it!  
We have received the funds and we shall be hopefully be getting everything confirmed and sent to print by the end of this week!  If all goes well, we should be receiving the books not much longer after that!

Hey there everyone, we just wanted to reach out and thank each and every one of you so far for backing and sharing this project.  We are over 700% funded in just the few days we have been launched and we couldn't be more proud and happy!
We also wanted to give a brief update with regards to the physical tier - as we have been getting a few comments and messages regarding the PDF.  We are happy to confirm that the PDF is also included with the physical copy (we may have forgotten to pop that in prior to launch, and you can't edit tiers!)

We're extremely blown away with how well the first hour has gone since launching this project - we fully funded in 20 minutes, that is WILD!
We can't thank you enough for your support so far, and the team of artists who have been creating some absolutely beautiful art - you all have been a huge help and this little zine wouldn't be real without you all.
A huge thank you from all of us - we can't wait to see what the next 6 days bring!

project_data.project_name: The Werewolf Collab: A Collaborative Art Zine!

campaign.story:
Hey there! I'm Amanda, an artist and illustrator residing near Boston, MA. You can view my work at  www.amandatulacz.com and follow me on instagram @amanda.tulacz. This is my third enamel pin kickstarter and I'm excited to make it a reality with your support!
To see examples of enamel pins I've made in the past, check out my shop and my Etsy 
"Cosmic Pantheon: Egypt" is a collectible enamel pin set inspired by ancient Egyptian mythology and the cosmic, yet fleeting nature of existence.
 All of the pins will come with:
two backing posts
mounted on double sided backing cards
black rubber backers
backstamp
***Back now and pay later! You will only be charged if the campaign reaches its funding goal.*** If the project doesn't reach its goal, your card won't be charged at all. Pledges can be adjusted at any time during the campaign!
Also, please don’t wait for your favorite design to be unlocked. If you do, it may never happen.



When the project is fully funded, you will be able to choose from any of the unlocked pins for your pledge amount.
 If all previous stretch goals are unlocked I will consider adding new pin designs as stretch goals (and potentially a free pin with every pledge!) 
The pins will retail at a regular price of $13-$15 once funded. However, in addition to the discounted early bird tiers at $10 per pin, these pins are available on Kickstarter at a lower price per pin as a thank you for helping to bring this project to life.

I had a test batch made ahead of this project to identify any potential production errors and see how white screen printing would look on black enamel. The results were stunning (pictured below!), but I did end up with a higher flaw rate than normal due to scratches on the screen-printing of some pins. Because of this I’ve adjusted all of the unlock goals to accommodate ordering a larger quantity of pins. This will make up for the higher flaw rate and insure that all backers receive standard A grade pins.  
Anubis test batch!
For every pin design, it will cost roughly $600 to create. This includes manufacturing fees and shipping from the factory. All remaining funds raised will be used for shipping to backers, materials, fees, and taxes. Excess funds will be used for the production of more pins and stickers. The buffer will be used to cover any additional or unexpected costs.
 Once the project is funded, surveys will be sent out to backers to select their pin choices. Once the surveys are complete it will take roughly 1-2 weeks for me to receive funds from the campaign. After the funds are received, the pins will be ordered. It should take around 4-6 weeks to receive the pins from the manufacturer, and orders will be promptly shipped out once pins are received. Assumed pin arrival date will take around 2-3 months from the end of the campaign. I expect the pins to be shipped out to me around mid-September to early October.
7/14/2020 - Campaign launches
8/13/2020 - Campaign ends and surveys are sent out
8/30/2020 - Funds are received and pins are ordered from the manufacturer
September/October - Pins are received and shipped out to backers.
September/October - Pins are received by backers. Please allow additional time for international shipping.
Want to support the campaign, but can't back it? No problem! Sharing on social media will help just as much. All shares are greatly appreciated! Be sure to tell your friends :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I will be sending the designs off to a pin manufacturer once funds are received. The designs may be tweaked to ensure the best outcome for the clarity and quality of the pin molds, but I will be sure to keep everyone updated on the final results.

Errors can happen during production which may delay the arrival date for the pins. I expect to receive the pins by September if all goes well, however I chose November as the expected shipping date for rewards to allow extra time in the event production errors occur.

Further shipping delays may occur if the design needs some minor edits, or if any errors happen during manufacturing. I will be sure to keep everyone informed of any delays.

Again, I'll be sure to keep everyone updated regarding any delays, and feel free to ask any questions!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My name is Fran Garcés, an illustrator and digital artist based in the Canary Islands, Spain. You may know me as Dibujante Nocturno on Instagram or Facebook. 
Thank you for taking the time to check out this Kickstarter campaign for my art book Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés. 
 Together with 3dtotal Publishing, I am creating a book that reflects who I really am as an artist, by giving insight into my creative experience and processes. The book will also include my ballpoint pen sketches, many of which I have scanned and colored especially for this project, and some new digital paintings, which I can't wait to share!
Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés will be beautifully presented in hardback with grained leather-effect binding and gunmetal foiling, making it a stunning addition to your art book collection. 
I see my sketchbooks as personal journals, recording important thoughts and moments in my creative journey. To offer a glimpse into my artistic mindset, I have chosen to include unseen personal sketches in this book, accompanied by notes and inner musings.
In addition to showcasing diverse galleries of my fantastical works, I will be sharing my workflow through a series of step-by-step tutorials and a collection of tips and tricks I have learned over the years as a freelance artist. Through this book I hope that I can help you to grow and develop as artists and offer inspiration for years to come.
I hope you will consider supporting this project to help make this book a reality. Thank you all very much!
Below are the exclusive items that are available in addition to the book. Some tiers and gifts are limited, so be sure to pledge quickly if you don’t want to miss out! We have put a lot of love into these items and we hope you enjoy them.
Please note that as this is a live project, all designs are examples of content I would like to include but these are subject to change.




 Launching this book through Kickstarter means we can thank those who support the book by adding extra stretch goal rewards to the campaign. I have designed high-quality bonus rewards to be given away if we can meet certain targets.






3dtotal like to give the best and most exciting stretch goals possible to their backers. For that reason we only reveal one stretch goal at a time. This allows us to respond to the success of the campaign, offering more exciting and adventurous items when the campaign does well, rather than having committed to multiple smaller inexpensive products.

3dtotal publishing is committed to having a positive effect on the environment. From 2020 they have committed to planting one tree for every book they sell by partnering with re-forestation charities. This includes books sold in their Kickstarter campaigns. If you support this campaign we would like to thank you for helping us take on this mission.
3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
We have fulfilled many successful Kickstarters and we have a great record for delivering parcels around the world. For this campaign we will be offering tracked shipping to certain locations as we're really determined that you receive your parcel first time without any hiccups or problems with delivery. Parcels sent to the UK, USA and Europe will be sent using our regular and reliable service, and parcels sent to the rest of the world will be sent with tracked shipping. Due to complications to logistics caused by the Coronavirus, some countries have introduced surcharges to receiving international postage. This is why shipping prices will seem slightly higher for some backers than it has done on our past campaigns.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in October. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address – the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
  As seasoned users of Kickstarter, 3dtotal Publishing know that a very small number of backers don’t fill in the survey at the end of a Kickstarter campaign, making it impossible for us to process and ship their rewards. 3dtotal pledges to hold all rewards for backers that fail to fill in their survey for 12 months and to make multiple efforts to contact the backers in question to try to successfully deliver their items.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges will be producing and delivering everything to you on time. We've selected an expert printer to work with and a fulfilment company 3dtotal Publishing has an established relationship with, so everything is in place as much as possible to ensure smooth production and delivery by the end of October 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to say that shipping of the books will commence the week of the 16th of November. Once the books are all on their way to you, we will be back in touch with estimated delivery dates.
Thanks again!

Hi everyone,

We'd like to thank you all for your patience and understanding regarding the delay to shipping. We will hopefully have more information to update you with very soon.

In other news, we thought you may be interested in our latest Kickstarter project. We are very excited to have teamed up with prolific visual effects studio , the team responsible for the iconic monsters of for their first narrative artbook .

Hi everyone,
The campaign has now ended, raising a fantastic total of £71,039! We are incredibly grateful to each and every one of you who has helped make this project a great success, thank you all so much for supporting Fran in making this book become a reality.
