STRETCH GOALS
Bonus rewards will be added to existing tiers, or will become available as new tiers as we unlock stretch goals. 
UNLOCKED: $20K Stretch Goal will unlock a new tier for SIGNED POSTCARD of ERIKA ISHII and RINA HOSHINO, FEATURING A BEAUTIFUL STILL CINEMATIC IMAGE FROM "AND THEN". 
Example of a possible postcard image
UNLOCKED: $25K Stretch Goal will unlock a new tier for the AND THEN MOVIE POSTER by MAYUMI NOSE.
AND THEN movie poster by MAYUMI NOSE
UNLOCKED: $30K Stretch Goal will unlock an extended edition DIRECTOR'S COMMENTARY of the film for every backer.
Additional Director's Commentary version of the final short film
UNLOCKED: $40K Stretch Goal will give Jenn the ability to offer some form of CREW COMPENSATION  to every principal crew member who donated their time and personal resources to the project because they believed in it. Including the Co-Director of Photography, Co-Writer, Director's Assistant, Gaffer, Wardrobe & Make-up, and Co-Producer. Please help support the amazing people who made this film. This amount takes into account Kickstarter fees, merchandise production costs, and shipping costs. 
The amazing team at our wrap party
UNLOCKED: $50K Stretch Goal will unlock more PHOTOGRAPHY MONOTYPE TIERS. 
UNLOCKED: $55K Stretch Goal will unlock the COSMIC PRIDE PIN for every backer at the $65 Tier and above. Celebrating queer pride, exploration, and night kings & queens. This will also allow the production to assist crew members and freelancers affected by COVID-19 on the "And Then" team. Some crew members are experiencing cancellations and postponements in the film industry. This Tier will allow for advanced relief for those most affected by the pandemic
UNLOCKED: $60K Stretch Goal every backer will receive DIRECTOR'S NOTES. This includes storyboards, shotlists, schedules, detailed lighting plans, script revisions, and tips on guerrilla filming. 
Storyboard sketches and script
UNLOCKED: $65K Stretch Goal digital footage will be converted into film to give the overall picture quality a more beautiful, nostalgic look.  
We'll use a lab in London to convert digital files to film
UNLOCKED: $70K Stretch Goal Jenn spent more than $31,300 using savings and available credit to kick-start the film production. This means Jenn can potentially recover most of the production costs after crew compensation, taxes, Kickstarter fees, merchandise costs, and shipping, and still be able to fund post-production, when all the math is done.
Jenn spent more than $31,300 using savings and available credit to kick-start the film production
$95K Stretch Goal This stretch goal has been reassessed after taking into account taxes and after adding a stretch goal to provide crew members financial assistance with the escalation of COVID-19 on March 17. This will allow a small crew to potentially return to Japan to re-shoot scenes that were cut. 5-10 scenes had to be cut during principal filming due to time and budget constraints. While footage is currently with an editor, Jenn feels that there may be a possibility the crew may need to film additional footage to make a stronger film. 
5-10 scenes were cut on the fly during principal filming
THE CAST AND CREW OF AND THEN 
The cast, extras, and crew in front of Goldfinger Bar on Day 3 of filming
We are proud to introduce our crew and talent from Japan and all over the world - Seattle, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Australia, London, and Chile.
ERIKA ISHII as MANA ENDO: Erika Ishii is an actor known primarily for her voiceover work in games and animation She can be heard in leading roles in Dream Daddy: A Dad Dating Sim, Mobile Suit Gundam Narrative (NT), Fire Emblem Heroes, and Sailor Moon SuperS, among others. Erika has acted and hosted with numerous new media outlets including Geek & Sundry, Critical Role, Nerdist, Screen Junkies, and Collegehumor.
RINA HOSHINO as HARU SUGIYAMA: Rina Hoshino is a bilingual Japanese-American actress, voice-over artist, and a singer.  Born in Yokohama, and spent her adolescence in Seattle from the age of 13, Hoshino formerly trained as an actress at the Lee Strasberg Theatre Institute LA. Hoshino's previous credits include Mewtwo from Detective Pikachu, Katana from DC Superhero Girls TV Series on Cartoon Network, Bunko from the World War Z Video Game, an Unannounced AAA Video Game by Japanese and American Studios, and singing the opening-theme of an Anime mobile-game that will be released soon.
JENN RAVENNA | DIRECTOR, CO-DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY, CO-WRITER, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER: Queer Asian-American film director and cinematographer based in Seattle, Washington. Her roots are in the video games industry. Her past clients include Arenanet, Magic the Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Dark Horse Comics, Riot Games, and Valve. As a director and cinematographer, Jenn's goal is to bring stories to life and connect people together through compelling imagery. jennravennatran.com 
TROY EDIGE | CO-DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY, COLOURIST: Troy is a Turkish DP and filmmaker based in London. He has worked extensively on commercials and documentaries, and his work has appeared on Netflix, HBO and BBC. “And Then” is his first narrative project. troyedige.com
ELLIE MCCUTCHEON  | ASSISTANT DIRECTOR, PRODUCER: Ellie McCutcheon is a documentary cinematographer and FAA-certified drone pilot who grew her roots in the San Francisco Bay Area documentary film scene before launching her own Northern California-based drone business. You can find her aerial work featured on places like Netflix, NPR, The Washington Post, and elsewhere. When not flying, hiking, or playing ukulele, she works as a producer, archival researcher, and occasional assistant director on documentary (and sometimes narrative) films. Learn more and say hi at elliemccutcheon.com.
PATRICK LAFFOON | CO-WRITER, PRODUCER: Writer and Producer based in Los Angeles, California who has written and produced several short films and worked in production and casting on animated TV shows like The Simpsons, Bless the Harts, and Final Space.
HAMISH CAMPBELL | PRODUCER: Based in Japan for over 10 years, Hamish is a fine art photographer, cinematographer and drone pilot. Specialising in evocative landscape stills and documentary video, he loves working on international productions connecting other cultures and people to Japan. www.hamish-campbell.com
MAKIKO SEGAWA  | LINE PRODUCER: Makiko works for International PR of Tokyo, organizing press tour, foreign-journalist program package, incentives and more. Alongside this, she has also begun working as a production-group chief, with a personal network of bilingual cameraman, photographers in Tokyo, serving a multi facet production, providing a fixer with a van, location hunting, logistics, translations, camera-shooting and so on for foreign media and foreign companies.
JUNKO YAMADA | ASSOCIATE PRODUCER: Junko works as a fixer, supporting various media companies and productions across Tokyo. She works with a personal network of professionals in the film-making industry in Tokyo, serving a multi facet production, logistics, and so on for foreign media and foreign companies.
MINAKO OKAMOTO | ASSOCIATE PRODUCER: A provider of a multitude of Japanese language services in Tokyo. Fluent in both Japanese and English, she offers translation, interpreting and cultural consultation as well as general production assistance and fixing. She also runs an international Japanese tutoring business, so if you've always wanted to learn Japanese, consider her services! www.privatejapaneselesson.com
DIEGO MIRANDA | STEADICAM OPERATOR: Diego Miranda is a steadicam operator and Director of Photography from Chile. His work includes various feature films, indie productions, and has worked globally for various well known clients. He is currently filming a TV feature for Netflix, and was the steadicam operator for Ema, Fireflies, The Snack Thief, Gun Shy, and more. 
SEAN MAGUIRE  | ASSISTANT CAMERA: Sean Maguire is an upcoming Australian Videographer and Editor who has completed his bachelors degree in film at the SAE Institute of Creative Media in Brisbane Australia. Sean has been creating high quality content for multiple years and has worked with major brands like Adidas, JBS, Shiseido, BAT, Schoolies, Ozzy Tyres
CHRIS BOULOS  | GAFFER: Chris Boulos is a Los Angeles based Gaffer who has been in the industry for almost 10 years. He has worked on award winning projects from low profile films to big budget productions with A list talent. He’s frequently referred to as “Your friendly neighborhood gaffer” for his fun and laid back demeanor on set. You can find him at instagram.com/brokencinema.
ROB MAYES | SOUND: Rob is a location and post sound engineer based in Tokyo. He has worked on location and post sound for feature film, television, documentary, corporate, short, and indie film projects. Clients include Netflix, ATP Festivals, RSA Films, Youtube Space, Warp Records, Virgin Earth Tokyo, Set Tokyo, Cutters Tokyo, Japan Soc.
WES COOLEY  | CHIEF WARDROBE AND MAKEUP STYLIST: Wester Cooley is an Actor, Singer and Designer based in Tokyo, Japan. Wester attacks projects from the ground up. As a designer he will help conceptualize your goals and bring them to life. Whether it be costume makeup or show design his experience has been across TV, theater and touring shows. Having been on the creative team for the nightclub LIGHT at Mandalay Bay with Cirque Du Soleil, or Costuming designing for the latest run of Macbeth with the Las Vegas Shakespeare Theater Company, his work is as broad as his talent.
YUYA KURIHARA | CLOTHING DESIGNER: From Ishioka, Ibaraki, Yuya is a talented clothing designer in Tokyo operating, Two Y. His clothing designs are timeless in elegance and modern sensibilities. More of his designs can be found on his website at www.rakuten.ne.jp/gold/twoy-you-me.
JON EVERIST | COMPOSER: Award-winning composer and musician from Seattle, Washington. Jon's scores for visual media have gained him dozens of award wins and nominations including the "Jerry Goldsmith Award", Game Music People's Choice Award, and a nomination from The American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (ASCAP) for "Best Score for a Video Game".  Jon's soundtracks often blend an eclectic mix of analogue synths and live orchestra. As a composer, Jon's goal is to spread empathy while supporting the director's vision.
SHIN AOMI | TRANSPORT MANAGER: Professionally and go-getting, Shin supports film productions from point A to B all across Tokyo. 
JOSIAH SPENCER | PRODUCTION ASSISTANT: Josiah helped out on  AND THEN as a production assistant, stepping out of his comfort zone as an anthropology academic. He assistant in various departments, including wardrobe, assistant to the AD and various producers, and was an excellent translator. He is currently based in Tokyo.
SHAHRIYAR AHMED (Anocam) | BEHIND THE SCENES PHOTOGRAPHER: SHAHRIYAR is a Tokyo based photographer, originally from London, with a unique and candid style in documenting what he sees and experiences. Twitter / Instagram / hello@anocam.com
Special thank you to contributing artists, LISA HEIDHOFF (Storyboards), JULIA RECK (Pin Design), ELORA PAUTRAT (Illustration), MAYUMI NOSE (Illustration).
Special thank you to cultural advisers and sensitivity readers, YUKA MENDO, LUIS MENDO, VIVIAN LE, MINAKO OKAMOTO, and RINA HOSHINO.
Special thank you to PAUL CARTER (Benbrick) for usage of his songs, What Holds You Together and They All Say for the Kickstarter video. 
HIGHLIGHTING SMALL, LOCAL JAPANESE BUSINESSES 
It was important to the director to showcase local Japanese business beyond the concrete and neon landscape of Tokyo. Here are some local businesses we worked with on AND THEN, who generously donated their space and resources either for free or a very small fee:
EQUIP TOKYO: A video and photography rental house based in the Harajuku district of Tokyo.
GOLDFINGER: A LGBTQ+ friendly bar located in the Shinjuku district of Tokyo.
HAMOREBI: A quaint cafe located in the Taito City district of Tokyo.
TWO Y: A clothing brand based in Tokyo. Creative Director - Two Y, President - Kazutami Yoshida, Producer/Maestro - Yuya Kurihara.
ゲストハウス SEKINO and PIZZA BUS: An Airbnb in Shizouka and homemade pizza place run by Futa.
ALMOST PERFECT: An artist residency in Taito City, Tokyo.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Principal filming has already been completed, so the risks are minimal. Our current funding goal gives us a small buffer in the event we have spend more on post-production, so that we can finish the film no matter what.

Pins, and prints are all regularly produced, sold, and shipped by JENN RAVENNA. Our team is well within our comfort zone.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: And Then News and Update! + Remaining Backer Rewards - Need Responses
updates.update_content:
Hey All!
I am happy to share some news about AND THEN! 
One quick note - I was notified that the subtitles lag behind a bit, so I will include an .SRT file in all the digital downloads by 4/20 for folks who would like to use that with the no subtitles version of the film. 
FILM FESTIVAL OFFICIAL SELECTIONS AND AWARDS!

updates.update_userinfo: New Film from Jenn Ravenna Tran - "Death's Diner"
Final Delivery Update + Exclusive Death's Diner Trailer Sneak Peak + Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Download Troubleshooting 
Hey all, it looks like some folks may still be have checking out. I tested everything to make sure everything worked this time. If for some reason Gumroad is still charging you and you don't want to use Paypal, there will be a discount box after you checkout where you can enter the code you received in your messages. That should take care of things.

updates.update_userinfo: NEW Download Link Sent to Messages for AND THEN
updates.update_content:
Okay!!! It took all day but we got a new link up and running. JUST sent the new download link to messages.
Here's what had happened:
1. Dropbox banned all links, too many downloads 
2. Re-uploaded files to Gumroad (I know it can handle mass downloads, should have tried this first) but accidentally to Preorders which wouldn't let me release the film ASAP, only scheduled releases

Hi all! 
I didn't know you can only send out 25 shared link invites apparently on Dropbox, that might be the cause of the 404 error issue you are all receiving. I am working on fixing it now. I won't be able to apply to everyone individually but wanted to let you know I am working on it. Thank you for the patience and apologies for the inconvenience. Will try to fix as soon as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: "And Then" the Short Film Delivered + Future Public Release Date
Official Kickstarter Backer Release Date for AND THEN!
updates.update_content:
Film Festival Official Selections! 
We're so close to the finish line! Some of you may have seen on social media, but I'm excited to share that "And Then" has been accepted into two film festivals! The Seattle Asian American Film Festival and CASCADIA International Women's Film Festival. 
My first priority is YOU, our Kickstarter backer. So I've decided to release the film to Kickstarter backers before the first film festival for Early Access, as promised in the reward details, and because YOU made this possible. The good news is that the film is already done! I just have to send the link out to you.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Reminder! Action Need! Fill Out Surveys By Tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! This is a final reminder to fill out Kickstarter Reward Surveys.
For a detailed summary of what's been happening with the film, please refer to the previous post. 
If you backed at the Monotype tiers, there will be a slight delay as the files are currently being prepped to print.

updates.update_userinfo: Action Need! Kickstarter Reward Surveys Sent! Premiere Status Update!
updates.update_content:
Hello lovely people! Here's a big juicy update!
Action Needed! Fill Out Your Kickstarter Reward Surveys!
Physical Kickstarter rewards are currently enroute to the distribution warehouse where they will be fulfilled by our amazing distribution managers, White Squirrel.

updates.update_userinfo: "And Then" is Finished! Kickstarter Back Surveys Coming Soon. 6 Months Ahead of Schedule!
updates.update_content:
"And Then" is officially finished! We are done with the final edit, score, sound mixing, color grading, and final finishing touches. Today we submitted to our very first film festivals. 
When will you be able to view the film? 
After we submit to the major film festivals, we will then send everyone a download link to the HD master file of the film. The reason why we cannot send the film out immediately is because some festivals have guidelines about premieres, and with so many backers we'd like to prevent any leaks from happening. Unless I am otherwise advised, I'm estimating that we will be able to sent the final film to backers first in the spring or summer of 2021. After backers have had some time with the film as an early watch, the current plan is to premiere the film on Vimeo so that everyone can enjoy it, although this may change as things development.

project_data.project_name: AND THEN: A Girl-Meets-Girl Short Film Set in Tokyo

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter for my first art book. I'm Erica, also known as HookieDuke, an illustrator and occultist. This book features a selection of my art from past five years of my work in music posters, album art, tabletop games, personal pieces, inktober drawings, and more. Contains some material considered to be 'mature content' as well as LGBT+  friendly drawings.
Ritual is a hard bound and approximately 8x10.667"
A brewing storm on the horizon, flashes in the distance, the cut of a knife, the dream settles in. Ritual is the collected art works of Erica Williams, a 170 page hard bound book spanning dreamscapes and obsessions. Please join my world of the occult, demons, and creatures of lore in this collection.
Rewards include original ink drawings, a metallic art print, holographic stickers, an intaglio art print, and an enamel pin. Five select original ink drawings are also available.
Ritual includes textless versions of my work for musicians like Metallica, Dave Matthews Band, Mastodon, and Ray LaMontagne among many others. In addition to music posters my work on album and book covers, Magic the Gathering, and Mondo is also included.
 Special Kickstarter only pricing on original drawings and intaglio prints.  
8.5x10" 12 color limited edition screen print "Edge of Light" on metallic gold foil. Edition of 425.
Enjoy the shiny <3
Planchette Creature enamel pin
Delight, a limited edition intaglio print is available. Intaglio is a traditional style of printmaking made from a copper plate with the art etched onto it. Edition of 20.
Peony, a limited edition intaglio print is available. Intaglio is a traditional style of printmaking made from a copper plate with the art etched onto it. Edition of 15.
50 available
Early Pledge Special. 50 Available
Unsigned Book Set. 150 Available
Signed Book. 100 Available
Five Available
Original Ink drawings - 1 of each available
 *All designs are subject to minor change due to production*
Thanks to Kickstarter's platform if certain milestones in funding are reached new rewards will be available for everyone. These high quality rewards include a bookmark, mini print, notecard set, and an additional 10 pages of process and insight into my work bringing the total page count to 180. These are automatically added to all pledges when the corresponding funding milestone is reached.
  I am honored to have spent the last several years sharing my work with the world and for the opportunity to bring my work alive through art prints. This new chance to bring so much of my work together in one place and to share it with new and existing fans alike means the world to me. Please accept my sincerest thanks and love for allowing me to do so and for supporting this new book!
Preview video music: "Mechanisms" by Adam Welle
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been operating an online shop for 6 years with experience in producing high quality merchandise with eco-friendly packaging. I will be hiring experienced help for fulfilling all pledges to make make sure that everything is completed smoothly and without issue. This is my first Kickstarter, which means some new challenges to overcome. There is always a room for human error, but I will do my absolute best to concisely and clearly explain any issues or delays that may arise. 

To ensure rewards are delivered on time, extra time has been included for book production. Quality checked during production and all made with love and care. <3 
Spread of Covid19 has been taken into account and hopefully will not affect the timeline, however if it will all information relating to the delay will be immediately and clearly relayed to all project backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy Holidays!

It is official! Ritual Kickstarter pledges have shipped! Thank you so much for the patience as we worked though the issues of damaged copies. The time it took to sort through them was longer than expected, there was just a lot of damage and we wanted to make sure that everyone received rewards that were in good condition and lovely.

Ritual has arrived, a little late due to a freight issue, but all books have safely landed.

This update is a little delayed as I have been moving, and the ill timing complicated things, so my sincerest apologies on that. However, everything ha settled down and rewards will start shipping out on October 26th! Tomorrow!!!

Hello everyone! Hope you are having a fabulous day. <3 
Wanted to share an update on Ritual, estimated shipping times, and information for changes of address. 
Firstly, and my sincere apologies, the book is a little behind. However they are all bound and now we are just waiting on them to make their way here so they can be sent out to everyone. I tried extremely hard to keep the September timeline, but the books are not due to arrive until the first week of October. Fulfillment will take 2-3 weeks, which means they should start arriving just in time for all the good spooky vibes! If there are any other delays I will let you know right away, but hopefully this is the only one.

updates.update_userinfo: August Update - ETA shipping and arrivals
updates.update_content: Enamel Pins have arrived! They turned out fantastic. These will be shipping separately from the book, so you may get a survey soon requesting your address be updated. Keep an eye on your inbox. <3

Thanks so much for your patience everyone! There hasn't been a lot to update as the process of getting the book put together and approved is a slow one, but this past week I did get in a new sample and wanted to share with you. <3 Right now there is a small delay on the book due to a color issue, but overall it still is on track to be arrive in September and be sent out to everyone at that time. So good news is there are no significant delays!

The first of the rewards for Ritual arrived today. "Edge of Light" prints are here and looking so pretty. The metallic foil is incredibly hard to photograph but is really stunning. I Just wanted to share with you!

Sorry this is late the day got away from me. But here is a small video I recorded! (It's awkward. It's me. That's just how it is)
Seriously though I said this entire time I was shocked and amazed and I didn't think this would go so well. I didn't think I would hit more than 400 pledges. It has over 1300!!! This has been the most empowering and positive experience for me. THANK YOU. Now to bring this into the physical realm. <3

updates.update_userinfo: WE DID IT!!! <3 The best finish ever.
updates.update_content:
Wow! WOW! I can't believe we met the final stretch goal and it's not even the last day of the campaign?!
This is so huge to me and I can't thank you enough. This has been my first Kickstarter and I had no idea what to expect and wasn't sure this was a thing people were even interested in. Every part of this process and the reaction it received and having it perform this well has left me in awe. I can go over how entirely mushy and floaty i am feeling and how this has been teaching me a lot about how supportive and amazing people can be but I will end up crying and just ramble on.

project_data.project_name: Ritual: Art Collection of Erica Williams

campaign.story:
We contacted over 100 illustrators from around the world to ask them a simple question- Butts, Can They Be Art? 
Some laughed, some cheered, some doubted... but every creator answered the call with their own surreal, humorous, beautiful, and unique visual interpretation of this cheeky challenge.
Butt Is It Art?  is the first of its kind. Never before have so many diverse creators from all over the world come together in such a huge way to create something like this. Never before has such a bizarre and unusual premise been given a chance to be published. By pledging, you are helping to create something entirely new, and supporting a large, engaged, and growing collective of artists.  
 Butt Is It Art? is a large scale anthology art-book showcasing original illustrations from dozens of artists across multiple mediums and at all experience levels.
It's an 7"x10" heavy hardcover, over 100 pages long; featuring a durable double binding, and high-quality photo paper.
A great coffee table art book for anyone who loves visual style, thematic richness, and independent art projects!  
A collection that focuses on diversity, expression, and exploration while avoiding shallow sexual titillation.
It's a passionate plea for the artistic value of bottoms! With a beautiful Introduction by writer and journalist Laura Kate Dale (the U.K.'s foremost expert on butts) 
A unique and beautiful work of collaborative design that you won't find anywhere else.  
Printing a book is no easy feat, and we don’t want to compromise on quality. We'd like to get an initial limited print run off the ground with two variant covers, one in matte hardcover and another in faux leather with embossed foil. If we can raise $8000, we will be set to bring this project to life - and that is where you guys come in!
The hardcover book will have a matte cover - glossy 105lb inside pages - and a durable double binding to ensure maximum quality
This Kickstarter-exclusive book will have a high-quality faux leather cover with an embossed gold foil design. Glossy 105lb inside pages - and a durable double binding to ensure maximum weight and thickness
A project like this can't get far without artists, and we've assembled an ambitious collection of creators from every corner of the globe. 
Here's just a partial list of our incredible creators! Each one representing different mediums, styles, backgrounds, and perspectives. Click the names below to see some of their work!

Right now about 80% of the art for the project is finished, with the remainder on schedule to be completed before the crowdfunding concludes! Participating artists have already been paid for their hard work, so all the money earned goes directly to printing costs and other fees such as postage/production of rewards.
Our current goal is $8,000. If we make OVER that goal we have some very special plans! See STRETCH GOALS below
Every dollar you contribute will go toward making sure the book you receive is the best possible art we can produce! With that in mind, as we approach set goals, we'll be improving the quality of the final product. 
10 additional artists added to the project - That’s 10 brand new pieces of never before seen art!!
All physical copies will now come bundled with a gold-foil butt is it art bookmark and a rigid cardstock mini-poster
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Several of the team members at Multiverse Books have overseen or participated in successful crowdfunding campaigns before! 
Over 85% of the commissioned art is already finished, and the remainder should be done before the crowdfunding campaign ends. 
As with any complex anthology project, there's the possibility of delay. However, at this time we don't anticipate any problems! We are all professionals who will work hard to get you your rewards as quickly as possible, and strive to remain transparent and upfront in the face of any difficulties.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good Afternoon!

This is Christopher's assistant again! Just to clarify for anyone who might've been confused. We are still offering expedited shipping of the "Butt Is It Art?" book and offering refunds to anyone who has still not received their items. Please feel free to message me directly if you would like to receive an expedited copy or refund. Thank you again for all of your patience and understanding.

Good Afternoon!

This is Christopher's assistant and I want to apologize for the delay in response about the "Butt Is It Art?" pledging. We unfortunately had not been receiving updates on our kickstarter page with the pledging orders. We are currently offering an expedited copy of the book which will arrive before Christmas, or a full refund. Please feel free to message us with any comments, questions, or concerns. Again, our sincerest apologies.

Thank You and Happy Holidays,

updates.update_userinfo: Better Late Than Censored! GOOD NEWS POST
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
First, I want to apologize for the delayed update. I know we are off the original schedule, and we want everyone to know what’s going on with the project!
It’s been a difficult couple of months for basically everyone on the planet, and our production team was no exception. We’ve been hit with delays, sickness, bureaucratic complications, and deaths. However, things are finally normalizing and we are proud to announce that

Hello everyone! 
I hope you are all staying safe in these unusual times! I'm writing today to give you an update on our printing process. The book was submitted to our production partners in China a few weeks ago. These are people we've worked with for years without issue, and have a comfortable and ongoing relationship with. 
However, this time the update process was.... a little odd. Responses were slower, and updates weren't forthcoming. After a few weeks with no news we finally get word-

Hello! 
We hope everyone is staying safe and taking care of themselves! Surveys have just been sent out to confirm addresses and how you'd like your names to appear in the THANK YOU section of printed copies of the book! Please fill them out within the next 2 weeks (don't worry, we'll send a reminder!)
We're working hard to bring Butt Is It Art? to fruition, and will update you as the printing, shipping, and fulfillment stages are completed.

updates.update_userinfo: We Did It!! Production and Coronavirus Update!
updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much! We've come a long way and brought this whole project to life! Multiverse Books 100% couldn't have done it without you! Butt Is It Art? is going to print! 
From here we're going to step into the production phase. I know you've all been following the news and are aware of the current Covid-19 Pandemic. It has definitely set back our production schedule a bit, but won't majorly disrupt the project or the final result. We want to be totally transparent with you every step of the way.

updates.update_userinfo: 2/3 of the way there! Art Update #2 (Plus a project recommendation!)
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! 
Less than halfway done with the crowdfunding window and we're over 75% funded! It's more than we dreamed possible for our first kickstarter! I've got some new art to share, but first I wanted to mention another butt themed artbook project you might enjoy! 
Butts on Things by the incredible illustrator Brian Cook is entering its final few days on Kickstarter and I wanted to recommend it as a companion piece to Butt Is It Art?

project_data.project_name: Butt Is It Art? - An Original Hardcover Artbook

campaign.story:
A coming of age story and illustrated novel inspired by the South Pacific.
Good for an adventurous someone of any age, "Naiya and the Foxdragon" explores the magic of leaving childhood behind, and that of when you finally start to realize the world around you is more intertwined than you first thought.
Naiya is a young teen who has been hiding from her past and her unkind uncle most of her life until she befriends a foxdragon named Aru. When the last of the magic orbs that once powered their city is depleted, she faces her fears and embarks on an unexpected journey into the heart of the jungle to save her home.
Along the way, Naiya discovers her own self-worth as she and her foxdragon friend navigate the treacherous jungle and learn about her own relationship with the world’s magic.
Aru (left) & Naiya (right)
 Naiya - An independent young teen of 14 years, Naiya loves to spend her time outside. She finds freedom in climbing rooftops and hidden passageways on her errands within the city as a house servant to a spice merchant. Always curious about the greater world, she enjoys learning through books. Naiya has a soft spot for animals, caring for those she finds abandoned in the city.
Aru - A young foxdragon brought to the trade city of Ora, Aru has no recollection of his past. His curiosity and fondness for food can, at times, get him into a bit of trouble. Aru is a loyal friend & companion. 
 While Naiya and Aru's story can stand on words alone, the illustrations throughout the book add glimpses into their world for a more immersive experience.
Each chapter begins with a unique full-page textile pattern, and the following spreads contain a variety of vignette, half and full-page spread illustrations to complement the text.
The book is a standard comic book size at 6.625 x 10.5 inches, chosen for comfortable chapter reading as well as an immersion into imagery that flows from page to page. "Naiya and the Foxdragon" is 282 pages long, 24 chapters and 78,000 words.

The outlining stage of "Naiya and the Foxdragon", my studio space and a thumbnail sheet of all the pages + illustrations in the book.
About Naomi VanDoren: I am a visual artist and author based in Northern California. For the past six years, I have been working independently as an artist on creator-owned projects like my yearly art books, which I have Kickstarted in the past.
In my storytelling, I strive to capture the adventures of my youth in the jungles of Indonesia and pay homage to the beautiful culture in which I spent over 14 years. "Naiya and the Foxdragon," and the tropical world of Antarah in which it takes place, was born out of a desire to fully dive into storytelling and create an immersive world using inspiration from where I grew up. It also was born from a love of the fantasy genre, epic quests that sweep you off your feet and endearing characters you feel a deep connection with.
If you're curious about my writing style I encourage you to check out the first chapter of "Naiya and the Foxdragon" which takes place 10 years before the rest of the book, when Naiya is still a young child.
If you're a fan of the Ghibli films, Avatar the Last Airbender, and even The Hobbit, I think you'll enjoy this book too.
Why an illustrated novel? I've loved reading and writing just as much as I love art. Rather than create a book that was art-focused, or heavily writing focused I decided I wanted a book that celebrated both in a way that allowed a reader to escape deeper into the world that I've created.
 This project is going to print as soon as the Kickstarter campaign ends!
I've spent the last 2+ years working on this project so that I can bring you something that is nearly complete and ready for print. As a Kickstarter backer myself, I appreciate creators that are transparent about the status of their projects. In that spirit, here is what has been done with "Naiya and the Foxdragon", what is being wrapped up, timelines for printing etc.
Writing: All of the writing from outlines through the final draft of the book are complete. I've worked with a professional developmental editor twice to perfect the story, run the project through beta readers and had a copy editor proof the book. The only thing that I plan to do in regards to the text is one final round of quick copy editing (1/2 way through already) for that last look as well as adding any words I find to complete the appendix page.
Illustrations: All of the illustrations have been designed and are in their final form linework-wise. This involved reference gathering, some 3D designs for some of the locations, character design, and lots of time for the composition and inking process - all of which are now complete. I'm going through the bulk of each illustration and adding the final touches of color to each (1/2 way through this process at this point). I estimate this to take 2 weeks while the campaign is live. Check-in on the status here.
Design: The full book has been designed from a rough draft to the final draft. While I have a background in graphic design, this book is being handled by a designer that has publishing experience. The only thing that remains in this stage of the project is to typeset the file and export it for print.
Printing: I'm working with a printer currently and finalizing files once the campaign is over. I've received a blank sample copy of the paper that will be used with the book along with the cloth for the Special Edition.
Timeline after the campaign ends: The timeline for the book production begins after this Kickstarter campaign is complete and I receive the Kickstarter payment from the campaign to make the order (which is usually 2 weeks after it ends, on or around the first week in April). Once I receive it, I am able to move ahead with printing. The estimated time for printing is 3 months from handing files over to the printer in April until books being physically at my door in July. I'm allowing a month for shipping your rewards out with the exception of books with remarque sketches which I have allowed for additional time to complete. I will be preparing shipping materials as well as any additional rewards during the waiting period for the books to arrive.
Shipping: Will be collected after the project is complete and the books are printed and ready to ship in or around June or July. Please see more about shipping in the "Shipping" section at the bottom of this project page.
Does not include shipping. Click on the image to find out more about changing your pledge amount.
All stretch goal goodies are for all backers, any tier!
Shipping for this project will be collected after the project is complete and the books are ready to ship. In order to give you the best price for shipping, I've decided to handle shipping after the campaign and through Backerkit. This allows me to better estimate how much shipping will be with a physical sample book as well as not inflate the Kickstarter funding goal which is for printing.
Here is a shipping table to help you estimate what shipping may cost. I ship artwork internationally frequently however it is impossible to get exact shipping estimates without a finished sample book in-hand.
*All original paintings will be shipped insured.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be the third Kickstarter that I've run. My previous two were designed similarly with a project that was already complete and both were delivered before their estimated due dates. This project is, however, a much larger project. I've done my best to simplify some aspects of it and thought ahead in regards to printing timeline, shipping, packaging etc. I have added some padding in the fulfillment timeline to be able to stay on target.

While there are many things I can plan out ahead of time I realize there are always unforeseen circumstances that may arise in regards to working with such a large order of books that are out of my control. I plan to be transparent about the status of the project along the way so backers will be the first to know if anything comes up.

In order to keep backers up to date on the project, I've included the "project status" as well for extra transparency.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Project Complete. It's been an incredible journey - And what's next!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
As of last month, all books are in the mail (with the exception of a few stragglers), headed to your homes or might have already arrived!
This has been such an incredible project to work with you on.
Thank you for joining me in making this possible.
The series

Hi Backers!
I didn't want to bombard you with emails in this final stage of the project but did feel like it was important to keep you in the loop here in the middle of shipping.
Books are shipping out. Yay! As of this morning, I've shipped out over 370 of the 600+ orders at this point working solo and am feeling really good about making that amount of progress. The remainder of the books, including most of the international orders, will be going out this week and into early next. Books with remarque sketches and original paintings will go out last as they take the most time and attention to pack and ship.

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Gu Zheng Wei, I’m a digital artist from Singapore. You may know me from Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook as Guweiz.
However you found your way here, thank you for taking the time to check out my first Kickstarter campaign to create my first ever art book, Guweiz: The Art of Gu Zheng Wei.
Over my creative journey, I have created pieces that I am very proud of, and have experienced many wonderful moments that I would love to share. For this reason, with the help and expertise of the great people at 3dtotal Publishing, I am crafting my first book.
As well as resulting in an inviting and thoroughly packed book, this campaign also gives me the opportunity to offer my art to fans in another physical form – as exclusive printed gifts.
Continue reading to discover more about what hides within the 152 pages of the book, admire the additional items available only during this campaign, and take a sneaky peek at the bonus stretch goal items that you can unlock!
Guweiz: The Art of Gu Zheng Wei will be beautifully presented in hardback, and will explore my artistic journey, from drawing my first anime portrait at seventeen years old, to developing my own unique urban style of manga and working on big-budget films such as Ghost in the Shell.
With an affinity for creating gritty textures and fantastical scenes, I categorize my work into two genres I have endless passion for: “fantasy” and “urban”. Within these styles, I explore the magical moments in the everyday and the edgy realism of fantasy realms. Get lost in my world of witches, warriors, and whimsical night shoppers.
To learn more about my workflow and thought processes, you will also find in-depth tutorials and discover a dissection of my working mindset and unique techniques. Delve into this book to understand the importance of maintaining a visual library for inspiration and reference, and how utilizing the art fundamentals can offer invaluable improvements to your design skills.
I would love to be able to share this book with you all, and I hope you might consider backing this project to help it become a reality.
Thank you!
Below are the exclusive items that are available in addition to the book. Some tiers and gifts are limited, so be sure to pledge quickly if you don’t want to miss out!
Please note that as this is a live project, all designs are examples of content I would like to include but these are subject to change.


We have chosen to launch this book through Kickstarter as it gives us the chance to thank those who make this book possible by adding extra stretch goal rewards to the campaign. I have designed four high-quality bonus rewards to be given away if we can meet certain targets.



Stretch goals are available to all backers from Tier 1 and above. Please note: final designs of items are subject to change.
3dtotal publishing is committed to having a positive effect on the environment. From 2020 they have committed to planting 1 tree for every book they sell by partnering with re-forestation charities. This includes books sold in their Kickstarter campaigns. If you support this campaign we would like to thank you for helping us take on this mission.
3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
We have fulfilled many successful Kickstarters and we have a great record for delivering parcels around the world. For this campaign we will only be offering tracked shipping to certain locations as we're really determined that you receive your parcel first time without any hiccups or problems with delivery. Parcels sent to the UK, USA and Europe will be sent using our regular and reliable service, and parcels sent to the rest of the world will be sent with tracked shipping.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in July. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address – the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
As seasoned users of Kickstarter, 3dtotal Publishing know that a very small number of backers don’t fill in the survey at the end of a Kickstarter campaign, making it impossible for us to process and ship their rewards. 3dtotal pledges to hold all rewards for backers that fail to fill in their survey for 12 months and to make multiple efforts to contact the backers in question to try to successfully deliver their items.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges will be producing and delivering everything to you on time. We've selected an expert printer to work with and a fulfilment company 3dtotal Publishing has an established relationship with, so everything is in place as much as possible to ensure smooth production and delivery by the end of July 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We hope you are all well!
As well as creating inspiring and informative art books, we are also committed to helping the planet and the people who inhabit it, and since 2018 we have run a yearly creative crowdfunding project called Earth Draw to raise funds for environmental charities.
This year, we are teaming up with Guweiz and 13 other fantastic artists to create a limited edition, high-quality art annual.

campaign.story:
Janaan and Simone, her best friend, practice their craft in peace, their community used to them and to generally everything. Even their gentle priest is unbothered. Palermo has always been a city of differences, after all. Everything changes abruptly when a town member is found dead, with a symbol carved into their forehead and horror on their face. They are only the first of a series of victims that will send the life of the community into panic.
Sicily is a big Italian island in the middle of the Mediterranean Sea.  This story is based on Sicilian folklore. Palermo, the capital of this island, is where this story is set, a patchwork of architecture and cultures.
“Ma’ari”: this is how Sicilians call “witches” in their language. On this island the Ma’ari were respected as keepers of knowledge and trustworthy healers.  Many saw them as creatures from “The Outside”, a world parallel to ours.
They could be protectors or they could be enemies: it was up to you to decide what to make of them.
They were pretty good at being both.
As a Sicilian myself - born and raised in Palermo - it feels like it’s my duty to tell our stories. I can only hope you will love it just as much as I do.
Something I also deeply care about is telling stories about the ones whose stories aren’t told very often. We use stories as mirrors, desperately trying to find the one with our reflection in it… ‘cause there’s nothing more powerful than finding yourself in a story someone else has told. You feel seen, heard and less alone.
I like to write about queer characters without necessarily centering the story around their sexuality: they exist, they are queer, but their story could be about magic, friendship, blood, murder or love. For instance: in Ma’ari, it’s about all of the above.
Read the first 11 pages of issue one HERE
After getting a degree in art, Elisa Bisignano - born in Palermo, Italy, in 1993 - decides that she really doesn’t want to be a painter. Thanks to some good luck she manages to enroll at the “Scuola del Fumetto” (School of Comics) of Palermo. She completes the three years and, once finished, creates with her colleagues “Ehm Autoproduzioni”, a small indie self-publishing house. She writes and/or draws a few titles, a couple of them in collaboration with other members of the group: ‘Come le bambole’, ‘Balloon’, ‘The Dead Waltz’, ‘TA’, ‘Frikis - Episode 4’.
As of today she is, thankfully, still not a painter. Her paintings would have been pretty bad.

Iolanda Zanfardino is a comic book and cover artist born in Southern Italy in 1988. She graduated with honors from the International comics Academy in Rome in 2015 and soon started working as an artist for Titan Comics and Marvel, and as a writer, artist and colorist in her first Original graphic novel for Lion Forge comics. She loves rock musicals, street art, Pride parades, dystopian literature and brave, heartwarming comedies.

The 3rd issue is done. We are half way into issue 4. We are a well oiled machine. If something happens at the printer we will let you know

campaign.story:
Introduction
I am an avid collector of enamel pins and have now worked to bring to life seven different pin designs through two previous Kickstarters. I love simple, recognizable designs translated into sleek hard enamel pins - and I also happen to be a huge fan of Beastars! 
When you pledge towards this campaign, your card isn’t charged unless we reach funding goal. Bonus “stretch goals” will unlock if the funding exceeds these goals, giving you more designs to choose from. When the campaign ends, you will be emailed with a form in which you can specify your shipping address and which designs you’d like, corresponding to your pledge tier. 
Backers will be able to add additional pins for the price of $10 each with no extra shipping cost via survey at the end of the campaign!
Designs
Each pin will be manufactured in shiny gunmetal and hard enamel at approximately 1.5 inches. Sizes may vary slightly depending on design.
Legosi- Unlocked!
Haru - Unlocked!
Stretch Goals
The initial goal for this campaign is a set of two pins, Legosi & Haru, but many more characters can be unlocked via stretch goals!
Optional Backing cards: $1100 - Unlocked!
You will have the option to add backing cards designed for this project to your pins! To save on costs and unnecessary use of packing materials for those who aren't interested, this will be optional via survey at the end of the campaign. 
Louis : $1300 - Locked
Louis
Jack: $1600 - Locked
Jack
Legom: $1900 - Locked
Legom
Juno: $2200 - Locked
Juno
 Gouhin: $2500 - Locked
Gouhin
Melon: $2800 - Locked
Melon

??? - More to come if we hit these stretch goals! (Bill, Zaguan, Gosha, Tem, Riz, Pena...) or possibly stickers!
For the custom art reward, check out some of my Beastars fanart below! More examples of my art can also be found on my various social media pages linked at the end of this page.
Funding Breakdown
Shipping will be available worldwide, but unfortunately shipping via USPS in a bubble mailer with tracking is expensive! If you live outside of the US, consider combining your pledge with a friend to save on costs. All shipping will include USPS tracking.
Timeline
Mid-January: Kickstarter launches!
February-March: Kickstarter ends, funds, addresses, and surveys are collected. Funded designs are sent to manufacturing.
April-June: Pins are received, quality checked, and packaged. 
July: Pins are shipped to backers!
Thank you for reading! 
Please help spread the word by sharing my posts on Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Facebook, etc! Thanks a bunch!
Twitter: https://twitter.com/corviforms
Tumblr: https://birdghost.tumblr.com/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/corviform/
Etsy: https://www.etsy.com/shop/Corviforms
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have completed and fulfilled two pin Kickstarter campaigns prior to this with no issues. I will be working with the same pin manufacturer as my previous two Kickstarters so I do not expect any issues, but there is always a risk of quality issues or a delay from the manufacturers. The timeline listed here gives me approximately 1 extra month to buffer for any delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

A handmade 4x6 ink & watercolor painting in the comic style OR a laminated watercolor badge of your character!
Paintings can be fullbody of one character or halfbody of 2 characters.
PLUS Four hard enamel pins of your choice from unlocked designs.
INCLUDES:
4× Hard Enamel Pin
Custom Painting or Badge

support.title: Custom Pin Design
support.descp:
This one is a little wild but bear with me here -
For this price I will design you a pin in this style for any character (Beastars, your own, etc) and get them manufactured. You will receive 50 1.5in pins of your custom design to keep, share, or sell! Please keep in mind manufacturing limitations (color availability, line thickness, etc). I'll work with you and the manufacturer to get the best product possible!
You would also receive at least one of each unlocked pin design, at a minimum of 8 pins of the premade designs.
INCLUDES:
8× Hard Enamel Pin
Custom Pin Design
50× Custom Pin

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
I wanted to let you know that I have a brand new bird pin kickstarter running right now! These will be 2-inch hard enamel pins as well as 1-inch minipins which are all being manufactured by the same reliable company that made my Beastars pins. 5 species with 15 pins total are unlocked so far with plenty of stretch goals still to unlock. Check it out here!

Hey Everyone!
Your pins were sent out this Tuesday/Weds via USPS with tracking, so keep an eye out! I haven't had time to email everyone their tracking # but I expect everyone in the US should receive their package soon :)
If you don't see anything within a week or so or are concerned about delivery, please feel free to reach out to me to get your tracking number.
Still finishing up the couple of art rewards, those will go out soon as well!
Enjoy!
- Rachel

Hey all! It's been a while and I hope you're doing well. 
I got factory photos and the pins are looking great! The colors are a little different from my drawing, but it's as close as they can get with the limitation of pantone colors.  Overall the quality looks great and I'm very happy with them!
They should arrive about a week from now along with the backing cards, so I'll be working on the art rewards this week so that everything is ready to ship out at once.

Hey! While I'm waiting on manufacturing to begin, I made some backing card designs for the pins. I plan on using 2.5in square business cards, same as I did for my previous kickstarter, and any text info will be on the back. Let me know what you think!

Decided to go ahead and place the pin order before waiting a full 2 weeks for the KS money to transfer so we can get these guys ASAP :) Just got mockups back from the manufacturer and it looks like they will be able to color match nicely - and each pin will have 2 posts for stability! I'll keep you updated with pin progress as I hear more. 
I'm also working on the backing card designs and should have something to show you soon. They'll be 2.5x2.5in cards and I'm also going to package them in poly bags for an extra-professional look! For Haru I'm going to do a simple drawing of the rooftop garden in the daytime, and then for Legosi I was thinking the same image but nighttime with a full moon so they're unique but complimentary to each other.

updates.update_userinfo: The campaign is successful! Surveys going out soon!
updates.update_content:
Thanks so much everyone!! I'm finishing up the surveys and they will go out very soon. I will also be working on a backing card design, which we hit funding for in the last 48 hours or so!
I am in contact with the pin manufacturer and am ready to place the order as soon as the Kickstarter funds are processed. 
I wish we had unlocked more designs so I could offer more options to you guys - especially those who backed at at more than 2 pins. I'm thinking about making some stickers which I can throw in with everyone's rewards and possibly doing a second kickstarter in the future to get the funding for more designs.

updates.update_userinfo: WE MADE IT! BEASTARS pins are funded!!!
updates.update_content:
Thank you SO much everyone! I can finally stop being excessively annoying on social media. We made it.
I appreciate all of you so much <3 
I'll be making more Beastars art soon to celebrate. Throw me some ideas for fanart if you'd like!

Hey All! First update here - I'll be doing a final push for this at Katsucon this weekend and I really believe we can reach the main funding goal. But- I won't be making these pins if we don't reach it, so please continue to support and share if you want to see them come to life!
Links for sharing - Twitter - Instagram - Facebook
Also I wanted to mention, since I doubt we can reach many stretch goals at this point, I am considering running a second Kickstarter in the future for them - after Beastars hits Netflix in the US and becomes  more popular!

campaign.story:
NEW! Time is short, so we have added two new Backer Rewards: content editing from series editor Jason Graves, paired with Signed Super Bundles! Get all the goodies, plus a comprehensive content edit (two passes) for over half off Jason's normal freelance rate. Available in two sizes: up to 15k words and up to 60k words.
New! We have added additional countries for shipment of physical backer rewards! Because each of the numbered, limited-edition copies of WWWW must be sent from the US, the cost of shipping isn't insubstantial; however, we recognize that some readers may want a print books and the shipping cost is acceptable. For you, we've added Canada, the UK, the EU, Australia, and New Zealand. If you live somewhere else and would like a physical copy, please send us a message and we can add your country!
New! All backers at the Warrior Bundle level or higher will receive an ebook copy of Necromancer for Hire by Darin Kennedy!
Authors
Following in the footsteps of Tales from the Old Black Ambulance, we have gathered a talented group of established and up-and-coming authors writing stories for your enjoyment:
Jody Lynn Nye
Gail Z. Martin
Janet Walden-West
Michele Tracy Berger
Nicole Givens Kurtz
J. D. Blackrose
Darin Kennedy
Paige L. Christie
Rebecca Wynick
Alexandra Christian
Foreword by Jean Marie Ward
Editor
Jason Graves established Prospective Press nearly five years ago as an inclusive, pro-diversity, feminist-friendly, queer-welcoming, and #ownvoices-embracing publishing house. He is the series editor of the Off the Beaten Path paranormal anthologies, Tales from the Old Black Ambulance, and this inaugural volume of the Concrete Dreams series of modern (aka Urban) fantasy.
The Project
As the debut volume of our new series, Concrete Dreams, we bring you stories about witches solving murders and righting wrongs, warriors battling evil—both human and otherwise, and wise women finding the truth and settling scores. These will be great summer reading!
For those who chose to be our awesome Backers at the Paper Witch and higher levels: we will make a limited-edition, Kickstarter-exclusive, numbered and Backer-labeled print run of up to 201 paper copies of the anthology, but no more than 201. Once these special backer copies have been sent out, regular copies of the printed anthology will be available via Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and most other bookstores around the world, while ebooks will be available via Kindle, Apple Books, NOOK, and other ebook markets.
The Plan
Autumn 2019
The Kickstarter
Winter 2020
Editing
Formatting
Ebook formatting
Finalizing cover
Spring 2020
Proofing
Printing
Shipping books to backers
The Budget
All of the backing being requested, aside from Kickstarter's cut, will go to pay the fantastic authors for their awesome contributions. Prospective Press will cover all other costs.
Prospective Press
Established in 2015, Prospective Press is a vigorous small press specializing in fantasy, horror, and other speculative fiction. Among our thirty-plus books, we have published four anthologies—Tales From the Old Black Ambulance and three volumes in the Off the Beaten Path series. Prospective Press produces books in the traditional way—a commitment to quality and a keen interest for compelling content. However, the company also keeps an eye to the future, watching for ways to make one’s reading experiences even more enjoyable and satisfying. From the Piedmont region of North Carolina, Prospective Press brings its world of quality genre fiction and select non-fiction and invite readers to join them in Seeing the Future.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been doing this for a while and have successfully launched over thirty titles, but we recognize that stuff happens. We've built extra time into the schedule and we will make every effort to have the book published and in your hands by June 2020 (July or sooner for print if you purchase a signed copy). We have recruited some fine and talented writers for this anthology, most of whom have already provided their stories. If unforeseen circumstances keep one of the remaining authors from completing their story, we will make every effort to fill their spot with a comparable tale by an equally talented writer.

And, as previously noted, if the Earth falls into the sun before we get the book finished, well... enjoy the ride, at least.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Tuckerized by Gail Z. Martin SSB
support.descp:
NEW REWARD!
Everything in the Signed Super Bundle plus Tuckerization by Gail Z. Martin!
Tuckerization is the practice of putting a real person's name into a story as a (usually) minor character as an in joke or a shout out, named after SF author Wilson Tucker, a prolific Tuckerizer.
You can see your or a friend's name in this story! Simply choose this Backer reward. Only available once.
INCLUDES:
One name Tuckerized as a minor character in the story
Printed Witches, Warriors, & Wise Women—Signed by three authors

updates.update_content: Time is short, so we have added two new Backer Rewards: content editing from series editor Jason Graves, paired with Signed Super Bundles! Get all the goodies, plus a full, two-pass content edit for half Jason's normal rate. Available in two sizes: up to 15k words and up to 60k words.

updates.update_userinfo: We've Arrived! Thank you and what's next.
updates.update_content:
Thank you, Backers!
Backing is now at 51% and rising, with interest growing fast. For our project Followers: now is a great time to show your support for Witches, Warriors, and Wise Women! With one week to go till our goal deadline, we have our fingers crossed that you who love stories with kick-ass heroines will join us in getting this fantastic anthology funded. Think of how much fun you'll have reading your early-release ebook or numbered, limited-edition print book soon—before anyone else can even get a copy!

We have added additional countries for shipment of physical backer rewards! Because each of the numbered, limited-edition copies of WWWW must be sent from the US, the cost of shipping isn't insubstantial; however, we recognize that some readers may want a print books and the shipping cost is acceptable. For you, we've added Canada, the UK, the EU, Australia, and New Zealand. If you live somewhere else and would like a physical copy, please send us a message and we can add your country!

updates.update_userinfo: New Backer Reward: Editing by Series Editor Jason Graves + SSB
updates.update_content:
As we reach the midpoint in the campaign, it's time to reveal a new Backer Reward: author Darin Kennedy will provide an e-copy of his book Necromancer for Hire (The April Sullivan Chronicles) to everyone who backs at a Bundle level or higher; this is retroactive to all existing Bundle-level backers as well.
Thanks, Darin!

Thank you, backers! We are now 29% funded with three weeks to go—great progress!
Please join me in welcoming the final author in 4W: the talented Paranormal Romance author Alexandra Christian!
This is going to be a FANTASTIC anthology!
Cheers,

updates.update_userinfo: New Destinations for Physical Backer Rewards
updates.update_content:
The lovely and talented Jean Marie Ward has accepted the role of penning a foreword for Witches, Warriors, and Wise Women, and we are thrilled to have her join the party!
Late last night, we added new backer rewards... See your name (or friends and family) in print with one of our Tuckerization add-on rewards. Most of our authors are participating, but there's only one reward per author, so grab your favorite's Tucker soon!
What's a Tuckerization? See our FAQs.

campaign.story:
POWER & MAGIC: The Queer Witch Comics Anthology Series is back for a second volume of Young Adult fantasy comics starring queer witches of color! In addition to this 200+ page, black-and-white, softcover anthology, we're also reviving the long-out-of-stock POWER & MAGIC VOLUME 1 with its first ever reprinting. 
The witch is a symbol of power for women across the world. She represents defiance, transcendence, healing, feminine monstrosity, and connection with the natural and supernatural worlds. From her wands and flora, to her bonds of kinship, POWER & MAGIC VOLUME 2 explores what gives each witch her power and how she'll choose to use it. Whether you've been longing for the new volume, or just discovering the series for the first time, we can't think of a better way to celebrate the witchiest month of the year than backing POWER & MAGIC and supporting queer witches of color!
Page by Myisha Haynes.
Page by Alexis Cooke.
Page by Cynthia Yuan Cheng.
Page by Yeon Kyung Charlotte Cha and Ciel Bahena.
POWER & MAGIC VOLUME 2 has been lovingly created by 26 creators of color, all women or woman-aligned and all extraordinary:
Ahmara Smith ☆ Alexis Cooke ☆ Arby Essex ☆ Bex Glendining ☆ Che Grayson & Steenz ☆ Cynthia Yuan Cheng ☆ Dominique Evans ☆ Fanfi & Mafe Balmaceda ☆ Grace Teoh ☆ JesnCin (Jessica Wibowo & Jacinta Wibowo) ☆ Joamette Gil & Rose Bousamra ☆ Juliette GMM López ☆ Kimberly Wang ☆ Lorena Reyes ☆ Myisha Haynes ☆ Nicole Miles ☆ Shivana Sookdeo ☆ Wendy Xu ☆ Yash Kesanakurthy & Annalise Jensen ☆ Yeon Kyung Charlotte Cha & Ciel Bahena ☆ Ashe Samuels (cover).
Panel by Juliette GMM López.
As always, every single cent of our budget is earmarked for paying our creators a fair page rate and producing the best quality books, rewards, and experience for you -- the backers! 
Page by Kimberly Wang.
Physical softcovers of POWER & MAGIC Volume 2 and the reprint of POWER & MAGIC VOLUME 1 are the stars of this show, but the magic doesn't stop there. The entire P&M Press catalog is up for grabs, as well as limited-edition and one-of-a-kind rewards created by Alexis Cooke, Hannako Lambert, and our contributors themselves! 
With more books to offer than ever before, we've also got more options than ever before! Kickstarter automatically sorts pledge levels by dollar amount, but the graphics below are organized by how many books come with each tier (for folks who find it easier to browse/decide that way). Whichever tier you choose, you can't go wrong!  
**Early bird slots sold out.
**Early Bird slots sold out.
SOLD OUT!!!
**Early Bird slots sold out.
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
SOLD OUT!!!
Watch this space as the campaign progresses! Once we've fulfilled our goal, stretch goals will send additional funds straight into:
Raising contributor page rates above $106/page,
Enhancing the production values of both books,
Two more enamel pins to celebrate each volume of POWER & MAGIC to date,
Commissioning NEW digital comics from additional women of color cartoonists (exclusive to all backers for one year)!
 Let's see how high these witches can fly!
Page by JesnCin.
Page by Fanfi and Mafe Balmaceda.
Page by Nicole Miles.
Page by Lorena Reyes.
Page by Yash Kesanakurthy and Annalise Jensen.
This project wouldn't be possible without the additional support, labor, and wisdom of the following people: all of Kickstarter's incredible employees, Corey Ranson, Jonathan Steiner, Ashley Gallagher, Steven Andrews, Rhiannon Rasmussen, Lucia Retamales, Iñaki Taberna, Icons8 (for the song "Dance of Princess" by Gemy), Covervault, and as always, C. Spike Trotman.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is about 75% complete, so we're on track to head to the printer before spring! As with all publishing endeavors, the risk of printing/shipping delays is always there. That said, this is our FOURTH Kickstarter campaign in as many years, and all were successfully fulfilled. We got this!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
QUICKIE UPDATE: If you have moved since first filling out your survey, you have 6 days to update your address! On September 1st, surveys will be locked in preparation for fulfillment! Almost there, gang!
Here's how:
Step One: Log on to Kickstarter on your desktop computer. Click your icon in the top right hand corner, and select our campaign from your list of Backed Projects.

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CHANCE TO UPDATE YOUR ADDRESS!!
updates.update_content: Micro-update: Surveys have been sent! Aim to fill yours out today (or even right now) if you haven't. We wanna get delivery info down for everyone before this purchase vanishes from your memory in a blur of Kickstarter patronage. :'D

POWER & MAGIC VOLUME 2 IS HAPPENING THANKS TO YOU!
All 1,200+ of you!!! Every campaign is brought to life by its backers, obviously, but this group truly went above and beyond. Your constant sharing on social media when the going got tough made every difference in the world. Less than a week ago, we were under 50% funded. Now with 4 whole hours left to go, POWER & MAGIC Volume 2 is overfunded! Thank you all so very, very, , much!!!

Micro-Update, Coven: We are precisely 24 hours away from the end, and an anonymous donor has offered to match the next $999 in funding (that was $680 ago, so we're almost there)!!! After that, we'll only need $6,648 to succeed. Let's see this through to the end!!!

project_data.project_name: POWER & MAGIC: The Queer Witch Comics Anthology VOLUME 2

campaign.story:
Welcome to the ultimate John Avon playmat project. 
All playmat backers now get 5 free deluxe double-sided prints!  
Over the years John has been inundated by requests for various Magic: the Gathering images to be reproduced on playmats. This Kickstarter will hopefully satisfy all those who have asked and more.
It is our desire to give you all the images you want on limited edition, hand-signed playmats. Already there are 57 different playmats from the last 23 years of Magic unlocked for backers and for the first time ever an official playmat with all 5 Unhinged lands! Scroll down to see this mat and all the others....     
For the next target there are 4 more classic images including Urza's Swamp c and 5th Spring Mountain...
All of these playmats will be limited edition; limited by the numbers ordered through this project. All of the playmats will be hand-signed in silver or gold by John, following 2 decades of signing John now has a titanium bionic wrist. Our partners Ultra Pro have done an amazing job in beautifully recreating John's work as well as significantly minimizing logos and legal information.  These mats will all look stunning.
There are a limited amount of discounted earlybird levels so you might like to jump on one of those now and wait for your favourite image(s) to be added.  We will be using Backerkit after the campaign concludes to ask you which playmat(s) you would like to receive (you will be able to add more beyond your initial pledge). Also via Backerkit, you will be given the opportunity to pick up one of our few remaining Unhinged or Unstable Land playmats at a special price.
**This will be your only chance to get your favourite image(s) on a playmat!**
Stretch Goals
Playmats to unlock at the next stretch goal..

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Previous problems in these projects have been caused by postal issues. We have addressed this by using premium postal services accordingly for various countries. We have added in some extra time for signing should this project really explode.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 

We are still getting reports that items are arriving all over the world, obviously the global situation is affecting different local services to different degrees.   

Replacement items have started shipping out.

Hello Dear Backers, 

Thanks very much for all the messages!  It is nice to know that our efforts have caused some joy in a challenging time.  

Stuff is still arriving all over the world so please do not worry if your things have not turned up yet.

Dear Backers, 

We have been in constant communication with the shipping company since our last update. They have told us "by the end of this week" for about the last 4 weeks. Yesterday I asked them for a statement to pass along to you about the situation.

updates.update_userinfo: Starting to arrive in the UK
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, packages have started to arrive in the UK!
Thanks to those who have reached out to confirm, it is really nice to hear along with your enthusiasm for the contents.
The shipping company have reiterated that they plan to get the rest out for everywhere else this week, so fingers crossed.  We will confirm when they do.

Just a quick message, I’m on holiday but work never stops...
Our shippers are still processing your packages.  They’ve told us they anticipate invoicing us this week, which is the point they are ready to send them.  
We’ve been pushing them regulary, and in the past they’ve never taken more than 2 weeks to get things through. Sorry about this, thanks for your continued patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Your parcels are on the way!
updates.update_content:
Hello Dear Backers
Many thanks to everyone who has helped cover the additional shipping costs.  We think we will now be able to cover the additional expenses brought about by the pandemic.  You are all awesome.
Lots of people opted for the extra prints, but many people didn't include their backer number, and in some cases their names/email addresses did not match up to our Kickstarter database. We spent two days cleaning and correcting this information to do our best to ensure those who contributed will get their extra prints. However it is possible some were missed in the maelstrom (and some donated after the cut off), so please follow up with us in this regard down the line.

Hello everyone, 
We have now packed just over 40% of the packages.
Address changes are closed! 
We will have an update on the shipping situation very soon.

campaign.story:
Long time no see! My name's Johannes Voss and I'm an illustrator on Magic: The Gathering. You might have seen my work, my Patreon or my previous campaigns.
Once, and only once, a year, I make my artwork available as signed prints! And that's why we're here!
So what do I offer you? Simple - signed prints. They're A4 sized, which is 11.7 x 8.3 inches and will fit in both 8.5x11 and A4 sized frames or mats. Professionally printed on sturdy 300g/sqm paper with a UV protective coating and autographed in silver ink, they'll come in a protective plastic sleeve and will ship packaged in stable wraparound cardboard. You get to decide how many you want, and which ones!
No nonsense - Prints on 300g/sqm paper, signed with silver ink, UV coated, and sleeved.
Here's the prints you can select from! Once the campaign has ended, you will get a survey for your shipping address and for your choice of prints. Pick any which ones, duplicates are fine too!
Stoneforge Mystic
Faerie Rogue - Saprolings
Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
On Serra's Wings - Commander's Authority - Angel of Vitality - Kaladesh Island
Sliver - Mr Ooze
Gift of Orzhova
Mr Squirrel - Knight's Return
Restoration Angel
Blood Artist - Shaman of Spring - Sunblade Angel - Sakura Tenshi
Angelic Destiny
Spirit - Fire Elemental
Tomik, Distinguished Advokist
Cat Dragon - Survivor Token
Rosethorn Acolyte
Stained-Glass Knight
Silverwing Squadron

So I make these pretty awesome sparkly tokens - you might've seen them on my Patreon. And because they'll make all your friends envious, I'll be unlocking them through stretch goals!
UNLOCKED! Every backer gets a sparkly Faerie Rogue Token! 
UNLOCKED: Every backer also gets a sparkly Sliver Token!
€ 60,000: Every backer also gets a sparkly Squirrel Token!
So when can you expect your prints? Here's the overview:
The campaign will run until the end of September. By mid October I will have basically everyone's survey answers and can start producing the respective prints! The printing company I work with has proven reliable countless times. I'll also order shipping materials etc. This whole process should take about two weeks, meaning I will start...
Shipping in mid-endOctober! This should take anywhere between two and four weeks if things go normally - I have quite a bit of experience with this stuff by now so I think I'll do just fine.
That means that depending where in the world you live, it'll take one to four weeks until you get your prints - that means November! Well in time for Christmas even if there's trouble.
Yes, there'll be sturdy packaging for every single print!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Besides delays caused by massive demand, I think I've got this covered! I've run four successful campaigns and also ship hundreds of packages monthly through my Patreon, so I'll be able to handle it! :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
