updates.update_content:
Hey all! I just finished this Cat token, which in and of itself is already a good thing. There's more to this one though - the flip side doubles as a Shrine Voltron token, to remind you of your triggers when playing my Shrines or the Hondens! :D
You can grab these via my Patreon until tomorrow! https://www.patreon.com/johannesvoss

Hey all! Just need to show you this Flying Shark token I did for Shark Typhoon from the new Ikoria set :D It's the sparkly token for April and you can get it through my Patreon until tomorrow, Apr 30!

campaign.story:
hi there, my name is colin. i am an artist based in houston, texas. i have an instagram where i post life and art updates, and an etsy where i sell products i have produced such as stickers, postcards and pins. 
i'm often inspired by medieval art and mythology so this pin idea is sort of based on the last pins i made, that were based on the vegetable lamb of tartary. these now are inspired by the mythological symbol of ouroboros, but with the common 'snarly dog' motif found in my art. 
these pins i plan on making around 1.25" inches in diameter. they will be made of hard enamel with a metallic gold finish and a locking pin back. they will also be sold on a unique backing card which i am working on designing at the moment and will post updates/pictures of soon.
if i reach my goal of $300 to fund these pins, if i reach my stretch goal of $400, I will also be making this design into vinyl stickers!

i am doing this fundraiser in order to cover production costs for these pins. once they are produced, they will be for sale on my etsy. however, if you back them before i produce them, you will get a small discount on them, along with other rewards based on how much you pledge. thanks for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Keep in mind that once my funding goal is met, it will take several weeks for the pins to be produced by a third party company and shipped to me. Backers are expected to be given their pins around December of 2019, depending on how quickly the goal is met.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
First of all I want to say thank you so much everyone for bearing with me and sticking with your pledges til the very end! The project was funded successfully by almost double! The remaining funds will be used to fund production costs for other merchandise projects that I have, along with restocking current inventory. 
Please note that the funds will take over 2 weeks to process, so production of the pins will not begin until the middle of this month. That being said, it may not be until December or January when the pins and other rewards are actually delivered to backers. Again, sorry for the inconvenience, I was not aware of the fact the project would get funded so quickly and lesson learned for the future!

It's been a while since I updated, but I am over $200 over the goal. Thank you so much for your support everyone, it really means a lot to me. I made a huge mistake by making the campaign so long, because I was inexperienced with starting KS campaigns and didn't know I would get most of the funding in the first week. So thank you all for your extreme patience! The campaign is going to end on Halloween and I will receive the funds a couple of weeks after, so production for the pins will not begin for another few weeks. The estimated time that I will receive the pins is in November-December, depending on holiday delays etc. I really appreciate everyone bearing with me. As for the the extra funds, these will be used to make this design into circular vinyl stickers, along with funding additional products I would like to make for my store. I am also going to launch another project in the near future, so please keep your eyes out if you like my work. If you have any questions about your pledge, please send me a message.

Thank you all so much for backing in such a short amount of time. I've already made over 25% of the goal in less than a few hours. Honestly I regret making the campaign so long, because I didn't take into account how long it would take to get the KS funds and for the production of the pins. (I was worried about not enough people showing interest or backing but I was proven wrong!) For that reason I am going to use a credit line to start production of the pins more quickly so backers will not have to wait for several months to get them, then pay off that bill with the KS funds if I reach my goal. For my stretch goal of $450 I will make this design into stickers. Thank you so much everyone!

campaign.story:
The Artist: Andrew Mar
"I’ve been drawing for my entire life, and always had worlds thriving within my imagination. I started using ink as a young child when my parents gave me lessons in traditional Chinese calligraphy. Some may have found it mind numbing and dull, but I grew addicted to the medium. Over time, the ink brush evolved into the ink pen, and those Chinese characters evolved into fantasy characters. I always make it a goal to participate in communal art challenges such as Inktober and Mermay. It helps provide the fuel of consistent discipline alongside passion.   
Ink is a straight-forward, binary medium- black ink and white paper. With only two hard tones at one’s disposal, it can be difficult to create subtle transitions and softness. Mistakes become stark, and attempts to fix them usually make it worse. The challenge is part of the appeal. My love for ink has me constantly striving to master the medium, and always eager to create."
Andrew Mar on: Instagram • Facebook • Twitter • Artstation
The Content:
The pages within this book are a collection of ink drawings of the life of my mind, separated by their realms:
Celestial – the dominion of angels, of elegance and power, who serve to protect their boundaries.
Terrestrial – the mortal lands of warring kingdoms, and those caught between them in forest and sky.
Infernal – a dark world of demons, succubi, dragons, and beasts, all scraping to survive and sometimes, even live. 
Pelagial – the abyss of those who only seek company so sparsely found in the void.
The Book
Like all books that I have created with the previous artists, this one is launching finished. We just want to know how many we should print for you guys. This is why we made this campaign
It has 284 pages of 150g matte paper and is bound in a hardcover with golden hotfoil stamping in the swashes around the title. The format is A5 and the artwork inside is mostly black and white. The book weighs 2 kg. 
This is a .gif - wait for it to load

The 3 Prints 


The Original Art
Zoom image
Zoom image

The Stretchgoals
Of course there are a couple of stretchgoals for all of you. These will be added to every single tier that is listed in this campaign and you will receive them together with the products you pledged for. Short: All backers get these!

All stretchgoals unlocked!



The Shipping Date 
We will start shipping the books worldwide starting December 2019. Until the shipping starts you can change your address in the surveys. Here is a helpful article. 
IMPORTANT: Please note that exactly 1 year after the campaigns end we will close the surveys. We will make sure to update you on multiple platforms, write messages here on Kickstarter to remind you, but as a general rule any pledge which still has no finished survey in September 2020 will be seen as a donation. This means those who have not responded to the surveys will lose their claims on their rewards and the pledge for rewards will be seen as a donation to the campaign. The reason is simple: the longer we hold out the more we get charged in taxes, insurance and stock fees.  
This is a .gif - wait for it to load.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the content and layout is finished. The only thing that is missing is the actual printed products for which we are running this campaign.

The fulfillment will be handled by the busy bees at Éditions Caurette who have great experience in publishing and cheap shipment to buyers of high quality print products. They have been publishing works of artists like Kim Jung Gi, Jesper Ejsing, Karl Kopinski and many more, so we trust their competence and judgement.

Shipping of the products will be untracked, except for the highest tier which will have items unique to this campaign and will demand a higher fee to make sure nothing gets lost. In case of problems with the shipping of the other tiers, Éditions Caurette will be there to answer your questions.

We don't expect any delays but of course we will update you all if there are any unexpected changes or unforeseen developments as we work fully transparently.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Some first snapshots of the finished product and news on shipping!
updates.update_content:
I got one!
I got the first finished book in my mail and couldn't wait to get back from Helsinki to take a look at it! I am extremely happy with the outcome and the golden finish is just everything I wanted it to be. I will stop babbling and let you all take a look through some shots I made with my phone:

Thank you for the overwhelming response on this book <3
If anyone at this point is still waiting for the book, please don't hesitate to send us a DM and we will gladly take care of this. Comments can get lost but DMs all go to the same inbox, and we won't miss a single one of these, promised :)
I hope you guys enjoy the copy and stay tuned for the next artbook in September, which is OBLISKURA by Alex Konstad. Until then, stay safe!

Hi everybody! 
Thank you for all that great feedback on Aphos and we are already working on the next campaign of Daniel Landerman launching next month!
If there is anybody that still hasn't received Aphos please contact Éditions Caurette through the email address celia@caurette.com and please include your backer number and if you ordered an update to tracked shipping.

Hi everybody! In case that your copy of APHOS hasn't arrived yet, please send us a Direct message, not a comment, so we can chat about how we can help you to receive your book. I promise you that if you haven't received it by now, we will make sure you get it. 
In the meantime, for those who are interested in what has been worked on recently:
16 more pages have been unlocked and now the last possible stretch-goal can be unlocked:
  cover for the slipcase edition

Hey folks! I can happily announce that the shipping is completed and all books have left the warehouse and are on their way to you! Bring some patience into this if you have the untracked shipping option and if there is any problem with the shipment please don't hesitate to DM us and we will help you!
Some of you already received their books and we appreciate any shoutout you can give us :)
The first part of the goodies arrived! Have a looky looky! :) This is for the tier with the book and prints.

... we just established an easy way to get it. Just follow this link and the guidelines written beneath.
Depending on where you live, check the option for ZONE 1 Shipping (Europe, by default) or Zone 2 Shipping (rest of the world) on the right side of the screen (above the blue button "Add to cart").
Please note that:

Dear supporters,
Since the book went to print and the extras and stretchgoals are ready too, I want to let the backers that also backed the print tier know that I ran into a few problems with the file for the horizontal format demon image and as there is no scan with higher res available I will use a different motive. To make this interesting for you guys I will add a fourth print to that tier, hoping that you will like it.

We are so happy with the result of the campaign and can only thank you all for your massive support! Now that it is inktober time we hope that you follow Andrew's progress on Instagram and participate along with him!
We just sent out the survey so please make sure to enter all the information. As usual there were cases where people could not order the book because of credit card issues, but don't worry. If you tried to back the campaign and can show us that it didn't work, with a screenshot etc. just order your copy here and add the information to your order.
A very cool update for you:

campaign.story:
AT A GLANCE
ALHAMDU is a musically driven, avant-garde short film about Muslim Futurism- what it could look like in a vibrant and joyous future where Muslims exist unapologetically. With a female-majority veteran team from the film industry, ALHAMDU is already halfway done after completing principal filming on the West Coast. We are looking to crowdfund the cost of principal filming on the East Coast, as well as post-production. The project is led by MIPSTERZ, a non-profit creative collective that amplifies marginalized creators through film, music, and illustration for the broad audiences ready to hear them. 
While the final video will be accessible to all on YouTube, ALHAMDU campaign rewards are exclusive to Kickstarter backers.  
ABOUT “ALHAMDU”  
COLOR. MUSIC. MUSLIM FUTURISM.
You may not acknowledge our past, but you will know our future.
What does an American Muslim future look like? Who gets to decide? Who gets included? 
We are taking Muslim Futurism, Afrofuturism, and other liberationist ideas, from the spaces of academia and constructing a world where we tell our own stories. A future where Third Culture is the dominant wave, where Muslims exist loudly alongside each other in their found-families. Join us on this surreal, fashion-heavy, and multi-chromatic journey featuring both dynamic portraits and soft emotional stills. This is a bright America that exists tomorrow, shared today. Show the audience that they should have been paying attention all along. 
Texture differentiates the scenes and color tells the story. From the different locations: the Californian desert and grasslands, the concrete jungle of New York; to the exaggerated fashionable aesthetic: street fashion meets your grandma’s closet, old world thobes and flowing hijabs, loud turbans and kufis, clashing patterns, obnoxious colors. Finding the wrong puzzle piece for the right fit.  
"Alhamdu" is the Arabic term for "Praise be", Alhamdullilah being an expression of relief, joy, exasperation, etc to Muslims everywhere.
THE MUSIC 
The soundtrack of the video is an original song featuring sounds and words from new Muslim artists. Produced by our very own, Yusuf Siddiquee, “Alhamdu” is best described as an alternative, third-culture hip hop sonic experience. Much like its creators, the song samples a previous generation and remixes it with the poetics of now. A classic Egyptian wedding song is looped and layered with live tabla and darbuka from percussionist extraordinaire Neel Agrawal. LA boom-bap rapper Haseeb the Few  reminds us of days before the ‘gram, NYC emcee Ahmed El-Naggar ruminates on third-culture kids stuck between worlds, all while an Oakland chorus of voices led by Emily Afton shouts “Alhamdulillah” at the top of their lungs.
Alhamdulillah, we are out here and unapologetically ourselves.  
- 
TIMELINE AND BUDGET BREAKDOWN
Crowdfunding goals are set up based off of costs involved in the 3 stages it takes to create and distribute the work: Pre-Production, Production, and Post-Production. They encapsulate everything from location scouting, to paying make-up artists and gear rentals the day of shooting, to film festival fees. 
Costs for production of backer rewards, shipping and fulfillment, and Kickstarter transaction fees have also been accounted for.
We are crowdfunding for the same reason we are making ALHAMDU: to be able to tell our own narratives. Crowdfunding is the best way to ensure that the talent and production team- both in front of and behind the camera- have full control over their story, are paid for their efforts, credited accordingly, and ensuring the work is produced and shared in a timely manner. 
Click through for high-res view
-
MEET THE TEAM 
-
THE REWARDS
WANT IT DONE RIGHT // DO IT TOGETHER - High Resolution Digital Wallpaper 
Inspired by the real landscapes and scenes featured in ALHAMDU. These girls have your back, and your desktop.  
-
MUSLIMS IN SPAAACE - 2 inch Hard Enamel pin
In printing, CMYK is what is used to create all other colors, you only need a few tools to come up with a future full of possibilities. Also, Something Something Radical Muslims Joke something  
-
 BE YOUR FUTURE - SCREENPRINTED TOTE BAG 
Be the future you wanna see...and see it on a tote bag too. 15" heavy duty material, with long handles for ideal everyday use. 
-
WANT IT DONE RIGHT // DO IT TOGETHER - Large Print
Pulling from the real landscapes and scenes featured in ALHAMDU, friendships and found-families are what allow us to thrive, especially when navigating hostile terrain. Solidarity no matter how you present yourself. 
Sized at 11 x 17" for easy framing, and printed on 130 lb matte paper, only the good stuff. 
-
CALL THE TEAM
Have a 30 minute video call with the Director and Art Director behind ALHAMDU. Ask any questions you'd like! It can be about the film, production process, or perhaps ask to receive feedback on any portfolio or project you may have. Abbas will sing to you if you ask nicely. 
-
PERSONAL COMMISSION 
An illustration entirely of your choice by the Art Director on ALHAMDU, Sara Alfageeh. 
(Constraints: No NSFW material, not for commercial resale, may be a limit on number of characters/figures included in the illustration.)
-
 EXECUTIVE PRODUCER ROLE + CREDIT 
-
ABOUT MIPSTERZ
MIPSTERZ is about presenting + producing. MIPSTERZ is a curated space for an emerging generation of Muslim creatives, enabling and amplifying our collective voice in the larger public space through film, music, and illustration. We are a creative collective recognizing the power in the minority voice and the broad audiences excited to hear them. 
MIPSTERZ is a home for marginalized creators to build, collaborate, or experiment with diverse folks who share a common connection to a larger tradition. Besides creating original work, we run live events, actively provide mentorship, resources, and carve out positive creative spaces. We have worked with everyone from the popular media, academia, to museums and art spaces to bring our multi-dimensional third-culture inspired voices and stories to the forefront.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SHOOTING

Every film has its own set of unique challenges. While we have a dedicated team of experienced producers, cinematographers, directors, etc we are still shooting outdoors and in several different locations, each with their own set of variables out of our control. Our current funding goal gives us a small buffer in the event we have to extend our shoot days, so that production can continue no matter what is thrown at us. 
-
We own the rights to our music, our footage, and all liability and consent waivers have been signed by those involved in the production. 
- 
REWARDS

Pins, Totes, and prints are all work regularly produced, sold, and shipped by MIPSTERZ and the artists they support, having done a successful pin kickstarter in the past as well. Our team is well within our comfort zone. 

Reward fulfillment is being done by White Squirrel, the service behind some of your favorite illustrators and kickstarters. They are detail oriented, professional, and incredibly easy to communicate with, ready to tackle any potential shipping issues- both domestic and international!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Film release and screening for all you amazing lovely people!
updates.update_content:
Salaams and Peace to all :-)

Don't hate us! I know we said the film would release on March 31! BUT as you can imagine, with our amazing, almost volunteer team--there will be delays as we strive for perfection. Right now the film is color corrected and has been sent back to the editor. The sound was also re-engineered and ready to be added back to the final draft!

Hello all! 
Sara here, Art Director on the ALHAMDU project. We had a really successful roll out of all the backer rewards, and were so touched by everyone sharing their reactions to their pins, prints, bags, and other ways they supported the work. 
It comes with a heavy heart that I have to share that the progress on the ALHAMDU film will be delayed. We were all on track for picture lock, and were waiting on the final mix of the music, but that has come to a halt in the recent pandemic.

updates.update_userinfo: Find some joy: New Footage + Delays due to Covid-19
updates.update_content:
WE DID IT! 
Hello all! Sara here, art director of the ALHAMDU project. After a long month of campaigning and just a couple days to spare, the ALHAMDU project became fully funded! Thank you so much to everyone who championed the project, shared it with friends, and shouted ALHAMDU from the rooftops. We are so thrilled to have made it to this point with you all! 
WHAT WE'VE BEEN UP TO DURING THE CAMPAIGN

480+ backers. $15,500 raised. 10 days to go! 
Hello everyone! This is Sara Alfageeh, Art Director behind ALHAMDU. Thank you SO MUCH for joining us on this journey so far. We are 2/3rds of the way done with our campaign and with our funding, and on our way to making Muslim Futurism a reality!! To the people who championed the project again and again on social media-- we see you, we love you. Throughout the campaign we have focused on the number of backers joining us because this effort isn't just about funding to make ALHAMDU happen, but opening the doors to a larger, vibrant community.

campaign.story:
Cover by Nick Robles!
Death is, truly, the one thing we all have in common. But that doesn't make it easy to talk about.
None of us can agree on what happens after the end comes, or about how much we should think about it beforehand, or even what death should mean to the living. But who says there's anything wrong with that? Not us.
This Iron Circus Comics anthology features a line-up of cartoonists, both new and notable, relating their favorite stories, myths, hopes, and suspicions about death, dying, and even The Great Beyond.
Featuring a foreword from the New York Times bestselling author (Smoke Gets in Your Eyes: And Other Lessons from the Crematory, From Here to Eternity: Traveling the World to Find the Good Death) and founder of death positivism herself, Caitlin Doughty, YouTube's very own Ask a Mortician, YOU DIED upholds the Iron Circus tradition of uniquely intriguing subject matter and artful execution in this frank and honest exploration of what it means to be "death-positive."
We're keeping it simple, because simple is always best with Kickstarters.
 $10 gets backers a DRM-free PDF of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife.
 $20 snags a DRM-free PDF and paperback copy of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife. 
And JUST 50 BACKERS will get the traditional Iron Circus Comics EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: a DRM-free PDF and paperback copy of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife, with FREE DOMESTIC and HALF-PRICE INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING!
Currently slated to appear in YOU DIED:
 Holly Adkins (Agnes and Patsy)
 Ahueonao (Inanna's Descent to the Underworld)
 Oliver Northwood (Ghost Friend)
 Shae Beagle (Herd)
 Luyi Bennett (Here Among the Chrysanthemums)
 S Case (Remember)
 Sally Cantirino & Jordan Alsaqa (The Spark Divine)
Angela Cole & Cheryl Young (I Promise)
 Dani Colman & Maddie Kathleen (Hive Mind)
 Danielle Emile Varona Chuatico (All Souls' Day)
 Rhandi Fisher (Many Happy Returns!)
 Grace Fong & Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein (BONE INK) 
 Casey Gilly & Raina Telgemeier (A Funeral in Foam)
 Ale Green & Fanny Rodriguez (Still Life) 
 Karoline Grønvik (Good Mourning) 
 A. "Miru" Lee (Third Option)
 Laura Ketcham (Peat, Bone, Oak)
 Juliette GMM López (Wreath)
 James Maddox & Jeremy Lawson (Beyond the Cosmos)
 Isabelle Melancon & Megan Lavey-Heaton (The Ankou)
 Nadia Shammas & Lisa Sterle (You Called to Me)
 M. Cat. White (First Law)
 Letty Wilson (What Eats Us)
 James F. Wright & Jackie Crofts (Okaeri)
 This makes for 24 stories, and over 240 pages of comics.
Iron Circus was the first publisher to include Kickstarter-based bonuses as a part of their projects. We're continuing that tradition of rewarding our creators here.
This pre-order event will determine the bonuses of our authors. That bonus is a $5.00 page rate increase every $5,000 the Kickstarter makes over goal. That means the more work an artist has put in, the more they stand to make. This is on top of the page rates they've already earned, and there's no cap on potential pay.
Pre-ordering YOU DIED here on Kickstarter directly benefits the creators and the work you love!
YOU DIED has only one stretch goal: a cover enhancement at $25,000!
We would love to add some gloss or foil to Nick Roble's amazing cover art. But beyond that, we're sticking with what we love to do: pad our creators' payouts.
We have an unprecedented line-up of jaw-dropping talent in YOU DIED. Here's just a small taste of what you can expect!

Beyond the Cosmos, by James Maddox & Jeremy Lawson
Inanna's Descent to the Underworld, by Ahueonao
Good Mourning, by Karoline Grønvik
What Eats Us, by Letty Wilson
Ghost Friend, by Oliver Northwood
Kickstarter graphics by C. Spike Trotman and Matt Sheridan. Cover art by Nick Robles. Interior pages by Casey Gilly, Raina Telgemeier, Ahueonao, Karoline Grønvik, Letty Wilson, AND Olivier Northwood.

updates.update_content:
Happy Saturday, everyone!

We're just checking in to let everyone know: if you have completed our Backerkit survey, you order (barring orders with address issues we'll have to troubleshoot on a case-by-case basis, about 100 orders out of the ~4,000  total we fulfilled across three projects) is IN THE MAIL.

updates.update_userinfo: You have 48 HOURS to fill out your Backerkit survey/update your addresses! Shipping begins SOON!
updates.update_content:
IT'S FINALLY HAPPENING, everybody!
After a long, long wait, for which we are eternally grateful you have all sat through with endless patience and grace:  Fulfillment of this project is about to begin.
If you have yet to fill out your Backerkit survey— and 84 of you still have not— please do so within the next 48 hours. Click this link! Remember to use your Kickstarter-associated email.
https://you-died-an-anthology-of-the-afterlife.backerkit.com/

Hey, all. Spike here.
Don't get too excited, this is a quick, li'l, Kickstarter-mandated update.
This account was founded in 2009, the year Kickstarter launched, under the name "IronSpike." The name I used everywhere, so that was only natural.
However, in the last 12 years? It's grown into something far beyond just me. Iron Circus Comics, formerly just a glorified self-publishing DBA, has grown into a small-mid graphic novel publishing house, the largest of its kind in Chicago, possibly the entire Midwest.

Hello again, everyone. Spike here.
I wish I had better news, but there isn't any.
Our fulfillment agent, Blackbox, underwent a change of leadership in 2020, and things have been more difficult since. The system is different, as is the warehouse location and contacts. This has tacked months onto a process we're accustomed to taking two to three weeks.

Heya, folks. Spike here again. Here's what's going on!
If you haven't filled out your Backerkit Survey for YOU DIED, you need to do that ASAP. You can do it here.
https://you-died-an-anthology-of-the-afterlife.backerkit.com/
We are not using Kickstarter surveys for this! You must fill out your Backerkit survey.  We're still waiting on nearly 100 backers to complete the survey.

updates.update_userinfo: Still waiting on +100 Backers to complete their Backerkit surveys! PLUS: Fulfillment schedule!
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks. Spike here! Just posting a quick update to make sure we're all on the same page.
Some bullet points:
The books are now scheduled to hit our distributor warehouse March 3rd. 
We will ship them from that warehouse to our fulfillment house, Black Box. Expect that to take a week or two!

updates.update_userinfo: 10% of backers still have not completed their surveys! Are you among them?
updates.update_content:
Hey again, everybody! Spike here.
A little while back, I sent out an email and posted a link to the Backerkit survey that would get everybody set up for fulfillment. However, 1 in 10 of our backers have still not completed their surveys!
No worries! We get it, it's been THAT kind of year.

updates.update_userinfo: BACKERKIT SURVEYS ARE OUT. Have you filled out yours?
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks! Spike here. And finally, finally, FINALLY, we're ready to begin fulfillment!
Backerkit surveys have gone out to everyone who backed the Kickstarter. If you didn't get the email, Click the link below and enter your Kickstarter-associated email.
https://you-died-an-anthology-of-the-afterlife.backerkit.com/
Fill our your survey, and we can begin the process.

Hey again, folks. Spike here. Got some bad news incoming.
As everyone knows, we're in the middle of a pandemic, which began in China. Iron Circus prints in China, and a lot, if not all, of the plants we use shut down for several weeks at the beginning of the crisis. Ever since, they've been playing catch-up, trying to get back on top of jobs they've had to reschedule. And, despite our best efforts, despite pushing the release date as far as we thought it would need? YOU DIED is another casualty of that compromised schedule.

updates.update_userinfo: Sneak-peek of the cover effect we decided on! Wait until you see THIS.
updates.update_content:
Hello, folks! Spike here.
When the Kickstarter for YOU DIED launched, we proposed, and hit, a stretch goal for a nice cover enhancement. At the time, we were considering something like embossing or a foil effect, to really show off Nick Roble's already-amazing art. 
But our print tech had other, much better ideas. As this final round of proofs demonstrates!

campaign.story:
Hi there!  My name is Marisa and I am a fulltime freelance artist!  I love drawing cute things and animals~ so I introduce you to my Flower Friends project!


Enamel pins are expensive to make so I'm hoping together we can make these critters come to life!

These pins will be hard enamel and roughly 1.5in with silver plating.  Each one will have two rubber clasps on the back to make sure they will stay on anything you put them on!


There are six Flower Friends-- Skunk, Black Vulture, Squirrel, Silver Fox, Raccoon, and Opossum!
Our little Skunk Friend has already been made HOWEVER he is a SOFT enamel pin.  Hard enamel pins look and feel nicer than soft enamel pins, so we would love to have our skunk friend remade as hard enamel with the rest of his floral friends!

STRETCH GOALS
Unlocked at $1850
 Unlocked at $2050




July: Kickstarter is live!
August: Kickstarter ends and backers are charged.
Mid-August: Pins are put into production
September: Pins shipped to me.  Each pin is inspected for quality.
Late September or Early October: Pins are packaged and shipped to you!


Pin production cost: 70%
Shipping & Packaging: 10%
Cost for fees: 10%
Wiggle room: 10%


Thank you for supporting my project!  Whether you're pledging for a pin or sharing with friends and family, thank you!!!

star-sweets.weebly.com
starsweets.etsy.com
plush-babies.com
Instagram: starsweetshop

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Aaron Miller. I work as an illustrator, and my passion is painting fantasy ART. I get to do that for some amazing projects, including Magic: the Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Star Wars, Hearthstone, Game of Thrones, and Lord of the Rings. 
In 2018, I created a treasure token for my Patreon supporters. A card token is a marker that a player uses during gameplay to represent something, such as a creature, that isn’t already represented by a normal card in the game. My treasure token since evolved into the Treasure Skull, which I want you to enjoy as wearable art. 

artist render of pin design
Each, hard-enameled, gold pin will be securely backed for safe travel. Each pin has two backing points and military rubber backings, so your pin will stay put and not spin in circles.
"Each Treasure Skull is lucky for whoever has it now, but not so lucky for whoever had it first."
Each pendant is crafted from powdered bronze and resin, with each gem hand set by sculptor David Lee Pancake. The pendant is two inches wide and 2.25 inches long. The chain is 18-inch, antique bronze. 
It's perfect for your next gala or gaming night.
The Treasure Skull brooch is the same size and made of the same, fine materials as the pendant. Adorn your finest outerwear with the pin-backed brooch while on your way to a feast or cosplay party.
I wanted a smaller, precious piece for the collection, befitting the setting of stones found in real treasure, so I reached out to metalsmith Olivia Gobert-Hicks. Every step of the process was exciting to see unfold. She first created a wax sculpture of the skull, followed by a production sample mold for the casting house to create my stunning precious metal versions.
The Treasure Skull precious metal pendant shown is the production sample cast in pewter. Your pendant will be cast in either sterling silver or gold-plated sterling. Each of the five gems are two millimeter long hand set in the 1" x 1.25" pendant.
Each pendant comes with a FREE 18-inch chain. Giving you the opportunity to wear the pendant right away while you find the perfect chain to suit your style and budget. 
Olivia has tons of options available.
If you're in love with it now, get ready, because it only gets better. Each pendant comes in a black felt jewelry box.
Store your dice in the Treasure Skull dice bag. Or, use it to hold your Treasure Skull collection.
Each bag features a Treasure Skull printed on microfiber exterior and boasts a soft, interior lining.  It measures approximately 6.5 by 8.5 inches.
Keep your precious items free of fingerprints and smudges. Perfect for your glasses or cell phone, too.
Each cloth measures approximately 5.5 by 6.5 inches.








HOW TO ADD ON TO YOUR BACKER PLEDGE
Press “Manage Your Pledge.” If you have not backed this project yet, it will say “Back This Project.”
Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount Box by the total price of the add-ons you would like to add. For example, add $10 for a pin.
Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at unless you would like to change it. If you do, you will also need to add the add-ons amount to the new tier.
Once the Kickstarter ends, you will receive a survey asking how you want the add-on money assigned. I'll use Backerkit to make this process easy.
I was excited to have the opportunity to team up with these amazing creatives to turn my ideas into reality. I can't thank them enough for their skill and creativity.

Aaron Miller is a professional illustrator from Chicago, Illinois, USA. Specializing in the fantasy/sci-fi genre. Featured projects; Magic: the Gathering, Star Wars LCG, Dungeons & Dragons, and many more. 
Mouthy metalsmith. Hillary campaign staffer turned MTG cosplayer. Sometimes wins commander games.
Olivia sculpted the precious metal pendant.
David Lee Pancake’s sculptures grace homes and business all over the world. David is an entrepreneur, avid reader, science fiction and fantasy aficionado, arm chair philosopher, and science nut, but his first love is art.
David sculpted the brooch and pendant.
Tawny Fritz is a Colorado-based artist who specializes in clean and intricate ink drawings as well as vibrant ink and watercolor paintings. She is also a specialty and guest speaker at events, focusing on encouraging creatives to go after the life they want. 
Tawny worked on the line drawing for the enamel pin.
The Orcish Librarian is a Boston-based writer, book-eater, and cosplayer. He supports his crippling dictionary habit by working in video game development and was once voted "Most Valuable Customer" for ten years running by the Greater Boston Paper and Pulp Trade Association. In his spare time, he enjoys reading, gargling, and keeping at least 500 feet away from public libraries. He also wants to give a shout out to Dios Revoredo for his dapper avatar.
The Orcish Librarian wrote some of the story text above.
Mei Jung "MJ" Scott is a freelance writer born and raised in the Pacific Northwest, USA. MJ wrote card names and flavor for over a dozen Magic sets, beginning with Theros. Also an accomplished cosplayer, experienced "cool Mom," and human rights advocate, MJ enjoys reading fantasy, watching anime, writing fanfic, and singing country when it's time to purge their brain of reality.
MJ wrote some of the story text above.
Your survey will be powered by Backerkit. You'll have a lot more control over your survey, your shipping address, and have a ton of additional add-ons to check out after the campaign has ended. 
SHIPPING:
Each reward and/or add-on increases the weight of shipping, making it difficult for Kickstarter's platform to tabulate. I've decided the best solution is to use BackerKit to calculate shipping. It's very easy! Check out the chart below to gauge shipping costs. I'll send you a survey, confirm your address, and pay for the shipping.  I'm doing all that I can as a small business to keep your shipping costs equal to or below my costs. 
You can expect postage per item to be about $5 USD Domestic and $10- $15 USD International, depending on your country. I learned a lot from the last campaign about shipping international and will try my best to keep the customs cost down or none at all for you by shipping items as a gift, which the rewards essentially are (I cannot guarantee against your country's additional customs fees.)

Note:
If you back this project, make sure you have the correct email address listed in your KS account because that is the ONLY way I will be able to contact you after the end of this campaign to get you your rewards.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk I'm taking is the shipping date for the brooch and pendant. If this campaign grows beyond my wildest dreams, it might just take a while to make more than I thought I'd need to plan for. I can always dream.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: If you're a Magic fan you might like these Foil Tokens.
updates.update_content:
Thanks for supporting me in the past I wanted to reach out to my fans to let you know I have a new campaign for foil tokens to really bling out your collection. (If you've already pledged thanks and I love you for it!)
We're close to the goal and I'd love to see it get crushed and open up the opportunity to unlock some stretch goals.
The foil packs also make fantastic gifts for any birthdays and the holidays later this year. You're going to love these!
Thanks for all your support.

I've had a few bumps with production but everything is smoothing out. I expect to have all completed survey orders shipped by the end of the month.
Pendants/Brooches
I ran into a bump in production here. David ran out of some of the gems and the order to replace them took a little longer than planned. But, all the remaining pendants are on their way to me and should be in the mail once I get back from Utrecht mid-October.

Hi folks,
Just wanted to send out a shipping update. I should be getting an order of the pendants in within a day or so. And another shipments early next week with all the brooches. Then expecting one last shipment of pedants soon after.
The silver pendants are taking a little longer than expected. But Olivia is looking into the hold up. I expect it to get sorted out shortly and have news of those pendants as well.

The stickers came in!
I've already shipped about 20 packages. If you're a $9 or $20 tier and you complete your survey I can ship out package before I leave for GP Vegas.
I've reached out to my artisans about the pendants and brooches to get a delivery estimate. I can't wait to ship those and see you guys sharing photos of you wearing them. I will lock in those orders when I know they are being shipped to me.

I want to thank you all for giving me and all the other artists the opportunity to bring you these fun and unique treasures. 
I've wanted to start exploring new ideas and directions and this project has opened doors and imagery to do just that. There's more to come. Thanks for joining me on this adventure.
Here's what happens next.

campaign.story:
Hi! my name is Georgina, and I'm an artist and the owner @Swiftterly! After the success and lovely feedback I received from my last Viking enamel pin kickstarter I have decided to do a project similar which is Pagan and magical themed!
What is kickstarter? 
This project helps raise the initial funds needed to make these designs into real enamel pins. The initial goal of the campaign will fund the dragon pins, after that there are stretch goals which will be reached depending on how much funding the project gets!
You can pledge now and not get charged until the end of the kickstarter ONLY if we reach the funding goal. You are able to cancel your pledge at any time before the kickstarter ends.
For mostly every pin design on this project there are different colour variants. Once the kickstarter ends I will send our surveys so you will be able to choose which pin and which colour variant you would like! 
Unlock order: 
£250 -  Ice dragon, Sunset dragon
£500 - Black and Purple dragon, Black and Green dragon
£750 - Pink and white moth, purple and white moth
£1000 - Red and black moth, Sea green and black moth
£1250 - Blossom Ghost Frog, Lime Ghost Frog, Night Frog (Glow in the dark)
£1500 - Dark Planchette, Light Planchette
£1750 - Dark Moon Child, Light Moon Child
£2000 - Gold Skull Beetle, Silver Skull Beetle
£2250 - Moon child embroidery patches
£3000 - Spook club mini pin
 Timeline!
July - early August: Kickstarter project runs
August: The payments are processed and surveys sent to choose your pins. 
Mid to late August: I then hopefully receive the funds from Kickstarter, and then I can place the pin order with my manufacturer
September: I receive the pins!
Late September early October: Pin rewards are sent out to all backers
Please note that this is just a rough estimate on the timings. I am aiming to have all pins sent out by late September! :) 
Grading:
A grade - none to extremely unnoticeable flaws on the pins
B Grade - Small tarnished parts, tiny specks in the enamel or one or two bubbles in the enamel. Not noticeable unless looking at it very closely. 
Past projects
Here are a few pictures of pins I have been able to create thanks to kickstarter and my backers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This kickstarter will be my 4th project I have launched and there has been a few challenged along the way but I have learnt from every one of them! 

All rewards will be shipped untracked. I have only ever has one package sent back to be and that was purely because I added the address wrong, (silly me)! However, if you would like your package to be tracked please add £9(GBP) to your pledge when you order.

If any challenges do arise throughout the process I will make sure to update everyone! :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Happy New Year! I hope that everyone is having a brilliant start to the year. 
I just wanted to announce that I have launched another project on kickstarter called Galactic Reptiles! I'm a huge reptile lover and also also love astrology, so why not combine the two and make them as pins.

Hi everyone! 
Hope you are all having a great week! Just a quick update to say that the last two frog pins we were waiting for arrived on Monday! Sorry I haven't done an update sooner, I was determined to get the last orders left sent out as I was aware a few people's packages were delayed because of this and also wanted to get them shipped before the Christmas post gets too hectic. That and by the time I come home from work every day its already dark and I haven't been able to get any decent pictures of them! And i'm pretty sure my postie hates me now when I rocked up with 60+ packages to sort out..  but it is all done! :) What do you think of them? (these are both b grades!)

Hi everyone! Happy Halloween! Hope you all had a great time what ever you did. 
My glow in the dark frogs have arrived! This means that I can start sending out packages with these included. To those of you who have pledged for a glow in the dark frog, thank you so much for your patience. It is my aim to get them all sent out this weekend. I promise you it's worth the wait! They are so cool!
I have tested the glow in the dark enamel and boy do they glow! When you receive yours keep it in the light for a while as it would have been in a dark envelope for a couple of days and you need to "charge" the glow in the dark enamel.

Hi everyone! Hope you're all doing well! 
I have been super busy sending out the pledges I could, so people who have asked for the moon child patch, 1 pin or 2 pins that do not include any frog pins, if you haven't got your package through already, you will do really soon!
The planchette pins and spook club pins have arrived! I'm super happy with how these have turned out and I will include a few photo's of them below. This means I can start sending out the 3+ pin pledges!
What about the frog pins?

Hi guys!
As promised here are the photo update for the pins I have now!
I am off to Brussels tomorrow for 4 days so I won't be able to send any packages out until then, but after that I will make it my mission to get all the pledges with all the pins I have with me sent out!

Hi everyone! I am super excited to say that more pins have arrived! We now have all the dragon pins, moonchild patches, all the moth pins, the moon child pins, and both variants of the skull beetle!  I'll update later with photos!
What about the other pins?
My manu has assured me that my spook club pins and planchette pins are in production now which is great! I have been told that they have a holiday from the 1st to the 5th of October though so it puts a few more days production on them. But we are still just about on schedule for these!

Hi everyone! Hope you're week is going well! 
I have just come back from holiday to find that the kickstarter dragon pins were waiting for me! I'm so so pleased with out they turned out! I will add photos at the bottom of this update :) 
I am also pleased to tell you that the frog pins that were taking quite a long time to get a quote/ proof for are now in production! I was told that they were just making sure that the gradient on the pins could be done. Better safe than sorry I guess!

Hi everyone! Hope you're all OK. 
Sorry i've been so quiet for a week or so, I have just this weekend moved house so I have been busy doing that and I haven't had internet for a couple of days. But now i'm back!
All pins are now in production except for the frog ones. I am chasing up on the progress of this with my Manu every couple of days so it shouldn't be long until they are in production too. It may mean that there is a delay on shipping these off to you but not a huge difference! I'll keep everyone informed on the progress of these.

Hi everyone!
Hope you are all having a great week :) I have great news to share, the Moon Child patches have come! I was able to get the patches before the kickstarter funds came in luckily but all the pins will have to be ordered as soon as the KS money comes in as there are quite a lot of pins to buy!
I think the patches turned out well though, don't you? :)

Hi everyone! 
I hope you've had a good week, its the weekend yay! 
Just a quick update to say thank you to those who have filled in the survey already! I will share with you what pins are most popular soon as I think that's really interesting. What do you think it is?

campaign.story:
Hey there! I'm Amanda, an artist and illustrator residing near Boston, MA. You can view my work at  www.amandatulacz.com and follow me on instagram @amanda.tulacz. This is my  first enamel pin kickstarter and I'm excited to make it a reality with your support!
Life in Death is a collectible enamel pin set inspired by the cosmic, yet fleeting nature of existence. 
Backing card designs subject to slight changes
They should arrive to you just in time for halloween!
All of the pins will come with:
 two backing posts
 mounted on double sided backing cards
 black rubber backers.
***Back now and pay later! You will only be charged if the campaign reaches its funding goal.*** If the project doesn't reach its goal, your card won't be charged at all. Pledges can be adjusted at any time during the campaign!
Also, please don’t wait for your favorite design to be unlocked! If you do, it may never happen. 
Early bird tiers: add $12 per pin to your pledge if you'd like to order more pins.

The initial pins that you will unlock are: 
Duality Ravens - “The dance between darkness and light will always remain— the stars and the moon will always need the darkness to be seen, and the darkness will just not be worth having without the moon and the stars." Unlocked at $700. 
1.75” diameter, rose gold metal 
Please note - each pin in this set is separate and counts as one individual pin. To receive both, pledge for two or more pins.


Stretch Goals:
Day & Night Ravens - "For every dark night there is a brighter day." Unlocked at $800.
1.75” diameter, rose gold metal 
Please note - each pin in this set is separate and counts as one individual pin. To receive both, pledge for two or more pins.


Tranquility - "Life was such a fragile thing: as delicate and as beautiful as a butterfly, as ephemeral as a sunset. Death is peaceful. Death is quiet, silent. It is calming." Unlocked at $1200.
1.75" diameter, silver nickel metal  



Ascend - "Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live." Unlocked at $2000.
2" diameter, silver nickel metal  

Tranquility Stickers - Unlocked at $2500 and free with every pledge! Design TBA (it will be a hand painted version of the Tranquility pin design)

 Quiver - "No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away." - Terry Pratchett. Unlocked at $3000 and free with every pin pledge.
Limited edition of 200
1.75" diameter, gold metal 
When the project is fully funded, you will be able to choose from any of the unlocked pins for your pledge amount.
The pins will retail at a regular price of $15 once funded. However, there are reduced cost early bird tiers and discounts available on kickstarter for quantities over 1 pin as a thank you for helping to make them a reality!

PRINTS AND ORIGINAL DRAWINGS
An image with available print options is below. Pledges that include original ink drawings will be able to request subject matter for the drawings. For reference of my ink work, you can view it at https://www.amandatulacz.com/black-white
For close ups of images, visit www.amandatulacz.com
Illustration for a martini recipe

FUND BREAKDOWN
For every pin design, it will cost roughly $500 to create. This includes manufacturing fees and shipping from the factory. All remaining funds raised will be used for shipping to backers, materials, and fees. Excess funds will be used for the production of more pins and stickers. The buffer will be used to cover any additional or unexpected costs.

TIMELINE
Once the project is funded, surveys will be sent out to backers to select their pin choices. Once the surveys are complete it will take roughly 1-2 weeks for me to receive funds from the campaign. After the funds are received, the pins will be ordered. It will take 3-4 weeks to receive the pins from the manufacturer, and orders will be promptly shipped out once pins are received. Assumed pin arrival date will take around 2-3 months from the end of the campaign. I expect the pins to be shipped out around mid-August to mid-September.
Mid-June - Campaign launches
Mid-July - Campaign ends and surveys are sent out
End of July - Funds are received and pins are ordered from the manufacturer
Mid-Late August - Pins are received and shipped out to backers. 
Early - Late September - Pins are received by backers. Please allow additional time for international shipping.

Want to support the campaign, but can't back it? No problem! Sharing on social media will help just as much. All shares are greatly appreciated! Be sure to tell your friends :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I will be sending the designs off to a pin manufacturer once funds are received. The designs may be tweaked to ensure the best outcome for the clarity and quality of the pin molds, but I will be sure to keep everyone updated on the final results.

Color on the manufactured pins may appear different than what you see on your screen due to your monitor display settings. All of the pins have been designed with the color palette required by the manufacturer (Pantone+ Solid Coated), so the colors shouldn't vary too much from the original designs. The colors are hand mixed at the factory, so slight shifting in color may occur.

Shipping delays may occur if the design needs some minor edits, or if any errors happen during manufacturing. I will be sure to keep everyone informed of any delays.

Prints and original drawings will be sent along with the pins once the pins arrive from the manufacturer. Prints may be delayed should I find any errors or damaged prints in the printing process.

Again, I'll be sure to keep everyone updated regarding any delays, and feel free to ask any questions!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Thank you so much for backing my last project! I'm updating to let you all know that I just launched my next enamel pin kickstarter, called "Spirits," which is a continuation of this set. You can check it out here!  https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/amandatulacz/spirits-enamel-pins 
There's two more designs for this set that I've been fussing over, but should have revealed in the next 2-3 days. Those pins will be of a horse skull and a hawk skull.

updates.update_userinfo: Stickers are here! Reward packages will be shipping tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
After disappearing in the USPS mail system for a few days, the stickers have finally arrived at my door (picture below)! That means reward packages will be shipping out tomorrow :)
Sometime within the next week I’ll be launching my next kickstarter, which will be for a new set of enamel pins. The new designs will be a series of animals skulls similar to “Tranquility” and “Quiver.” I’ve included a little preview of the cat skull one below. This is just my initial concept drawing and I’ll likely fine tune it a bit more. I’ll also be adding a limited addition color variant of “Tranquility” as one of the stretch goals (pictured below!).
Thank you all again! This was all made possible because of each and every one of you.

I’m happy to say that I’ve received the pins and they look incredible! (Pictures below)
It’s going to take me a few days from here to sort through all of them, grade them, card them, and package them. I should be able to get most of that done on my days off from work next week.
The cut off date for changing addresses and purchasing additional pins is next Wednesday, September 18th.

updates.update_userinfo: The pins are officially on their way to me!
updates.update_content: Hey guys! Great news - the pins are officially on their way to me! That means I should hopefully receive them sometime next week. I’ll post another update when I receive them and let you know when the cutoff date is for address changes and additional pin purchases. Once I have them in hand it will take a few more days to a week for me to sort through and grade them, card them, package them, and drop them off at the post office. For now, here’s the rest of the preview photos!

Hey everyone! Here’s 3 more preview photos of the pins. It looks like they should be shipping out to me sometime around Thursday or Friday, and the stickers should be shipping out to me sometime this week as well! That means anytime within the next week to 2 weeks I should be receiving the pins. From there I’ll quality check them, and if all is good reward packages will begin to ship out. Please make sure your address is up to date before then. I’ll post another update a few days before I start shipping to remind everyone, and any additional pins need to be purchased by then as well.

Hey guys! I hope you’ve all been doing great. I just wanted to post a quick little update to show you all the preview photo I received today of “Quiver.” The other pins are finishing up production, and I should have them within the next two weeks. I’ll post another update when I get photos of the rest!

Hey everyone! Sorry this update is getting to you a day late - yesterday was my birthday, and though I planned to spend it at home painting it ended up being much more eventful than I had originally planned. I hope your week has also been great so far!
I've been playing around with the painting for the tranquility design, and I think I've decided that I want to get the stickers printed on holographic paper. The holographic paper doesn't cost too much more than the regular vinyl so I'm fairly sure I can swing the additional cost. If I do, the forehead carving and stars would be holographic, though I'm still playing around with making more elements holographic as well.

campaign.story:
I'm back, and this time for something completely different: CAT PINS! Not that I'm done with bird pins, but, you know... caaaAAATTTS! They're cute, they're cuddly, they're... sophisticated??
A project that started with a memorial pin for my childhood cat Oscar, Sophisticats evolved into a larger project with these three gorgeous designs perfect for any aristocat (can I say that?), each based on a different historical figure: King of Sweden Oscar II, the last Tudor royal of England Queen Elizabeth I, and His Imperial Majesty The Emperor of France, Napoleon!
39mm / 1.5 inch
    Hard enamel for shine, smoothness and strength
    All Divine Passerine pins have my art name, Yseulta, printed on the back
    All pins also come with some fancy backing cards!
          *Please note that final designs may be tweaked as necessary for manufacturing*
 So regal! Of course, with so many interesting historical figures (and so many cats!), Sophisticats has a great potential for more designs. This campaign is starting at these three designs here, but if all goes well, I hope to reveal more pins!
This will be my third Kickstarter, and all of my previously funded pins are available on my Etsy shop here:
Sweet, sweet bird pins on Etsy! 
I'm also active on instagram !
Here's just a handful of the pins I've already designed so far:
 All shipping will be through An Post Standard. International backers are responsible for any customs, taxes or other fees that may occur. 
 I'll be watching this page like a puma in the night for any questions that come in! Feel free to click on the "Comments" tab under my main banner picture if you have any questions about this campaign or how Kickstarter works.
Alternately, check out the "FAQ" tab, where I have some information already prepared!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third Kickstarter campaign, and by now I feel very comfortable with the process. The only issues that I can foresee occurring are delays in manufacturing or shipping, which I believe would only happen if any of these designs needed adjusting or re-making. That being said, I do not anticipate any major delays.

I hope you all understand if there do happen to be delays in any of these processes, I will be quick with updates! As always I will be keeping everyone updated as to what is going on, as above all I aim to keep every one of my supporters informed and happy!

As a final note, my cat Jiji was a major help in wrapping orders for my last Kickstarter, and he said he could pencil me into his schedule for packaging everything this time around as well, so I will have a lot of great help!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Guess WHO'S HERE? It's our royal kitty children! And they are GORGEOUS <3 
I'd blather on about how gorgeous they look, but I think a photo will illustrate this better:

updates.update_userinfo: All designs funded, we did it!
updates.update_content:
I thought that a shorter Kickstarter campaign would go by quickly, but these past two weeks were so intense it felt like a regular month campaign! But it's over now, and WE DID IT! We managed to unlock not only our initial three Sophisticat designs, but also a fourth stretch goal at the last minute as well!
Since we did unlock Marie Catoinette right at the end, if anyone missed out on adding her to your pledge (or if you just want to add any of the other cats in general!), shoot me a message and we'll talk about it!
I'm already in contact with my manu for updated quotes and final design reviews, and I've also asked if they would be willing to start production with a down payment as I wait for the Kickstarter funds to arrive.

OKAY WOW, I was going to update this tomorrow but I'd better do it before more people jump ship XD
Due to me being UNABLE TO READ, I noticed today on my manu's email that the prices he gave me were in USD, and I didn't even notice that until now so all our numbers were wrong. Partnering that with some money I found in my pocket, I've realised that we're able to unlock all three of our initial pins!

I just realised I posted about the backing cards for this campaign on instagram and forgot to update you guys about them here! For those of you who have already seen these, then I'm sorry, I just love how they turned out! I'll post a preview of them at the end of this update, but for now, a quick pre-announcement!
What's a pre-announcement? It's just my way of saying that when we unlock our second stretch goal at €600 (just saying, but we're €50 away from that!), I have some awesome news for you guys! So that's the pre-announcement: announcing that at our next funding goal, I'll have something else to say XD

updates.update_userinfo: First goal funded, thank you all so much!
updates.update_content: I launch, I go to bed, I wake up and what do I see?

campaign.story:
“Ambedo is a collection of all of the sweat and tears I’ve shed in the past decade of my career. It’s a recording of my progression as an artist in terms of style, technique and personal narrative. I very much hope that you like the sweat and tears that are sprinkled onto each page.” --Tran Nguyen
Tran Nguyen and Flesk Publications have partnered to create her first art book, Ambedo. This book is available as an affordable signed hardcover. In addition, limited and open edition signed prints are on hand, plus enamel pins and original art are also available. Enjoy the samples and details below. Thank you for visiting! 
All books pledged for through Kickstarter come signed by Tran Nguyen! In addition, all pledges of $40 or more come with a free 8x10-inch print! Thanks to all of our supporters for making this book a reality!
Stretch Goal #1 is UNLOCKED! We are including a two-piece bookmark set for free to everyone who pledges for the $40 Ambedo book.
Stretch Goal #2 is UNLOCKED! We are including a 4x6-inch, ten-piece postcard set for free to everyone who pledges for the $40 Ambedo book.
Stretch Goal #3 is UNLOCKED: We are adding an additional 16 pages to the Ambedo book!  The book is now 208 pages. This bonus section will highlight the process of how Tran makes a painting in a special behind-the-scenes tutorial.
Ambedo is a luxurious new hardcover book that collects the very best paintings and drawings by Tran Nguyen completed from 2009 to 2018. It showcases her sensuous and personal work that was done for gallery exhibitions, as well as her advertising, book and editorial illustration projects completed as a freelance artist. Over 120 paintings are featured along with nearly a dozen preliminary sketches. An introduction by Tran opens the book, followed by her brief intimate commentary for each of her solo and group show chapters.
$40, 9x12 inches, at 192 pages. The book is now 208 pages thanks to the third stretch goal being unlocked! All books purchased through Kickstarter will include a unique bonus signed page that is bound into the book. The book features gilt edges (gold printed on the edges of the pages) and utilizes gold for highlighted text treatments on the interior pages and on the cover.
Tran’s paintings are created with a soft, delicate quality using colored pencil and acrylic on paper. She’s most known for her paintings of whimsical women and melancholic landscapes, which often possess an air of fantasy and surrealism.
Tran Nguyen is a fine artist and freelance illustrator currently based in Georgia. Born in Vietnam and raised in the States, she is fascinated by creating traditional paintings in the realms of fantasy and surrealism. Tran illustrates for magazines, books, product packaging, advertising and mural art. Her clients include Smithsonian magazine, Tiger Beer, the World Wildlife Fund and Amazon, and she has been showcased in galleries across the world.
This signed 13x19 inch museum-quality giclée print (above) feature Tran Nguyen’s painting “The Cerulean Girl.” 
The “Forbidden Forest” signed print (above) is only available in the $120 and $220 group tiers, as well as the original art tiers. This 13x19 inch museum-quality giclée print comes signed by Tran. 
These luxurious 13x19 inch prints will utilize 290 gsm acid-free matte paper that also is water resistant, and they are printed with archival and fade resistant inks. An open edition print is one that is not numbered or limited.
This signed and numbered print will be limited to the quantity ordered during this 30-day campaign. The luxurious museum-quality giclée print features Tran Nguyen’s beautiful painting “Spin the Dawn.” This oversized print is 18x24 inches and utilizes 300 gsm acid-free premium matte Moab Somerset paper that also is water resistant, and it is printed with archival and fade-resistant inks. This exceptional print is $100.
These two “A Place We Once Homed II” one-inch enamel pins will be expertly made under Tran’s supervision. Please note that the designs may fluctuate slightly during production. The enamel pins come as a set for $20.
As a bonus, we will include a free 8x10-inch mini-print of “Towards Leadership” with all pledges of $40 or more.
Tran is making seven of her original preliminary artworks available during this Kickstarter campaign. Each original art tier includes the signed hardcover book of Ambedo: The Art of Tran Nguyen, the signed  13x19 inch print of “The Cerulean Girl,” the signed  13x19 inch print of “Forbidden Forest,” the signed and numbered premium 18x24 inch print of "Spin the Dawn," and the two enamel pins. Note, these images do not appear in Ambedo.
The  A Cornered Keepsake preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size:  7x9", paper size  8x10" (unframed).
The A Half-lit Heartbreak preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size: 6.5x8.5", paper size 11.5x11" (unframed).
The Cranberry & Elderflower preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size:  8.5x5.5", paper size  14x9.5" (unframed).
The Kushiel’s Chosen II preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size:   6.5x9", paper size 11x10" (unframed).
The Spin the Dawn preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size: 6x8.5”, paper size 11x10.5" (unframed).
The Sleeping With Nostalgia preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size:  9x7", paper size  10x8" (unframed). 
The Sleepless On the Silk Road preliminary original art is done using graphite on paper, image size: 5.5x7.5", paper size 11x10" (unframed).
Stretch goals allow us to thank you for your growing support by rewarding you with exclusive bonus items and upgrades. All three of our stretch goals have been unlocked. Thank you!
UNLOCKED! A 2x6-inch, two-piece bookmark set that features two of Tran’s paintings. Free to everyone who pledges for the $40 Ambedo book.
UNLOCKED! A 4x6-inch, ten-piece postcard set that features some of Tran’s favorite pieces. Free to everyone who pledges for the $40 Ambedo book. 
UNLOCKED! Adding 16 Bonus Pages to Ambedo!
We will add an additional 16 pages to Ambedo! This will increase the book page  count from 192 pages to 208 pages. This bonus section will highlight the  process of how Tran makes a painting in a special behind-the-scenes tutorial.
Add on anything to anything! An “Add-On” lets you pledge for more than one tier by adding the price of any additional tier to your existing pledge. Say you want to include an extra book? Simply add on an additional $40 to your pledge and let us know. You will also need to double the shipping charge. If you have any questions, we are here to help.
This signature page for the Ambedo book is exclusive for our Kickstarter supporters. This will be bound into the book.
We expect to have your pledged items shipped to you in September 2019. The book is done and ready for the printer. We expect to send everything to the printer within two weeks after the completion of this campaign if we hit our goal. It takes approximately three months for everything to be printed and then to be delivered to us. We will ship them to everyone in early September, immediately upon their arrival at our Flesk warehouse in Santa Cruz, CA.
All books shipped within the U.S. will go by USPS mail and will include tracking. Premium signed giclée prints shipped within the U.S. will go by USPS first-class mail (small prints) or priority mail (large prints) and will include tracking. These prints will be shipped rolled in a sturdy tube for safe delivery. The enamel pins will be shipped with the prints or separately by first-class mail.
Items shipped to our international friends usually take three weeks for delivery to your local post office but can sometimes take up to six weeks, depending on the country. Note that customs for your local country may hold on to packages for a week or longer and incur additional charges that are the responsibility of the backer. We will not mark items as a “gift.” We know that shipping overseas is very expensive, and we too wish it was cheaper! We help by subsidizing some of the shipping cost. We make no money from the shipping.
Ambedo and all artwork are trademark and © 2019 Tran Nguyen. All rights reserved.
Video and text used for this campaign is © 2019 Tran Nguyen and Flesk Publications. All rights reserved.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John Fleskes answers:

I pride myself on having a seventeen year record of delivering over ninety books of the highest quality. I've run ten previous Kickstarter campaigns with artists such as Brom, Frank Cho, J.A.W. Cooper, Jeffrey Alan Love, Gary Gianni and Mike Mignola (Hellboy: Into the Silent Sea Studio Edition), Petar Meseldzija, Richard and Wendy Pini (Elfquest), Mark Schultz, and Daren Bader and Lance HaunRogue. Most of these have been on time. We are very open with our backers and communicate through updates often to keep you up to date.

In some cases, things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published over ninety books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands when I said I would.

I can't thank everyone enough who has supported us before. You directly help us to make these beautiful books.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi, everyone,
I'm very excited to let you know that Ambedo is at the printer! We took our time to create the additional 16-page bonus tutorial section that was unlocked toward the end of the campaign. We are very pleased with how everything looks.
In addition, the enamel pins have been finalized and are currently being manufactured. We look forward to sharing pictures just as soon as they arrive.

Hi, everyone,
Thank you all so much for supporting us. We are thrilled with how well this campaign turned out. The number that excites us the most is that there are 911 of you that backed this project. That is 911 of you who we are privileged to prepare this book, prints, pins, and bonus items for and who we get to share the art of Tran with. Thank you!!!
Here's a note from Tran:
