campaign.story:
I'd love to take a moment to introduce you to my latest art book which has been over four years in the making. 'Welsh Monsters & Mythical Beasts' is an 89 page illustrated guide containing numerous creature profiles and legends accompanied by detailed ink and watercolour illustrations.
Digital product mock-up.
My name is Collette and I'm a full time freelance fantasy illustrator from Wales, a modern Celtic nation situated on the lower West coast of the British Isles. I grew up surrounded by the stunning countryside, dramatic landscapes, legends of King Arthur, dragons and tales of mysterious creatures that inhabited the land. Over the years I built a career through my art and have been heavily influenced by Welsh culture and inspired by fantasy, nature and ancient mythologies from around the world. 
Samples of inside pages.
You may have heard of the Red Dragon (Ddraig Goch) featured on the national flag of Wales, but sadly here in Wales many of our other legends and mythical creatures are being forgotten over time. I felt so sad to see my culture loosing such an amazing array of stories and creatures, so it  became my mission to bring them back to the forefront of Welsh culture and introduce them to a new generation and share our rich mythology with the world.
Y Ddraig Coch - The Red Dragon
SPECS:  
89 pages in length 
Approx 8.27 x 8.27 inches in size
UPGRADED TO HARDBACK (VIA STRETCH GOAL)
Printed cover with metallic gold foil filigree and text 
I originally launched the 1st edition of this book in 2016 and I received an overwhelmingly positive response. The original book had to meet very tight deadlines and I always had this niggling feeling that it could have been so much more than what it was, still, people all over Wales started sending in even more legends of mythical beasts from their local areas. There was so much new material that naturally it inspired me to expand on the original book and create a second edition. So, I set out to recreate some of the original illustrations and add many more.
Sample of gold foiling effect that will feature on the cover.
ADDITIONAL CREATURES & LEGENDS:  
THE ANNWNN (The Celtic Otherworld)  
TYLWYTH TEG (Fairy Folk)  
ELLYLLON (Elves) 
COBLYNAU (Mine Fairies) 
BWBACHOD (House Fairies) 
GWRAGEDD ANNWN (Water Fairies) 
GWYLLION (Mountain Fairies)
CEWRI (Giants) 
CERNUNNOS (The Horned God) 
BWCA (Knockers) 
CWRACH Y RHIBYN (Hag of the Mist) 
MORGANS (Mermaids) 
CATH PALUG (Paulg's Cat)
Samples of two new pages
Listed below are just a handful of changes that have been made to this new edition of the art book:
Metallic gold foil cover artwork and text
Expanded from 50 to 89 pages
Existing legends and creature profiles have been expanded
Original artworks have been enhanced or re-drawn 
Graphic design and typography has been updated
All blank pages have been removed 
Existing typos have been removed or corrected
An editor and Welsh translator will oversee the writing
Can be bought with an additional behind the scenes sketchbook
New exclusive prints available 
Postboxes are smaller and more streamlined
The book has been ISBN registered 
Features a barcode for easy sale
Wholesale options available
The new book has been separated into sections to include Dragons, Beasts, Spirits and a whole new section on Fairy Folk has been added.
I'm so excited about this expanded version of the book, there's so much new content and I hope you will love it too!
This time you'll have the option of adding an additional sketchbook to your order! The all new sketchbook offers a unique insight into the development of the book; featuring a variety of thumbnails, concept sketches and page plans.
Sketchbook digital mockup
It is the same size as the art book featuring a soft cover and recycled pages.
Works in Progress
This is the perfect add-on for aspiring illustrators and behind the scenes lovers out there who want to see how the book was made. 
EARLY BIRD REWARDS:  
During this campaign there will be a limited number of Early Bird rewards available. Each Early Bird book will be signed, will include an original hand-drawn pencil sketch and will be lovingly hand wrapped in black paper and tied with string, all held together with a golden wax seal. 
All physical book pre-orders are eligible for stretch-goal rewards, you will be able to purchase additional prints, books and items via my Etsy store once the book is completed.
PRINTS TO CHOOSE FROM:   
If you have selected a pledge that includes a print or multiple prints, you will be prompted to provide the names of the prints you would like when the customer surveys are sent out via a selection menu.
All prints will be printed onto 'Polished Pearl Polar' 300gsm card, these extra special prints will have a shimmering almost surreal appearance when they catch the light. 
COMMISSIONS:   
REGARDING COMMISSION SUBJECTS: Just one character or creature per commission slot. Bust commissions may include any mythical creature of your choosing while full body commissions will be exclusive to dragon types only. When the surveys are sent out you will be prompted to provide information, reference sheets or keywords regarding your commission. You can do this by writing a short description in the note box provided in the survey or by sending your information via private message once the Kickstarter has ended.
WHOLESALE PRE-ORDERS:
Be the first to stock this unique art-book in your store by pre-ordering through the Kickstarter, books will retail at £30 each.
The book is ISBN registered, this number and the bar-code is printed on the back cover and comes with additional A3 promo posters so you can advertise easily. 
Original artworks featured in the book will be available to buy during the campaign, as they sell out each AVAILABLE artwork will be marked as SOLD. This pledge is a first come first served basis, so once you chose this reward you will need to message me asap with the artwork you would like so I can reserve it for you. 
Selection of originals available.
Alternatively you can pay for originals separate to your pledge, just pop me a private message and I will link you to my Paypal.
More original artworks will be listed for sale on my Etsy store as the project progresses. Kickstarter backers and Patreons will be informed as soon as they are made available.
PLEASE NOTE: Originals will be sent out separately to your art book order. 
Stretch goals that have been unlocked will become clear, goals yet to be unlocked will appear faded.
Please keep in mind that if a target is not reached these stretch goals will not be included with your order.
I want to say a massive thank you to all those who backed the first edition and brought this project to life, you guys literally kick-started my freelance career! Those who bought a book during the original Kickstarter in 2016 and all those who have pledged over $5 to the project on Patreon, will receive an additional hand signed, gold foil art print:
Digital print mock-up.
DISCLAIMER Please keep in mind in order to receive this reward you must have backed the first edition of this book on Kickstarter or you must be an active Patreon who has pledged $5 or more over time. You must also be an active Patreon during the campaign and remain a Patreon until May 2019 at ANY level. If you did not purchase a book during the last campaign but would like to get in on this giveaway, you can do so by becoming a $5 Patreon Supporter for one month HERE
My name is Collette J Ellis and I'm a full time freelance fantasy illustrator from Wales, my work is hugely influenced by ancient mythologies and I love drawing dragons and mythical creatures.
Hello!
In the past I have achieved an MA in Design Communication and have exhibited at various conventions across the UK; including London, Manchester and Cardiff. In October 2016 I opened my third solo exhibition in the Oriel Yuys Mon on Anglesey and have launched a number of successful Kickstarters, the first of which was the 1st edition of the book ‘Welsh Monsters and Mythical Beasts’ which sold over 1,000 copies in its first year.
2016 First edition.
Over the years I have worked on numerous publications for authors and album covers for musicians. I've been featured in several online blogs and magazines, including Imagine FX Magazine, 'Y Lle’ on Welsh TV channel S4C and have even appeared on the BBC ‘Wales Today’ Show. 
Samples of my artwork.
If you want to know more about my work and what I do, you can check out my website that includes more artwork, a link to my mailing list and links to my social media pages: www.collettejellis.com 
October 23rd - Kickstarter launch day
November 22nd - Kickstarter closes
January 2019 - Book edited 
March 2019 - Book completed and paid for
April - Surveys sent out to backers
May / June 2019 - Books dispatched 
Please keep in mind that this is a rough guide, prep and shipping time can vary dramatically depending on how many books have been ordered. I will continue to keep backers up to date with monthly updates here on Kickstarter, but my goal is to have the books delivered by October - November 2019 at the very latest should I sell more than I anticipate in the schedule above. 
COSTS:
To give you an idea of how the money will be spent should this project fund I have created a rough pie chart illustrating the costs involved.
A rough pie-chart to illustrate funding breakdown.
The funding goal includes production costs, postage, packaging, prints, add-ons and additional fees including Paypal, Credit-card fees, Kickstarter fees and a cushion should additional costs arise, in my experience running Kickstarter campaigns there are always a few unforeseen costs. 
WELSH LANGUAGE:
Sadly due to cost, I'm unable to produce a bilingual copy of the physical book for this pre-order. However the Welsh language is incredibly important to me so if this Kickstarter goes well I intend to have the book translated into Welsh and made available in book stores and online by the end of 2019.
Please keep in mind that the writing for the book is 80% complete thus far and 60% of the artwork is complete. This Kickstarter will afford me the time and means to complete the book, it will also be receiving a final edit by a professional editor. I will be working closely with ExWhyZed Printing to ensure you receive the best quality product so I have allowed time for these final touches to be made. 
Pledges will be shipped worldwide! Simply select your pledge option, your location and Kickstarter will calculate shipping for you! The price will include postage and packaging costs. All orders will be sent standard delivery. In the event of lost items, I will offer to resend your order once for free after 28 days of the items being sent; alternatively, you will have the option of a refund or Etsy store credit. Please note that I can only reship an order once if it is lost, if the second parcel is lost, I will not be able to offer a replacement. If you fail to provide a correct address during the surveys then I will be unable to replace your order. 
CUSTOMS DISCLAIMER: Please be aware that some countries will charge a handling fee on items over a certain price / weight, unfortunately I have no control over this. 
KICKSTARTER SURVEY DISCLAIMER: Please keep in mind that once surveys have been sent out you will have a limited amount of time to fill them in (up to 4 weeks). After this time a public update will be made to let you know that the books have all been shipped. Anyone who has not completed their survey by this time will not receive a copy of the book, instead their pledge will be viewed as a 'donation pledge'. 
This time I have chosen to have my book printed by ‘Ex Why Zed Printing’ in Colchester, UK. 
I have used them several times in the past for my art sketchbooks and prints as they have came highly recommended by many other successful Kickstarter users and friends. They are both remarkably fast and incredibly high quality. 
Learn more about Ex Why Zed via their website: http://www.exwhyzed.co.uk
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
*** IMPORTANT PLEASE READ ***

After my last few campaigns, I learned that things don’t always go to plan so I have allowed for extra time in my deadline just in case this happens. 

You will be continuously updated every two - three weeks on the progress via this campaigns updates section or you can follow the project on my social media accounts. 

I've also allowed for time needed to complete all commissions and art works, so that I can give my all in creating some fantastic rewards for those backing this project!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last of the Kickstarter editions are up for sale!
updates.update_content: For those who missed out on the Kickstarter and Pledge Manager campaigns; There are 200 remaining copies for sale in my Etsy shop right now. There are also some seconds available, these are damaged items and have been discounted to reflect that.

Good news for those who have been waiting for the remaining Kickstarter editions of my Welsh Monsters art book. Orders will open on Wednesday the 14th of October, 6pm (London Time: GMT+1). They will be available to purchase from my Etsy store at this time, so be sure to refresh the page at the time above: https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/CCJEllis
Personal Update:

Hello lovely kickstarter backers! It seems we’re overdue for another project update! 
Unfortunately last Friday I ended up in hospital with severe stomach pains and sickness, after 8 hours in A&E and basic tests I was dismissed as having a ’stomach bug’ and sent home. Over the next day the pain continued to worsen. My mother is a nurse and decided to drive all the way from the north of Wales to get me and bring me back home. I was checked into the hospital where she works, where they did more tests, an x-ray and ultrasound. They discovered I had gall stones which were causing inflamation of my gall bladder and a cyst on my right ovary. I’ve been discarged for the time being with pain meds while they decide the best course of action. It’s very likely I will need my gallbladder removing and they need to check out the cyst and decide if that can be removed also. I’m in a lot of pain most days right now, I’ve never experinced anything this awful. Hopefuly they get me fixed up soon.

All of the Welsh Monsters Art Books have officially been dispatched! XD
... and now I’m taking a much needed week-long nap ^^’
Thank you so much to everyone who made this project possible, I’ve been reading all the lovely comments from those who have recived their books already and they mean so much to me! Hopefully the rest start arriving soon :) I’m so excited to hear your thoughts x

Just a short update to let you all know that all international orders outside the EU and UK have now been dispatched. The Post office has told me to advise everyone that some orders may take up to three months to arrive at their destinations, this is due to delays caused by the Covid-19 pandemic and is unfortunately outside of my comtrol. However, this is a worst case senario, it is very likey your items will arrive sooner.
If after three months your items have not arrived yet, then please get in touch with me via private message or via the contact section of my website (www.ccjellis.com) with your order number, address and the email you used to sign into pledgemanager.

Books have started to be dispatched to UK and EU backers so please keep an eye put for your packages, they might be arriving any dayfrom now. 
We still have a lot of books to pack however, so please keep in mind we’re going to be dispatching books for about a month if we continue at our current pace and *fingers crossed* don’t fall sick. we’re doing everything within our power to protect ourselves when doing post and food runs but it’s a possibility we must make allowences for. Some countries borders are still closed, so we are keeping these packages safe ready for dispatch once normal postal service resumes. 
I need your reviews!

Today myself and my partner Ash started packing up some of the orders. Its so surreal to finally be at this stage and despite everything thats happened over the course of this project im so grateful we’ve reached it!
The moment you’ve been waiting for for so long! It’s been a bumpy road, but the books are finally here!

The printers just sent me some photos from their factory in South Wales! The books are printed now, their just being bound and packaged ready to ship. They're hoping to get them dispatched to me by the end of the week if all goes to plan *fingers crossed* this is so exciting :D I can't wait to finally get them in my hands!

project_data.project_name: Welsh Monsters and Mythical Beasts V.2

campaign.story:
Illuminated is an enamel pin set featuring designs of mythological creatures. The art style is inspired by a blend of different historical European artworks.
The unicorn is the very first design that will be available, and consecutive designs will unlock based on stretch goals.
Enamel Pin Specs
 Hard Enamel Pins
45 mm (1.77 inch)
Gold Plating
Butterfly Clutches AND Rubber Clutches for the back
Backing card
We have done a lot of research and are trying a new manufacturer this time around. This, plus the increased pin size from our previous projects, has changed the goal amount, but will not change the price of the pins. We are hoping that these pins will be even higher quality than those that have come before!
Stretch Goals
Timeline
November - Kickstarting
December - Backer Polls & Product Count
January - Production
February - Shipping
Due to proximity to the Chinese New Year, there may be up to a month's worth delay for production times should there be any delays earlier in the timeline.
Add-Ons
Unfortunately, we will not be handling add-ons during this kickstarter project. If you would like to purchase additional pins or other rewards, all leftover stock will be available on our Etsy Page after the project is complete.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are producing with http://www.awesomemerchandise.com/ this time around! We've heard a lot of great things and there are many great projects that have come from them off of kickstarter. Designs may be tweaked to ensure the best outcome for the clarity and quality of the pin molds, and we will be sure to keep everyone updated on any design changes.

The portion of this process with the longest potential delays will be in the month of shipping. We will definitely be ordering shipping supplies ahead of time based on the success of the campaign, and our experience with a similar type of kickstarter has us confident we can overcome any hurdles thrown at us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Exciting news-- we've packaged and labelled all the kickstarter packages! The final boxes will be going straight to the post office first thing tomorrow, and everyone should have already received a tracking number for their packages.
Thank you so much for all of your patience and support in completing this kickstarter! If you're having trouble with your package, please email us at crowcouncilart@gmail.com or message us on Kickstarter.

Hello everyone!
We've had a couple drawbacks these past two weeks-- the manticore and the griffin had incorrect fills! We've contacted the manufacturer and hopefully they'll be getting us replacement pins by the 25th of February. In the meanwhile, we've backed and bagged the rest of the pins and will begin shipping out orders that don't include the manticore and the griffin pins.
Thank you all so much for your patience! When we've sent out your order, we'll message you with a tracking number. Due to the snow, ice, and cold, it may take us a little while longer to get this all done, and we appreciate your patience!
Our physical merchandise arrived! It will take us a few days to put all the pins on cards and in bags, but we'll be shipping out rewards soon!
Hello everyone! We've finally got mockups for the printed patches ready for viewing. Everyone will be getting a full set (all 10) of patches regardless of their reward tier.
Hello! We're working on cleaning up those stretch goal designs and getting them vectored! The phoenix and manticore have been spiffy'd up already:

Hello everyone! Reward surveys have been sent out! As a note, for tier two (2 pins), if you want duplicates, just let us know in the "delivery options" portion of your address information.
We can't believe we hit 11k even! Thank you all for making this a wonderful project, we'll keep you updated on when we receive funding/begin production!

In the very last 24 hours, we've hit the final stretch goal! All designs are unlocked and will be available as options, and the free patch set totals to 10 designs per backer.
This is a very huge accomplishment and we thank every single one of you!
This is the last day to make any adjustments, additions, subtractions, or cancellations to your pledges! Thank you all so much, your pledges mean a lot to us.

I am in awe at our supporters and backers that we reached yet another stretch goal, so close to the deadline. Thank you so so much for helping us produce our designs, we couldn't do this without you all!
As another small update, we've found another pin producer that we are going to try to go with for the kickstarter instead of Awesome Merchandise. We are speaking directly with a factory rather than a middle-man, and have already ordered a test batch of 50 pins from them using a different design to check the quality of metal and color of enamel. Everything seems extremely promising, and here's to hoping things run smoothly from here!

Hello everyone! There are 4 days left for the kickstarter-- please be sure to adjust your pledges to the final tier that you'd like, whether it's adjusting it up to include new designs or adjusting it down to avoid duplicates (such as if you have 10 pins)!
Also, we've hit the stretch goal for the phoenix! Thank you so so much for your patronage!

campaign.story:
ADD ONS UPDATE!!!
Want to add on items or get more of something? No problem! Just add the desired amount below to your pledge and more will be sent your way. Some of these prices are slightly higher because they include the extra shipping.
 Hi there and welcome to my first ever Kickstarter campaign! My name is Lydia Fenwick, but the internet knows me best as "Lyfe Illustration." I am a professional illustrator from Southern California who has a passion for watercolor, ink, whimsical women and animals, and my panther chameleon sidekicks whom I affectionately refer to as tree dragons.
During the month of October, I embarked on a series of women and animal illustrations based on constellations, including all astrological signs, as a celebration for reaching 200K followers on my Instagram. Each piece was done in a single day, using mainly ink, and filmed for YouTube (You can view a video of each finished piece here!) The project soon turned into some of my favorite work and my following quickly grew to almost 240K which brings me to why I'm here...
Kickstarter allows me to make something much bigger than I can on my own! The 30 day funding period allows me to create multiple new art products with the best quality possible and offer them to you for a much cheaper price than in my normal shop. The best part about this is that the bigger the campaign gets, the more I get to reward you all through stretch goals! Giving fancy gifts to my supporters is one of my favorite things to do, so I really hope we get there!
I have prepared A LOT of reward options for you all, including even more stretch goal additions!
 FIRST is a better visual list of all pledge tiers available so you can see exactly what you will be getting in the one you choose! This also includes stretch goal extras as they are unlocked. 
PLEASE NOTE the "value in shop" price! This is how much these items would/will cost in my normal shop. Some are only available during the Kickstarter. Basically you won't find deals on my work like this again; I wanted to make my first Kickstarter extra special and worthwhile for my backers <3 
NEXT I have listed the rewards with as much detailed information as possible so you know exactly what each item is, including what you could get if we surpass our main goal! 
*This is the mock-up cover art concept. Cover is being painted with watercolor and ink right now!
Sample Page
My main goal for this project is the "Galaxy Girls" book. It is filled with illustrations of constellations and astrology signs as well as descriptions of the lore behind them. 
Book details:
At least 80 pages with 31 illustrations 
TUTORIAL now unlocked!!
8.5" x 11" 
HARDCOVER now unlocked!!
Shiny holographic cover detailing
Thickest paper available 
Below is a list of illustrations you will find in the book! Some pieces are in the mock-up stage and some are yet to be made. Throughout this campaign I will be working on the last pieces and will update this page as they are finished! 
That's what you are by funding this Kickstarter! Everyone who pledges for a book ($35+) will have their name included in the back under my "Lyfe Supporters," the list of the very important people who brought this book to lyfe...life ;) After the campaign ends, a survey will be sent out for the name and/or @handle you wish to be listed as. If you wish to remain anonymous, that of course is ok as well.
*Real names only please, joke names and inappropriate @handles will not be printed.
*Bookplate mock-up, final art will be more detailed
I am illustrating a limited edition bookplate sticker, about 4"x3", as a collector's item for those who wish to have a signed book! It will come un-stuck so you can place it wherever you'd like.
I am not limiting this tier, so the edition total will be the unique number of signed book backers. However, this bookplate is a Kickstarter Exclusive and will not be available to any one else after the campaign ends!! 
*Examples of what inside cover sketches will look like
These sketches are limited to 50 backers who wish to support everything this campaign has to offer AND get a one of a kind doodle by me inside their book cover! Sketches will be randomized quick portraits and Galaxy Girls themed. 
Every Original Book Art tier will also get a sketch inside their book covers as a thank you for supporting my original work! 
*Please note these are mockups and final design may vary slightly...and be hella more shiny!
Shiny stickers are the best kinds of stickers! I'm making my first ever *holographic* stickers featuring these celestial cuties: fox, rabbit, and the galaxy version of my deer girl! More animals from the book can be unlocked as stickers if we reach certain social media stretch goals. Stickers will be 3-4 inches on their longest side.
*Please note these are mock-ups, final design may vary slightly
I've been drooling over enamel pins for years now, so it is time to finally release some of my own! You will get two pins, the official Galaxy Girl pin and a Lyfe Chameleon pin to celebrate my panther chameleon sidekicks and our brand name. Fun fact, my chameleons have a social media following of their own. It's a little ridiculous: @lyfechameleons
Enamel Pin details:
hard enamel
gold metal
about 1.5" (33mm)
rubber clutches 
include an artistic backing card
*Purchasing only one pin is not available during the Kickstarter. If I am able to order extra, single pins will be available in my shop after for $15 each.
 Is my obsession with shiny things obvious yet? I am releasing a set of my first ever gold and silver foil embellished prints! My specialty 5"x7" prints go for $15 each in my shop, so you are getting quite a deal with these tiers. 
Want to add on items or get more of something? No problem! Just add the desired amount below to your pledge and more will be sent your way. Some of these prices are slightly higher because they include the extra shipping.
Graphic of Stretch Goals coming soon!
I have included some social media goals so everyone can help unlock some more cool stickers! As long as we hit the funding goal, everyone will receive the following when they are unlocked:
500 Retweets - Retweet this link here to unlock the Dragon sticker! ALL tiers will receive this reward!
500 Notes - And why not get Tumblr involved? If this post here gets 500 notes ALL tiers will receive the Pegasus sticker!
500 Shares - If this Facebook post here gets 500 shares ALL tiers will receive a Lynx sticker!
30,000 Likes - Ok Instagram, you are my main squeeze. If we get 30k likes on this post here ALL tiers will receive a Chameleon sticker!
Come on guys, let me give you free stickers ;) 
If we surpass the initial $7.5k funding goal, we can unlock these awesome extras:
10k UNLOCKED! - A tutorial will be added to the book! 
12k UNLOCKED! - 5 more 5"x7" holographic prints will be added to the set! Deluxe set will now have 20! 
15k UNLOCKED! - 5 more 5"x7" silver embellished prints will be added to the set! Deluxe set will now have 25!
18k UNLOCKED! - 6 more 5"x7" gold embellished prints will be added to the set! Deluxe set will now have the complete series of 31!
22k UNLOCKED! - A third enamel pin with be unlocked and sent to ALL pledges over $20! 
25k UNLOCKED! - The book will become a hardcover! 
35K UNLOCKED! - A Kickstarter exclusive bookmark will be unlocked and sent to ALL pledges with a book!
50K UNLOCKED! - A print of the cover will be unlocked and sent to ALL PLEDGES! 5"x7" for all pledges without a book and 8.5"x11" for all pledges with a book. 
70K - I will now be able to make a T-SHIRT!!! This will most likely be a screen printed black uni-sex tee with the Libra design and stars. It will be available as an extra add on for all tiers, and free to all EVERYTHING tiers (tiers 11-14)
80K - All social media stickers, Dragon, Pegasus, Lynx, Chameleon, and a *mystery* sticker, will now be unlocked without having to reach specific like/retweet/share goals and sent to ALL PLEDGES!
??? - We've hit so many goals so fast I am working on more! Suggestions welcome :) 
 Let's be real, shipping costs can be a pain, especially for my international supporters. Books with nice thick paper are heavy, and packaging them securely just adds on more. Unfortunately, I cannot get around the price of shipping, but I can assure you your package will be packed with love by *me!* 
Domestic Backers: I refuse to send you your package media mail as it has a much higher chance of getting damaged! Therefore all tiers will include tracking except the sticker only tier.
International Backers: I will include tracking whenever possible, but some international tiers may not include tracking past the U.S. to alleviate some extra cost. If you wish to add tracking on international orders please email me: lyfeillustration@gmail.com
Please know I do not make any money off of shipping, and in some cases, I lose a bit. 
As my main goal is making high quality art products, I will not rush production if it will lose quality. I have given myself a time cushion by giving an estimate ship date in April 2019, but they may arrive and ship sooner. I will keep you all updated on the process and status of production on here and my social media as often as possible!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This may be my first Kickstarter, but it is by no means my first "pre-order" type of project! I have over 3 years experience of producing quality products, selling my work online, and shipping all over the world. I am confident this will help me provide you with the best rewards on time!

That being said, with no previous Kickstarter to gauge how many backers I may receive, I could have more on my plate than anticipated. I have given myself a time cushion, and will update you along the way if any delays come up!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: My New Astrology Kickstarter Ends TOMORROW!

updates.update_content:
Hello lovely people! 
As some of you may have noticed...
Packages have begun to ship out!!!

Hello my friends!! It is almost time to ship your rewards!!!
Thank you all SO much for your patience the last few months! I have quite literally been working non-stop creating the book, prints, and allllll the fun extras while preparing to ship them all out! The books look AMAZING and I will be posting them as soon as I can! There have been a few set backs in other areas like stickers and.......taxes......., but nothing that will affect your rewards. All is being fixed to look perfect right now :) and I plan to make a video on the entire experience once everything is sent out. This journey has been more work than I ever imagined haha but an over all incredible experience. THANK YOU!

updates.update_userinfo: One More Note on Adding Items Through My Shop! (sorry!)
updates.update_content:
Just letting you know my shop is now live!!
To those of you who got the glitch where the silver print pack was shown as free, I had to cancel your orders. I'm so sorry for the inconvenience!!! It is fixed now and you can still use the free shipping code! HUGE thank you to those who pointed it out <3
Thank you for your patience while I work out the bugs on this new platform!

updates.update_userinfo: Shop is now LIVE! Error Updated
updates.update_content:
Happy New Year Everyone!
My apologies for the radio silence on my end! As a perfectionist, I spent many all nighters during the holidays working on the book until it was...perfect! I am happy to announce it is currently at the printers being made! Wooo! I was able to add many name changes in the Lyfe Supporter section for those who missed the deadline a bit :]  I also added a few special touches to the cover like making the holographic areas debossed (lowered) and adding an anti-scratch/fingerprint coating.

updates.update_userinfo: New Shop Opening with Exclusives for My Backers!!
updates.update_content:
Hi again everyone!

For those who pledged for a book, this the last chance to respond to the backer survey in time to specify what name you want listed on my Lyfe Supporter page! 
Again, my apologies for the delay in responding to messages! The book files need to be in by the 20th and I only have time to focus on that right now. Expect lots of updates after :)

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year! - Project Progress Update
updates.update_content:
Quick little update!
Surveys are being sent right now, so be sure to fill them out asap! Especially if you want a specific name in the "Lyfe Supporter" section of the book!! I need those by December 14th.
If you ordered a t-shirt, or it comes in your reward tier (11-14), or even if you might want to pre-order one later, here is a size chart for the shirts I plan to print on:

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CHANCE to List Your Name!
updates.update_content:
From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU!!!!
I can't tell you all how honored I am to have 1,031 backers for my Galaxy Girls project!! Each and every one of you has changed my entire career as an artist in just one month! I could not be more excited to produce all these rewards and get them in your hands!
What's Next?

campaign.story:
♦️♦️♦️ Information ♦️♦️♦️
approx. 1.75in metal pins
hard enamel 
double clutch
rose gold finish 
glow-in-the-dark in the 'whispy-spirit' area, not in the bones.
In the mock-up art, the image behind the main form is meant to represent what it may look like in the dark with its glow effect. Colors and intensity may vary in final product, but the pin itself will attempt to be as close as possible to the design.
 RECENTLY UNLOCKED - ASTRAL VARIANTS (Please read below).
Astral Variant pins are $12, or $10 for a random one. The designs are the same 9 as the Spirit pins. The metal plating is rainbow metal, and instead of glow, we have dark blue glitter. This pin is soft enamel.  If you back at these levels and want 'more', please add the appropriate amount . I have added a Random Astral Pin reward and a 1 Astral Pin reward. If you have already pledged, you may modify your pledge for the additional amount. (Example: You backed at 3 pins, but want to add 2 Astral, add the $24 to the pledge difference, or, for example, you backed at 3 pins but now want one to be Astral, then add the difference - in this case, $2 to your pledge!) I will have a list on the survey as to what the additional pins you pledged for!
Here is an example of rainbow plating I had done in the past. As a note, the orange/yellow were not very prevalent. I'm not sure if this is the case in most rainbow plating runs or if it also depends on the surface area.
I encourage you to look up 'rainbow metal/plating' on pins if you are still not sure of what it may look like, and look for more line detail oriented pins.
Thank you.

updates.update_userinfo: All rewards sent + NEW RPG KIT PINS KICKSTARTER
updates.update_content: Thank you all for backing this project. The final stragglers have been sent out. Thus, I am proud to announce my newest Kickstarter, which I've been working hard on for the past several months:

Most of the stateside (constituting a little over a half of the backer rewards) were shipped end of last week and some of you may be receiving them already.  Most being those that didn't have any question or additions to them.
From here I'll be working on sorting out invoices for those that added on, contacting where needed, and the whole overseas lot are yet to be sorted through since I have to basically sit and itemize forever on those customs forms :)

I seem to be unable to take a decent picture to save my life so I'm including a video. I think for the future I'll need to invest in a good lighting rig.  Lighting truly matters with pins and these do look pretty darn awesome. Most of the rainbow pins turned out on the purple or teal spectrum. I am also super impressed with how bright the Spirit pins glow, when charged up, even being visible in a lit space.

So I'm going to be at MFF (Midwest Furfest) this weekend. My Pins are currently being shipped to that location too (along with other ones I've ordered) and will hopefully make it in on time. This means that I will attempt my best to check the pins over (reserving the best for backers) and also have them available there. When I get back mid next week, I will be sending out any invoices and starting the packaging/shipping process - so long as there are no issues.
I hope the pins turned out and that they will be liked. I have yet to see them myself and will take pictures, but most likely will have limited access to get into Kickstarter and figure out how to show them - so it may be a 'when I get back' type of deal.
Backing cards ordered, Sticker ordered, and Surveys sent!

What is next/what is happening?
A glimpse into the back-end of running of a Kickstarter.
*
Kickstarter takes about 14 days to collect, clear and transfer the funds.

updates.update_content: We are so close to 8k (within $100 as of posting this) and the freebie sticker for physical tiers. Therefore ---- *drumroll*

I'm quite taken aback that the 8k mark is something within potentially being realized before this campaign is over. For those that are new backers or missed the prior update, I suggest you read my prior update on Spirit v. Astral and the price difference/how to edit your pledges.
I'm currently gearing up and working with the company I'm going to be using to work on the art for these ahead of funding so I have a leg up on getting these out for the holidays.

campaign.story:
Each of us belongs to at least one race, and that's complicated enough but... what happens when you have more than one? 
How would you fill out your census if you were a Mestizo person in Peru? How would you do your hair if you were both Black and Asian? What would it be like to be both human and alien, meeting another member of your own species for the first time in space? Or to be a young girl who finds that she can move between the human and celestial realms of Judaic lore? And what do all of these stories have in common?  
Electrum is an alloy formed by mixing the elements of gold and silver, and mixed-race people are just as precious! We are overjoyed to bring you our newest anthology Electrum: 26 brand-new fiction and non-fiction comics that explore the joy, the insecurities, and the unique strengths that come with being mixed-race from the perspective of dozens of artists from all around the world.  
from "Mestizo" by Alberto Rayo & Diego Revelo and "Rose Metal" by Iasmin Omar Ata
Over a year in the making, Electrum is the first-ever comics anthology entirely produced and created by mixed-race artists. In this book, you'll hear our own voices in a variety of art styles and genres, from fantasy to history, from science fiction to autobiography, and much more. 
from "Coils" by Georgia Henderson and "Chameleon" by Veronica Agarwal
These stories don't shy away from difficult subjects. You'll be reading about origins and celebrations, but also internalized fears, racism and insecurities. But each and every story in this volume illustrates the way we've learned to draw strength from our challenges, and how we choose to embrace our bright future. 
from "Bobby and Jules" by Kam Mars Heyward and "Angel's Daughter" by Tzor Edery
 We are so proud to bring you all of these stories... and more!  
In addition to the book, you can pick up some great rewards, including a bookplate dedicated to the recipient of the book, a double-plated enamel pin celebrating the mixed-race identity, and even a limited number of sketches and custom art from your favorite contributors.
At the ◈ FLYING HIGH ◈  tier you'll receive an original 5x7 drawing from one of our contributing artists (including Der-shing Helmer, Georgia Henderson, Julia Hutchinson, Iasmin Omar Ata, Lara Kim, Yến Quach and Charlene Soto), or you can choose one of our special custom commissions from the very limited ◈ COMMISSION TIER ◈ options. We may be adding extra artists to the commission tiers as the campaign progresses, so be sure to check back!
Veronica's gouache icon's are soft and sweet, just like you! These icons work great for professional profiles, social media pages, and personal use!
See more of Veronica's work here
Hi, I'm Georgia and I like drawing cute, tough girls of color, and mixed families! I'm the author of Coils, which is about a cyborg girl who learns learns to embrace her very human hair. Thank you for supporting Alloy: Electrum, and please let me draw you some cute kiddos!
 See more of Georgia's work here
If you would like a cute and fun commission with Art Nouveau inspiration, you can choose me!
 See more of Shadia's work here
Kiku has contributed to the Beyond and Elements Anthologies and has an upcoming graphic novel from First Second.
See more of Kiku's work here
I love the challenge of expressing just the right moment and feeling in an illustration. Let's make some magic! ✨
See more of Yến's work here
Cheery colors and cute designs are what I live for. I'd love to share that happiness with you. Thank you for your support in backing this beautiful project with us.
 See more of Charlene's work here
I don't do commissions very often, but when I do it's so I can help fund all ages mixed-race comic anthologies~
See more of Der-shing's work here
All of these commissions are for SFW subjects only. If you have specific questions about any of these tiers, just PM us and we'll get back to you!
As we go, we will also unlock upgrades and improvements to everyone's books. You don't need to do anything to collect these... as the campaign reaches new milestones, your book automatically becomes higher quality!
from "You Were Never Lost" by Little Corvus and "Hair" by Kiana Khansmith
When you support this campaign, you also directly support our team of artists. Increased funding unlocks the following page bonus goals, with no upper limits!
     ◈$35,000- each team earns an extra $5.00 per page
     ◈$40,000- each team earns an extra $10.00 per page
     ◈$45,000- each team earns an extra $15.00 per page
     ◈... who knows how far we can go when we work together?
from "Cloud Walker" by Kelly Bull
Electrum is for everyone. While the primary purpose of the book is to inspire and celebrate mixed-race readers of all ages, we also intended Electrum to be shared with the friends and family of mixed-race people, and all comic lovers regardless of background. We are an inclusive anthology that uplifts our voices without silencing others.
from "Captain's Log" by Sam Wade
Many of us who pursue relationships beyond the bounds of our own race may also have (or be planning to have) children who combine the qualities of both parents! We live in a multicultural world, and this book will help build empathy and guide non-mixed readers to understand our diverse and growing demographic.   
The artists of Electrum are among the best artists working today. We come from countries all around the world and from a variety of races, religions, genders and occupations. We run the gamut from seasoned Eisner and Ignatz award-winners and industry professionals to first-time contributors. What binds us together is our love of comics and our passion for sharing our stories with readers old and new!
Find out more about our stories at our Twitter, via updates to this campaign, or via the links below~ 
 ◈ Alberto Rayo & Diego Revelo ◈ M Cat White ◈ Charlene Soto & Kelsey Soto ◈ Georgia Henderson ◈ Hinahina Gray ◈ Iasmin Omar Ata ◈ Jem Yoshioka ◈ Jordan Alsaqa & Jenna Yow ◈ Julia Hutchinson ◈ Kam Mars Heyward ◈ Kelly Bull ◈ Kiana Khansmith ◈ Moe Espinoza ◈ MOM ◈ Sam Wade ◈ Little Corvus ◈ Lara Kim & Sara Lee ◈ Shadia Amin ◈ Sloane Leong ◈ Tajliya Jamal ◈ Tess Stone ◈ Tzor Edery ◈ Veronica Agarwal ◈ Yến Quach ◈ Ashanti Forston (bookplate) ◈ Yoshi Yoshitani (cover)◈ Kiku Hughes (editor and contributor) ◈  Der-shing Helmer (editor and contributor) 
The Alloy Anthology aims to explore complicated and intersectional identities through visual storytelling, starting with our first volume, Electrum. We hope to inspire future generations and celebrate the complexities inherent to being human ♥ 
Thanks very much for taking a look at our project! With your help we hope to make this dream a reality. Special thanks to my co-editor Kiku Hughes for her hard work and partnership, to Lucia Retamales for her work on our video (and music credit to "Finale" by Eveningland), to Christina McKenzie (production technician) and Rhiannon R. S. (prepress technician) for their hopeful future work on this book, and to Taneka Stotts for support and friendship. 
~Der-shing

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks for the Ignatz nomination, and your consideration at SPX!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
I don't think I mentioned it here, but Electrum was nominated this year for the Ignatz Award, which celebrates comics from small press publishers... that's us!  We are super stoked to be nominated in the category of Outstanding Anthology, which is quite an honor for the very first anthology most of us on the team have worked on... and for the editors, this is the very first time an anthology. As you can imagine, it is exciting times!

campaign.story:
Anna O'Brien had her future set, scratching out a living in the remote hills of southern Appalachia with her new husband at the turn of the 20th century. Now, cast out by tragedy and strange magic, she’s bound to wander the countryside, living by her wits and banishing spirits for her work. But for Anna, some things aren’t so easily settled, and some traditions aren’t so easily forgotten. Dark, ancient things are stirring in the woods, awakened by the war between the states, by the new roads, the belching locomotives and logging cuts. There’s granny witchery and her own roots to learn. If she’s going to survive, she’d better learn them fast...
Anna O’Brien: Ghost Days is an illustrated collection of short stories, with tales of the uncanny that draw from the (often misunderstood) history and folklore of the Southern Appalachians. An enchanted mask that exacts a powerful price; a bank heist that runs afoul of an undead curse; dark things yearning for an even darker savior on a remote hill; and two women tormented by a relentless suitor. 
Born out of a deep love for the southern mountains, Ghost Days is road trip through a world on the brink of massive upheaval and ecological collapse, a world of old traditions and remnant spirits. It's a mix of historical fiction and magical realism, plus a hefty dose of monsters, hags and haints. If you like the work of Mike Mignola, Andrzej Sapkowski, and Manley Wade Wellman, this is the book for you. 
But you don't have to take our word for it. You can read the first story, Wampus Mask, for free right here!
We're asking for $7,000 to make a physical book!
The manuscript for Anna O'Brien: Ghost Days is already written, and the art is already done. Should we make our goal, we will deliver unto you an 8" x 5.5" (22 cm x 28 cm) perfect bound book, with black and white interiors. It will have eight stories  and nine gorgeous interior illustrations, comprising about 52,000 words and around 250 pages. 
Here's an early mockup of the cover! 
And one of Tiffany's interior illustrations, from the story Night on the Bald.
In addition to digital and physical copies of the book, we're offering a number of rewards! These include digital extras like research notes, author commentary and tutorial videos.  But what about physical rewards, you ask? 
But that's not all! We're also offering a limited number of hardcovers, plus two collectible, hand-annotated editions at $800, which will never be available again!
We got ‘em! At $7,500 we’ll add a process section in the back, including a sketchbook portion from Tiffany and folklore and research notes from Asher.  This is a feature we've seen in comics, and we feel it would be neat to have something similar in a fiction collection. [UNLOCKED!]
At $10,000, some of Asher's original design sketches (which you can see in the backer updates!) will be added to the already unlocked sketchbook portion of the book! [UNLOCKED!]
If we crack to $11,500, then we’ll produce a print run of 500 books through PrintNinja, which will be sold in bookstores and on Amazon, given to libraries, and released out into the world! [UNLOCKED!]
If we get to $12,500, Tiffany will produce five new interior illustrations for the book, giving you even more spooky bang for your buck! [UNLOCKED!]
And if we reach $14,000, we’ll upgrade the print run to 500 hardcovers, which means everybody who’s pledged at the paperback level will get a hardcover book! (These books will only be signed if you’ve pledged above the 75$ tier.) [UNLOCKED!]
If we reached $16,500, K Stellar Dutcher of the indie folk band The Seventh String will write, record and release an Anna O'Brien single! [UNLOCKED!]
Asher Elbein is a journalist and short fiction writer based in Austin, Texas. He began writing fiction in high school, briefly set it aside to focus on narrative journalism, and now makes time in his life for both. His work has previously appeared in The New York Times, The Texas Observer, The Atlantic, Bitter Southerner, Oxford American, and Audubon. He likes hats, folk music, wandering back roads and wild places, looking for snakes and listening to stories. You can visit his website at www.asherelbein.com
Tiffany Turrill is an illustrator, concept artist, and ex-Texan based in the San Francisco Bay area. She works in publishing and games, and has created pictures for the likes of DC Comics, Fantasy Flight Games, and Disney Interactive. She’s designed horrifying monsters for a Star Wars game no one will ever see, illustrated two very sweet children’s picture books, and enjoys creating toothy monstrosities on her spare time. You can visit her website at www.tiffanyturrill.com
Gretchen Felker-Martin is a writer and film critic. Her work has appeared on Polygon, Ignota, and VRV as well as in the comics anthology Mirror Mirror 2. She is the author of No End Will Be Found, a horror novella about the witch trials of Wurzburg, and writes the weekly film column In the Flesh for the VRV Blog. Born in backwoods New Hampshire, she now lives with friends and her cat in Massachusetts. 
Good question! You pledge a certain amount to back this project. If you back at certain funding levels, you get rewards. If the project is funded, we get to make the book, and you get it as well as that sweet, sweet merchandise. If we don’t make our goal, you won’t be charged! Not a penny. 
 In the interest of transparency--and to explain why we’ve set a high funding goal--We’ve worked out the costs for the goal as follows: 
$1,800 for Tiffany’s art;
$400 for editing by the fantastic Gretchen Felker-Martin;
$1200 for book design; 
$1000 for pin/patch/sticker designs and production
$1500 for print-on-demand to match backer levels;
$1200 (to account for unanticipated costs and Amazon/Kickstarter’s cut) 
We’ll be utilizing print-on-demand through Ingram and MakeThatThing for fulfillment services. Both come highly recommended and have a proven track record for producing products and getting them out on time.
 We hope to have a finished book by February at the latest, and all physical rewards--pins, prints, original art--will ship with the book. Digital rewards, including ebooks, should ship by December.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is our first kickstarter, we’ve taken every opportunity to minimize risk. The manuscript is written and edited; the art is done. We just need your help to make sure everyone gets paid for their time, and to make sure we can hire the designer and print the book! 

Any snags, obstacles, or delays will be promptly addressed, and Asher will be in constant communication to update backers and insure that the rewards are delivered on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hey, friends and backers! It's been almost a year since Tiffany and I ran this Kickstarter campaign, and we're endlessly grateful that you guys helped make Ghost Days a reality. To celebrate the anniversary—and because we thought it'd be fun—we're really excited to release a new 15,000 word Anna O'Brien novella, In The Snow, The Jungle, complete with four incredible new illustrations from Tiffany! (Those of you who backed at the level of an extra story pack got to read an earlier version of the story: it has been substantially rewritten and expanded.)

Hey, everybody! I'm super proud to announce that Ghost Days rewards have shipped! If you ordered a physical reward, it should be winging its way to you via the magic of interstate and intercontinental shipping.

Just got word that the books are 5-7 business days away from the fulfillment center, so it's time to figure out where to send them! You all should have received an email asking you for your shipping information, so please fill that out as soon as possible so there's no delay in getting you your physical rewards. Again, we're hoping to have everything physical shipped by mid-April. (You may have to take some time out of Infinity War-ing and Thrones-gaming to read it, but Tiffany and I are pretty confident it's worth your time.) As for non-physical rewards, Tiffany is in the homestretch on videos for the Artist pack, so keep an eye out! Stellar is likewise plugging away at the song, and should hopefully have that done by mid-April or so.

updates.update_userinfo: Books are finished printing! Timing updates! A lovely review!
updates.update_content: Hey, y'all! Dropping in to let y'all know that the books have been printed, and are currently making their way across the ocean from PrintNinja's facilities China. (It turns out that the phrase "a slow boat to China" describes basically every boat to China. It's far away.) All of which means that the books should be arriving at the fulfillment center at the beginning of April, and will be promptly sent out then. Backer surveys go out in late-March, so please fill those out as promptly as possible when you get them! Otherwise we can't mail the books out.

updates.update_userinfo: Updated e-books and other status updates!
updates.update_content: Hey, everybody! Just want to give everyone a quick status update. We're in the proofing process for the book, which means that I've sent in the digital files to PrintNinja, and now we're sorting out any issues before the books go to press and it's too late. On the docket are a few formatting issues and making sure the artwork looks as good as humanly possible.

Just a quick one today! Most of the digital rewards are getting emailed out on Friday, December 28th. (That's tomorrow!) That means some of you will be getting the Folklore Pack, and basically all of you will be getting an eBook. Tiffany assures me she'll have the videos done before the New Year, so expect those this weekend.

In the meantime, here's a sneak peak of a special piece of art done by fantastic artist and dear friend Annie Lewis, for "In the Snow, the Jungle," the 12,000 word novella included in the Folklore Pack. It's a tale of murder, guilt, ghosts, and a strange forest atop a mountain, where snow falls as rain that patters and drips along jungle leaves...

Hey, gang! We're hard at work on getting the digital edition of Ghost Days out, as well as all of the bonus content for backers! So in the interest of transparency--and because we've got some killer new art to share--here's where we're at!

Money! With everyone involved having been paid, we're now sitting at $13,240, which is well within our budget for printing and other expenses. 

A timeline! Gretchen will have a final edit ready by tomorrow evening, which means I'll have the final text off to Emily, who's been working hard on the final book design. (I've just bought ISBN numbers and sorted out the Library of Congress number, as well as writing up the acknowledgements and afterward.) That means we'll have the  Our goal is to have all ebooks and digital rewards finished by , give or take a few days. So everybody who backed us will be getting a nice Christmas gift!

Since we're printing overseas, we're racing against a bit of a deadline: Chinese New Year runs from January 27-February 14th, and the printing presses at PrintNinja shut down during that time. It'll take them three weeks to turn around a hardcover book or so. So we're aiming to and the
With regards to final delivery estimates, it generally takes six to eight weeks for the books to ship, which means that the I'm really sorry about this--chalk it up to inexperience on my part when it comes to dealing with printers (and the fact that China really is remarkably far away, yikes.) We hope you guys enjoy the digital rewards and ebook while you wait! 

Finally, has delivered some killer new interior spots for the first and last stories in the book! Just two more pieces of art to go.

Happy Thanksgiving, folks! Just a short one today. Tiffany has returned from her Dallas sojourn and is working on the new illustrations. Those are still on track to be finished in early December. In the meantime, she's got this to share: an early sketch of Anna O'Brien wandering across a logged-out slope, for the story The Revenant Score.

campaign.story:
My name is Evan! I've been creating and self-publishing fantasy-adventure comics online and in print since 2006. For the past eight years, I've been working primarily on Vattu, an enormous graphic novel series about a girl captured by an empire.
I'm running this Kickstarter to finally print the THIRD collection of this story, containing almost 400 pages of the comic. All of the contents of this book are finished; all that's left to do is get the books printed. This Kickstarter is the place to preorder the third book of Vattu, or get the entire series so far. Thank you for helping make this possible!
Vattu is an expansive fantasy adventure comic, and is the third graphic novel set in a world of strange creatures called Overside. Vattu is a girl from a nomadic society who is caught in the middle of a clash of cultures with the conquering Empire of Sahta. In the first two books, Vattu is taken from the idyllic grassland of the Fluters, and must find her way through a new world of zealous conquerors, and the many peoples incorporated into their Empire: mute, monstrous slave-soldiers from across the sea; chemist-priestesses who manufacture an addictive drug; and amphibian people called Grish who struggle for a foothold in the capital city of  Sahta.
In the third book, Vattu is taken in by the Emperor of Sahta and begins to see an entirely different perspective on the Empire and the nature of its power. At the same time, a cunning pirate named Bakrah lands among the Grish, and begins to see how their marginalization and righteous anger can be tools for his own power. Reactive and revolutionary tendencies throughout the city's populations begin to emerge.
The fourth book will be the last book of Vattu.
Each of the books has focused on a particular population within the Empire and its capital city, and a particular angle on Vattu's central concerns of political power and the development of identity within and against it. This is a huge, strange, meditative comic: it is the largest and most complicated thing I can imagine working on as an individual, and I am grateful to my audience for making it possible for me to focus on it.
Vattu is the winner of a 2014 Ignatz Award. The webcomic version has been running since summer 2010, and first two books have been in print for a few years.
For the duration of this Kickstarter, a free download of the first three books (not including the extra material from the print versions) is available here.
Book 3 of Vattu will be printed in paperback and hardcover versions, to match the first two books (though it has about 25% more pages than either). The paperback edition will have a matte cover and french flaps, with a wordless full-bleed image on the front cover. The hardcover will have a cover of gray cloth over board, with Vattu's icon printed and debossed on the front, and a ribbon bookmark in red. Hardcovers will have a white partial jacket to match the first books. You can see photos of the previous books here and here to get an idea.
Like the first two, Book 3 will have a "title sequence" of extra art, and an appendix section with several world-internal maps and documents.
The books represent the ideal presentation of the comic, in my opinion: extra content is world-internal and supports the story, and I've tried to present the story in an immersive and beautiful way.
Very few extra things for this Kickstarter! I am prioritizing just getting the book printed. Every book of Vattu ordered through this Kickstarter will include a signed bookplate. Some tiers include the option of a print: this image is meant to be the portrait of Vattu that is painted in the comic itself, and also appears in the appendix of Book 3. No more of these will be printed than are preordered through this Kickstarter.
Copies of my earlier graphic novel Order of Tales are also available through this Kickstarter (in print, online). Order of Tales is an atmospheric adventure story following the last member of a society  of story-collectors, as he becomes involved in a secret conflict  involving a mysterious being made of glass, and thousands of years of  violent history.
The only stretch goal for the project will be a reprint of the paperback version of Vattu Book 2! At $35,000, which is 7K over the initial goal. We're running low on Vattu 2 and I'd like the whole story to be available in print consistently. Whether we meet this goal or not, the previous Vattu books are available through this Kickstarter.
 Working with the printers and fulfilling the rewards will be handled by Make that Thing! They're well-equipped for this and they've helped run a number of big book projects on Kickstarter, including my second book of Vattu, and illustrated Wizard of Oz and Moby-Dick.
The 28,000 USD goal for this project includes an estimated $13,000 to get both versions of Vattu Book 3 and the extras produced, and an additional amount to cover shipping and handling, and Make That Thing!'s fee.
Thank you for reading, and thank you for your support!
- Evan Dahm
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the seventh book I've self-published, and the fourth I've made with Make That Thing. The format is identical to the previous Vattu books. A lot of extra time has been factored in to the estimates here to account for possible holdups in printing, and getting the books shipped to the United States, which always takes a long and unpredictable amount of time.

I'm working with Make That Thing again this time; they'll be talking to the book printer and getting all of the rewards sent to backers and that's something they're good at and have done a lot of!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello!
If you still haven't filled out your "backer survey" to give me your address to receive physical rewards, please do so! You should have received an email about it, and a link to the survey should show up at the top of the page when you're logged in on Kickstarter. Thank you!

Hey this Kickstarter campaign is done and funded! THANK YOU everyone; it is always encouraging and humbling to know people are enjoying what I'm making and want to help make it happen.
Book interiors are almost done being assembled; money from the Kickstarter is available in about two weeks, and then we can go straight into production pretty quickly. I'll post updates here on how that process is going!!

HELLO!
So we hit the stretch goal this past weekend, meaning the paperback version of Vattu Book 2 is being reprinted as a part of this Kickstarter, and I don't have to worry about juggling a limited number of remaining Book 2's between all the reward tiers. This means that every tier including the Book 2 paperback is now unlimited! ALSO, added a tier that's just books 1 and 2.

campaign.story:
UPDATE:
All tiers are officially UNLOCKED!! All backers will be able to choose from any of the 31 pins in the collection!!
Hi there! ( ´ ▽ ` )ﾉ My name is Shirley and I'm a Black and Korean full-time independent artist living in Central California with my 18 year old iguana Ness, and my German Shepherd puppy Eden.
 What started as daily paintings for Inktober of 2017, 야생의신명 or Oracles of the Wild has now transformed into something bigger—my very first art book and a 31 pin collection!
I've now had 14 successful Kickstarter campaigns (including the original campaign that started the enamel pin Kickstarter trend) and for my 15th I've decided to dream big and put together this kaiju of a campaign!
Here's a compilation of my previous campaigns! ( ´ ▽ ` )
There are 31 pins total in this collection!
Main funding will be for the 6 designs that are part of the 하늘의( HEAVENLY ) mask set, along with the risograph art book.
The other 25 pin designs are stretch goals that backers will be able to order if unlocked!
Pin Specs:
1.25 x 1.25 inches
Gold metal
Hard enamel
Screen-printed details
Double backing posts
Rubber clutches
Cover Design
야생의신명 or Oracles of the Wild is a 5.25” x 6.5”, 38 page risograph* art book that will be printed by Risolve Studios on Mohawk Via Vellum paper with black and metallic gold.
*Risograph is a type of printmaking method! Risograph gives you that handmade DIY aesthetic (similar to silk screen-printing) but with the efficiency of a machine.
Each page will feature one mask, their bestowed name, and a short description of the qualities and spirit that embodies the mask.
Funding is for 100 of each of the 6 pins in the 하늘의 ( HEAVENLY ) mask set, and a print run of 50 art books. However, more will be printed if needed for this first edition.
Risograph printing costs: $678.15
Pins: $1347.00
Pin backing cards: $244.00
Shipping: $424.00
Kickstarter fees: $135.00
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my 15th!! Kickstarter campaign so I'm rather seasoned when it comes to running a campaign, fulfilling rewards, and working with manufacturers. ٩(ˊᗜˋ*)و

I will warn that we may run into some delays in regards to pin manufacturing.
This past year we've had some issues regarding quality which ends up causing minor delays. But in the end, I've always been able to get the quality of product I want.
Pin quality issues have been happening much more frequently I feel that it's now appropriate to mention delays may happen, and should be expected, as a precaution.

These pins are also going to be using an additional screen printing technique which I've never tried before! So we may run into some quality issues on that front as well. But again, my manufacturer has always been faithful when it comes to helping me get the high quality I expect when something goes wrong.

I heavily pride myself in making sure I stay upfront and transparent when it comes to communicating with my backers. I like to keep everyone in the loop in regards to whatever's going on, including when we may run into issues. And I've got a wonderful track record on ensuring backers get their rewards in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Only a few hours left - Last chance to get these free gifts with your copy of the book!
The Enchanted Forest team are a group of 14 fantasy artists and illustrators from all over the world, gathered by myself (Jodie), also a practicing artist! Tired of seeing generic and uninspiring 'how to' art books in stores, I've decided to publish my own - an A4 size thread-sewn softback filled with a wonderful variety of fantasy art and a comprehensive selection of tutorials! My end goal is to create a book that will inspire artists and art lovers alike!
Inside The Enchanted Forest you'll find over 130 pages of traditional and digital art; featuring woodland elves, witches, mermaids and other high fantasy beings! In addition, there are 28 pages of exclusive tutorials covering a variety of topics from digital painting, copic marker and traditional media to illustration prep, colour theory and much more!
 Prototypes of the The Enchanted Forest have already been printed - we now need your help to fund a full run of books!
 Each artist has an 8-page section of the book, which includes a collection of illustrations, their exclusive Enchanted Forest images and a 2-page art tutorial.
For everyone interested in the art-making process, we've lovingly put together 14 unique art tutorials from our featured artists: these tutorials have been written especially for the book and can't be found anywhere else! Take a look at some highlights:
In their Enchanted Forest tutorial, Eli Baum highlights the many ways you can use color theory to enhance your images, draw attention to certain aspects and tell a story with your art!
Have you ever wondered how digital illustrators create such crisp, perfect images without using line art? Viv Tanner walks you through the process from start to finish, with tips on how to apply color gradients, flats and texture.
In this wonderful traditional media tutorial, Miss Etoile walks you through the creation of one of her beautfiul Copic Marker & gouache illustrations. Learn how to prepare your sketch, transfer it to art board and complete it!
Learn how to complete a traditional painting in ink, watercolor and marker - Nati's tutorial contains a full list of her favorite tools and tips on how to use them!
Anndr reveals her top digital painting tips to help speed up your creation process, adjust colors effectively and use Photoshop's tools to create great special effects!
 Using your own 3D models as reference can save a lot of time! In this tutorial, Cashile details her creative process from start to finish, and how to set up reference models of your own using free software.
Exclusively for Kickstarter, all of our reward tiers include a downloadable PDF copy of all 14 tutorials, so you can read them on your phone, tablet or PC! Not only that, there are three unique videos showing the creation process of various illustrations from start to finish, so you can watch and learn how our artists create their works!
To celebrate the launch of the book our artists have designed a beautiful collection of Gold Foil prints! These will be printed on heavyweight stock, finished with delicate gold hot foil stamping and presented in a custom card case. The full set is available in the Deluxe Tier alongside a whole range of other art goodies!
In addition, this stunning variant of our cover art by ELK64 will be produced as a Holofoil Art Print and will be included free in all book pledges as a bonus 'thank you!' to our backers! This special print will have a magical rainbow holographic foil effect on highlighted areas~
If you'd like a range of wonderful art goodies with your book, you can also pledge for a Deluxe tier! This special Limited Edition book set contains over 30 different art prints in various sizes, a signed copy of The Enchanted Forest and a full set of gold foil prints - all presented in a beautiful foil-stamped gift box. Each box is signed and numbered by the author and is exclusive to Kickstarter!
Please note the A4 Art Prints and Art Postcard sets will not be available to other tiers in the Add-On Store - these are exclusive to the Deluxe Book Bundle!
We have a variety of rewards to choose from - whether you'd just like to donate or would like a copy of the new book, take a look at what we have on offer!
If we can hit our initial target, a whole range of exciting goodies will be available at certain milestones! All stretch goal bonuses are added to the campaign completely free of charge, so please spread the word as much as you can to ensure everyone gets the most out of their pledges!
After the Kickstarter has ended, book tier backers will be able to add extras to their pledge via the add-on store. Here you can add upgrades and extras such as:
Extra copies of The Enchanted Forest
Extra Deluxe Book Bundle sets
Upgraded shipping (tracking)
Copies of our last book 'Threads'
Gold Foil Print sets
Enamel Pin sets
Items from the add-on store will also be upgraded depending on your initial pledge - so for example if you have a Golden Early Bird tier and wish to add extra books, these extra books will also come with the Gold Foil prints and other Kickstarter items.
How do I pledge...?
Thanks so much for your support! Simply choose your reward on the right and enter the total you'd like to pledge. Please note, Kickstarter will not take payment until the end of the campaign, and you can always change your pledge later if you need to!
Shipping & Tracking
The shipping rates above are for standard Airmail and do not include tracking, which allows you to see the journey of your package online. You can upgrade your pledge to include tracking after the campaign has ended via the add-on store.
Shipping Schedule
Our book is 100% ready to go! As soon as the funds are recieved, we will go into full production. The estimated shipping time is November / December 2018: Delays are possible, but we've streamlined the production process so any delays will be minor at best!
Did you enjoy our last project: 'Threads: Fashion Artbook'?
With the help of our Backers, in 2015 we brought our fashion-themed artbook 'Threads' to life and shared it with the world - it has been sold in multiple countries since publishing and we've had nothing but positive feedback from our buyers! We hope The Enchanted Forest will delight fans of Threads in the same way, but with a brand new theme, new artists, new tutorials and an exciting range of Kickstarter-exclusive goodies!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To avoid any delays, we've made sure the book is 100% complete, we've already printed sample copies, and have the bonus goodies all set up and ready to order! So, the entire project is ready to go as soon as we have the funding. 

All we need is your help to get the ball rolling! Thanks so much for your support~
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Mock-up! It'll look a lot like this, but maybe a tiny bit different!
Gawki is making a book! At 12 x 9 inches, it is a fully colored artbook filled to the brim with her entire collection of personal digital artworks! Featured within its confines are surreal worlds, character designs, stories behind the pieces, and even commentary about her art process.   
Jump on the Kickstarter and you will be able to get some exclusive goodies with the book! Gawki has not taken on commissions in a really long time (a few years even), and honestly who knows when you could get another chance! 
The book includes 144 pages of:
Full illustrations + close-ups
Character and creature designs
Stories and themes behind the artworks
Art processes from start to finish
Coloring tips
Sketches
Hidden frogs throughout the book!
The physical book is automatically going to have all the enhanced features right off the bat, so all you cool cats know you will have the best version it can be! We're skipping paperback all together, and going for all the neat specs you see above! 
Since the physical book is already max cool, all the stretch goals will be bonus goodies! This is for those who pledge for the physical items only! 
Custom Packaging: Instead of the book being shipped in a plain, old box, Gawki will create a custom box that features her art on it!
Extra Postcard: Wowie! Everyone gets a postcard! If you're already getting one, guess what?! You get a bonus postcard featuring freshly made artwork created JUST for this kickstarter campaign! 
Stickers: Everyone gets stickers! They will be exclusive designs made for this kickstarter, so this will be the only time you can get your mitts on 'em!
Fancy Slipcase: The hardcover is already strong, but now get a +3 buff stat with a fancy slipcase! Only books ordered over kickstarter will receive this!
Exclusive enamel pin of a unicorn that will never, ever be sold online.
Precious limited postcard print of everyone's favorite good boys: FROGS! It will also have a little hand-written thank you on the back!
Random sketch will be an original drawing. It will either be pencil or ink!
Commission! Any medium (or mix of mediums) of your preference! Gawki typically only works in pencils, ink, or digital though! Please contact her as soon as you claim this slot to make sure what you want drawn is possible!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is my very first kickstarter, I'm working with a rad company that's experienced with printing many other successful books! Also, I'm so very lucky to have wonderful (and dependable) friends that have successfully kickstarted their own books in the past. While most campaigns are run by several people, I am just one person-- but if anything happened everyone will be updated on what's going on! I'm putting my whole heart into this project, and I hope it shows! There is nothin' out there that I think can stop me from making this happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
