updates.update_content:
Everyone should have links in their messages for the downloads. I will go through the Backer Reports tonight and send additional emails to people who requested them. I have tested all the download links and they are all functional. Should you have any issues with them, please let me know as soon as possible. 

We CAN'T WAIT to see what kind of art you all make from these amazing images. ♥

Hello all! Blue sent the links for the second day of shooting over this morning so I'm in the process of downloading those now. 
We have over 1100 poses from across the two days. Once everything is organized, I will be making new ZIPs to send out to backers at all tiers. Stay tuned!! I am hoping to get them all sent today!! ♥

Filling you all in that our editing is about half done. Commissioners all have their images and Blue is working on the second day of the shoot now. I anticipate having all the rewards out to you in the upcoming weeks! Let me know if you have any questions in the meantime. 

Meanwhile, here's a video we took during the shoot!

The editing of over 1000 photos is currently underway! YAY! We're not sure how many will be in the final download ZIP(s), but safe to say, we made a LOT of pose references! :D

Stay tuned for download info coming as soon as it can. Massive thanks to Blue, our photographer, who's working on ALL the post work. ♥
Come hang out with us! https://youtu.be/PpjDS_zpbEk
Hey! We're heading to FL today! YAY! Shoot starts tomorrow 10AM.

campaign.story:
...but Dr Michael Fisher, a disgraced planetary geologist living on Mars, has never felt more isolated. The situation worsens when both he and Dr Bex Egunsola, the station's newest biologist, accidentally break through the floor of an unstable lava tube into an ancient subterranean world... and they are not alone.
Is this purgatorial abyss a prison or a sanctuary? Genuine or constructed? How thin runs the line between life and death? And is there a chance for the fallen to return to the world of the living?
Join two imperfect humans and their otherworldly companions as they fight for survival and freedom from the internal sea of Mars.
ᵀʰᶦˢ ᶦˢ ᵃ ᶜᵒᵐᶦᶜ ᶠᵒʳ ᵐᵃᵗᵘʳᵉ ᵐᶦⁿᵈᵉᵈ ʳᵉᵃᵈᵉʳˢ. ᴾˡᵉᵃˢᵉ ˢᵉᵉ ᵐʸ ᵃᵇᵒᵘᵗ ᵖᵃᵍᵉ ᶠᵒʳ ᵐᵒʳᵉ ᶜᵒⁿᵗᵉⁿᵗ ᶦⁿᶠᵒʳᵐᵃᵗᶦᵒⁿ
Mare Internum is an award-winning subterranean science-fiction comic which explores the horror of isolation and the power of perseverance in the underworld of Mars. The comic will conclude in April 2018, and is conceived, written and illustrated by me, Der-shing Helmer, the Ignatz-award winning artist of The Meek.
This Kickstarter campaign brings the complete 270+ page full-color story to life in beautiful print form for the first time, in both softcover and Limited Edition hardcover.
wrow! Thanks to overwhelming response, the number of available hardcovers has been increased :]
As usual, my number one goal is to make a beautiful and durable book with a ton of unlockable upgrades which will be automatically added to your edition as the campaign progresses.
How will this version differ from the online comic? Well, the print and PDF editions contain entirely new pages, edits and improvements to the art and writing, and "one year later" illustrations to lend a sense of closure to the characters and story, and an afterword. These additions are limited to the Kickstartered editions only, and will never be shared or posted online.
extra content + all the pages you know and love (except, you know, edited)
Mare Internum is a labor of love, and from the very beginning has been a creator-owned comic funded by its dedicated readers. Your pledge supports a high-quality, independently produced book created with immense pride and personal attention to each step of the process.
To celebrate my first complete self-published book, I'm also offering several rewards:
COLLECTOR'S PIN: I am once again teaming up with the incredible Maya-styled artist MonaRobot (Tumblr | Patreon) to create the PROCESSOR, a sister pin to her incredible limited KALLAKORE design from the Friends in Dark Places Kickstarter campaign.
Just like the first pin, this pin will be stamped, numbered, and will come mounted on a breathtaking metallic backing card. And as with the first pin, the PROCESSOR pin is limited to just 150 copies which will never be reprinted [EDIT:Due to me being an idiot who lowballed the interest in this pin, I'm increasing this number to ~300 pins (and Mona is receiving a bonus)! The lower your backer number, the lower the backstamp number on the pin you receive]. Check out our previous collector's pin below:
DIGITAL COMICS: I've hired none other than Abby Howard, whose work I love dearly, to do some digital humor strips for all of us... omg
EXTRAS PDF: Vaguely aware of the presence of tons of extra content, but not motivated enough to wade through 3 years of Patreon archive to find it? Don't you worry, you'll be given a handy PDF copy of all this bonus info in one place, as well as additional brand new content for long-time readers!
PRINTS: a set of prints created by some of my (and your) favorite artists, which will be revealed as stretch goals are met. I'm srsly excited about these you guys
BOOKPLATE: a custom-made color bookplate which will be unavailable outside of this campaign
BOOKMARKS: a set of three beautiful graphic bookmarks to be included with every book purchase
SIGNED AND SKETCH: each of these very limited signed books will also come with a hand-drawn ink drawing of a Mare character of your choice for you to sell for a tidy profit after I'm dead
BUMPER STICKER: Keep Mars Red! Originally just a silly worldbuilding detail/ homage to the popular California bumper sticker, now an actual position to have irl T__T Please don't ruin Mars (btw, this bumper sticker will be printed on removable vinyl, so no worries about messaging up your car permanently~)
MORE?? yes, there are more secret rewards which will be automatically applied to your tier as we unlock the following goals ↓
I like my Kickstarters chock full of unlockables, and this one is no exception. We've got a slew of delightful and incredibly talented guest artists, as well as numerous upgrades and add-ons to apply to your book or pledge tier free of any additional charge once these goals are met. You'll just keep getting extra stuff, and best of all you're helping a bunch of other science and comic artists ~who are not me~ get paid.
Want to try and unlock a few? (EDIT: you guys are legends and have unlocked nearly every single thing I had planned for, what the heck)
I am ridiculously grateful to be working with the same production team that helped me create the successful The Meek Vol 1 Kickstarter books (ps you can hire them too, check out their links):
Christina McKenzie (production technician): responsible for correcting my horrendously dark web colors
Rhiannon R. S. (prepress technician): sources ethical printers and high-quality book materials

As well as support from:
Taneka Stotts (guidance and friendship without end)
Dustin (for having to listen to 5000 iterations of this story)
Lowell (for helping me keep my comics online since 2008)
Jared Petker (for making me go outside more than 2x a year)
the beautiful guest artists who kindly allowed me to hire them
every one of my Patrons and readers who made this work possible
Royalty-free Music credits:
"You're Not Wrong" by Roljui- YouTube Audio Library
"Sea & Ocean Wave Sound Effect" by Binaural Beats
To readers old and new, thank you for reading. I can't wait to finish this journey with you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second comic Kickstarter, and third Kickstarter overall. Both of my previous projects drastically overfunded and were successfully fulfilled to thousands of backers. I'm looking forward to using my experience to make this my smoothest project ever!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: MARE INTERNUM: the sci-fi graphic novel

campaign.story:
Invocation is a collection of ink illustrations that tell a mystical tale. An “Inktober” project: each drawing was done in the 31 days of October in 2017. Unlike a traditional comic, each drawing tells its own story while still connecting to the overall sequential arc. This kickstarter is to be able to get beautifully printed and bound versions made.
The books will be in a perfect bound format at 6”x6” - perfect for top of the toilet musings.
                                           Page numbers correspond to artwork! If you wish to purchase more than one original please message me and we will figure it out!
                 (5x7 ink commission of your original idea - please no pet or other IP character commissions please)
    Books should be in production for 2-3 weeks and expedited books will take a week to ship. Fingers crossed books can ship to backers on December 20th!
   If we reach $3500 in funding all the books would be upgraded to a casebound version. Hardcover instead of paperback, but without the cloth or foil stamping of the next version.
 If we reach $4000 in funding we'll unlock the cloth hardcover edition! All of the books will be upgraded to this super nice edition of INVOCATION with a cloth cover with foil stamping on the front. 
 US - $5
Canada - $10  
Everywhere else - $20

updates.update_content:
All rewards have been sent out and backers should have started receiving their books today!
 Please let me know if you do not receive your reward by the end of next week and I will check on the status. 
I really can never thank you all enough for supporting this project and I hope you're all pleased with how the books came out.

THE BOOKS HAVE ARRIVED!
I am so ecstatic that the first shipment of books have arrived and they look PERFECT!
That cloth cover...
That foil...
Those deckled edges!

GOSH DANG! You guys are all amazing and LOOK - we made our cloth cover stretch goal! These are gonna be so much nicer and I'm really excited for you all to receive your copy.
With only a few days left, I will be sending out the backer surveys AS SOON as the campaign is over. Please, please, please fill them out as quickly as you can since I have to design the Thank You page and will need your names (as you want them) for that page. As soon as those are all done I can send in the final file for the book printing and the sooner the better to be able to get these to you all as fast as possible!

Hello wonderful backers!
We are SO CLOSE to our cloth cover goal! Current funding is at $3,920 That's only $80 away! woo!
We have 4 days left so tell everyone you know...(please...you don't have to though)
Thank you! <3

Hooray! We reached our first stretch goal of $3500 so the books will be in hardcover! 
We still have 10 days left and are only $220 away from the cloth cover stetch goal.
Thank you everyone! <3
Cassie

Hey everyone! Woo-hoo we're going strong and pretty close to $3500. It's come to my attention that some of you may want more than one copy of the book. If you would like more than one copy you can simply increase your pledge amount by $15 for each additional copy. Once I send out backer surveys there will be an option for added book copies, but you would have to pledge before the end of the campaign to get more - you won't be able to add to your reward once the campaign is over.

ALSO! If I were to do a stretch goal at $3500 to make the books hardcover, NOT with cloth or foil stamping, but just upgrading the paperback to a casebound version - would you all be interested? Please comment or message me if you would dig this.

Thank you all so much for your support so far!

project_data.project_name: INVOCATION a book by Cassie Hart Kelly

campaign.story:
Our goal is to show the richness and deliciousness of a plant-based lifestyle.
                      There are many great cookbooks out there, but Simple Happy Kitchen isn't a cookbook.
This book is a guide to all the wonderful options of a plant-based kitchen. It teaches the benefits of the diet and provides easy tips for implementation.
As part of this guide, we do have a few recipes to show you. These easy-to-make meals are great inspirations as you develop your plant-based kitchen.
    Backing Simple Happy Kitchen is extremely rewarding! We produced great gifts designed especially for the project, all based on our cute tasty plant-based characters. 
To make it easier for you to choose, we’ve arranged the rewards in 7 different packs:
                          Yes! we're working with the fluffiest modeling agency!
    Great news! You amazing backers UNLOCKED ALL THE STRETCH GOALS! Stretch Goals are great perks we add to the existing backers'* orders once we reach specific milestones in funding.
* Stretch Goal perks are added to pledges of the Book Pack and above, unless stated otherwise ♥︎
** The E-Pack is automatically sent to those who pledges of the Book Pack and above ♥︎
After the campaign ends, you lovely backers will receive a SURVEY that'll allow you to select the plush dolls and charm sets (in case pledged for packages containing any of them), and verify your details for shipping. Feel free to message us with any questions!
Wanna order more than one pack? Buy one for a friend? No problem! When setting your pledge, simply enter the amount to cover the price of the pack you want X the number of copies/packs you want. Extra shipping charges may apply.
For example...
For 3 BOOK PACKs, pledge 3 X $47 = $141. Then add 3 X the shipping price to your country.
For 2 VITAMIN PACKs and 1 extra book+coloring book, pledge 2 X $119 + 1 X $47 (The BOOK PACK) = $285. Then add 3 X the shipping price to your country.
For 4 MULTIVITAMIN PACKs, pledge 4 X $139 = $556. Then add 3 X the shipping price to your country.
(Make sure you have enough room for 32 doll-pillows, ok?)
  During the campaign we had live videos! Replay the videos of Mr. Tofu or Miss Tomate!
As a backer, you are welcome to suggest topics and ideas that promote plant-based life.
We’ll host polls and questionnaires to determine the most interesting topics, then include those themes in the book. By participating, you’ll have a big hand in the book’s formation.
Have any suggestions for the book? Give us a shout, and we can discuss it!
Sprouted beans voting YES in a democratic poll for adding a chapter about benefits of sprouted legumes
  Back us!
Add a second copy to your pledge for someone you care about, to help them live a healthy life, full of happiness and compassion.
Tell all your friends to get their own copy, as you won’t be loaning yours to anyone - because we all know people never return things, right?
Subscribe on our Website, follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Share! Help us spread the word using these buttons below:
      Hi! I'm Miki Mottes, an illustrator and designer. I’ve devoted my design skills and volunteer time to many animal welfare organizations and associations that promote plant-based nutrition. I decided to take it to the next level and do my best to make a big change, in a way that could reach everyone.
(I'm the one on the left)
After illustrating the successful Kickstarter of Prof. Dan Ariely - “The Irrational Game” (1800% funded!), and after following its process, I know how things work and feel ready to manage this big production.

I base all information in the book on studies and reliable data, and you can easily find the references cited in the book and website. All nutrition information is written and verified by awesome vegan nutritionist BSc Tal Porat who volunteers in Challenge 22+ (Experience veganism for 22 days) as a professional clinical dietitian, as well as other experts.
  Some of our experts, examining a walnut
I would like to thank Ziv Meltzer, Oren Fait, Gal Mamalya and Omer Matityahu for their effort, motivation, and support during the creation of this project. Special thanks to Shirley Charlie Kleinman and Shachar Bechor for being great vegan charm models. A big thank-you-almond-cheese-cake to Neta Dror for consulting and doing the things I'm not good at.
The book has many more important issues to cover, such as:
Nutritional comparison of plant-based VS non plant-based foods • Plant-based Omega 3 • Dietary fibers • Shattering the myths • Meat substitutes • Building a healthy plant-based grocery list • Easy to make plant-based burgers • Soaking and sprouting • Breastfeeding on a vegan diet • Kids and plant-based food • Super-healthy smoothie ideas • Nutrition facts reading guide • How to replace sweets with healthy eating • How to eat a raw plant-based diet • Sample meal plans for the vegan athlete • Answers to common questions • Oils guide • Tofu and Tempeh • Keto diet (and others) • Plant-based versions of common recipes • Amazing things you can do with aquafaba • Cultured vegetables • 22 days vegan challenge kit • How a plant-based diet can help you lose weight • The E number dictionary • Things you need to know about Vitamin B12 • The plant based pyramid • and more…
Some of the topics are already sketched, but we need your support to develop them into beautiful, funny and useful illustrated pages.
If you'd like to write about us, you can find high-resolution page samples, logos, rewards photos and campaign video here.
You can contact us via email: hello@simplehappykitchen.com
♥ Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While every project comes with risks and challenges, I feel more than confident the book and rewards will make it into your hands.
My goal is to make the highest quality products, so I’m working with a top-quality printing house and manufacturers, using the best quality materials. I received samples from the suppliers, and they look great, so I feel very comfortable with starting mass production of the rewards as soon as the campaign ends.
The wonderful team behind Simple Happy Kitchen is highly experienced with designing, printing, manufacturing and fulfilling shipments worldwide.
Of course, there can always be unexpected delays with bulk orders once the Kickstarter is complete, but I promise to do my best in communicating any delays or issues. I want to ensure I meet your expectations.
In the meantime, do you have questions, thoughts or feedback about Simple Happy Kitchen? Leave your comments here, and I'll personally reply!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
One year ago today, Simple Happy Kitchen was successfully funded, and it’s all thanks to you! 🤟❤️
Let's celebrate the first birthday with a FLASH SALE! ⚡️
30% OFF EVERYTHING for 3 days only! Use coupon code KS1YEAR on checkout. 🌞

Dear backers,
We're shipping your orders! If you haven't got a tracking code to your email - don’t worry, you'll get one soon, so you can start tracking your chickpeas. or tofus. or books!

Dear backers,
The moment of truth is here! We are busy sorting, packing and taping the Simple Happy Kitchen books and exclusive rewards!
YOU'RE AWESOME! ❤️

Dear backers,
We’re almost there! The book (both the hardcopy and the e-book) is scheduled to be released June 25th! All books and rewards would be shipping from Utah, United States, so depending on where you are in the world, you should be getting the package anywhere between 1-3 weeks time (Australian friends - thank you for your patience).
We would update you the day the books and rewards are shipped.

Dear backers,
EXCITING news! After more than a full year of hard work, the Simple Happy Kitchen book is finally ready and on its way to our fulfillment center in California!

Dear backers,
We're so excited! printing starts in just a few days. The pages are ready and the cover is designed, I'm already holding the barcode, as you can see...

Dear backers,
Pedro Almondovar, your favorite almond is here!

Hey backers!  
The production goes as planned, both for the book and the rewards –
We’re sooooooooooooooooo excited about it!

Dear backers,
It's been more than a month since we finished the (amazing-thanks-to-you!) campaign and we feel it's time to send you guys a quick update on how things are going!
As you know, once the campaign was finished we sent out a survey to collect all the information we needed for your rewards. The survey also gave us a chance to hear what you wanted to see in the book. And boy, were you amazing! You lovely backers suggested so many great topics for the book! It truly helped us understand what YOU wanted to see being covered in the book. So once again – THANK YOU! <3

campaign.story:
BECOMING DANGEROUS is a nonfiction book of deeply personal essays by marginalised people using the intersection of feminism, witchcraft, and resistance to summon power and become fearsome in a world that would prefer them afraid. With contributions from twenty witchy femmes, queer conjurers, and magical rebels, BECOMING DANGEROUS is a book of intelligent and challenging essays that will resonate with anyone who’s ever looked for answers outside the typical places.
The latest book from Fiction & Feeling, a new and independent UK publishing company, the book is edited by me, Katie West, and Jasmine Elliott. From ritualistic skincare routines to gardening; from becoming your own higher power to searching for a legendary Scottish warrior woman; from the fashion magick of brujas to cripple-witch city-magic; from shoreline rituals to psychotherapy—this book is for people who know that now is the time, now is the hour, ours is the magic, ours is the power.
Originally, this book was going to be about the secret and safe spaces women create for themselves and each other. But as I was exploring that idea, I started to notice that so many babes I knew were turning to each other in more ritualised ways. I saw my friends creating private covens on Facebook, casting emoji spells to protect each other, sharing ritualised skincare routines, using tarot readings to make their weekend plans, making offerings to the Goddess, and performing binding spells on their President.  
I loved looking at the different ways in which women and LGBTQIA people; people of colour; nonbinary, and gender variant people were all summoning power in a world that prefers them powerless. The world is not a fair and equal place and, for many of us, that makes it a scary place. The culture we live in is built on systems of oppression and a patriarchal imbalance of power. We’re regularly faced with threats to our agency and authority. Those with power are not keen on sharing, and those of us without are left with discovering ways to summon it for ourselves. Discovering power that hasn’t been given to us begrudgingly or allocated sparingly makes us threatening. Power makes us dangerous. 
I knew I wanted to make a book about this. I wanted a book for people who needed to discover ways to summon their own power and become dangerous. 
Rituals, and magic in general, tend to increase in popularity during times of uncertainty and unrest. So at a time when there are forces at work in the world that threaten our freedoms, rights, and well-being, now is the moment to go dark and fuck shit up. This book collects twenty remarkable, defiant writers doing whatever they need to do to get people to stop fucking with their energy. The essays are personal explorations about how and why rituals of resistance work for them. Our goal is that this 300-page softcover book can help you to summon your own power to resist, survive, and thrive. 
This project won’t be possible without your help! Please check out our amazing rewards and pre-order your copy of BECOMING DANGEROUS today. Also! Please share this Kickstarter with the people you know who could do with becoming a bit more powerful, a bit more dangerous.
Contributors for this book write for publications like The Guardian and The Paris Review; websites like Autostraddle, The Hoodwitch, VICE, Broadly, and Nylon; and have published books and journal articles with several different publishers. 
Some identify as witches; others identify as writers, musicians, or artists. All of them have developed personal rituals to summon their own power and want to share these personal experiences of resistance and survival with you.
Cara Ellison(Embed With Games, Polygon 2015) ▲ Catherine Hernandez  (Scarborough, Arsenal Pulp Press 2017) ▼ Deb Chachra (The Atlantic, The Guardian) ▲ Gabriela Herstik (HelloGiggles, Nylon)   
Jaliessa Sipress (The Hoodwitch) ▲ J.A. Micheline (The Guardian, VICE) ▼ Katelan Foisy (Motherboard, Electric Literature) ▼ Kim Boekbinder (NOISEWITCH album out September 2017) 
Larissa Pham (The Paris Review, ELLE.com) ▼ Laura Mandanas (Autostraddle) ▲ Leigh Alexander (The Guardian, Motherboard) ▼ Maranda Elizabeth (LittleRedTarot.com, We Are The Weirdos, 2017) 
Marguerite Bennett (Batwoman, Insexts) ▲ Meredith Yayanos(Coilhouse, The Parlour Trick) ▼ merritt k (Total Mood Killer, TigerBee Press 2017) ▲ Mey Rude (trans editor at Autostraddle)  
Sam Maggs (Bioware, IDW)  ▲ Sara David (editor at Broadly) ▼ Sim Bajwa (Nasty Women, 404 Ink) ▲ Sophie Saint Thomas (VICE, Cosmopolitan) 
NEW REWARD! A super limited edition illustrated hardcover. This book is printed at a spectacular printing co-op in London. It's going to be the most gorgeous book you've ever put on your shelf. Trust me. It's an art object, and you're going to love it. Only 100 copies available.
Inside: 13 beautiful, full-colour, full-page illustrations created by a group of talented and inspiring artists: Emi Lenox, Corinne Dodenhoff, Vivian Rosas, Lori Field, Tea Cake, Maria Nguyen, Hana Shari, Rita Milone, Ursula Decay, Camila Rosa, Taylor Maudlin, and Kaethe Butcher [artist line-up subject to change] . The art was made exclusively for this project and was inspired by the essays within. See below for examples of the art!
The cover: Ellen Rogers photograph shot exclusively for this book mounted inside a stamped frame, black foil title on front and spine .
The book: bound in black velvet , black ribbon book mark , black end pages with black ink design , natural recycled paper , perfect bound with head/tail bands , encased in a black slipcase with black foil title on the front, and Becoming Dangerous hands with knives on the back .
A digital version of the book to read on your devices in your preferred format!
The paperback! Get yourself a physical copy of the book! Also comes with a digital copy of the book.
Join the coven and get your own Becoming Dangerous hard enamel pin. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. (The book and pin may be shipped separately.)
Bestselling writer and cartoonist Kate Leth has designed a custom 4"x6" sticker sheet of witchy, ritual-inspired flash exclusively for this Kickstarter. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. (The book and sticker sheet may be shipped separately.)
 The first book that Fiction & Feeling released was a collection of true stories about the end of marriage and what happens next written by 16 extremely talented divorced writers including Chip Zdarsky, Ray Fawkes, Janelle Asselin, and more! Get a physical copy of SPLIT along with a physical and digital copy of Becoming Dangerous. (The books may ship separately.)
  Queen of the Enamel Pin and Champion of Badass Women Jen Bartel has designed a twin set of custom enamel pins exclusively for this Kickstarter. These gold hard enamel pins (1" and 1.5") are connected with a 4" gold chain. Placed on a backing card created by Jen just for this project, this is a work of art in more ways than one! Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. (The book and pin may be shipped separately.)
 Julia Scheele, the amazing illustrator behind Queer: A Graphic History, has created a gorgeous A3 print exclusively for this Kickstarter. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. (The book and print may be shipped separately.)
 Get five physical copies of Becoming Dangerous for you and your coven, or skwod, or book club. 
Get a digital copy of Fantasian, a novel by contributor Larissa Pham; a digital copy of We Are The Weirdos, a novel by contributor Maranda Elizabeth; get a subscription to The Pussy Parlour, an exclusive email newsletter sent to your inbox once a month packed full of feminist, culture, and witchy writings from Becoming Dangerous contributors like Sim Bajwa, Cara Ellison, J.A. Micheline, Leigh Alexander, and other special guests! This Kickstarter is the only way to get access to this fantastic newsletter. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book.
 Contributor Maranda Elizabeth is offering tarot readings via text. Their written readings come complete with photos of the cards for you to keep for reference and journaling prompts. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. [Reward limited to 5]
 Contributor and astrologer Jaliessa Sipress will send you a personalized synopsis of where each New and Full Moon fall in your Natal Chart and how this positioning may affect you and your life. This synopsis will then be accompanied by a list of three meditation questions and a crystal suggestion that aligns with the work of that cycle. Information will be sent via email three days prior to the date of the New or Full Moon phase (ex. information for the Full Moon on March 12th will be sent on March 9th). Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. [Reward limited to 2]
 Writer and trans editor for Autostraddle Mey Rude is offering a sensitivity reader consultation. Do you have a story/comic/book with a trans character? Mey will read through your manuscript for issues in representation, internalised bias, or problematic language. An invaluable and necessary service for people writing outside their culture and personal experience! Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. [Reward limited to 1]
 You want it all! You deserve it all. Get both the Becoming Dangerous and Jen Bartel enamel pins, the Kate Leth witch flash sticker sheet, the Julia Scheele Teen Witches A3 print, Also comes with a physical and digital copy of Becoming Dangerous. (Items may ship separately.)
Visual artist and the Mistress of Magic, Katelan Foisy, is offering a personalised palm reading that she will render into an original pen and ink illustration for you. It's a beautiful work of art and reading in one. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. [Reward limited to 3, one palm]
Visual artist and the Mistress of Magic, Katelan Foisy, is also offering a personalised physiognomy painting. Physiognomy is face reading, similar to palm reading. You send Katelan a photo of your face (or someone else's!) and she creates an original work of art using watercolours and ink that has insights into the personality and character of the subject. It's a gorgeous portrait and reading in one. Also comes with a physical and digital copy of the book. [Reward limited to 2]
 Become a Patron Saint of Becoming Dangerous and have your name in the acknowledgements of the book. Sometimes you just believe in a project so much, you need to see it happen. The Patron Saints of Becoming Dangerous are generous, supportive, and using their own power for good. Helping others summon power of their own is no small thing. Respect.
£26,000 - Limited Edition Illustrated Black Velvet Hardcover REACHED!
See some of the artwork that will be included below:
 by Emi Lenox for the Limited Edition Illustrated Black Velvet Hardcover of Becoming Dangerous
  by Corinne Dodenhoff for the Limited Edition Illustrated Black Velvet Hardcover of Becoming Dangerous
More art will be added as it comes in! Stay tuned!
Ellen Rogers (Artwork is intended only to shows artist's style and is not the final cover for the book)
£27,000 - New Rewards unlocked! If we reach this level, a bunch of new rewards from our contributors will be unlocked. These rewards include consultations with Sam Maggs to ritualise your skincare routine (limited to five); makeup consultations with merritt k (limited to five); 30-minute call sessions with Sophie Saint Thomas to discuss sex and dating advice (limited to five); and a Becoming Dangerous mixtape download featuring new music from Meredith Yayanos and Kim Boekbinder, along with special guests! Also, every single person who pledges will get the Becoming Dangerous Spell Booklet—three rituals created by our contributors who are practicing witches to help you summon your power!
£28,000 - Everyone gets a bookplate with their paperback! If we reach this amount, everyone who supports the book at the £15+ levels is getting a bookplate created especially for this project by Lights. Yeah. You heard me. Lights, the super talented musician, comic book creator, and owner of Stanley, the greatest cat on the internet.
Bookplate by Lights!
£29,000 - Audio version of Becoming Dangerous. If we reach this amount, an audio version of the book will be created for distribution. 
£30,0000 - Paperback version of Becoming Dangerous gets an upgrade! If we reach this, the paperback will be upgraded to have gold or silver foil on the cover and French flaps—which are great for keeping your place in a book!
£31,000 - Three new authors will be announced! If we reach this level, we'll be able to add three new contributors to this book. Spread the word and share this campaign so we can get to this level and get more rituals, more power! 
One of the driving principles at Fiction & Feeling is that our creators are paid fairly; this accounts for why contributors' compensation is the biggest slice of our funding pie. 
Our initial campaign goal covers all printing, design, and editing costs; provides compensation for all of the contributors in the book; and goes toward shipping costs, reward production, and Kickstarter/credit card fees. 
Here's the breakdown:
  To make sure this project is a success, I'm working with Backerkit to ensure the back-end of this campaign runs as smoothly as possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project comes with risk, and this one is no exception. However, I've done everything I could to mitigate those risks. 

I've helped prepare, run, and fulfill several Kickstarters before in my past life as a personal assistant to creatives. I have great support from some Kickstarter superstars (thanks, Hope!), and I've been preparing this Kickstarter for almost a year. I've published books before and the last publication I did was the project I did to learn everything I needed to know to make this project happen. I've made mistakes and now know how to avoid them.

I do not require finished pieces of writing from contributors until the Kickstarter is fully funded and they can be paid for their work. This means it's a possibility that a contributor's situation may change at some point between the beginning of the campaign and the end of it, making it impossible to write their piece. However, we will do our utmost to keep the line-up as advertised, and no matter what, you will be getting a book with twenty authors and they are all going to be incredible.

Despite the best preparations, things can still happen. Printers can be later than they say, shipments can get mixed up or lost, suppliers can be late on delivery. I can't control those things, unfortunately, but I am an excellent communicator and will keep you up to date on issues as they arise and let you know how they're being handled.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Just letting you know there are only 10 days left to back my latest Kickstarter for Better Than IRL, a book about finding your people on the internet. 
The book is full of marginalised writers telling their true stories about what it was like to find their people on the untamed internet. The untamed internet existed in a time before algorithms, corporations, and terms of service made anything more than an emoji hard to come by. A time when the internet was still new, and huge, and wild. No one knew quite what to do with it, but we built our little corners and made lasting connections.

updates.update_userinfo: Did you find your people on the mid-2000s internet? I have a new book for you.
updates.update_content:
Hello!
It's been awhile! I hope you all enjoyed reading Becoming Dangerous and thank you again for helping to make it happen!
Today I launched a new Kickstarter for my newest collection Better Than IRL: true stories about finding your people on the mid-2000s internet. 
If you were one of those people who created meaningful connections and formed strange and wonderful communities on the internet from around 2003-2013, then this book is for you.

Hello everyone,
I just wanted to say thank you for helping to make this Kickstarter a success. You're all the best.
ALL REWARDS HAVE BEEN SHIPPED. If you haven't received your rewards, please email me at hello@fictionandfeeling.com.

updates.update_userinfo: Finally. The last of the shipments are going out.
updates.update_content:
It has been a long journey, friends. Longer than I anticipated. But here we are. The last of the shipments are due to go out this week and next. And then we're done!
If you are inside the EU, your rewards will be shipped Friday or Monday.
Hardcovers are also shipping this week! They look SO GOOD.

updates.update_userinfo: If you haven't received your book, read this:
updates.update_content:
If you haven't received your book/rewards, it will ship in mid-June when I return from Hawaii. Fulfilment for this Kickstarter was supposed to be done weeks ago, (hence the vacation), but due to damaged books from the printer, and having to reprint them, this isn't so. The new printing didn't arrive before I left the country, so I'll be shipping upon my return and after the book launch. I apologise for the delay.
You can read the details about this in past updates here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/katiewest/becoming-dangerous-a-book-about-ritual-and-resista/updates

updates.update_userinfo: Books won't be shipped until early June
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Heard from the new printer yesterday and unfortunately, the new batch of books won't be ready until May 29th. Which would be fine, except seven months ago I booked a trip to Hawaii for the last two weeks of May. I did this believing I would be done with this Kickstarter's fulfillment by now. And if the books hadn't been damaged when they arrived here in Edinburgh, I would be. Everything is ready to go. I just need books!

updates.update_userinfo: New books at the printer, refund on it's way
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Good news! Today I received the refund from Marquis for the damaged books. I also received word from the new printers that the books are already under way and should be done in about 3 weeks. 
Also just wanted to let you know that the book is selling quite well despite me doing zero promotion for it. (I was thinking there's no point promoting a book I don't actually have on hand to sell. Turns out, !) These sales are 100% because of all of you who have posted photos of your books and talked about it to your friends. Thank you thank you thank you.

Hello everyone!
An update: I'm still waiting on a refund from the original printers. They pretty much refused to do a reprint, so I'm waiting for my refund to be approved. (It better be approved. *angry glare at camera 1*)
In the meantime, I've contacted several UK printers for estimates. One place seems very helpful and responsive and came well recommended to me so I've decided to go with them. They're going to take 3 weeks to print and when the books arrive I'll be able to get rewards out very quickly as they're all ready to go, I just need the book!

Hello everyone,
I am very glad to see that everyone outside the EU seems to be getting their rewards. I've seen folks in Canada, Australia, and Singapore receiving their books and that's such great news!
In not so great news: I'm still arguing with the printer about the damaged books. At one point I thought I was being unreasonable and so showed the damaged to my friend Anna who has worked in book stores for year. She assured me that had she received the books from a publisher, she would've sent them right back as she wouldn't have been able to sell any of them.

Hello everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that if you are outside the EU and haven't received your book yet, you can contact BackerKit here. However, you may want to hold off a couple days as I think I've only seen two or three people outside the US who have their book. I haven't seen anyone in Canada who has received their rewards yet. 
EU Backers: I'm still missing three boxes of books. I ended up with only 50% of books being undamaged, which is only around 190. I've packed them up and will start shipping this week. I've also contacted another printer in order to get the books I'm missing replaced. We're in talks to make that happen soon. Thanks for all your kind messages of support regarding this delay!

project_data.project_name: BECOMING DANGEROUS: A book about ritual and resistance

campaign.story:
Brains can be real assholes sometimes. Freaking the fuck out in traffic... avoiding important shit we have to do... being a dick to people we care about... What the hell, brain? 
This is a book about how to make friends with your brain again. In her unique, unforgettable voice, Dr. Faith Harper shows you how your brain is actually trying to help you and provides practical, simple exercises for teaching it to work for you rather than against you. The second half of the book includes chapters honing in on stress, anxiety, anger, depression, addiction, grief, and other specific ways our brains get fucked. 
Reading this book is like having a friend with a PhD talk you through all your stuff with easy-to-understand science and plenty of cussing. Unfucking your brain is totally possible! Why not start now?
About the Book
  Unfuck Your Brain: Using Science to Get Over Anxiety, Depression, Anger, Freak-outs, and Triggers by Dr. Faith G. Harper comes out from Microcosm Publishing in fall, 2017. Back it here and get your copy before its official release!
As for the book... we'll let it speak for itself. Here's an excerpt from the introduction:
This book is essentially all about trauma. And our traumatic responses, life bullshit, and other-people dickitude that gets in the way of us kicking ass at life. It’s also about how we create coping strategies that deal with this bullshit that fancy doctor people like to label with words like anxiety, depression, addiction, anger, etc. 
These strategies are part the whole complicated process of your brain responding after shit goes down in your life. The brain is really just trying to do its job by protecting you the best way it knows how. But the brain often ends up being a not-particularly-helpful asshole instead. It’s like your friend that offers to beat the shit out of anyone who upsets you. Gratifying, but not helpful in the long run.
This book is also about general life bullshittery and other-people’s dickitude. The shit that might not be traumatic but gets in the way of us kicking ass at life. The ways we manage stuff that isn’t full blown trauma…but sure as fuck isn’t kittens, rainbows, and teddy bears. Like with trauma, the coping skills we create for THESE situations tend to be less and less useful over time and downright exhausting.
The good news is, no matter how long you’ve been stuck in this quicksand you CAN rewire your response and unfuck your brain.
Here's a video of Dr. Faith reading a section from the introduction, "Who This Book is For" (spoiler alert: very possibly you!).
PLAY

About the Author
Dr. Faith G. Harper, PhD, LPC-S, ACS, ACN is a bad-ass, funny lady with a PhD. She’s a licensed professional counselor, board supervisor (that means she teaches therapists to be therapists), certified sexologist, and applied clinical nutritionist with a private practice and consulting/training business in San Antonio, TX. She has been an adjunct professor and a TEDx presenter and proudly identifies as a woman of color and uppity intersectional feminist. 
About the Publisher
Microcosm Co-Owners Joe Biel + Elly Blue
  Since 1996, Microcosm Publishing has been creating books and zines that help you empower yourself to change your life and world for the better. We operate out of a bright green building in Portland, Oregon, where we try to have the most fun every day.
Rewards
Are you ready for some books and zines that will change your world? We've gone through our catalog and chosen a selection of care packages bound to help you shift the balance to change your life and world.
5-Minute Therapy Zines
It takes about 3 years for a book to come out. Instead of waiting that long to have a thing to share with her clients, students, and the world, Dr. Faith decided to start cranking out zines—which are basically like much-shorter, photocopied books that you can put out into the world as fast as you can write them. And Faith can write fast, and has a lot to say. By the time this book comes out, we'll have published more than 20 of her zines, with more on the way, on topics ranging from boundaries to friendship breakups to dating to succeeding at work to living with an STI. 
Some of the zines ended up becoming chapters of the book; when we're choosing specific ones to send you along with your book, we won't choose those.
And yes, we have a reward level where you can get ALL THE ZINES.
Unfuck Your Mind & Body
For this reward level, we'll send you a selection of books we've published about mental and physical health.
Unfuck Your Body & Mind
Good Trouble is Microcosm founder Joe Biel's biography of learning to turn Autism into a superpower
Maps to the Other Side is Sascha DuBrul's story of being young, punk, and bipolar and building a radical mad rights movement
Sick is a compilation zine about physical illness
Bamboozled is a true-life parable about the hazards of not unfucking your brain
Distance Makes the Heart Grow Sick is Cristy C. Road's art book featuring emotive young people expressing themselves and changing their lives.
Cycletherapy shares different stories about healing from grief through the comforting and cathartic act of bicycling
Unfuck Your Lifestyle
Of course, all this unfucking doesn't happen in a vacuum. You still have to work and eat and such. Once you start unfucking, though, you might find you want to do some of those things a little differently. Here are some guides. (At this level you'll *also* get all the books in the Unfuck Your Mind & Body reward.)
Unfuck Your Lifestyle
[IMAGE with book cover thumbnails]
How & Why is Matte Resist's manual and manifesto for sustainable urban living; projects range from building rain barrels to making music
Urban Revolutions will teach you about the modern bicycle movement and how to revolutionize your own life on two wheels
Grow is Eleanor Whitney's guide to turning your crafty passion into a business that supports you. Live your dream!
Scam is inspiration for a different sort of off-the-grid urban revolution
Unfuck the World
Once you've taken a good, hard look inward, you'll likely want to turn your attention outside yourself again, this time with the tools to make lasting change in the world. We hope the authors of these books inspire you with what is possible. (Even better: By backing at this level, you'll also get ALL THE BOOKS in the previous two levels.)
Unfuck the World
Beyond the Music interviews dozens of people who are living their values in all walks of life
In Cambodian Grrrl, Anne Elizabeth Moore travels to teach young women to make zines
Katrina's Sandcastles is Kaycee Eckhardt's tale of students overcoming great odds in New Orleans schools
Why We Drive is Andy Singer's part-comics journalism showing the checkered history of the private automobile and its alternatives
X-Ray Visions is a documentary movie about the all-ages music venue and cultural icon that defined Portland, Oregon in the 90s
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been publishing books for more than two decades, and we're pretty good at it by this point, if we do say so ourselves. There are always some unavoidable risks in the process—books can be late from the printer (or printed upside-down!), errors can be made in data entry and shipping, pallets can be spectacularly dropped in the parking lot—but we have enough practice handling those kinds of challenges that communicating and making them right with you comes easily. And learning not to beat ourselves up over normal stuff like this is a key factor in unfucking our own brains. 

Thank you for trusting us with your pledge! We hope that you get as much out of this book as we have.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: How to be accountable? Change your habits and behavior to create the life you want
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
We have a new Kickstarter going, for a book Dr. Faith's co-authored with Microcosm Publisher Joe Biel. It's called How to Be Accountable, and it's funding now. It's got tons of brain science about how we act in ways that might harm ourselves and others—even when we don't want to or mean to—and how to notice that and change it. Good stuff to steady ourselves with in these uncertain times.
Thank you!

updates.update_userinfo: Can we unf*ck 2020? Dr. Faith's new planner/workbook has some tools to try
updates.update_content:
Hi all. These are some pretty weird times, to put it mildly. Here at Microcosm we're doing our best to keep a steady course. "We can be the calm eye in the storm," said our operations manager Sid, and part of that is continuing to do things like edit books that come out next year, plan for the strongest possible future, and keep launching Kickstarter projects on schedule. Like this one: 
Dr. Faith's next book, Unf*ck Your Year, is a workbook and weekly unplanner. You write in the dates, so you can start any time, jump around, and take a break and get back to it. Each week is paired with a worksheet to fill out or a new habit to practice. It's good stuff. We wish it were here right now. (There is a backers-only update on the project right now with one of the exercises, if you want to check it out.)

updates.update_userinfo: Capitalism may not want you to Unf*ck Your Worth, but we do!
updates.update_content: Every time Dr. Faith has a new book out, we say "it's her best one yet!" which we realize may start to sound a little suspicious. But those of you who've been following along since Unf*ck Your Brain, her first book, know exactly what we are talking about. Because when you practice doing something a lot, you tend to get better and better at it. That's true for writing books (and Dr. Faith writes a LOT) and it's also true for the unf*ckening work done by y'all. Each one comes together to create a more profound and nuanced window into all the ways our lives' adventures can screw up our brains, and offers more targeted, helpful tools to get us back on track, or maybe on track for the first time.

updates.update_userinfo: How much do you take your own happiness into account?
updates.update_content:
We're proud to announce our newest book project on Kickstarter: Ariel Gore's F*ck Happiness, a feminist critique of the mental health establishment, and especially the more recent movement towards positivity and happiness. 
Not that these aren't worthy goals, Gore writes, but the top researchers and study subjects in positive psychology all seem to share one thing in common... they're cis straight white men. And, not coincidentally, their advice has some serious gaps: Mothers, caretakers, and people whose work is primarily emotional and social-relational, the unpaid or low-paid roles that tend to still be filled by women.

updates.update_userinfo: Bicycles, dragons, and a call to action
updates.update_content:
Feminist bicycle science fiction... about dragons? Yes, this is what we're publishing next. And it's funding on Kickstarter right now -- check it out for some intense stories by up and coming authors.
Also, you may have heard about Kickstarter workers' efforts to unionize being met with a lot of resistance by the company's management. The union organizers aren't calling for a boycott at this time; there's still hope that a fruitful negotiation and dialogue can be had. Please join us in asking Kickstarter's senior leadership to voluntarily recognize the union. You can do so by and/or taking any of the actions outlined at . Let's work together to make the internet and the world a better place for people who do all kinds of work.

updates.update_userinfo: A Dr. Faith-ful Humble Bundle of ebooks! (And a new Kickstarter of course...)
updates.update_content:
Hi team,
We have two exciting announcements for you:
First, we've partnered with Humble Bundle to offer a sliding scale bundle of our ebooks for the next 12 days... including many by Dr. Faith! The cost is as low as $1, and you get to choose what percent of your payment goes to Humble, the publisher, and a couple of rad nonprofits: Portland's amazing StreetBooks library and the redoubtable Comic Book Legal Defense Fund. Yay!

updates.update_userinfo: Live is so much better with BOUNDARIES and CONSENT (a new book by Dr. Faith!)
updates.update_content:
We received the finished draft of Dr. Faith Harper's new book about BOUNDARIES and CONSENT. I believe that this is her best book yet, most timely and relevant. Dr. Faith has really knocked it out of the park to help people this time. Trista also really took the book up a notch with some of their best illustrations yet to explain these  concepts. Take a look below.
The book has one day left on Kickstarter. If we can break $16,000, we're going to add 64 pages to the book and increase the print run to 5,000. If we can break $20,000 we'll increase the print run to 7,000 copies and add illustrations. Either way, you'll get the best deal. The book will be $14.95 in stores and you'll still get it for the low, low sliding-scale price as an early backer. Is something wrong with our boundaries? Read the book and decide!

Dear Brainiacs,
We are Kickstarting another book by Dr. Faith, and we're extra excited about this one. Unf*ck Your Boundaries is all about how to hold your own without throwing up a spiky wall to the world. In this day and age, that's a vital life skill. 
We're participating in the "Break Kickstarter" initiative, which means we're offering the book on a sliding scale: You decide your price, based on what the book is worth to you and what you can afford.

updates.update_userinfo: Unf*ck Your Anger - a new Dr. Faith book on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello, dear brainiacs,
When Dr. Faith turned up at our office during her honeymoon (!) back in 2015 with a powerpoint draft titled "Your Brain is an Assh*le" that would eventually become Unf*ck Your Brain, we had no idea just how ready the world was going to be for her work.
Dozens of zines and nine books later (and counting!), it's still true. Every book is a team effort; Faith brings her subject expertise and inimitable voice, putting countless hours in of research, writing, and revising. We hone the framing and packaging of the books, go back and forth with lots of edits and trying to ask the hardest questions we can. And with each book, we all get better at it.

updates.update_userinfo: A gorgeous book of butch heroines
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
We have a new book project in the works—with just a few days left to go! The Life & Times of Butch Dykes is Brazilian-Canadian illustrator Eloisa Aquino's brilliant and beautiful ode to masculine lesbians of the last century and today. Help us get this representation out into the world by backing it on Kickstarter.
More news coming soon,

project_data.project_name: Unfuck Your Brain: Using Science to Work Through Your Shit

campaign.story:
Hello! I'm Lucy Bellwood, a professional Adventure Cartoonist living in Portland, Oregon. I'm running this campaign to fund a printed collection of my 100 Demon Dialogues Project and a companion plush toy to keep you all company as you bicker with (and perhaps get to love) your own inner jerks.
What's all this about? Here's the scoop:
Back in 2015 I started exploring a series of illustrated dialogues between myself and a small, obnoxious character who had a lot of big ideas about everything I was supposedly doing wrong in my life and my career. 
Sharing these illustrations induced a particular kind of catharsis: it turned out most everyone I knew was struggling with feelings of imposter syndrome and anxiety. Externalizing these conversations and giving them a humorous twist often enabled me to overcome my self-doubt and get on with the exciting business of Making Good Art—and it seemed to help other people do the same.
This year, for The 100 Day Project, I decided to delve deep into these Demon Dialogues. For the past three months, I've been drawing a demon every day, exploring all the ins and outs of the creative process, growing up, and trying to live a balanced life as an adult in the 21st century. (You can read all the entries online for free right here.)
The project has garnered a massive and humbling response. I've heard from so many people who saw themselves in these illustrations and were able to laugh at the absurdity of the demon's demands or nod in recognition when something hit too close to home. Lots of people were asking for books or prints, so I decided to launch this campaign to bring a physical edition of the project to life.
The primary goal of this campaign is to produce a print edition of the complete 100 Demon Dialogues series. I'll be making softcover and hardcover editions available, both with all the fancy bells and whistles I can think of. 
Softcover editions will measure 6"x 6" and feature French Flaps, color covers, spot foil, and patterned inner covers.
Hardcover editions will measure 6" x 6" and feature ribbon bookmarks, colored spine stitching, spot foil, and patterned endpapers.
Both editions contain all 100 entries from this year's 100 Demon Dialogues project, printed in black and white, plus a brief essay on what I learned while completing the project. If things go really well, I'll be including a gallery of additional demon entries from previous iterations of this project, but let's get the basics down first.
Of course, the logical companion for the print edition is a cuddly demon of your very own! 
I've partnered with Soft Stuff Creations to produce a plush toy demon for all your bickering needs. Here's a look at the prototype:
This little fella measures about 15" from tip to tail and has beans in his backside so he can easily sit up on any surface you care to place him on. The body and eyes are both ultra-soft, short fur, and the eyes and mouth have embroidered edges. His floppy limbs windmill in a very pleasing manner when you throw him down a flight of stairs, too. 
"Ugh, I can't believe you like this band."
Soft Stuff Creations has a stellar record of producing plush toys for folks like KC Green and Kate Beaton, and I'm really excited to be working with them for this reward.
While I'm deliberately keeping this campaign simple so I can better focus on producing high-quality books and toys, I am offering a limited-edition run of signed and numbered, reversible letterpress prints, produced in partnership with my pal Emily Riley of Rx Letterpress, a local Portland printer.
These prints will be 6"x9", featuring black and blue ink with a custom watercolor wash—which means no two will be alike! You can hang them whichever way appeals to you the most, or switch ’em up depending on the day.
(Concept art only, final design forthcoming.)
If you're looking for prints of specific Demon Dialogues, never fear: the fine folks at Buyolympia have got you covered. You can buy prints of every single demon from the series right here.
  Of course, producing all these exciting things takes money, which is where Kickstarter comes in! The operating budget for this campaign looks like so:
For all you number nerds, here's the breakdown. [Note: these numbers are current quote estimates and may change, but we've been careful to overestimate where possible so there won't be any nasty surprises.]
~$9,540 to Soft Stuff Creations for plushie design and production.
~$3,050 to the print team for book production and shipping.
~$1,000 for print brokerage and negotiation.
~$8,000 to Blackbox, who will be bringing their stellar customer service and logistical experience to the table to get your packages shipped intact and on schedule.
~$600 to Allyson Haller, my fabulous book designer.
~$320 to Rx Letterpress for limited-edition demon prints.
5% for Kickstarter fees (about $1,214, with current figures).
2-5% for credit card processing fees (variable, but again: about $1,200).
This takes us just about up to $25,000, which you'll notice is the goal for this campaign. I try to be transparent about my finances as often as possible, so here's the deal: this campaign is to fund the production of these items, which is why I’m setting the base funding goal at 25k. 
However, reaching the magic number of $32,500 will ensure that I’ll be able to afford the taxes on this income (The More You Know: Kickstarter money counts as income for creators!). The final rate may be less than 30% because many of these expenses are deductible, but it's always best to play it safe where this stuff is concerned. 
There are no official stretch goals for this campaign because I wanted to jump straight into making the best possible thing right off the bat, so consider this our one above-the-mark mission. Deal? Deal.
Support Team
I'm thrilled to be working with the following companies to ensure the backend of this campaign runs as smoothly as possible:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third Kickstarter campaign, and I'm really looking forward to implementing everything I learned during my first two successful experiences.

All the illustrations in the 100 Demon Dialogues series are complete! I've been working hard to get as much of the book design done ahead of time as possible, so all that remains is gather that artwork and getting the final files put together with my fabulous book designer, Ally.

For both books and plushies: production and transit time are hefty where overseas projects are concerned. I'll be keeping backers abreast of the production process so they can see what goes into designing and producing these objects, but we can't get around how long it takes them to arrive from abroad. 

Our March 2018 arrival estimate is VERY generous to allow maximum time for potential delays. I'd rather your rewards be a pleasant, early surprise than an overdue burden! I will, of course, keep everyone fully apprised in the updates of when to expect their goods. Blackbox and BackerKit, our survey and fulfillment companies, both have fantastic customer service and backend interfaces to help guarantee that your books and plushies arrive in a timely and undamaged fashion. I have the utmost faith in them. 

Aside from shipping delays, though, we're looking at a solid, stress-free experience bringing some exciting things into the world. I can't wait!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi friends!
Here we are in November and I have so much to be grateful for. Over the past nine months you have showed up for TWENTY-FOUR different events, shared countless meaningful stories on social media, left reviews, introduced friends, and made the entire launch of 100 Demon Dialogues a smashing success. Thank you, thank you, thank you for believing in this book and continuing to support me through this wild year of travel.

updates.update_userinfo: Tour Events: San Diego, Austin, Boulder & Beyond
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! I'm still out here!
The 100 Demon Dialogues Tour continues apace, and I'm feeling really recharged after a productive trip home and a big turnout for the tour stops in Ojai and Los Angeles. Y'all made me feel so welcome and seen. It was an honor to pass some of that back.

updates.update_userinfo: More Tour Cities, A New Workshop, and More
updates.update_content:
Hello hello, friends—
I'm writing to you from a fancy office in downtown San Francisco where I am trying very hard not to look like a weird interloper who snuck in off the street. I'm back on the road for another couple months, so a friend is kindly letting me crash a desk here while I throw together last-minute event pages and social media posts for the rest of the tour. It's been pretty chaotic, but it's coming together! 
Big News:

Hello, everyone!
It's been such a wild and crazy month. I'm still pinching myself that I'm actually at home in my own bed. 
The first leg of the 100 Demon Dialogues Tour went really well, and I'm so grateful to have met so many kind, open people on the trip. Thank you for coming out, spreading the word, and helping to make it happen. Here's by the numbers:
It's happening!

Hello, friends!
The 100 Demon Dialogues commercial release (and US book tour) are fast approaching, so first up I'm gonna give you some dates to check out:

Hello hello!
It's time for your monthly update on all things Demon Dialogues. It turns out we had a couple minor hiccups with shipping orders to folks who added items in BackerKit, but I believe we caught all the errors and are now good to go. As always: if you're missing an item, package, or shipment notification, get in touch with the fulfillment team at mail@blackbox.cool and we'll make it right.

Splendid news, everyone!
Blackbox has successfully shipped all the completed orders for 100 Demon Dialogues!

campaign.story:
Power & Magic: IMMORTAL SOULS is a comics anthology about queer witches for teens and adults ages 14-and-up. The book is over 110 pages long, black and white, and contains 10 original stories by women and non-binary creators of color. In this special installment of the POWER & MAGIC SERIES, queer witches of color delve into the darker sides of magic: astral planes, necromancy, visions of death, and communion with the spirits of our world... and the beyond.
This book is the immediate follow-up to POWER & MAGIC: The Queer Witch Comics Anthology, an award-winning collection of fantasy stories exalting the witch as an archetype of feminine power. With IMMORTAL SOULS, we are cementing a series tradition: stories told by women and non-binary creators of color, all starring queer witches of color.
Sonia Liao.
From Volume One's synopsis:
"The witch is an icon of power. She represents transcendence, healing, insight, defiance, feminine monstrosity, and a sacred relationship to the self, the community, and the universe. From the euphoria of holding the stars in your grasp, to the sacrifices we make to reach them, POWER & MAGIC explores what it means to be a person of power in all its complexity."
What happens when these people of power draw that power from "the other side?"
Ayanni C. Hanna and Melanie Tingdahl.
Every dollar we raise here on Kickstarter goes toward covering print costs, paying the creators, and rewarding you with limited-edition extras and ever-increasing book quality! Read below to learn more about our backer rewards and about our system for paying creators.
POWER & MAGIC is edited by Joamette Gil, a queer Afro-Cuban cartoonist and founder of P&M Press. You can learn more about P&M Press, our mission, and our journey at powerandmagicpress.com.
Francis Quintero.
  Amber Huff (Ladies’ Night Anthology Volume 3: How To Magic)
Ayanni C. Hanna and Melanie Tingdahl (Hoten, My Little Pony #1 ghost-variant cover, Lumberjanes/Gotham Academy #1 variant cover)

Yeon Kyung Cha (Beat-Per-Min, Lilies Anthology, The Boy In Front of the Flower Shop)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter campaign, so you won't be taking a risk on a fresh face! The first one was a complete success save for shipping delays, and I've assessed exactly how to significantly reduce (if not completely avoid) the issues that led to said delays. The comics are done and ready to hit the printer as soon as we receive the funds! As for quality, it's like we said above: this series is AWARD-WINNING. You're in for a treat. :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The full-length Volume 2 of POWER & MAGIC is here!
updates.update_content: After 9 long months, our newest anthology is live and kicking on Kickstarter today!

updates.update_userinfo: HEARTWOOD: Non-binary Tales of Sylvan Fantasy is LIVE on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Immortal Souls backers!
I'm writing today to share the launch of our third comics anthology on Kickstarter, HEARTWOOD: Non-binary Tales of Sylvan Fantasy. Together with 28 other creators, we've crafted a book that the world hasn't seen before: a collection of comics about and by people who identify as a non-binary gender.
Support if you can, and help us make history (and a run of gorgeous books)!

project_data.project_name: IMMORTAL SOULS (The Next Queer Witch Comics Anthology)

campaign.story:
WELL It just so happens that this little fella got a little popular and He's my boy, and I love him, so it would make me very happy if I could get him made into pins!
Pins will be 1-inch soft enamel with clasp and black nickel plating.
A popular Boy
Here's a breakdown of the costs:
 Goal: $650
Pin Production: $350
Sticker Production: $100
Shipping and Packaging: $200
Stretch Goals
$900: Glow in the dark pins! You will have the option to make 1 pin in your order glow in the dark enamel!
$1150: Sparkle pins! You will have the option to make 1 pin in your order glitter enamel!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
TheStudio.com will be used to produce the pins and Stickermule.com will be used to produce the stickers. I have not previously used these producers for stickers or pins but they come highly recommended. There is always a risk that manufacturing or shipping from them will be delayed.

I have determined that I will be able to ship pins and stickers in the US via USPS in a padded envelope by first class mail for $3 each (including packaging). Unfortunately, shipping a package more than 3/4 of an inch outside of the US is going to cost over $13.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey birdy pals - 
I have a brand new bird pin kickstarter running right now! These ones aren't quite so lumpy, but still good. One even has a knife! Below are all the currently funded designs. 
Check it out here!
Can't back right now? That's ok! Shares help a LOT!

After over two months of waiting for the pins to arrive and approximately 7 hours of organizing, labeling, packing, getting postage, and doing more labeling, all of the pins and stickers have been dropped off at my local post office and they are on their way to you!!! 
I hope the boys arrive to you safely :)

The pins have been shipped to me! Just waiting on getting the last box now (the glow-in-the-dark took a little extra time) and then I'll be mailing out your stuff as soon as I can write everyone's address :) The pins look great and I'll upload some good pics of them before I ship them out!
I've also decided that I have enough stickers to double everyone's order - so if you got 1 sticker, now you'll get 2, if you got 2 now you'll get 4, etc. Just wanted to say thanks to you all again.

HI everyone, just wanted to give you a quick update on the project since it's been a while. I received images of the physical samples and they have been approved for manufacture. 
I had some difficulty with the physical samples because they originally made the pins grey instead of white! They are fixed now though, and on their way to being produced. 
The manufacturer is giving a delivery date (date they will be delivered to me) of "Between 10-18-2017 and 10-25-2017". Shortly afterwards I should have them packaged up and sent out to you, so please make sure your address is up to date!

updates.update_userinfo: Stickers have arrived and pins are in production!
updates.update_content: Just got the beautiful stickers in the mail!

Woah! I never expected so much support for this, thank you all so much for backing and sharing this kickstarter! 
Surveys will be headed out soon to get your shipping address and to ask which type of pin(s) you want - original white, glow in the dark, or sparkle, as we have reached both stretch goals! 
Once I have the information on how many of each type I'll be needing to order, I'll send in the info to the company that is producing the pins.

When you were a kid with glow-in-the-dark stars on your ceiling, did you look up and wish that they were actually small, fleshy birds? I know I did! 
Well now you've help me make glowing birds a reality, we've hit the $900 stretch goal to fund glow in the dark enamel pins! You'll be able to choose to have regular white enamel or glow enamel for your reward. I'll send out a survey to see what you want before I place the pin orders.

Five days in and we've hit our goal, I'm honestly amazed! Thanks so much everyone for supporting and spreading the word.
We've got 25 days to go - can we make it to GLOW IN THE DARK stretch goal of $900??
Any reblogs on tumblr or shares on social media are hugely appreciated!
(reblog on tumblr here!)

campaign.story:
*Note* Our initial Kickstarter goal was set for 75K but since we have hit that and our initial stretch goal of 125k we are now looking to raise at least 200K as our next stretch goal. The more we raise, the better quality film we can deliver. A budget breakdown is included at the bottom this post.
Hair Love, is a 5 minute animated short film that centers around the relationship between an African-American father, Stephen, his daughter, Zuri and her hair. Despite having long locks, Stephen has been used to his wife doing his daughter's hair, so when she is unavailable right before a big event, Stephen will have to figure it out on his own. This sounds simple enough, but we soon come to find that Zuri's hair has a mind of its own. 
This story was born out of seeing a lack of representation in mainstream animated projects, and also wanting to promote hair love amongst young men and women of color. It is our hope that this project will inspire.
I've had the idea for this project for a couple of years now, but it wasn't until I recently started coming across a lot of viral videos of black fathers interacting with their sons and daughters online that I finally had the confidence to try and make this a real thing. Below are great examples of some of the great viral videos I have come across in the past year:
Through this project, it is my hope that we can show a positive image of black fathers and their daughters, while encouraging natural hair and self-love throughout the world through the animated space.
CHARACTERS:
ZURI (Daughter)
 STEPHEN (DAD)
ANGELA (Natural Hair Vlogger)
ROCKY (Pet Cat)
Meet the crew:
MATTHEW A. CHERRY (WRITER/CO-DIRECTOR)
This will be my first attempt at an animated project, but my 3rd Kickstarter campaign and I am super excited about this project. Previously, I directed two Live-action feature films: The Last Fall and 9 Rides, both of which premiered at SXSW, as well as, two Live-action short films: This Time and Forward, in addition to many music videos.
JASON MARINO (CO-DIRECTOR)
I will be co-directing this short film with the incredible 3D artist, Jason Marino. I came across his short film, Tamara on Twitter a few months ago and tracked him down so we could collaborate on this project. Check out his short film, Tamara below.
VASHTI HARRISON (CHARACTER DESIGNER)
Vashti Harrison is a remarkable artist and filmmaker in her own right. Vashti illustrated all of the 2D character designs featured in our Kickstarter campaign. Vashti is also ramping up to release her first children's book Little Leaders: Bold Women in Black History, which you can pre-order right here: https://t.co/m554qLrvi4. You can also check out some more of her work below
 PETER RAMSEY (Executive Producer)
Peter Ramsey is a legend in the animation game, and we are so fortunate to have him be a part of this project as an Executive Producer. Peter was the first African American director to direct a big studio, feature-length, animated film, Rise of The Guardians, and he is currently co-directing Sony's new animated Spider Man film that will feature, Miles Morales for Sony. Peter, is also an accomplished story board artist.
FRANK ABNEY (Executive Producer)
Frank Abney is another legend in the animation game that we are super excited to have as a part of this project. Frank was named one of Variety's, 10 Animators to Watch in 2016. Frank has worked on projects such as, Big Hero 6, Frozen, Kung Fu Panda 3, The Boss Baby, and Coco and is currently working on the upcoming Incredibles 2, while continuing to develop his own projects and short films. Frank is a valuable asset to the team. He likes to work on projects that spotlight strong African-American characters and illuminate key events from African-American history. 
MONICA A. YOUNG  (Producer)
Monica Young has worked with me on all of my projects on the producing side and is another invaluable resource to the team. Emerging from the music industry, she has recently added film and TV producing to her repertoire. Monica is a super knowledgeable and experienced producer that will be helping to coordinate all of the music on the film, ranging from helping with composer selection to curating all other necessary music.
JEROME CALDWELL (Producer)
Jerome Caldwell was a producer on my latest feature film, 9 Rides and has been a resource on a lot of my prior projects. He is a great partner when it comes to producing and getting films done, and more than that he is a great person whose knowledge and expertise will be invaluable in getting this project completed, especially in the post-production phase.
VAUGHN GILL (Producer)
Vaughn Gill initially worked with me as the attorney for my first feature "The Last Fall." He served as one of the Executive Producers on my webseries "Almost 30" as well as my second feature "9 Rides." As a Producer, Attorney and a Father who has had the "Hair Love" experience his expertise will be tremendously helpful in completing this project.
BUDGET BREAKDOWN - 200k Stretch Goal
Storyboarding - 5k
3D Character Designs - 10k
Environment Design - 10k
Visual Development On Characters & Environments (Plus Color Script) - 10k
Character Modeling, Texturing, and Rigging - 10k
Environment Modeling & Texturing - 10k
Hair, Fur, and Clothes animation - 15k
Lighting/Rendering/Compositing - 10k
Animation - 15k
Editing - 10k
Sound Design & Music Composition - 10k
Animation Producer - 10K
VFX - 5K
Business & Legal Expenses - 25k
Kickstarter Gifts & Shipping - 25k
Kickstarter Fees - 20k
CONCLUSION
We have our goal set for $75k, but we are now trying to raise $200K or more to make this project at the highest quality level we can make it. The more we raise, the more people we can hire to work on it. We are aiming to do it in the same vein as other Pixar animated, short films, and as we all know animation is more costly than traditional Live-action projects and every little bit helps. Thanks so much for checking this project out, and I hope you'll help to support it. Sincerely, thank you. 
-Matthew A. Cherry
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge with the project is going to be managing the pipeline of the animation work. As you all know animation is a huge undertaking and most animated hollywood films cost around a million dollars a minute to produce. We are confident that with our partner's at Nimble Collective that we will be able to manage the work flow and hire some great animators to get this project done in a fairly short period of time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
