Prior to working at Pixar, Frank Abney has worked on Academy Award winning films "Frozen", and "Big Hero 6" while at Disney, "Kung Fu Panda 3" and "The Boss Baby", at DreamWorks Animation, and is currently at Pixar finishing work on their next film "Coco".
We are also including a digital download of our the movie and will include your name in our end credits in our Digital Producer section. No other physical gifts will be included with this perk.
We only have 10 slots available so get in while you can.

support.title: iPhone Filmmaking Workshop w/ M. Cherry
support.descp:
As a special limited gift we are offering limited access to a special live online 4 hour iPhone Filmmaking workshop with 9 Rides Writer/Director Matthew A. Cherry and 9 Rides Director Of Photography Richard Vialet. Matthew and Richard will talk through the process of how they made 9 Rides with two iPhone 6s's and teach you how to use the Filmic Pro app as well as the other tools we used to make the movie (The Beast Grip Pro Rig and the Moondog Labs Anamorphic Lens). We will also answer questions and provide advice on making content with your iPhone.
Matthew is a former NFL player turned filmmaker his first feature film The Last Fall premiered at SXSW 2012 and is available to stream on Netflix. His 2nd feature film 9 Rides was shot on two iPhone 6s's and premiered at SXSW 2016. Richard is an accomplished Director Of Photography that shot both of Matthew's feature film's The Last Fall & 9 Rides he currently is working with Tyler Perry and Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta.
We are also including a digital download of the Filmic Pro app as well as a download of 9 Rides and Hair Love (once it becomes available) and will include your name in our end credits in our Digital Producer section. No other physical gifts will be included with this perk.
We only have 10 slots available so get in while you can.

updates.update_content: Hey everyone. You all may have received an email from me from my personal email address at cherryentertainment@hotmail.com or cherry2_bsi@Hotmail.com in past few weeks about getting your current mailing address to receive your Kickstarter gifts. It is indeed me reaching out to you and not spam or a hacker. For whatever reason I'm losing access to the backer reports directly through kickstarter next week and it's just easier for me to track through email than through here. I still have a few more gift tiers to send emails out to so please give me a few days before you reach out and say that you haven't received it yet. Most of the gifts should be out to you in the next few weeks. Like always thanks for the support and your patience.

I just wanted to take the time this morning to thank each and everyone one of you for supporting and believing in Hair Love as early as you did. No matter what happens tonight we already won and you all are apart of an Oscar nominated animated short film and a New York Times Best Selling Picture Book. Thank you again for your support. 
-Matthew A. Cherry

Hey everyone, first of all I want to apologize for how long it has taken to get these gifts out to everyone. Last year was somewhat of a crazy year for me trying to get the film finished and top of getting it out there plus having a full time job and directing but still no excuse. In a perfect world would have liked to have gotten these out by Christmas. With that said most of the gifts are in my possession and I'm excited to finally be able to get these out to everyone. If you have moved recently or never filled out the survey please try and send us your updated shipping address as soon as you can. The only gifts that I do not have yet are the Zuri dolls (That will take another 4-6 months to create and ship), and we have a limited supply of the Hair Love pins so if you don't get them in this batch I will ship them out individually at a later date, and we're still figuring out the Making Of Coffee Table book. Also lastly about the digital download; now that we're Oscar nominated we're going to be hitting theaters in select cities on a tour with all the shorts through Shorts International and there are a lot of tricky eligibility issues that we have to navigate with the film. With that said to be safe we won't be sending out the digital download link until after the Oscars on February 9th. I hope you all understand. Now that we're with Sony Animation it's a bigger conversation and we're trying to be smart about maintaining our eligibility throughout this month long window we have before Oscar night. Our Kickstarter backers will still be the first group of people to own the film and we look forward to getting the film out to you as soon as we are able.
Guys we did it!!!!! Cannot thank you all enough for believing in this project. Words can't express our gratitude. We did it! From a kickstarter campaign to an Oscar nominated short film!

campaign.story:
NEW ART ADDED:
      Hi! My name is Ross Tran and welcome to World of Nima! I’m a digital illustrator for the Entertainment Industry and I’ve been producing videos for my YouTube channel RossDraws for almost two years.
Nima is my original character whose story and world I've been developing for the last 4 years. Nima is a combination of all my childhood influences and inspirations and I want to inject every bit of life from the grand adventures I experienced as a kid into my own personal world.
Nima’s story takes place in a world with hauntingly beautiful and vibrant locations. I want Nima’s world to excite people the way I was drawn into the world of Avatar the Last Airbender. I draw a lot of inspiration from anime like Full Metal Alchemist, fighting games like Super Smash Bros., and movies like Spirited Away. Nima’s world will take you through an expansive and magical journey with a dynamic cast of companions, travelers, and enemies. This book will show my vision from start to finish, depicting this vivid world with scribbles, sketches, key scenes and cinematic paintings.
Every page will be crafted with care with a mixture of Typography, Layout, Graphic Design and Digital Illustrations.
  The book is the first step into introducing Nima to the world.
           SHIPPING - 
Shipping will be handled through the Pledge Manager! Please enter a 'safe' address to have the book and rewards sent to since the Development of the book can take some time. If you do change your information the time it's shipped, please leave a forwarding address with your local post office. I frequently will be updating you on the process and completion of the book, so incase you break up with your girlfriend or boyfriend, you still have time to change your address and get the book safely :)
CREDITS -
Ross Tran - Creator - Artist
Youtube
Instagram
Facebook
Brent Ashe - Logo Design and Branding Help
Instagram
Hamps - Theme song Composer
https://soundcloud.com/grynpyret
ABOUT ME:
Ross Tran moved to LA to pursue a design career at 17. By 19, he designed a character for a feature film. He's worked in the industry for the past 6 years. Some of his clients include Samsung, Riot and Disney. He now works on his own franchises and produces videos for his YouTube channel RossDraws.

Some clients include:
  Thank you so much for your support! It's my dream to bring Nima's adventure and world to life. With your help, I can take my first step on this journey and I can't wait to bring you along!
-Ross
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first book so there will be challenges in my way, but I'm highly prepared to develop my own project and bring it to life. I graduated from Art Center College of Design, known as one of the hardest working schools in existence. 

Note that there could be unexpected challenges and factors that affect the delivery date of the book such as weather, politics, and convention dates. If anything arises, you'll be the first to know. 

I'll be sure to have great communication with publishing, printing, shipping and you, my supporters, to make sure things go smoothly. I'm based in the US so less risk is involved through distribution. I can't wait for you to see the book!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The cover designs are still in progress. Cooper is currently working on the final painting. Please check back again for updates.
 Thank you to everyone for making this Kickstarter campaign a smashing success! We are grateful to you all! Please watch the updates for the latest news or visit our website at fleskpublications.com.
Welcome to our J.A.W. Cooper Kickstarter campaign! With your support we are bringing you a gorgeous selection of books, prints, and more. Thanks for looking!
Cooperset! (Samples not shown to scale.)
We have an amazing selection of items that highlight the artwork of J.A.W. Cooper, including:
Three 64 page books titled Familiars, Flora & Fauna, and Viscera. Update--Stretch Goal #1 Unlocked: Flora & Fauna is now 80 pages!
The hardcover set includes a slipcase to house all three books.
A premium 18 x 24 inch signed and numbered print of "Sticks and Stones." No Longer Available!
A premium 18 x 24 inch signed and numbered print of "Shapeshifter."
A postcard set featuring Cooper's travel gouache works.
Three exquisite enamel pins to complement the three books.
Four exclusive 8 x 10 inch bonus prints included with every pledge of $25 or more!
The Fig Frog enamel pin is included with every pledge of $25 or more!
The prints are exclusive to this campaign and will be limited to the number of pledges made.
Stretch Goal #4 Unlocked! We will add the 1 inch enamel pin "Fig Frog" to every pledge of $25 or more! This pin will only be available through this Kickstarter campaign. (Note that the design and colors are in progress and may change.) One pin per person.
Four exclusive bonus Kickstarter prints will be included with any tier selected of $25 or more. One set per person.
Mature Warning: These items contain drawings of boobs and butts! We understand that some of you may find nude subjects, even those of the elegant and artistic nature found in J.A.W. Cooper's works, to make you uncomfortable or may even outright offend you. We feel that the nudes in these books are graceful, playful, and charming. This is fair warning that as cute and cuddly as Cooper’s art is, it is intended for a mature audience and for those who are 18 years or older.
We will update these covers as the paintings and final designs are completed. Thanks!
  J.A.W. Cooper Books
A three-book complementary set compiling the best of J.A.W. Cooper’s drawings and paintings. There are tattooed women, smug animals, grotesque figures, sensuous paintings, and anything else that comes out of her twisted mind. (Mostly naked, of course.)
Each of these books is 9 x 12" at 64 pages each. (Flora & Fauna is now 80 pages!) Together, these three titles contain 208 pages of the very best of Cooper's pencil sketches, red pencil preparatory drawings, pen illustrations and paintings.
Familiars book design in progress.
  Drawing on themes of the occult, Familiars explores animals as allegories for the human condition—a physical projection of that which is clandestine. This book is 9 x 12 inches with 70 artworks spanning 64 pages. Available as individual paperback, or as the first of the hardcover three book set.
Flora & Fauna book design in progress.
Flora and Fauna delves into the atmospheric and relational qualities between people, animals, and nature. This title showcases her command of the animal kingdom and passion for drawing from real subjects. This book is 9 x 12 inches with 90 artworks spanning 80 pages. Available as individual paperback, or as the second of the hardcover three book set.
Viscera book design in progress.
A journey into the violent, steaming innards of making art—raw, spontaneous and unfettered—Viscera explores instinct and intuition as the spark of artistic creation, to delight the feral child at our core. This book is 9 x 12 inches with 70 artworks spanning 64 pages. Available as individual paperback, or as the third of the hardcover three book set.
Two premium 18 x 24 inch signed and numbered prints are available!
The first print is of Cooper's alluring painting "Sticks and Stones" that was only available for the first 3 days of this campaign. The print is limited to those who pledged for it during this short time frame. Thanks to those who picked it up!
The second print is of the exquisite painting "Shapeshifter." This print will be limited to those who pledge support for its production during this Kickstarter campaign only.
J.A.W. Cooper Postcard Set
A postcard set that features five of Cooper's personal favorite gouache works completed during her travels. Place a stamp and use these postcards to share stories of your own personal adventures with friends, family, or let your cats back at home know how much fun you are having without them.
These enamel pins are only available as a set in the "Cooperset" and "Everything" tiers. These will not be available outside of this Kickstarter campaign.
What better way to shine than by fastening an exquisite enamel pin designed by Cooper to your outerwear? These three enamel pins are the perfect companions to the books. Each will be expertly made under Cooper's supervision. The drawings above will give you a taste of what they will look like. Please note that the designs may fluctuate slightly during production based upon what is feasible to do with the manufacturer. We're looking forward to making these as exquisite as possible. They will be a minimum of 1 inch in size. The enamel pins will only be made upon the successful completion of this campaign.
Original Art Tiers--SOLD OUT!
Here's a rare opportunity to obtain an original piece of art by Cooper. She rarely, if ever, sells her pencil or ink drawings. Each original art tier is paired with the FIRST 3-DAY "EVERYTHING" FLASH SALE tier to guarantee that you don't miss a thing. This tier can be selected at any time during the 30 day campaign. This is for the ultimate J.A.W. Cooper patron!
In addition, each of these originals will appear in one of the books.
A. "Conquerer" 8.5 x 10.5 inch, ink on acid-free 50lb bond paper
B. "Moth Friend" 8 x 11 inch, colored pencil on acid-free 50lb bond paper
C. "Bear Family" 10 x 8 inch, graphite on acid-free 50lb bond paper
D. "Salamander And Lion" 10 x 8 inch, graphite on acid-free 50lb bond paper
E. "Tattooed Back" 8 x10 inch, ink on acid-free 50lb bond paper
F. "Girlfriends" 8 x 10 inch, ink on acid-free 50lb bond paper
Original Art Note: Drawings may fade over time in direct sunlight; be sure to take steps when framing and deciding where to hang these pieces to guard against premature sun damage.
 Four Kickstarter Bonus Prints!
Exclusive Kickstarter Bonus Prints! We will include an 8 x 10 inch print of the pencil art for "Rattle" and "Safe Passage," plus, prints for "Smug POS Dogs" and "Smug POS Cats" by Cooper for all pledges of $25 or more.
Stretch goals are bonus items that are added to the campaign as we hit certain goals. These are additional items that are free upgrades. As we gain more support, we offer more rewards as a special thank you.
UNLOCKED--Stretch Goal #1 -- We will add an extra 16 pages to the Flora & Fauna book that will feature more animal drawings by Cooper. This will raise the page count for this one book from 64 pages to 80 pages!
Hardcover set slipcase design in progress.
UNLOCKED Stretch Goal #2 -- We will add a slipcase to house the three book hardcover set. In addition, we will add the second 8 x 10 inch bonus print of "Safe Passage" to all pledges for $25 or more.
UNLOCKED Stretch Goal #3 -- We love prints, and we love the idea of giving more of them away. We will include two more 8 x 10 inch prints featuring Cooper’s Smug POS Cat’s, and her equally Smug POS Dog’s, to everyone who has pledged $25 or more!
UNLOCKED Stretch Goal #4 -- We will add the 1 inch enamel pin "Fig Frog" to every pledge of $25 or more! This pin will only be available through this Kickstarter campaign. (Note that the design and colors are in progress and may change.) One per person.
The four bonus prints are available as one set per person.
Add-on anything to anything! An Add-On lets you pledge for more than one tier by adding the price of any additional tier to your existing pledge. Say you want to include an extra set of postcards? Simply add-on an additional $10 to your pledge and let us know. Want two of something? Double the pledge and let us know that you would like two of them. Please also double the shipping charge. Easy-peasy.
You can expect to receive your pledges by October. Since the books and prints have been designed already we will send them to the printer within a couple of weeks after the campaign ends if we hit our goal. It takes approximately three months for everything to be printed, then to be delivered to us. We will ship them to everyone immediately upon their arrival at our Flesk warehouse in Santa Cruz, CA.
All items shipped within the U.S.A. are by USPS Mail and will include tracking. The items shipped to our international friends usually take 3 weeks for delivery, but can sometimes take up to 3-6 weeks depending on the country. We know that shipping overseas is very expensive and we wish it was cheaper, too! We help by subsidizing some of the cost. We make no money from the shipping.
Sample book spread from Familiars
  JOHN'S THOUGHTS ON J.A.W. COOPER
The first time I saw Cooper's art was when she submitted to Spectrum: The Best in Contemporary Fantastic Art. This is when her art smugly entered my life, sat in front of me to show itself off, and literally caused a pause in time. I couldn't help but to absorb and enjoy her art for an undetermined (translates to very long) amount of time. This moment repeats itself every time I see a new piece of hers. She has the perfect mixture between the informed sciences and the surreal as she stretches reality into an abundance of unique views that constantly amazes. The intelligence and cleverness of her drawings are simply extraordinary.
Sample book spread from Viscera
 ABOUT J.A.W. COOPER
J.A.W. Cooper was born in England to a South African/British mother and an American father - both freshwater ecologists. She grew up traveling for their research and professor exchanges, living in Kenya, Sweden, Ireland and traveling across Europe. Home base was Southern California between trips, sabbaticals, and longer stays in other countries. Her mother always practiced art, in particular scientific illustration, and from an early age she was eager to learn how to perform the same kind of "magic." Between my parent's dedication to ecology, our extensive traveling, and her mother's skill as an artists, Cooper was primed to be fascinated with flora and fauna and obsessed with capturing them in sketches and paintings.
Sample spread from Flora & Fauna
  A message from the Publisher, John Fleskes: What Kickstarter offers is the opportunity to create and do what we love, while connecting and giving back to our supporters in a personal way. This makes the process much more enjoyable than if we simply worked behind closed doors. It is also gratifying to have the opportunity to continually add value to the project through stretch goals. I've never felt that we are making products. Instead, we are making unique art books and prints. This is done with great care to best allow us to showcase Cooper's art in a way that we can be proud of. We hope that you will cherish them just as much as we do.
All artwork is © 2017 J.A.W. Cooper. All Rights Reserved
Video and text used for this campaign is © 2017 J.A.W. Cooper and Flesk Publications. All Rights Reserved.
fleskpublications.com
jawcooper.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John Fleskes answers:

I pride myself on having a fifteen year record of delivering over eighty books of the highest quality. I've run six previous Kickstarter campaigns, with Brom, Frank Cho, Petar Meseldzija, Richard and Wendy Pini, Mark Schultz, and Daren Bader and Lance HaunRogue. Most of these have been on time. We are very open with our backers and communicate through updates often to keep you up to date. 

In some cases, things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published over eighty books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands when I said I would.

I can't thank everyone enough who has supported us before. You directly help us to make these beautiful books.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone,
We want to send out a big THANK YOU to all our kickstarter supporters who supported this project! All the rewards have been shipped out! If you did not receive your package yet, please send us a private message and we can help you from there!
As a reminder, here is how the actual packages work.

Hi All,
We’ve been getting a lot of questions from our international supporters who may not have received their rewards yet. To all our supporters who are still waiting for your packages, rest assured, they are on their way!
We use a special service provided by FedEx called International Mail Service. This service does not provide a tracking number. It would cost much more to ship overseas using a regular USPS ($72.00), UPS, or FedEx ($187.00) service using a tracking number. We’ve used this International Mail Service from FedEx for 5 years now, and it works great to provide our international friends with a cost efficient service. FedEx ships the packages direct to your local Postal Office, and then the package will be delivered to you right along with your regular mail. It saves you guys a bunch of money, and is a reliable service. Packages usually take less than 5 weeks to arrive, but in rare cases can take longer.

Cooper visited us last Friday to sign all of the deluxe prints. We are rolling them in tubes today and are shipping them out this week.
We added a unique touch to these prints to mark these as official prints from Cooper and Flesk. Cooper created custom original designs which we used to make blocks to stamp onto the back of each print using pewter paint. Each of these stamps are hand set with no two looking alike. The imperfections of them make them perfect.

campaign.story:
Hi there!
My name's Ashley Cope and I'm the creator of Unsounded, a high fantasy adventure graphic novel. Unsounded is published online for free right now and you can read it for yourself at http://www.unsoundedcomic.com.
The comic stars Sette Frummagem, a streetwise young pickpocket eager to please her dad, the local King of Thieves. In order to prove her worth, Sette is sent across the continent to collect on a debt from her cousin, with no one to protect her but a mysterious man named Duane who... happens to be undead.
Battling and sneaking their ways past human traffickers, corrupt police officers, heroic royal guardsmen, nihilistic mages, and desperate criminals, our protagonists finally arrived at the headquarters of Sette's cousin. The second book ended on a tense note, with an injured Sette leading a menacing slaver back to a Love Hotel bedroom where there awaited a ravenous, oblivious, man-eating Duane!
Now, in the third book, things get really weird. With a friend at your elbow though, you can survive almost anything... even the flip-side of reality. Even a pain-eating genocidal superweapon. Even a whorehouse musical!
Unsounded is rated PG-13 for occasional rough language and violence. There are also a lot of boobs. Sometimes they talk!
What's this Kickstarter for?
Let's print Volume 3! Like the first two books it will be a professionally offset printed, perfect-bound, softcover tome. It will include chapters 7,8, and 9 of the comic, weighing in at 300 pages - what a beast! This is the longest of the books so far, with some of my favourite art and definitely some of the fan-favourite interactions and story twists! All comic art will be edited and retouched, and there'll be new interior illustrations. If the stretch goals are met I'll add additional, print-exclusive content. Would you like a senet bestiary?
I also desperately need to reprint the first volume (again!) and hopefully reprint the second as well. Check out the stretch goals below for the skinny on that.
GOOD v. EVIL - Put your mark on Unsounded
I'm super stoked to be offering two KS exclusive 1" x 1.25" metallic hard enamel pins!
But you'll have to look deep inside yourself, backer, and determine your true nature. Do you cling to your best days? Do you focus on the positive and keep a khert-fish ever pinned to your pocket? Or do you walk beneath a dark cloud, smoke eels in your shadow, fixated on entropy and the inevitable end of yourself and all things? You can only choose ONE pin, so choose wisely! Whichever design sells the most will determine the art on the back of Volume 3. Will it be an illustration of the merry Adeliers, or the diabolical Frummagems? Duane's best days or Sette's worst? You decide.
These are Kickstarter exclusive and will not be kept in stock afterwards.
Stretch Goals!
$55K - An illustrated senet bestiary. Senet beasts are the immortal first inhabitants of the Kasslynian continent, predating mankind and privy to the deepest secrets of the world. These mysterious creatures are mostly extinct, but the extant remainders range from silk-spinning worms to cannibalistic, mind-altering viper-men, to the water-blooded waterwomen and their airheaded brothers, the stormbringers.
$60k - An illustrated short story. Duane was not a man of means in his younger days, and a desire to line his pockets drove him towards an unsavoury pursuit.
$70k - Every copy of Volume 3 will come with a cool new sticker and bookmark.
$80k - MOAR BOOKS. With enough dough I'll be able to reprint the entirety of the series to date, concluding with volume 2! This will allow me to open up that Complete Set Tier to the options of pins and bookplates, so that anyone who wants pretty much anything is able to pick it up. Until then, my stock is unfortunately limited to the 7 boxes left under my bed.
$100k - In this impossible and dystopian future, every copy of volume 3 will come with a set of Unsounded art prints. This amount will not be reached, let us be satisfied with the reality into which we were born.
Thank you.
Unsounded only continues to exist because of the support of its readers!. When you support the comic you become a direct patron of a independent story delivered ad-free and unfiltered to your eyes, creator to reader, without any middlemen in-between. I hope you'll consider making a purchase. If you have any questions about the rewards, feel free to comment here or email me at murkoph@gmail.com
I also must say a big, sloppy Thank You to everyone at the Unsounded Tumblr, every little reprobate on /co/, and to my good friend Celesse over at Sugar Bunny Shop who knows much more about the business of art than I ever will.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm a one person organisation. Everything is packed up and shipped out by me. I've run two of these campaigns successfully at this point and I'm pretty confident in my abilities, though I always appreciate patience when it comes to the signed copies and fancier incentives. I want to deliver my best to you!

So please pledge with confidence and know that I will work my very hardest to get you your books or other items in a timely manner. Thank you for believing in me!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Today's shipment is awaiting pick-up on a pretty nice and sunny Florida day~

As of today, I have every order that does not include a bookplate out the door. This leaves about 380 bookplate orders left to go. Every survey has been sent out. Thanks to everyone who's let me know their order has arrived, and thanks to everyone else for being so sweet and patient. Fulfilment's gone very smoothly!
If you know anyone who missed out on the Kickstarter, volume 3 is now available for regular purchase in the Unsounded comic shop. Give someone you love a book of rotting corpses and unwashed child feet this Christmas. Comes with metaphysical squid fish and existential criminal angst.

Hey guys!
Books are at my house and I started shipping orders this week. Things to know:
--I'm a single person doing all this by herself, so it's slow. To stay organized I do a tier at a time, which I prioritize by volume and speed so I can get the most stuff out of my house the fastest. I do not send out the address survey for a tier until I am nearly ready to start shipping it. Kickstarter's backend becomes a mess otherwise.

Manufacturers are sloooow. Just wanted you to know I haven't forgotten about you, backers. I approved a sample wet sheet from the printer yesterday and the pins are still in production. We're still six weeks away from volume 3 arriving at my door, they say.
All the Volume 1's are sent out though. If you only pledged for volume 1, you're golden. I think only 3 people in that tier have yet to send me their shipping address: acr, C. Argentieri, W. Christopher.

Hey guys! I wish I had a more tangible update for you, but right now I'm at the mercy of the manufacturers. I was hoping to have pins in hand (and shipped) by the time I had to break for Otakon, but I guess I chose a questionable manufacturer. They messed up the die, I'm told, and haven't even been able to get me the samples yet! Just a picture of samples?

updates.update_userinfo: Can't Get Offa This Train We're On
updates.update_content: Update! I got my expedited copies of the Volume 1 reprint today and for those people who were concerned the reprint would be different or inferior - no worries. These look identical to the first printing. I cannot tell them apart from the lone copy I had left - and it's a good thing some insane people scribbled all over that one at Metrocon a few years ago or I wouldn't know it was the old printing at all ;)

A short progress report, my lovelies, to keep you in the loop.
The Volume 1 reorder was placed, and those are about two months off. It takes the printer two weeks to manufacture and then six weeks to ship via the salty ocean. I ordered 1500 copies so hopefully I never have to reprint this sucker again. I also ordered an extra 50 copies expedited via airmail so I'll have those on hand at Otakon which I will be attending in August. Come see meee.

And that's a wrap for the campaign! Thanks to everyone who pledged - you should feel pretty good about yourself! You're directly responsible, in part, for the continuation of something you must like at least a little bit, and I can think of fewer things better to roll out of bed for each day than art.
So what's next? Kickstarter is going to do its thing, charge everyone's cards, get the money together. It takes a fortnight, then it transfers the money to me so I can order your goodies. We didn't raise enough for a volume 2 reprint, but we did get the extra print content paid for and also bookmarks and stickers. Not shabby at all!

campaign.story:
Gold and black hard cloisonné enamel
Negative space triangle cutout 
Butterfly clutch backing
 $1+ Thank You!
Even if you can only spare a few bucks, I appreciate every penny! Thanks for helping get this project off the ground!
$15+ Faithful Familiar
Have a favorite? At this tier, you'll get a single Arcane Animal pin of your choice.
$25+ Casting Companions
Can't choose, or want to share with a friend? This tier gets you two pins of your choice.
$35+ Totem Triad
You can probably tell where this is going -- pledge at this tier, and you'll get three pins of your choice! Collect all three designs, or get multiples of your favorite.
$45+ Sacred Square
This tier gets you four pins of your choice. Mix and match from all the unlocked stretch goals to build your own custom animal dream team!
$55+ Pagan Pentad
You guessed it -- pledge at this tier to get five pins in the designs and colors of your choice.
$65+ Arcane Assembly
Now that's commitment! At this tier, you'll get six pins of your choice, so you can collect all three animal designs in both color options. 
April - Kickstarter launches!
May - Kickstarter ends! If successful, pins go into production. Once the designs are approved, manufacturing takes about 3-4 weeks.
June - I receive the pins from the manufacturer and begin the laborious (but joyful!) process of shipping them to all of you!
July - Barring any shipping mishaps, everyone should have their pins in hand by the end of July!
  60% - Pin production! Pretty self explanatory -- this covers the nitty-gritty of getting these pins manufactured. 
30% - Shipping! This covers the costs of all shipping involved -- from the manufacturer to me, and then from me to you!
10% - Safety buffer! This is to account for Kickstarter fees, payment processing, and any miscalculations or unforeseen expenses.
My initial goal of $600 covers manufacturing, shipping, and Kickstarter fees for an order of 100 pins in a single design. For every additional $300 raised, another pin design will be unlocked!
Hey all! Thanks for checking out my humble Kickstarter! 
My name is Molly Alice Hoy, and I'm an illustrator and comic artist based in LA. When I'm not illustrating kids' books or drawing comics, I enjoy working on smaller side projects like designing patches, prints, and enamel pins. Turning these designs into real live products, however, often means meeting order minimums that can easily run hundreds of dollars. As an indie artist, it's rare that I have that much disposable cash in one place at any given time! 
In January, I turned to Kickstarter and successfully funded my first pin design. Now I'm back with some new designs and a more ambitious goal. Your Kickstarter pledge not only scores you a cool pin (or two! or maybe three!), but it also helps directly support me and make my dream of an indie art career possible. Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The fact that this is a small project with a modest goal mitigates a lot of the risks and challenges that other projects face. Having gone through the process of funding, ordering, and shipping a run of pins once already, I have a pretty good idea of what I’m in for this go-round. On top of that, I’ve done my best to allot generous buffers in both my budget and timeline to account for any oversights or mishaps that might arise during production and shipping. And of course I’ll be sure to keep my backers up to date in the event that any such mishaps arise!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: I'm so excited and relieved to announce that the corrected owl and cat pins FINALLY arrived yesterday, which means that everyone's rewards will be shipping out first thing TOMORROW! (Monday, 8/21)

Whew! So it seems I've finally gotten everything ironed out with the manufacturer, and replacement owl and kitty pins are in the works. I should be receiving those next week, and once I have them I'll be shipping them out asap.
Wolf pins finally went out TODAY, so folks who only ordered wolf pins can expect to get their rewards this week. Apologies for the delay!
And a million thanks to everyone for being so patient! As bummed as I am that I couldn't get these rewards to you as promptly as I would have liked, it's more important to me to be able to ship a product that I'm 100% pleased with and proud of. The wolf pins look great, so I'm optimistic that the corrected owl and cat pins will be just as handsome. I can't wait to have the whole set all together so I can finally, FINALLY get these pins in your hands!

Welp! I guess things were going a little TOO smoothly. I received the pins from the manufacturer only to find that the owls and kitties were made to the wrong size specifications.
I'm working with the manufacturer right now to get it resolved, but that does mean that rewards shipping will be delayed by at least a few weeks as the new, corrected pins get made. Folks who only ordered wolf pins are in luck, however, as those ARE the correct size and will be shipping out on time.
Eek! The manufacturers sent me a little sneak peek of the black kitty pins last night, and I had to share!

updates.update_content:
Hooray! White and rose gold owl pins are now funded, and with 12 days left in the campaign, I'm optimistic that the latter two stretch goals will be unlocked as well! 
To accommodate the new stretch goal designs, I've added three new reward tiers. So if you're looking at the new rose gold options and thinking that perhaps three pins aren't quite enough, you now have the option to increase your pledge and take home four, five, or even all six designs.

(technically we did it on day 5 when the owl pins were funded, but now we've reached the goal that I ACTUALLY had in mind all along)
That's right, all three pin designs have now been unlocked! This means every backer will get their choice of owl, kitty, or wolf pin, and those who opted to collect all three will, in fact, get the full trio! (whew!)
But we're barely to the halfway point of the campaign, so I'm rolling out some stretch goals that I think you guys are really going to like...

campaign.story:
The ArCANIS Tarot consists of a full 78 card Tarot deck, complete with its own limited edition, custom designed tuck box. The cards themselves are printed on 3.5"x5.5", high quality, 350gsm card stock with rounded corners, so they're built to last even after you've given your hundreth relationship reading to that one friend of yours that asks every week... you know the one. 
There are 22 Major Arcana cards, and 56 Minor Arcana cards, split into 14 cards of 4 different suits - swords, wands, pentacles, and cups.
Major Arcana
 The Major Arcana are the twenty-two trump cards at the beginning of a tarot deck. Each of these cards bearing a specific name and number carries a significant meaning when pulled during a reading, and are typically considered the most important cards in the deck. They are usually the first things a new tarot user will learn.
0 - The Fool. Bringer of Beginnings
  08 - Strength - Conquer Your Fears
 

The Minor Arcana
The Minor Arcana are the 4 suits, with 14 cards in each, that make up the rest of the 78 card tarot deck. Typically, they are sorted as Swords, Wands, Pentacles, and Cups. They serve to clarify detail and nuances in a person's tarot reading, depending where in the spread they lay. Think of them more as signifying changes or insight into your day-to-day life, whereas the Major Arcana is typically interpreted as having a more significant telling or impact - signaling a larger turning point in your life.
Three of Swords - Difficulty, Loneliness, Betrayal
  Ace of Wands - Confidence, Courage, Self Expression
  Four of Pentacles - Greed, Control, Obstruction
  Three of Cups - Friendship, Working Together, Celebration
   
The ArCANIS Tarot Art Book is a 6"x8", 168 page, full color, hardcover book, designed to accompany the deck. Complete with written interpretations and meanings of the cards themselves, as well as popular tarot spreads for multiple types of readings, this book is for both the tarot expert and the newcomer who is just beginning to learn. The book can also act as a stand alone on its own for backers who just want to see the art in collection, who may or may not be interested in receiving an actual deck.
    For the $16,000 stretch goal, I'll be able to have the cards foil stamped on both the front and back! The front and back border around the cards, and the silver area of the four suit design on the back of the entire deck will be foil stamped in silver.
For the $17,500 stretch goal, ALL BACKERS who pledged at the Hermit or Magician tier and above (Including the sold out $25 early-backer tiers) will receive a hard enamel pin - where the final design will be voted on in a final poll by backers!
 
The ArCANIS Tarot combines simple, modern character design with a love of animals. People can be very particular about the deck they use for their own readings, and with this in mind, I found it important to invest in designing a deck I would purchase for myself. I have wanted to illustrate a deck for nearly ten years, but could never find a design aesthetic that felt "right". There were many false starts over the years, but the moment I designed the Devil card for Inktober this past year, I knew I hit what I was looking for. 

I created the initial softcover book of the 22 Major Arcana for the CTN Animation Expo in November. The response I received at the Expo was so amazing that it really pushed me to make the full deck! To make things even better... I partnered with CTN's founder, Tina Price, to turn the original illustrations into a full gallery show, opening July 28th, at her amazing Center Stage Gallery in Burbank!
Center Stage Gallery in Burbank, CA
  Center Stage Gallery in Burbank, CA
    David DePasquale is a Los Angeles based visual development artist in the animation industry. He has done work for Nickelodeon, Disney Television Animation, and is currently employed at Dreamworks, working on a new, super secret show for Netflix!

Originally from New Jersey, David attended the Fashion Institute of Technology in NYC where he earned his BFA degree in Illustration before moving out to the west coast to pursue his childhood dream - designing for animation. Much of his personal work is influenced by modern design and the artwork of animation masters from the mid-century. 

To check out more of David's work, follow him on Instagram
@davidadepasquale
  My funding goal of $13000 will cover everything from deck and tuck box printing, book printing and binding, non deck/book printing for postcards and prints, shipping costs, and kickstarter fees.
As always, thank you so much for your support and your willingness to help fund this project. This deck has been, far and away, my largest personal artistic undertaking to date. It means a great deal to me, and I hope with your funding, it will mean a great deal to you, too!

- David
*Video music license purchased royalty free. Song composed by Frogard, licensed through AudioJungle.
*Book cover font "BrainFlower" license purchased for use, copywright Denise Bentulan.
*All other work, fonts, banners, video copywright David DePasquale, 2017
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although the entire 78 card deck is completely illustrated, there is still a bit of work to do on the book layout. I'm not a graphic designer, so I'm working with the folks at Global PSD to make sure anything I design will print properly and in time. The book is a huge undertaking, and I'm double and triple checking my card interpretations and spread explanations to be absolutely certain I'm not publishing misinformation. 

With any project involving publishing, whether it's a deck or a book or both, printing is always a risk. I have tried to do as much research as possible to assure I can get any and every reward out on time, and I would rather over estimate a shipping date than not be able to met my backers' expectations. Transparency and consistent communication are something I promise with this and every project I create in the future, and as I continue hitting goal posts with this project (i.e. receiving Hard Proofs of the book and deck, receiving updates with both printing houses regarding every stage of publishing, shipping updates, and any hiccups along the way) I will absolutely, 100% keep my backers informed.

I am always open for questions... after all, we're on this journey together! I couldn't do with without each and every one of you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! I just wanted to post an update regarding shipping and delivery - I shipped everyone's rewards out at the end of September, so everyone who has pledged should have received their rewards by now... in fact, you should have received them a month ago!

If you have not received your reward, a few things may have occurred:

- You have not filled out your Backerkit survey (There are still a small handful of you who have not!)
- You have not fixed your payment info, and were not charged for your pledge (Again, just a small few!)
- Your package is stuck in customs (Bleh!)
- USPS lost your package (Double bleh!)
- Your package was delivered, but swiped :(

Luckily, I have only had a few backers contact me with these issues. I have since sent out replacement packages, and am wrestling with USPS for shipping and product refunds (since they were all insured!)

please contact me! I want to make sure everyone has their stuff! I'll be able to deduce exactly what happened and we'll make sure we get a solution out to you as soon as we can.

- David

updates.update_userinfo: All packages have been shipped! Woohoo!
updates.update_content:
Hey everybody! 

The rest of the packages went out last week via Priority Mail. Yay! Most domestic backers should have received their packages, and International should be arriving this week or next, depending on destination. Please message me if you do not receive your package (Domestic) by this Saturday, October 7th, or (International) by October 14th.

I hope everyone enjoys their rewards! I've been seeing some people posting on Facebook and Instagram and tagging me, and it just makes me so so happy. Please message me with any issues and I'll resolve them as fast as I can. I am out of the country from October 9th-21st, but I have access to my email.

Thank you for allowing me to bring this project to life. I couldn't have done it without each and every one of you. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

Hey everybody!

SHIPPING HAS BEGUN! WHOO HOO!

Hey everybody!

Getting ready to ship! Woohoo! This is your 24hr reminder that I will be locking down addresses in BackerKit, and you will no longer be able to update your address.

If you need to change your address, please head over to this link and put your email in to take you to your survey, or follow the survey link from BackerKit in your email that you received after you completed it. Please note: while I can change addresses manually after I lock them down, this is a huge pain in the butt and I would prefer to not have to do it, so make sure your address is correct!

Can't wait for everyone to receive their decks! They are going out USPS priority shipping and will be done in batches. :)

As always, thank you everyone!

Hey everybody!

The final shipment of books has finally arrived! This means I have everything I need to start shipping, which will begin the week of September 4th! Woo!! Most backers in the Continental United States will receive their orders within 5-7 business days of shipment verification, and most international orders will receive theirs in 2-3 weeks after that, so with any luck, everyone will have their hands on their decks before the end of September! Woohoo!

Advance copies arrived! Whoo!!
My advance copies of the deck and book arrived, and I can't tell you how happy I am with them! Take a peek!

Yay! Another huge step toward fulfillment. Backerkit responses have been locked down and the credit cards for pre-orders and add-ons have been charged. Don't worry if you haven't seen a charge yet, it might take up to 24 hours to hit your cards!

Please note: Pre-Orders are absolutely still open, but pre-orders made after this date may not ship until after the initial September shipments. I will do my best to get every order out the moment I am able!

Thank you, everyone!

Hey everybody!
Tonight WAS the night for survey lock down... but I'll be keeping surveys open for an extra week just to try and wrangle the last few backers!
Please note, this means anyone who has added any additional decks or books or pins or prints to their order will NOT be charged for them until after the 7th of July. This is the new Backerkit lockdown date!

updates.update_userinfo: Three Days Left for Reward Surveys!
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody! I still have some stragglers who haven't filled out their surveys yet. Please keep in mind that if you don't have your survey filled out by 11:59pm June 30th, I cannot guarantee your rewards will ship on time. Even for local pickup, your surveys must be filled out.... it gives me a more cohesive list of who gets what!

Thank you all!

- david

Hey all!

I've gotten a few messages from a small number of backers stating they've never received a survey - sometimes this is due to emails hitting your spam folder, or a slightly misspelled email address. If you still haven't received your survey, head over to this link and input your email address manually:
https://arcanis.backerkit.com

Please feel free to message me if you're having any issues! Thank you!

campaign.story:
Coloring is fun and so are magical girls! Naturally, coloring magical girls will be extra, super fun! Support this project to help me produce a book of beautifully detailed illustrations of original magical girls!

The 8" x 10" (approx. 20cm x 25cm) books will be printed via Smartpress.com on 100# cover, uncoated smooth paper. They will be coil bound along the top. The paper weight has tested well with colored pencil, crayon, and markers. Each page will have a blank backside to avoid problems with bleed of art materials. Books ship worldwide and shipping is free for all US backers.  
Backers receive exclusive access to WIPs of the book art during and after the campaign. Plus, every backer gets a surprise digital coloring page just for supporting the project!
The following is a breakdown of the costs to make this project: 
$350 for Print Production & Shipment
$400 for Art Production
$50 for Fees
$50 Buffer for Additional Costs
$850 GOAL
If more books are produced than needed to fill Kickstarter orders, the additional books will be sold online and at conventions.
After reaching our stretch goals, the book is currently at 25 pages (20 by me and 5 guest pages). Additional pages may become available as the campaign proceeds! Check updates for more information.
This goal unlocked at $1000! This means I will add 5 more illustrations and bring the total number of illustrations to 20! A perforated edge will be on each page for easy removal. 
$1500 funding level, we unlocked detailed backgrounds to all the pages drawn by me. The paper in the book will also be upgraded to thicker stock with no bleed in marker tests. 
 A funding level of $2000 unlocked designs by Guest Artists!
Special Guest 1: We welcome Juri H. Chinchilla to the project! Please visit the update post for more information about her!
Special Guest 2: Runesael has joined us! Please visit the update post for more information about him!
Special Guest 3: KoriMichele is ready to make magical girls! Please visit the update post for more details about their art!
Special Guest 4: We welcome Gilles Bone to the project! Please see the announcement for more info!
Special Guest 5: Our final Special Guest Artist is Drachea Rannak! See the update post for more details.
Bonus Guests: Yoshi Yoshitani & Marco Albiero are also joining the project! Get all the details on their announcement.
Final stretch goal is unlocked! The book is now 28 pages and a new page will be added every $200 from here until the final minute. Let's end this strong! :D 
Thanks to marwaboukarim of TheNounProject for the lock icon.
Your enthusiasm for this project is greatly appreciated! Remember, art WIP for this project will only be available for backers. You can follow my thoughts and other art on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and DeviantArt.
Sample Sketch Design WIP
  Final Page Design Sample
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am making the art during and after the campaign, so part of the fun will be watching the work develop. I do not have any conventions or major obligations this fall so keeping up with this will be my primary focus, however there's always a risk that life could throw in a surprise. For that reason, I've estimated the delivery in March 2017 to account for potential, unexpected events, and to give me enough time to complete all the art, order the books (including a full proof), and get everything shipped. 

I have used this printer before with my pose reference books and they have been fantastically reliable. In the case they cannot do the project for some unforeseen reason, I have additional options for print including through CreateSpace or Lulu.

If you have any questions about me or the project, please feel free to message me. Thanks so much for your considered support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Almost everyone should have the book(s) now! YAY! There is some delay in the tracking info for some deliveries to European countries, but I'm not sure if the tracking just doesn't go to those places or if they are actually delayed. If you do not have a book by Feb 19th, please let me know!
I made a survey for backers and non-backers to get some feedback on where to go with the project. Please fill it out if you have a moment!

updates.update_userinfo: Last Shipping Update & Retail Sale Info!
updates.update_content:
Everyone who backed the Kickstarter (and did their survey ;D) should have shipping info now! Lots of people are already getting their books!! YAY!

You can use #MagicalGirlColoringBook on social media to show off your books or the coloring that you do!
The books will be for sale on my Storenvy towards the end of the month for $24.99 + shipping. I'd like to make sure that most, if not all, of the backers have their books before they are available to everyone else. You can preview the sale page now!
Backers: thank you once again much for your support on this project! Your pledges and belief in this book has been a huge boost to my personal illustration heart. ♥
The books arrived today! I'll be starting to get things shipping in the next few weeks. Please be sure to do your backer survey if you haven't already! Yay!

All backers should have a survey email this morning! And I just got the notification that the books are printed and shipped! I should have them near the end of next week and I'll start getting them out to backers ASAP! 
After the books have shipped, I'll be sending out a separate survey regarding interest in Volume 2. Stay tuned for more Magical Girl Coloring in 2017! ❤️

Here's a video of me opening the package live!
And here's a picture! :D

campaign.story:
POWER & MAGIC is a comics anthology about queer witches of color for teens and adults ages 14-and-up. The book is over 160 pages long, black and white, and contains 15 original stories blending fantasy, drama, humor, and romance.
On January 27th, I asked if any women of color out there were interested in making comics about queer witches of color, an archetype near and dear to me... The answer was a resounding yes. POWER & MAGIC is brought to you by a team of 17 women, demigirls, and bigender creators of color.
Left to Right: Comics by Vexingly Yours, Juliette G.M.M. Lopez, Natasha L. Barredo, and Jemma Salume.
The witch is an icon of power. She represents transcendence, healing, insight, defiance, feminine monstrosity, and a sacred relationship to the self, the community, and the universe. From the euphoria of holding the stars in your grasp, to the sacrifices we make to reach them, POWER & MAGIC explores what it means to be a person of power in all its complexity.
After 7 months of hard work to complete the anthology, we're ready for your orders! Every dollar we raise here on Kickstarter goes toward covering print costs, paying the creators, and rewarding you with limited-edition extras and ever-increasing book quality! Read below to learn more about our backer rewards and about our system for paying creators.
Back POWER & MAGIC today to make the magic possible!
POWER & MAGIC is edited by Joamette Gil, a queer Afro-Cuban cartoonist and founder of P&M Press. You can learn more about P&M Press, our mission, and our journey at PowerAndMagicPress.com.
Top: Nivedita Sekar, Naomi Franquiz | Bottom: Ann Xu, Aatmaja Pandya.
Aatmaja Pandya (Travelogue, Baker’s Dozen, Chainmail Bikini: The Anthology of Women Gamers)

Risks and challenges
From quadruple-checking our numbers and tracking down the best printer for the job, to studying and consulting with successful comics KS veterans - we've done our homework. 13/15 comics are already completed, and 2 are wrapping up as we speak. Printing and shipping delays are the only potential risk.

Greetings, P&M backers:
I'm writing today to share the launch of our third (how time flies) anthology on Kickstarter, HEARTWOOD: Non-binary Tales of Sylvan Fantasy. Together with 28 other creators, we've crafted a book that the world hasn't seen before: a collection of comics about and by people who identify as a non-binary gender. 
Support if you can, and help us make history!

campaign.story:
Français • Italiano • Español • Português • Nederlands • Svenska • Deutsch • Pyсский • Malay • 한국어 • 中文 / 如何訂購 • 日本語 • العربية 
               Your phone gives you complete control over the Podo.
The micro-adhesive pad lets Podo stick on basically anything.
Podo shoots photos, videos, and time lapse. Set any interval and Podo will capture everything automatically. See one here.
This advanced software and go-anywhere size make Podo the most versatile, and easy-to-use camera ever!
How to order on Kickstarter: Click "Back This Project" and select a reward, add $5 per item for accessories (see below), then complete your pledge. For more details see bottom of this page.
Podo makes a perfect holiday or birthday gift, and pledging today lets you save up to 50% off future prices!
STRETCH GOALS
UNLOCKED - Upgraded tin packaging
UNLOCKED - Image processing upgrade
UNLOCKED - Free upgrade for carrying cases
UNLOCKED - Water proof case add-on
UNLOCKED - Backers up to $600k Xmas Shipping 
UNLOCKED - Stereoscopic shooting mode
$800k - Free upgrade for water proof cases
$900k - Free hard shell gear case
$1M - Double the memory free upgrade, new colors, filters!
Learn more here.
REWARDS
Benefits
Freedom: Capture any moment from any perspective. Your shots are no longer limited by the reach of your arm.
No mounts, stands, or selfie sticks required.
Control: The Podo app puts you in control for every shot. Wirelessly preview, capture, and transfer, with Bluetooth technology.
Every shot is perfect because you're the one who took it.
USE CASES
Your phone is great, but it's not always the right camera for the job.
Our customers love how easy it is to use Podo to enhance their lifestyles:
Everyday adventures:
Self-portraits: Ditch your selfie stick for good.
Group photos: Fit everyone in on the very first try.
Family: Fun for even the most camera-shy little-ones.
Animals: Get up-close on their level with your pets.
Food: Snap a recipe step-by-step or get that perfect food pic.
Cars: Use Podo as an easy backup cam.
For your passions:
Photography: A fun and creative addition to your gear bag.
Travel: Never miss a photo op, without relying on strangers.
Style & Fashion: Check your outfit from the back, and take your #ootd.
Fitness: Check your form, yoga poses, and of course, progress pics!
Sports: Record your swing, or watch a basket from the back board.
Artists: Dancers, musicians, stop-motion animators, painters, etc.
Time Lapse: Set any interval for the easiest time lapse ever.
Perfect for events:
Weddings/Parties: Capture it all automatically with time lapse.
Concerts: Get every angle of the venue without running any cables.
Multi-angle: Use multiple Podos to capture everything at once.
Photo booth: Everyone loves a good photo booth!
FEATURES
Large Pixel Size
The pixels on our sensor (2.2 μm) are 50% bigger than those in the iPhone 7 (1.5 μm) and the Galaxy S7 (1.4 μm).
Bigger pixels collect more light, leading to increased dynamic range, improved low-light performance, and reduced noise. Bigger pixels = better picture.
Choosing a 5MP camera allows bigger pixels within the same sensor size, and is enough megapixels to print at 14"x11" full resolution.
See sample images here.
Micro-Adhesive Sticky Pad
Podo sticks with a quick press, then peels right off. It physically "grips" the wall so it doesn't wear out, and you can clean it with water. Think gecko's feet...but on a camera.
No other stands, clips, or mounts required. Just slip Podo in your pocket and you're good to go.
Sound like magic? It feels like it too! Just wait until you try it yourself.
For a short video on how it works, click here.
The Podo App
Our camera may be tiny, but it becomes powerful by partnering with your phone. Bluetooth technology lets your phone act as a complete wireless controller.

1. Wake Podo up and start the preview, all from within the app
2. Adjust settings, hit the shutter, or start a countdown
3. Choose your favorite shots and transfer them to your phone
When you're done, just stick Podo in your pocket and it will return to sleep automatically. 
The Podo App is free for iOS and Android. Requires iPhone 5/Android 4.4 or higher.
Photo transfer times vary with phone model and strength of Bluetooth connection. Typical transfer time for a 5MP photo is 2-4 seconds.
App Modes
PHOTO: Simple. Fun. Our bread and butter.
LAPSE: Set any interval for the easiest time lapse ever. (Does not require connection with phone)
VIDEO: 720p HD video at 30 fps. Your phone records the audio like a wireless mic.
MULTI (new): Capture photo, video, or lapse with up to 6 Podos simultaneously in a unique and immersive way.
BOOTH (new): Easily provide the classic photo booth experience. Silly faces are highly recommended!
SOLO (new): Activate tap-gesture controls and put your phone away. 
As we update the app, Podo will gain even more features over time!
More Features
Fully rotating hinge lets you shoot any angle 
Accelerometer automatically orients the photos LEDs indicate Podo's actions (not for flash) 
Adjustable countdown timer 8GB memory holds thousands of photos 
Li-ion battery lasts 1,000 photos or 2 weeks in standby
TECH SPECS
Size: 1.3" x 1.3" x 1.5" (3 x 3 x 4.5 cm)
Weight: 1.5 oz (43 g)
Sensor: 5 MP (2.2 μm pixels)
Video: 720p 30fps
Lens: 90° wide-angle, glass
Memory: 8 GB
8-LED ring
Bluetooth 4.2 LE + Classic
Accelerometer
Rechargeable battery (up to 1.5 hrs. video)
ACCESSORIES
To order an accessory, add its price to your final pledge amount. Do not change reward level. You can add accessories in any quantity and combination. Watch here.

You will specify your specific accessory choices via online form after the campaign is over. See bottom of page for detailed instruction.

The Choices:
Sticky pads are 12x6 cm and perfect for sticking your phone to your dashboard, hanging keys and cards by the door, or for mounting frames and posters. *These are stand-alone bonus pieces, not replacements for the Podo.*
Drawstring bag is perfect as a gym back or light daily carry!
Carrying case is made of high-quality Santoprene (industrial-grade, highly durable) and allows Podo to hang on your bag, belt, etc. Thanks to the success of this campaign, we're also including a neoprene sleeve with magnet enclosure that fully protects your Podo.
BACKER REFERRAL PROGRAM
Refer your friends and earn free stuff! Simple.
We count the number of Podos referred. So if your friend orders 6 Podos, you get credit for 6 referrals. What a good friend.
The top referrer overall also receives:
Two advance Podos from our manufacturing test runs
The very first Podo from mass production! (#001)
See the bottom of this page for the full how-to and program rules. Good luck!

RETURNING BACKERS
If you pledge for a Podo yet again, we'll send you one free gift bundle of:
3 piece Sticky pad set ($10 value) 
Podo carrying case ($10 value) 
Drawstring bag ($10 value) 
Our sincere gratitude, again.
ABOUT US
The founders, Eddie, Jae, and Sam, began as friends and roommates at UC Berkeley. We got tired of someone always getting left out of group photos and needing cables to transfer photos from Jae's DSLR. We wanted something much more versatile and easy to use, so we made it!
We raised $427,000 last year from over 3,600 amazing backers. Podo shipped worldwide, won global design awards, and starred on TV, magazines, and even a music video.
Podo represents our passion, our team’s grit, and our conviction that technology should be fun and simple. Thank you to every fan and supporter who’s shown us love along the way.
HOW TO ORDER
1. Back this Project: Click "Back This Project" at the top of this page, or click here. You may choose a maximum of one reward level.

2. Add accessories: Add $5 extra to your total pledge amount per accessory you would like to order. There is no limit to how many or which combination you can order, and there is no additional shipping cost required. See above for accessory choices.

3. Finish payment, and that's it: Your credit card will not be charged until the campaign is completely over. Once it is charged, we will ask you for your shipping address and which accessories you chose, if any.

Note: We do not handle VAT or other import duties for shipments, and we do not charge for this upfront. We are not professional agents in this regard and cannot give you estimates or tax advice. Backers may face additional customs costs upon delivery of their Podo. To avoid regulatory problems, we will put the reward level value (sans shipping) on the declaration. We cannot promise to do otherwise. Thank you!

HOW TO ADD ACCESSORIES
Click "Manage My Pledge", then "Change your pledge". Do not change your choice of reward.

As seen in the video below, you must manually add to your total pledge amount to reserve your accessories.

We will confirm your choice of accessories via survey once the campaign is over.
PLAY

REFERRAL PROGRAM RULES

Procedure
Find your backer number. To find it, visit https://www.kickstarter.com/profile/backings and find us under "Active pledges." Scroll down.
Affix your backer number to the beginning of podolabs.com followed by a period (no commas). 
For example, backer number 9,999 would use 9999.podolabs.com
Share your unique link with friends and family. 
If they use it to order, you will automatically get credit!
Rules:
You must pledge for your own Podo(s) first.
Referral credits are calculated after the campaign is over.
We cannot respond to individual requests for referral count status. 
Cancelled orders or failed payments do not count. 
Your referral must use your link to pledge in one session or the referral will not register. 
Please do not try to game the system (we'll know) or you will forfeit any and all rewards. 
The Really Big Pack counts as ten referrals. 
If someone has already pledged once, they cannot re-pledge using your link.
3 days before the campaign concludes, we will post referral totals for all backers so you can get an idea. However, the official count will only come after the campaign concludes, as some referrals may cancel their pledge.
Thank you and good luck!
EXTRAS
Visit www.youtube.com/c/podolabs for fun and informational Podo videos!

Take your camera and stick it:
   Cher Lloyd - Activated Music Video
    How Podo Works:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is no longer our first rodeo, and there are many reasons why we expect to deliver faster than last time. For one, this version is much improved but similar enough that we can reuse much of what we learned.
Second, we're further along in the manufacturing process; we've already down-paid for the early bird units and tooling has already begun. Third, our new manufacturer is much more experienced with high volumes of cameras. Lastly, we know not to run into the same certification delays as last time. 

And of course, we are still under Highway1/PCH's experienced wing, who's motto is appropriately, "We Make".
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update, New Card art, and project delivery FAQ!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Everyone!
As we move into October, the fulfillment process for the campaign is about to begin, so we wanted to post an update with all the relevant info and answers to everyone’s frequently asked questions here! As always, if there is something we do not cover or if you have any further questions, just comment below and we will be happy to help!
But before we begin, another Card art reveal from the extremely handsome Brad Rigney! This time its Dracula, in all his many-formed glory. We love you, Brad.

Hey, Everyone!
As mentioned in the title of the update, there is an unfortunate last minute delay in shipping. This is due to an Amazon fee change they recently notified us about- full details on the why and how are below. The book will still ship in 2017, and we anticipate the delay won't be more than 2 months. If you have any questions, please message us here on Kickstarter and we will be happy to help! We also have the first image of card art ready to show! Details below-

Hey, everyone!
We’ve been hard at work the past few months getting everything ready to go to print, and have some updates for you regarding surveys, shipping, and our new fulfillment service using Backerkit. More below!
You should have an email from Backerkit with a link to the surveys and store in your inbox already- but if not, you can find the Backerkit page here!

campaign.story:
Angora is a sheltered young girl who is sent on a mission: to find the center. Her journey will take her from the depths of the southern jungles to the deceptive warmth of the desert cities, to the bitter peaks of the Northern Territories where a new war has broken out after years of uneasy peace.
The story revolves around three very different groups being drawn inexorably towards each other... but to what end?
And as the bonds of civilization slowly weaken, monstrous powers with their own motivations walk the earth once more... but who will be left to inherit it?
The Meek is a long-format, character driven adventure about the gray areas between the good and bad, revenge and forgiveness, life and death. I am overjoyed to finally make a print version of the comic available to readers old and new :]
   For years, the only way to enjoy the entirety of The Meek has been online, through the webcomic format. Now, for the first time ever, I will be printing the first three chapters- nearly 150 full-color comic pages- for readers to enjoy in physical form.
This volume contains the first three chapters, along with brand new bonus material!
The art and formatting has been fully refreshed for this volume to bring you the best looking version of the comic that has ever existed. The books will also feature all-new bonus material that has never been available before.
I have been removing all of that weird old art and replacing it with weird new art
Anyone who has followed my work for a while knows I have notoriously resisted merchandising my work. But in honor of my first Kickstarter, I am excited to introduce some stretch goals and special rewards:
  Wallpaper- A high resolution wallpaper of the new wraparound cover art made for this book
Postcard - A 5x7 thank-you postcard featuring art from one of the amazing contributing artists
Mini Print Pack - A set of Limited Edition 5x7 prints featuring art by some of the most incredible artists working today. New artists and prints will be added to the postcard tier as our stretch goals unlock!
Enamel Pin- Limited Edition enamel pin of Mocheril, the first in a planned series
Signed book & a character sketch - A very limited tier for you to get your books signed by me and received a random 4x6 character sketch tucked inside. Since I rarely attend conventions, this is your best chance for a personalized item!
    Tessa Stone: Not Drunk Enough, Buzz!
Gene Ha: JLA, Top Ten, Mae
Joy Ang: Adventure Time, The Anthology Project
Melita Curphy: Miss Monster
Ariel Ries: Witchy
Heather Campbell: Valve, Legend of Korra comics
 Additionally, as we meet our stretch goals, the physical quality of the book will increase as well with gloss, french flaps and more! These additions will not come at any extra cost to you; as we unlock our stretch goals, the book in your reward tier will simply become more beautiful.
About the creator
I am a biologist, an educator, and a self-taught independent artist.
I've been working on this comic in one form or another since my early teens, and have been hosting and posting the comic online for readers to enjoy for free since 2007. The response to my work throughout the years has been incredibly gratifying. I am so thankful for your readership, and excited to be able to finally give you a physical copy of the comic that means so much to me.
  This KS would not be possible without the kind support of
Taneka Stotts (project manager)
all of the incredible postcard artists
Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein
Christina McKenzie
Shirley Jackson
Jared Petker
fabulous readers such as yourself!
Music: Decisions Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've mitigated the risks on my first print project by hiring an experienced project manager and production team with several successful AND beautiful Kickstarter book projects under their belt. This book is guaranteed to be the highest quality product possible.

The comic pages have been drawn, a printer is primed and ready to go, and I have been thoroughly advised on how to fulfill your orders efficiently once the printed books have been approved.

In short, I am doing everything I can to make this a great experience for me and for you! Please feel free to PM if you have any specific questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
***The Dream Cluster is an illustration anthology showcasing the stunning work of 50 diverse and talented artists, exploring the stuff of dreams through many different perspectives.
We aim to be a platform for new voices of the artistic community to be heard! 
//The Dream Cluster es una antología ilustrada que incluye el trabjo de 50 artistas y busca explorar el tema de los sueños desde diversos ángulos.
The result is a book filled with vibrant illustrations that are both awe striking and haunting, personal and inspiring pieces bound by the logic of the subconscious mind.
The project addresses dreams, the logic - or lack of- behind them and their impact in the dreamer, making each illustration a unique window into the minds of our artists, their desires, fears and some of the sources of their inspiration.
//El resultado es un libro lleno de vibrantes ilustraciones que son impactantes y encantadoras; personales y mágicas piezas sostenidas por la lógica del subconsciente que explorar los sueños, la lógica -o falta de- detrás de ellos y su impacto en el que los sueña, haciendo cada ilustración una ventana a la mente de nuestros artistas, sus deseo, miedos y fuentes de inspiración.
We need YOUR help to fund the project and bring to life these whimsical worlds!
//Necesitamos tu ayuda para hacer este proyecto una realidad.
The finished product will be a 7.5 x 10.5 in, perfect-bound, softcover book, with 50+ pages of full-color illustrations by our talented contributing artists. Additionally, the book will include an artists index (with word from our artists regarding their dreams).
//El producto final será un libro de 7.5 x 10 pulgadas de pasta suave que incluye 50+ páginas a color con ilustraciones de nuestros artistas. Adicionalmente el libro contiene un índice con la lista completa de ilustradores y algunas palabras con respecto a sus obras.
*book render
The project is illustrated by: TABBY, CHRISTINA MROZIK, GERALDINE RODRIGUEZ, KEEZY YOUNG, ELLEN SHI, LADY ALOUETTE, EL CHICO TABLA, ZOE PERSICO, KALEY HAMILTON, MARKIA JENAI, MAR SPRAGGE, FLOR DE VITA, LAUREN DEGRAAF, JENN ST ONGE, TARA O'CONNOR, GUMBATEI, DANTE & QUERELLE, JEY BARNES, RICA MARCH, ISABEL DE LARA, SONYA ABBY, GLORIA FELIX, BARBARA DE LA GARZA, ADDY RIVERA, LAUREL VARIAN, MIRELLE ORTEGA, JACOB MYRICK, MORGAN E. BREWER, PATDAG, QUEENIE CHAN, LISA MANUZAK, MARINA P SOTO, LILIANA VERA, PACO SANTOYO, HAILEY THURROTT, RUBEN GUERRA, CAMRYN A., FLEUR SCIORTINO, J. CASTRO, GISSELLE AVILA, SHARON SORDO, JILLIAN ANDRE, MEGAN PHONESAVANH, ALLISON M. LESCH, JESSICA ROJO, R-GIE, HIPOCAMPO, JINGYI DOU, MAR ZAVALA, LILCRESCENTMOON

Kickstarter has finally delivered and we are now officially on the heavy part of the production stage. This week we will be checking in with the few backers who had trouble with Kickstarter accepting their payment methods to give them options on how to keep their pledges (if they wish to do so).
Other than that, we're currently making sure everything in the book is in great shape (no weird typos, everything in the right format, etc) so that we have no inconvenience after we send everything to the printer!
