The new Vattu books have just arrived at Make That Thing headquarters, and shipping will begin in the next couple of days! Thank you everyone for making sure your shipping addresses are up to date (if you still need to do that, please try to do so by Monday! details here).
SO expect your books soon. Thank you everyone.
Another thing! I'm participating in a new edition of art books by Benign Kingdom: It'll be a nice 32-page book of my recent mostly-unpublished work, in a set with three other fantastic comic artists. You can have a look at Thank you so much for having a look and helping get the word out!

Recently finished the last bits of this process that are my job; the books are now in production and should arrive in the United States around the end of May. Again, sorry for the delay, but the color-correction process took a little longer than expected.
I got a couple of advance copies TODAY, and I am very pleased with them.

Got another round of these, corrected, a few days ago. The color is almost perfect now, or close enough that I know how to correct the whole book and get it to look right.
So NOW what I'm working on is adjusting the color on every page of the book to match these test pages, and then I'll send the finished file to the printer and we get moving in earnest. This initial process took a little longer than expected but the color has to be right, and I'll let you know as soon as I have any estimates re: arrival time.

Since last update, I've delivered the files and paid the up-front first half of the cost of printing. I just received a batch of 'wet proofs' for book 2: these are sample proof pages from the book that are offset-printed (the same process as the final book, but too expensive a process to proof the entire book). This allows me to see exactly how the color will look so I can make adjustments! It's closer than I thought it would be, so hopefully one more round of wet proofs and it'll be ready to go.

campaign.story:
Acclaimed artist Dan LuVisi is ready to take you on a twisted trip down memory lane. You know those popular culture characters you love so much from your favorite video games, TV shows, and movies? He’s reimagined them, putting them in an alternate and strangely satirical universe. After years of putting these images and their associated stories online, Dan is ready to present you with POPPED CULTURE, a book that collects some of his peculiar pop culture paintings, the stories that accompany them, and presents many new and unseen ones as well
Expect to be entertained, disturbed, and, yes, even moved by the world of POPPED CULTURE!
THE ART
A small dose of some of the featured artwork from POPPED CULTURE! 
"The Pumpkin King"
"Good Mornin', Max"
"Inglorious Puppets"
"The Mouse Queen"
"The Mouse King"
"My Brother's Keeper"
"The Puppet Hunter"
"Forbidden"
"The Yellow King"
"The Driver"
"What I Do Best"
"The Streets - Chapter 1"
"Chew"
"Recalled"
THE BOOK
POPPED CULTURE features 96 pages (upped from 64 pages thanks to the generosity of backers!) of Dan LuVisi's bizarrely skewed takes on popular culture in one eye-popping book. Some of the images contain short stories, explaining the disturbing and/or sometimes thoughtful backstories behind the characters. The book also includes some amazing work from several guest artists: Chase Conley, Jason Edmiston, Dave Wilkins, Richie Pope, Alex Konstad, Allison Smith, Sterling Hundley, and more!
There are two editions of the book to choose from:
Standard Edition: softcover
Kickstarter-Exclusive edition: hardcover, exclusive cover art, dust jacket, foil stamps on cover and spine of book (added thanks to the generosity of backers!), and a tip-in page with an exclusive Dan LuVisi print
WHO IS DAN LUVISI?
Dan LuVisi’s story as an artist began with what may be his very first memory: drawing Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in a coloring book with his father. Before finding success, he suffered through his share of setbacks, including learning disabilities that had teachers telling his mom he’d be lucky to flip burgers for a living and difficulties making ends meet as an artist.
What drove Dan’s life and career in the early years were his unwavering love of drawing and his desire to share his creations with the world. After years of struggling, he found regular freelance work with companies such as DC Comics, which renewed his craving to make something original. Spurred on by friends and online fans, Dan created LMS: Killbook of a Bounty Hunter, his massive scrapbook-style book about Gabriel—a genetically engineered super-soldier who is framed by a extremist organization—and the people Gabriel targets in his quest for revenge. The book made a splash due to Dan’s bold artistic vision, leading to talk of many ancillary possibilities, such as merchandise and a film. LMS changed Dan’s idea of what he wanted to do with his art and he used its success to found Section 9, a company that provides a home for upcoming artists who want to create their own characters and worlds.
Perhaps more so than any of his works, Dan's POPPED CULTURE series struck a chord with people around the world. Now, Dan wants to reach out and connect with even more people through a book featuring the strange art and satirical stories of the series.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Dan LuVisi has a secret weapon: his dedicated followers. They are the ones who encourage him to build and share the unique worlds he creates in his art. The publication and subsequent success of LMS were completely dependent on fans wanting the book and pre-ordering copies back in 2009.
Having POPPED CULTURE on Kickstarter is a way to continue the connection between Dan and his fans. For the past couple years, many of his online followers have asked him to put together a POPPED CULTURE book. Now, finally, it's time. 
Currently, Dan's about 85% finished with the art for POPPED CULTURE. By donating to the Kickstarter, you’ll make it possible for Dan to finish the art for the book and get it assembled and printed . . . and perhaps even add some cool extras! For your donations, you can get the book (in either the Standard or Kickstarter-Exclusive editions) and numerous awesome rewards, add-ons, and stretch goals.
REWARDS
For your pledges, you can receive the Standard Edition or Kickstarter-Exclusive Editions of the book, plus all kinds of great stuff, like a PDF of the book, a POPPED CULTURE T-shirt, an original Dan LuVisi sketch drawn inside the book, an original Dan LuVisi hand-drawn artwork, and even a Dan LuVisi digital work drawn according to YOUR specifications (you would own all rights to the work). Check out the list of rewards for all the details and options.
POPPED CULTURE T-shirt included with many reward tiers (available in S, M, L, XL, XXL)
ADD-ONS
In addition to the items included in the various reward tiers, we are happy to provide additional items that you can purchase in any quantity you desire.
How to purchase add-ons: First, you must pledge to one of the reward tiers. After pledging, you click “Manage” on the Kickstarter page. You will then have the option to change your pledge amount (without changing you reward tier). Add an amount to your pledge that corresponds to the add-ons you want. For example, if you would like two signed posters (each of which is $20), you would increase your pledge by $40. This means that if you pledged to the $60 reward tier initially, your revised pledge—to get two copies of the signed poster add-on—would be $100.
We will have a Pledge Manager after the campaign to help you select which specific add-ons you would like for your increased pledge.
POPPED CULTURE Poster: “My Brother’s Keeper” - $15 OR $20 signed
Measures 18” x 24”
POPPED CULTURE Poster: “What I Do Best” - $15 OR $20 signed
Measures 18” x 24”
POPPED CULTURE T-Shirt - $20
Available in multiple sizes: small, medium, large, extra-large, and extra-extra-large (we’ll ask your size after the campaign ends). Note: this is the same T-shirt that comes with several of the reward tiers.
Redemption poster - $15 OR $20 signed
Measures 18" x 24"
LMS poster - $15 OR $20 signed
Measures 18" x 24"
STRETCH GOALS  
Stretch Goal 1 = $30,000: add 4 pages to the book [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 2 = $40,000: add 6 pages to the book [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 3 = $50,000: add 2 pages to the book AND a behind-the-scenes video with Dan LuVisi showing the creation of a POPPED CULTURE piece [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 4 = $65,000: add 4 pages to the book [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 5 = $75,000: add 4 pages to the book AND add foil stamps to cover and spine of the hardcover book [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 6 = $80,000: add 8 pages to the book [UNLOCKED!]
Stretch Goal 7 = $85,000: add 4 pages to the book [UNLOCKED!]
SHIPPING
We plan to charge for shipping after the Kickstarter ends via our pledge manager. The amount charged will be determined by the actual costs to ship your items to your location. 
For International Shipping: Please be forewarned that shipping costs could be substantial due to international shipping rates. We will do our best to get you the lowest, fairest shipping rate possible and not charge any more than it costs to ship your package. Once the product is finalized and we know exact shipping dimensions and weight (sometime after the campaign ends), we will publish shipping prices for international orders on the Kickstarter page.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
POPPED CULTURE is a book that has been in the works for years but, as with all such projects, there are certain risks that something totally unexpected could happen (especially in regards to printing and shipping) and the book could be delayed. In such an unlikely case, backers will be notified and given updates on the reasons for the delay.

For the $1,000 reward tier, Dan LuVisi will not draw anything that he finds morally offensive or obscene. Strange, bizarre, weird, and hilariously gross are okay though!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Well overdue for an update - as well as an explanation as to the lack thereof as of late:
Without trying to throw anyone under the bus, I will just say that a clearly defined deal with someone that was designed to get us to the finishing line did not work out in the end. Subsequently, we, internally, ended up with more questions than answers. Faced with the challenge of figuring out what had and had not been done and shipped, we were looking at a quickly deepening rabbithole.

Hi everyone,
As mentioned in our last update, we recently identified a new fulfillment solution that proved more stable than what we had in place prior to that and international shipping IS finally under way. Canadian softcover books are out, followed now by the various other countries, consecutively. In addition, the posters have been shipping as well.
And not to sound like a broken record, but once again: we are extremely grateful for the patience you have shown with us during this learning curve and hope you all will enjoy your rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: The light at the end of the tunnel!
updates.update_content:
In 2010, I opened up the box of my first book LMS: Killbook of a Bounty Hunter. I pulled the first copy out, held it to my chest; flipped it and...

The entire cover is pixelated. 

Maybe it was just one book, I thought, digging for another. But nope. Another messed up cover, and another...and another. And several thousand others. Along with pixelated pages here or there too. 

I was so furious, that I refused to allow any of the books to go out. My business partner and I took out a loan to re-print the books, as I would not allow a tarnished first edition to go out. It cost a pretty penny; if you've seen my LMS book...it's quite huge.

But we did it for the followers, fans, and everyone who supported us. So we waited, and waited and I remember getting emails from people asking "Where is my f'ing book?" and "Are you stealing my money?". At the time, I chose to stay quiet on who was to blame for this disaster, as the damage had already been done—but I wanted to fix it, and I wanted everyone to get what they waited for. Because goddamn, being accused of that shit SUCKS.

Hey everyone,
Dan wanted to personally update, but I felt I, Stephan, his business partner, should take over for this one. First and foremost: thank you all for your patience. From both Dan and I, we appreciate you understanding the hiccups, as this is our first Kickstarter. Thankfully, all domestic orders - other than the ones who only days ago completed their pledge manager info - have been shipped (If yours, for some reason hasn't, please email kickstarterissues@section9-ent.com). Which brings us to the international orders. We’re acutely aware that we’re late in the game as is, but also can’t turn the clock back, so we simply ask for your understanding and to accept our apologies. Fortunately, International IS finally shipping.
Thank you for all your warm remakes for those who have already received the books. Some questions came in that we thought we should address regarding the book:

campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Lois van Baarle, sometimes better known as Loish! I'm a digital artist and animator from the Netherlands. I make my living as a freelance artist but what I love to do most is make my own digital paintings and artwork, which you can find on my website, loish.net.
PLAY

Over the years, I've gradually gained an amazing fan base who have given me so much support as my artwork and career developed into what it is today. I've regularly been asked whether there is an art book featuring my work, and I've had plans to make one for the last three years. I've researched different options and given a lot of thought into what I'd like to include in the book. With the help 3dtotal Publishing's expertise in digital art books and Kickstarter, I hope to create a book that not only showcases my art but gives a detailed behind-the-scenes look at how I create my work.
To make sure I can offer something special in return for supporting this project, I'm coupling the book with signed art prints and commission slots. I'm also hoping to share some of my knowledge by offering downloadable video tutorials, extensive portfolio reviews and feedback, and livestream sessions as some of the pledge options. I hope that there is something for everyone who is interested in digital art and my work!
A mock-up of the Art of Loish book
 "Loish is an exceptional artist apart from any derivative -- her imagery comes from a place full of originality and vibrancy"  (Tran Nguyen, Illustrator)
As the project was funded so quickly (thanks so much again everyone!), 3dtotal Publishing and I have come up with some stretch goals to give you some extra rewards if we reach certain targets. We hope you like them!
Please note that these images are just mock-ups so the design is subject to change. The playing cards will feature 52 different images!
The book will of course feature images of my art, particularly my illustrations, and show my progress from someone who drew digitally as a hobby to a professional freelance artist. It will feature tips and insights, and show the process of creating my work, from initial idea and sketch to finished piece. You'll find images that range from finished digital paintings to rough sketches, studies, sketchbook pages and client work. I hope that you will find it inspiring, insightful, and most importantly, enjoyable to read through!
More specifically, the book will include a visual timeline of my artistic journey, with a selection of remakes of past works to show how my work has evolved over the years. I will also discuss my approaches to illustration, sketching, concept art and storyboarding. In addition to all of this I would love to be able to share some never-before-seen work and provide written tutorials and tips for fellow digital artists. 
I have been working on this project for a while and have already completed the cover art and new illustrations for the book, as well as a detailed plan for the various chapters. The lovely people at 3dtotal Publishing have already agreed to produce the book and are helping to launch the project on Kickstarter. All I need now is a bit of help from you guys to make this project happen! Please consider backing this project!
In terms of specifications, the book will measure 255 x 255mm in size and will be presented in a craft paper slipcase with a cutout. At 152 pages, the book will also be personally signed by me with a numbered certificate inside.
Please note: some of these pledge options have conditions attached which are detailed below! 
#1 A downloadable video tutorial
...................................................................................................................
#2 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside, so you have proof that you helped make this book happen!
...................................................................................................................
#3 A copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside, so you have proof that you helped make this book happen + one downloadable video tutorial
...................................................................................................................
#4 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials detailing the creation of a character illustration and a digital painting.
...................................................................................................................
#5 A copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials detailing the creation of a character illustration and a digital painting.
...................................................................................................................
#6 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book.
...................................................................................................................
#7 A copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + an A4 print of an original artwork created for the book.
...................................................................................................................
#8 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book + a rough digital character bust commission (completed by 5 December 2015) in which you can request any character you like.
...................................................................................................................
#9 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book + a portfolio review, where you can send your portfolio and get personalized tips, advice, suggestions and a constructive review of your portfolio, plus answers to any and all questions you may have.
...................................................................................................................
#10 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book + a rough digital full-body character commission (completed by 5 December 2015) in which you can request any character you like.
...................................................................................................................
#11 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book + a signed full-body sketch commission (completed by 5 December 2015), the original copy of which will be sent to you on paper.
...................................................................................................................
#12 A signed copy of the book with a numbered certificate fixed inside + two downloadable video tutorials + a signed A4 print of an original artwork created for the book + a rough character bust commission created in an exclusive livestream session (completed by 5 December 2015), in which any character you request is drawn in a live stream, where you can ask any questions you may have, provide instructions for the commission, and watch it being drawn live.
Overview of the different types of commissions
Overview of the video tutorials
Here's some extra information about the downloadable video tutorials to give you a bit more of an idea of what to expect. The video that comes with the £5 tier will be video 1.

Video 1: This tutorial will run you through the process of creating a rough character sketch - the type of sketch I often make for my clients when working on character concepts. Starting with the rough sketch, it will show you how to choose colors for the sketch, add details and shading effects, and adjustments throughout the process. Basically, it will show you how to make a dynamic and colorful illustration with the detail and personality needed to convey a character in a time-effective way.

Video 2: This tutorial will show my process for creating a digitally painted character illustration based on one of my older pieces - basically, a re-make. I'll talk about the older illustration and the points I would like to improve in my revised version, and show you my process for drawing the characters, as well as give pointers on digital painting, backgrounds, and everything you need to create a finished character portrait.

For backers of the £80, £130, £250, and £440 tiers: Backers must deliver their instructions for their commission and any reference material within 10 days of Kickstarter closing. Please specify whether you are happy with the commissioned work being posted online when it is finished. A credit line can be added to commissioned images shown if desired.
Digital commissions are usually delivered in a digital file upon completion. If you wish to receive an A4 sized print of your commission, please state this in your initial instructions! If printed, an additional fee to cover printing and shipping will be required.
For backers of the £80, £130, and £250 tiers: Commissioners will get to see a rough digital version of their commissioned drawing and at this time, can list any revisions (one major and any minor). Once the finished commission has been viewed digitally, one round of minor revisions will be accepted.
For backers of the £90 tier: Backers must submit their portfolio for review digitally to Lois within 10 days of Kickstarter closing, along with any questions they may have. They may receive their feedback either in writing, chat session, or Skype session - please specify which form is preferred when submitting your portfolio! Lois will provide digital feedback by 5 December 2015 at the latest.
For backers of the £250 tier: Commissioners will get to see a rough version of the sketch and can list any revisions (one major and any minor). Once the sketch is complete, one round of minor revisions will be accepted before the sketch is sent out to the backers' address.
For backers of the £440 tier: The livestream session can take place between 9am and 9pm (Central European Time) by prearranged appointment. Backers must make contact to arrange their appointment within 10 day of Kickstarter closing. Revisions can be made during the livestream session as per commisioner's instructions. After the commission is delivered, one round of minor revisions is allowed.

For all tiers: Commissioned images can be shared and posted on the web with appropriate artist credit, but not sold or used commercially in any way, shape or form by any person(s) or organization(s) other than Lois van Baarle and 3dtotal Publishing. The copyrights of all other images and products of this campaign are held by Lois van Baarle and 3dtotal Publishing. These products are not to be used for resale, or used commercially by any other person(s) or organization(s) other than Lois van Baarle or 3dtotal Publishing.
3dtotal Publishing are able to ship worldwide! Simply select your favourite pledge option and your location and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you!
Shipping in the UK will be trackable; however shipping outside of the UK will be untracked. If you require a tracked solution for your rewards, please message us or email support@3dtotal.com and we'll provide a shipping quote.
What if my parcel gets lost?
In the event of lost orders in the mail (it happens!), we will offer to resend the order once for free, or alternatively you will have the option of a refund. Please note that we can only reship an order once if it is lost. If the second parcel is lost, we will not be able to offer a refund.
I’ve set aside time in my schedule to get the book done on time, with a detailed week-to-week plan to ensure that the deadline is met. I also put aside some time to work on the backer prizes, especially the commissions. It is the first time in a long time that I am able to accept commissions and I'm very excited to do these!
I'm new to the world of publishing and this will be my first artbook, and Kickstarter feels like the best solution to finanance and create this book. Not only that but at the same time, it gives me the opportunity to open commission slots and make some detailed tutorials, something that I've wanted to do for a long time!
Working with an independent publisher that specialises in digital art books means that I'm making my book with people who understand my work, and most importantly, know what they're doing. It's really important to me to make a book that reflects who I am as an artist and is produced by professionals with experience, not only in publishing but also with crowdfunded art projects (for example the Sketch Workshop and female anatomy figure campaigns). Together with 3dtotal Publishing, I'm confident that this project will succeed!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge of this project is timescale. Good planning and sufficient time is needed to put together this book as well as provide you guys with great backer prizes! As mentioned before, I have completed the cover art and exclusive illustrations for the book, as well as a detailed schedule to write and put together the various chapters. This will allow 3dtotal Publishing to commence work on the book immediately if the funding goal is reached. I've also set aside the time needed to complete all commissions, portfolio reviews, and livestream sessions within the specified dates, so that I can put all of my energy to creating some fantastic rewards for backing this project!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello everyone,

campaign.story:
RiotMinds’s fantasy setting Trudvang has become a cult classic in the almost 15 years since the first book was released. The illustrations and artwork has earned a special reputation and a great following. We’ve developed a setting based on the traditional Scandinavian and Celtic sagas, legends and myths. It’s a truly unique fantasy world inspired by the very source of story telling, such as Beowulf, the Icelandic tales, the Finnish epos Kalevala, and also true art masters such as John Bauer and Akseli Gallen-Kallela.
We’ve been rewarded with some of the most astonishing art from exceptional artists like Paul Bonner, Justin Sweet and Alvaro Tapia, just to mention a few. Throughout the years more than 1000 top class illustrations, and more than 20 covers have passed our doors. 
RiotMinds art and art direction has been published in fantasy art publications such as Spectrum, and the game has been awarded with high ratings and a very loyal fan base, expecting nothing but the best.
WE seek funding for a truly unique ART BOOK: The Fabulous Art of Trudvang.
This book is a Kickstarter exclusive and for backers ONLY. It will not be sold or distributed to 3rd party. This is a one and only unique chance for backers to get the collected art of Trudvang in one book.
Shipping cost will be added to your pledge as you check out.
Our goal is to produce one of the best art books ever made for a fantasy setting. Something you can use as a well of inspiration whether you are a fantasy gamer, dreamer, artist or just love the art itself. If you are into gaming you can see this as “illustrated Trudvang”, if not, just like an exceptional art book.
Illustrations from all our World books...
...including the famous Trudvang dwarves!
 Full wide screen covers
Short stories about the beasts of Trudvang and some of it´s characters.
We will fill this book with artwork, both illustrations and covers. It’s a hard cover, glossy paper, high-production-value art book with the best illustrations and paintings selected. We will also give the book some extra touch by explaining some of the thinking behind the scenery and design as well as sharing some of the stories from the world of Trudvang. 
Let there be lots of dragons and other fierce creatures and..
..lots of trolls..
 ..some deities..
 ..a full chapter about the undeads..
..and of course giants..
We will publish, not only sketches and scribbles but also actual illustrations and paintings, everything wrapped in a design worthy the true art masters behind this book.
RiotMinds is a traditional game publisher since 16 years back. We have published numerous of gaming books for mainly two games: Trudvang and Götterdämmerung. Both have been awarded with prestigious ratings and reviews. All books have been sold in Swedish and later this year Trudvang Chronicles will be released in English for the first time.
The founders: Theodore Bergqvist and Magnus Malmberg have been working with fantasy and gaming properties for many years. Between 2001 and 2005 Theodore Bergqvist was the CEO and Creative Director at Conan Properties Inc, working with renowned properties such as Conan, Solomon Kane and others. Theodore Bergqvist was also the founder and CEO of Paradox Interactive, a Swedish strategy games developer and publisher.
RiotMinds have published more than 20 books for it’s table top Role Playing Game: Trudvang Chronicles (in Swedish: Drakar och Demoner Trudvang), a Board Game and numerous of other products of which many does not even exist to buy any more.
RiotOnline a new digital service for our RPG´s, including complete rules, world setting and a suite of digital tools to create and store characters, roll dice, make game calculations as well as a remote center to start gaming sessions online, all wrapped in stunning graphics.
So, to cut it short: we think we know what we are doing and we know it will be good, and we need your help. RiotMinds is a “labor of love” project for us and as such the resources are limited to produce and print such an ambitious project as an Art Book.
We´ve started, we have most of the art in place but we need funds to write, edit, layout and print it. We ask for 15,000$ and the funds will be used for printing, layout, commission to artist and editing.
We think this can be a great book, but with your additional help it can be even better! If we fund more than we asked for, we will of course spend the money to make the Art Book even bigger and more exclusive. See our stretch goals below.
NEW STRETCH GOAL 30,000$ (GOAL UNLOCKED!)
If we reach the 30.000 dollar goal we will sign and number all the books (Kickstarter exclusive) AND commit to a small print run for selected retailers globally. To balance the high shipping cost we will also make a slipcase OR a dust jacket for the book, should we reach this goal.
(GOAL UNLOCKED!)
If we reach 35K we will add all the fuzzy extra such as a fabric bookmark ribbon inside the book, embossment, extra thick paper and all things that make the book stand out in the shelf.
If we reach 45K we will add another bunch of pages to make the book even bigger and include as much art as we can. The original idea is to have 120 pages, but with this stretch goal we can go as high as 192+ pages, including more art from Paul Bonner and Alvaro Tapia. We will produce a slip case for the book.
We will add an extra package of a couple of unfoldable pages, a full color Trudvang map and pages with boarders and interior art from previous publications.
ALL ABOVE + We will PRINT the Core rules + world setting of Trudvang Chronicles (in English) for you to buy in our store. Including new covers and some new interior art.

Risks and challenges
We´ve secured the rights to make this book, and we have set aside time to produce it. However, sometimes Printing takes a bit longer than expected and even though we aim at a fast delivery it´s a risk it will take longer time than expected.

campaign.story:
82 Sleepless Nights 
I had my second baby in July of last year, and I was worried that I wouldn't have any more time to draw for a long while. For a little bit it was almost impossible to make the time, but I was determined. I decided to draw a small inked illustration each day starting in October. The best time to work was in the short period of time after I put the kids to bed but before I fell asleep myself. 
The images started simple, but soon, they evolved into something more intricate. The further I got in the sketchbook, the more I wanted to fill every single page with a lovely image. Somehow, the whole 82 page book got filled up. I’ve decided to publish them as a little book, so I could share them with people who’ve helped encourage me.
The original book
See more of how the book came together here!
Greeting Cards 
In addition to the book, I’ve also decided to make my favorite 5 illustrations into a series of greeting cards. They make great gifts!
Assorted Greeting Cards
Coloring Book 
I am also collecting 20 of my favorite drawings into a 8.5x5.5” paperback sketchbook. This is a great way to experience the art by coloring it yourself! You can get this by supporting the campaign at the Deluxe level or higher. 
Original Ink Drawings 
Get a new original piece made for you that is just like one from the book. They are done at the same size (4”x6”) with the same sepia ink as the original book. It will be a special and unique drawing made just for you.
Watercolor Paintings 
I’ve made some of my favorite drawings from the book bigger and painted in watercolor. You can own one of these pieces as a 1-of-a-kind companion to your book. They also come with a free pack of greeting cards :)
Click to view larger versions
If you are interested in seeing more of my painting process check out my blog! http://www.aniamohrbacher.com/process-blog/
Set of 5 Greeting Cards with envelopes
4x6" Hardcover 82 page book "82 Nights" - Mock-up
Deluxe Package with 20 page coloring book full of intricate linework
Collectors Edition with Signed and numberd bookplate
Get your own custom 4x6" ink drawing with the Original Art Package
Collectors Edition with original sketch on the bookplate
Original Painting Package with "Longing"
Original Painting Package with "Sisters"
Original Painting Package with "Queen"
Original Painting Package with "Nightfall"
Original painting "Kindred"
Original Painting "Selkie"
"Butterfly with a Thousand Eyes" comes matted and framed
More of my work is available through my web store please check it out!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is my first Kickstarter project, I have watched my husband successfully complete and fulfill 3 of his own. Therefore I have his resources and expertise at hand to make this a success. 

As with most ambitious endeavors there may be unforeseen delays in printing/mailing that I am hoping to prevent, but otherwise I expect the process to go smoothly. I will be sure to update if there are any complications to provide some transparency to the process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Lots of "82 Nights" prints , and originals available on my website
updates.update_content:
Hi there! It's been a while since you've last heard from me :)
I'm always a bit weary to advertise, since I don't want to bother anyone. I figured though that if you backed my book, then it must mean that you do like my art.  (and hopefully want to see more of it!) I've been working on a lot of new paintings since "82 Nights" project, and I think my style has changed a bit since then.  I'm really proud of my recent paintings, and I  hope that you will like them too!
Since I'm skipping on conventions this year, I have decided to have a big sale on my .

A Walk Through 82 Nights: A Mother's Journey
I have some exciting news to share with you! I thought that my "82 Nights" journey ended with fulfillment of the Kickstarter campaign, but the book led to something more. IKON IMAGES Gallery and Shoppe in Canton Ohio is hosting a solo show featuring 16 of my paintings. Each of the paintings started as a page out of 82 Nights book. Here's a little sample of what's there. If you'd like to see the rest of the images, or if you regret missing out on an 82 Nights original, please follow the to the gallery.

Shipping Completed
I'm excited to say that as of today all of the rewards that could have been shipped, have been shipped!  If yours hasn't reached you yet it is probably on its way. (but please make sure that you responded to the survey, there's still a number of you who didn't)
 If you haven't responded yet, I'll be contacting you via private message, and I'll be sending your books out as soon as I get a reply from you :)

I have best backers ever!
First I wanted to say, that I'm amazed just how patient and positive all of you have been! The fulfillment for this campaign is taking way longer than I hoped (about a year now).  I anticipated that some of you would be unhappy with the wait so I have to say that receiving Kickstarter message and comment notifications has been rather scary.  It turned out that this fear has been unfounded, most of the messages I received were positive and encouraging!  I feel humbled and grateful, and I can't thank you enough for being so wonderful :)
Shipping Continues

Books are on their way!
I've been busy getting the books and deluxe packages out to you!  If you pledged at $25 tier and replied to survey, the books will be reaching you very soon! (or you might have yours already)
I'm working my way up the tiers, so the deluxe packages are shipping next.  I have a stack of boxes of books that have been signed for this tier, along with coloring books, greeting cards and magnets!  These will be shipping this week.

Yay!
I just got a word that books will be in Chicago customs July 19th, and I wanted to share the news with you.  (It will take few more days to go from there to the warehouse)  That means that I will be sending surveys asking for addresses soon!
I know that it's been too long, but it looks like our wait is coming to an end :D

And they look awesome! 
I feel like some weight has fallen of my chest and I'm really excited to see the books now.   If I'm calculating things properly, I should expect them in August.  And then it will be slightly over a year of this crazy roller coaster!
Greeting Card Tier

updates.update_userinfo: I got my hard proofs today
updates.update_content:
Sorry for a long silence
Things are moving along! The new files have been delivered to the printer, and now I'm waiting for printed copy of a proof. We should be in a home stretch from there :)
If you backed on a greeting card level I sent out a survey for that today. Please fill it out, so that I can mail you your cards.

Reprint
I'm terribly sorry to do this to you guys - especially since in the last update I said the books are on the way. I looked at expedited copy with my printer, and we decided that it's not up to our standard. This is my first book, and it means so much to me. I want this to be something that I'm proud of, something that you can cherish, so the printer volunteered to reprint it for me.

campaign.story:
As a professional designer and an amateur magician - this is my dream project. I've been collecting cards myself for several years now. While I've always loved the variety that's out there, the designer in me has always wanted to try my hand at my own version.
Bloodlines derives it's name from the tradition of playing cards - 4 royal families. When I embarked on this design challenge, I tasked myself with ensuring the court cards in this set felt like they belonged together. Each "family" has their own traits and personalities, which I hope you will find unique and refreshing to your typical deck of 52. 
I will be printing with the United States Playing Card Company - famous for their Bicycle® Playing Cards. They continue to deliver high quality cards and expert printing - ensuring that this deck will be a beautiful piece in your card collection. With your help, we can make these cards a reality! 
 The Cards
Each card is stylized to have a distinct, textural quality.
The Tuckbox
The goal is to utilize the highest quality printing techniques for the tuckbox. My plan is to use gold foil - and if we go beyond our goal, embossing. 
The Rewards
Uncut Sheets! These are incredibly beautiful and look great on the wall!
Posters
These 11" x 17" wildcard posters will be screen printed with metallic ink by local Durham shop owner & legend, Lenny - of Hey Monkey! Design
Add-Ons
Don't see the reward tier you're looking for? To add-on additional rewards, simply go to "manage pledge" and add the corresponding amount to your pledge to ensure you get the extra reward items!
 Add-ons can only be redeemed with a base reward.
Thank You!

Hey Backers!
My apartment has spent the last several days being treated as a fulfillment warehouse - which means your orders are on their way! A few days ago I began mailing out the cards via the USPS.
Domestic & International Backers

Backers,
The cards are here!

Hello backers!
I hope everyone is having a great weekend so far. Today I have a quick progress update that I’m happy to share!
Over the last few weeks, I’ve spent time refining the artwork and prepping it for Bicycle. Recently I’ve signed off on production and we are gearing up to make these a reality!

Hello backers! 
Surveys
Surveys have been sent out to collect your information! Please note the add-on question...if you upped your pledge to redeem an add-on, I will need that information to cross-check with your pledge amount to make sure you get the proper rewards. We did it!

What’s next?

campaign.story:
The Angelarium is a place where experiences, ideas and archetypes exist as real living entities. It's the domain of angels and emanations. Growing at its center sits the Tree of Life, a physical manifestation that reflects the whole of existence.
This 52 page art book is a chronicle of Enoch, a living man who traveled the Angelarium and explored the interior world of the Tree of Life. He encounters its ten emanations, and ruminates upon the unknowable being that is Ein Sof.
With your support, I'll be able to create this initial printing of Angelarium: Book of Emanations and build a foundation for more releases set in this world. Support for this project helps the team that created it build upon the work that's been done create more moving forwards.
Creators
Peter Mohrbacher and Eli Minaya
Angelarium was created by me, Peter Mohrbacher. I've collaborated with artist and writer Eli Minaya to help bring this vision to life. His iconic ink drawings were the basis for most of the Emanation's appearance and his writing is the basis for the book's story.
Albino Dragon Cross Promotion
If you back this campaign and Albino Dragon's Angelarium Poker Deck campaign you get a free bonus print of Matariel, Angel of Rain. (*must back both campaigns at $25 or more)
Addons
Here's some other stuff we created for the project you can get as well:
T-shirts - $25
Pendants - $25
Da'at Playmat - $35
Signed 12 x 18 prints - $25
Original Sketches - starting at $100
Regular rewards will start shipping around May. But any addons you pick up from the Angelarium store will usually ship out within about a week.
Kickstarter Exclusive Challenge Coin
This 2" challenge coin is being created expressly for this campaign and will only be available through Kickstarter. It's included in every reward tier of $55 and over. The design features Eli's illustration of Keter as heads and Malkuth as tails.
Sketch Primer
This 5.5" x 8.5" paper cover book contains all the sketches from the process of creating the main book. It's a great companion item and it's now included in all the "deluxe" tiers and higher!
Rewards
Angelarium: Book of Emanations is a 52 page hardcover art book with dust jacket. It'll contain at least 22 original illustrations for Peter Mohrbacher and Eli Minaya along with accompanying poetry and short stories.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've never printed a book before but I know that any new venture incurs risk.

To help make sure this thing works out the best it can, I've decided to work with a local printing company that specializes in helping independent creators publish crowdfunded projects. I'm going to be leaning on their expertise to help make sure that the quality of the book and the pipeline from concept to delivery goes smoothly.

Will this be late? Probably. Every campaign I've run has been delivered late no matter how much I prepare for it. I can't promise shit won't happen, but I do promise to be transparent about it and as helpful as I can before, during and after this project gets funded.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Angelarium Book 2 is now on Kickstarter!

updates.update_content:
There were an unlucky 11 packages that took several months to find their way to the front of the queue, but as of today, everything has been shipped.
If you are still waiting on a package from me, please email MohrbacherArt@gmail.com to inquire about its status. We'll be able to help you with tracking numbers, replacements and any other questions you have.
Lessons Learned
#1. No more casually adding sketches to reward tiers. I'm not good at completing them in a timely manner and combining that with the promise to deliver sketches from both Eli and myself made it a lot harder. He was totally great about taking care of them promptly, but the mailing back and forth exasperated the single biggest delay in this whole process.

At this point, the only rewards that remain unfulfilled are the Collectors Edition books. Since I've been getting an increasing number of questions related to them, I figured it was high time to make an update.
The thing that has prevented them from being mailed is my own sluggishness when it comes to sketching bookplates.
I am currently on a trip away from my regular studio to avoid the cold Chicago winter. I've brought the full collection of book plates complete with sketches by Eli. When I return from my exodus on , I will have all the sketches complete and they will begin mailing shortly afterwards. I expect the process to take about a week and the shipping time to take between 1-4 weeks depending on the distance they need to travel.

The warehouse has shipped all the packages that it's going to ship. The remaining packages are either collectors editions, portfolios and late survey respondents.
If you did not purchase a collectors edition or portfolio and you are missing a package, you can contact Julie over at MohrbacherArt@gmail.com to get customer service. She will be helping people by providing tracking information, updates on returned packages as well as replacements for missing packages.

Nearly all of the tiers have had their rewards handed off the warehouse and most of those have been put into the mail. There are a couple of exceptions, which I will address specifically in this update. If you aren't waiting on one of the two listed items,please email Julie at MohrbacherArt@gmail.com with issues about missing packages, damaged packages, missing items, undelivered addons or any other situation where you gave us money and we didn't give you what you expected in return.
Ultimately, this campaign was constructed in a way that was very confusing for us to get the right stuff to the right people. We've been working on that for the past several months and it never stops being a source of anxiety for the whole team. We're looking forward to confirming that everything went out to the right places, so we can finally call this campaign complete.

The sketch primers finally made it stateside. That means almost all the remaining tiers are just about ready to ship.
Tomorrow, I will be dropping off playmats, T-shirts, prints and coins to the warehouse where the books and sketchbooks are already residing. I'll be spending a chunk of the day there signing books for backers. This means that starting next week, several hundred more backers will be having their packages mailed.
The last few backers

updates.update_userinfo: 12 x 18 prints for Kickstarter backers only
updates.update_content:
Well, after months of talking delays, I'm happy to have an update that is all good news.
I've gotten hands on with the sketch primer and it's great. Way better than what I was originally planning on. I think you'll like it too. My printer told me that he has airmailed over the first 100+ copies to the US to alleviate the delay on a large number of backer rewards. This means surveys are going out for a number of tiers deluxe and higher tiers.
Keep an eye out for shipping surveys if you haven't gotten one already!

I've got an update full of mixed news.
The books have cleared customs and are in the warehouse right near me. The bad news is that this just happened this week. I had recently written that they were going to be shipping out in September because that's what I was told but stormy weather in the Pacific ocean had other plans. A slow boat ride and a leisurely trip through customs has found us in the month of October without a single book mailed yet.
Sketch Primer Delay

I forgot to add a question to poll you if you pledged extra money for additional rewards. I'll be sending out a separate survey directly to those of you who have addons. Keep an eye out for emails from me later this week.
-Pete

campaign.story:
Urbance is a 26-minutes animated action serie for 16+ audience. Written and Directed by Joel Dos Reis Viegas and Sébastien Larroudé. A topic that hits with stunning visuals and blasting tunes; Urbance brings you into a post-modern story world, made of hip-hop vibes and electronic influences.
 (SHARE THIS CALL TO ACTION IN VIDEO)
   Watch Urbance official Trailer!
VIDEO 1: What is Urbance?
VIDEO 2: Behind the scene...
VIDEO 3: THE ANIMATION with Hiroshi Shimizu
VIDEO 4: THE MUSIC with PLAID

Our goal is to raise a minimum of $189,000 to complete the production of a pilot episode. After completion, this pilot will be presented to broadcasters, investors and festivals as an independent artistic vision that will stand as the ground base of a full TV series with Transmedia developments. Anything raised above our minimum goal will be invested in the production of the Episode 1 of Urbance. 
Here is how we intend to use the funds raised :
Increase the quality of animation (and bring Hiroshi Shimizu — of Studio Ghibli's fame— on board!)
Help offset the current production costs
Produce exclusive music with AAA artists
Manufacturing costs for backers' rewards

_______________________________________________________________
GOAL#1 $189,000 ACHIEVED!
_______________________________________________________________
UPDATE #26 - Meds are in da house! Pre-order now!
_______________________________________________________________
UPDATE #16 - HOW TO PLEDGE FOR MULTIPLE REWARDS?
_______________________________________________________________
UPDATES #13
New $35 Reward : VIDEO GAME!!!
You were not expecting this soon but here it is: the first video game in the URBANCE transmedia story world is coming and it’s coming fast thanks to the cross over between two franchises: URBANCE & HOVER: Revolt of Gamers. Check update #13 for more details.
 _______________________________________________________________
 _______________________________________________________________
"In a post-modern city torn by street violence, sex is prohibited because of a deadly genetical virus infecting the entire population. Men and women have grown apart, hating each other until two young rebels, disowned by their own gangs, are leading the fight to live their love freely."
In the crumbling inner city, sex kills. The urban landscape is split in two — men on one side, women on the other— opposing each other. COEVO seems to be the only hope: a government medical treatment developed to cure every single citizen except that those wearables haven't produced the expected results yet...
Born among this lost generation of frustrated gangs, Kenzell and Lesya live each day as their last, defying anyone who stands in the way of their union. Like modern avatars of Romeo and Juliet, they will have to choose between love or their kind, Passion VS Reason, Deadly Eves VS Neo Blasterz... In their flamboyant relationship lies the premises of a revolution against the authorities, the vicious Mediators and their mysterious separatist laws. Rebels can change the world...
PLAY

Based in Montreal, Steambot is a Canadian creative agency specialized in developing ideas and providing Concept Art for Entertainment Industry. Founded in 2006 by Sébastien Larroudé, Joël Dos Reis Viegas and Nicolas Ferrand, Steambot rapidly became a serious outsider thanks to its innovative teamwork approach but also its unique creative touch.
We at Steambot come from different backgrounds; from Animation (Joël) to Architecture (Sébastien), to Céramic Design (Nicolas). This richness of disciplines keeps us constantly curious to discover new skills and extand our activites : we don’t only outsource Art, we also produce original projects (IP) internally.
The journey started in 2005 when Steambot was a collective of Artists, inspired by sharing, experimenting and by pass ego. Years later, we still trust in these values that led the team to collaborate on numerous AAA games and movies such as TRON Legacy, Godzilla, X-MEN: Days of Future Past, Thief, Batman Games (Warner). This exposure allowed Steambot to establish the agency as a leader in the Industry.
"I have been a big fan of this project since I first saw it. Love the characters, the color design, and the animation… Damn, how did you guys do that? So damn slick."  
Robert Valley Designer / Animator / Director on TRON: Uprising, Motorcity, XMEN Evolution, Aeon Flux, Dance Central
______________________________________________________________
"With Urbance, Joël not only opens another door into the high-end space of the TV animation lexicon, he shatters it. Like Fat Albert, The Boondocks and Black Dynamite before it, Urbance introduces a world that reflects the diverse, fast-paced one we live in and not a manufactured one. Where social tolerance is at the forefront of the world, while never speaking down to it's audience...and visually blowing them away at the same time. It's a perfect tour de force mix... and it's a show that needs to be made NOW."
LeSean Thomas Creative Producer / Supervising Director, Black Dynamite: The Animated series (Season1)
______________________________________________________________
キャラクターのデザインや色彩が素晴らしく、魅力的なので。
自分にはないセンスに魅力を感じました
"The character designs and the colors of Urbance are incredible. There is a charm that I don't have in my designs and I would love to develop."
Hiroshi Shimizu Animation Director / Character Designer : Princess Mononoke, Porco Rosso, Michiko & Hatchin, Space Dandy
______________________________________________________________
"With Urbance, I had the chance to discover an uninhibited Western project offering a large freedom of expression in both story and designs. It's pure dynamite in the animation industry  and we definitely need to support it!"
Eddie Mehong CFO / Art Director at Yapiko Animation / Animator on Space Dandy, Macross Frontier, Basquash, One Piece, Zetman, Conan
______________________________________________________________
"When I saw Urbance for the first time a few years ago I thought that it was already quite an achievement in terms of design and animation. It never stopped moving in the right direction then. Steambot guys are working at the opposite side of the globe, but I can feel a connection with them. I backed the project and I am confident that the true animation lovers will support Urbance. I'm also certain that a lot of japanese animators will be delighted to work on a project with so strong artistic values. These are way too rare. And I would be honored to help the team create a stimulating and creative environnement with the japanese side."
Thomas Romain Tokyo based animation creator : Oban Star-racers, Basquash!, Space Dandy
Crowdfunding is the ultimate way for our growing community of Urbancers to show their interest and support the franchise. You can be part of it by pledging here, share the fever with your friends and stay in touch through our 11,000+ OFFICIAL FACEBOOK PAGE or other social networks (Urbance is on Tumblr, Reddit, Instagram, Pinterest, Linkedin, Twitter, Behance, Deviantart, You Tube,...). 
We've chosen Kickstarter to make this beautiful and unconventional project possible the way we see it. No artistic compromises. Let's build Urbance together!

campaign.story:
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Main Reward ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~  DELUXE UPGRADE ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 
We have successfully unlocked the option to upgrade the standard hardcover book to a clothbound Deluxe Edition:
There are no seperate reward tiers for the Deluxe Edition of the Wormworld Saga book. All you have to do, to upgrade the standard edition of the book to the Deluxe Edition, is to add an additional $15 to your pledge. ANY reward containing a book can be upgraded that way. If your reward includes more than one book just add $15 for each book you want to upgrade. 
After the campaign a survey will be sent out to all backers in which you will be asked how many books exactly you want to have upgraded. Just to make sure.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me via private message. 
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Funding Progress ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
The Wormworld Saga in an epic fantasy adventure for all ages. The original graphic novel is published online at wormworldsaga.com. In 2012 the German publisher Tokyopop started to publish a German book edition of The Wormworld Saga and collected the first three chapters in a glorious hardcover book.
The current German edition of the first Wormworld Saga book
The German book already had a second edition and this January a French version of the book was published by the well-established Belgian publisher Dupuis. There really is no reason why we shouldn't find a publishing partner for an English edition of this book in the United States. Especially if you take into account that 70% of the visitors of the Wormworld Saga website are located in countries where English is the native language and 50% are actually living in the U.S. Frankly, of all languages, an English edition should have been the very first one to be published. 
However, it turns out that it's not that easy to bring a European graphic novel to the North American market and since the traditional publishing world didn't give this book a chance we've decided to have this crowdfunding campaign. 
PLAN B - because everyone should have one!
This project is based on the page layout that Tokyopop created for the German edition and should this campaign succeed, the printing of the English edition will also be supervised by Tokyopop in Germany. It's interesting to note that publishers normally don't print foreign language editions. Printing the books isn't even the problem. Distributing them is. Publishers typically don't have strong connections to distributors in foreign countries and since bringing the printed books into the bookstores is the critical part in selling books the traditional way, most publishers only do business in their home country and license their books to foreign publishers if they want to bring it to foreign markets.
However, in this case we don't have to worry about distribution because we will do our business directly with you, the reader. Through this kickstarter campaign we will find out if there is a demand for an English book edition of The Wormworld Saga and should this be the case, it will be our pleasure to meet it without any middlemen.
OUR GOAL - which we can't reach without you!
Our goal is to produce a moderate print run of an English edition of the first Wormworld Saga book. Our funding goal covers the printing costs, postage and kickstarter fees. It's simple as that. To thank you for your support we have a nice set of rewards.
REWARDS - because you deserve them!
The central reward of this campaign is the book. We'd love to see it in as many hands as possible and therefore we've tried to make it extra affordable. Since this book is going to be produced in Germany we expect to ship practically all books via international mail. Therefore we have incorporated a flat shipping fee into the price of $25 for the book. No matter where you are located in the world, you don't have to worry about additional shipping fees AT ALL. 
The book is 5.91″ x 9.25″ (15 x 23,5cm), hardcover with varnished logo, 128 pages, and contains the first three chapters of The Wormworld Saga, a sketchbook section, a fan art gallery*, and a 'Making Of'-article about the history of the project. All books in this campaign are signed and stamped with a kickstarter exclusive blue Wormseal stamp.
* We will actually try to get ALL NEW fan art from international artists for this edition. If you are an artist and want to contribute to the fan art gallery, keep an eye out for our call for submissions!
You can also get a small sketch and a personal dedication in your book. Since the blank first page is covered with the stamp and the signature, these will go on the last page of the book.
If you want to make your book extra special, you can get these three prints from my favorite panel artwork of each chapter in the book. The prints are 5.91" x 7.87" (15 x 20cm) on strong 230g/m² paper with rounded corners and they are signed and stamped with a kickstarter exclusive blue Wormseal stamp.
Because these are very popular Wormworld Saga items we're offering an exclusive edition of the large collector's prints of The Journey Begins, Welcome To The Wormworld, and Trapped! . The prints are 27,6" x 19,7" (70 x 50cm) on strong 230g/m² paper, signed, dated, and come with a kickstarter exclusive blue Wormseal stamp. You can get a personal dedication on it, too.
The three collector's prints are also available as a bundle in THE PRINT MANIAC tier at $500. This reward will also come with three signed posters:
The three posters "Captain Orion", "Fireflowers" and "The Course of Things"
And if you're willing to invest an additional $100 you can add some nice merchandize to the package. The MERCH MANIAC tier at $600 comes with all the prints, a wooden sword replica, a plush, and a button set. Here's a video:
As my illustration workflow is 100% digital these days, I practically don't draw on paper anymore. But you know, it's like riding a bike and whenever there is an occasion for it, I enjoy doing pencil drawings for my most dedicated fans. The pencil drawings are 5.91" x 7.87" (15x20cm) with rounded edges on heavy drawing paper. The drawing incorporates a kickstarter exclusive blue Wormseal stamp, is signed and dated and you can get a personal dedication on it. These are rare items. Really, you don't often have the chance to get one of these!
CUSTOM REWARDS - because you know exactly what you want!
If none of the listed rewards exactly fits your needs - maybe you want a specific number of books, or just a very specific mix of the available items - you can choose the reward tier THE INDIVIDUALIST at $25 and combine your own custom reward. Take any combination of items that you find in the chart below and calculate the total sum of your custom reward. Then edit the amount of your pledge to fit this sum and you're ready to go. When the campaign ends, we will send around a survey in which we will ask you of which items your custom reward consists and that's it. Please note that kickstarter limits the number of items that we can send out in bulk. So, please don't choose more than 10 pieces of a specific item. Your total number of items can be more than 10 pieces though.
All Custom rewards - even those that don't include books - come with at least one set of all available freebies. If your custom reward contains more than one book each of the books will come with all available Freebies. 
For custom rewards it's hard to optimize shipping fees. The shipping costs are incorporated into the pricing of the individual items but the more items you combine the more likely it is that we can save shipping costs if we send out everything in one big package. In cases where we can save a substancial amount of shipping costs we will compensate this with additional items that we will put into your package.
Do you have an idea for a completely new item that you'd like to have but don't find in this list? Write it in the comments and if your idea isn't too crazy it's very likely that I will add it to the list.
FREEBIES - because everyone loves them!
We appreciate any contribution to this campaign, be it ever so small. Therefore every backer will receive a PDF containing the Jonas, Raya and Loki papertoys. You will have to print out the PDF and assemble them yourself though. Fortunately this is a lot of fun!
PHYSICAL FREEBIES - because what's in your hand matters!
The following items will be given away as freebies to all backers that receive a physical reward ($25 and above). You know how it works: should we reach beyond our funding goal, the list of freebies is likely to expand as we hopefully hit many different stretch goals.
For the beginning we'll put this cool metallic Wormseal sticker into all packages. It's 3.15" (8cm) in diameter and looks especially cool on dark surfaces. I personally love to put these on black Moleskine notebooks. It looks awesome!
A set of three postcards with the covers of the chapters that are featured in the book. These postcards are strictly limited to this campaign and will never be produced again. The idea is, to have all future books equipped with chapter postcards so that you can gather a nice collection of them!
This giant magnetic button is 3.1 inches (7,9cm) in diameter and sticks to any magnetic metal surface. It simply looks awesome anywhere you put it.
The "Trusted Blade" bookmark is the ideal companion to the book. Every bookmark will be signed with a silver marker.
This dust jacket is perfect for all Deluxe Editions because that way you don't have to let go of the nice cover artwork if you upgrade to the Deluxe Edition. And for the standard hardcover books it also doesn't hurt to get them some extra protection.
The special thing here is that the mockup above shows the first map of the Wormworld which now is over 7 years old. I really don't like to officially use this map any longer and that's why the map we are talking about here will be a brand new map that I will illustrate completely from scratch.
BONUS ITEMS - because ... Bonus!
Every backer (down to the $1 rewards) will receive the Wallpaper Set:
I will create a collection of info and images about Captain Orion and you'll receive it in form of The Captain Orion Files PDF (for all $10 rewards and above). The PDF will include all major Captain Orion artworks, editorial text and a lot of sketches and studies of this character. It will also include a Captain Orion comic splashpage that was created as a demo for a videotraining. This page will be translated in English (it currently is lettered in German):
The Upgraded Map (for all $25 rewards and above) will be printed on both sides and on the back there will be a list of all backers. I will sign the map with a silver marker and this special version of the map will be limited to this campaign:
LOCKED FREEBIES - let's free them!
All freebies have been unlocked! You're AWESOME!
THANK YOU! - which can't be said often enough!
No, really! Thank you for your interest in our kickstarter campaign and we hope for your support!
Greetings, 
Daniel Lieske
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The production and printing of the books will be done by Tokyopop. They are one of the biggest comic publishers in Germany and have a huge experience in this field. The books will be printed in Germany so pirate attacks on cargo ships from China really are no issue at all! Phew!

I myself will be personally involved in the fulfillment of this campaign. I've already done two kickstarter campaigns and nobody had any complaints about how I handled those. Of course there's always things that can go wrong but normally these are minor issues that may cause small delays if at all. My policy is to be very transparent about the progress of the project and you can expect regular updates from me during the fulfillment phase.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Wormworld Saga English Book Edition - The Long Due Update
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,  
During the past few months I received a lot of messages concerning the 3rd volume of the Wormworld Saga English Book Edition. This is a very valid request since the copies of Volume 2 were shipped a bit more than a year ago now. I guess everyone kind of expected the next book kickstarter campaign alongside the release of Chapter 8 in May, or at the latest in the wake of the Chapter 9 launch last month. There are good reasons why there hasn't been a new kickstarter campaign yet and I'd now like to address these in all appropriate detail.  
In November 2015, actually right at the time when I was packing the Volume 2 books at the office of my publisher, I've received an email from a major US book publisher who wanted to publish the English book edition of the Wormworld Saga. Of course everyone was happy about this inquiry because this has always been the goal - finding a proper publisher for the English Wormworld Saga books. Negotiations started and everything looked just fine. As soon as I've received the first version of the contract, the editor who had initiated the negotiations, quit his job. Then the new editor started to change the contract in a way that it became unacceptable for me and my German publisher. We had to bail out of the negotiation.

I'd like to send out a short reminder to all backers of Volume 1 of the Wormworld Saga Book Edition, that the kickstarter campaign for Volume 2 is closing soon. Again we've managed to create an awesome reward package for the backers and I'm personally looking forward to the hand-painted resin figure, that can be added to any reward for a small extra shipping fee of $10.
I'd love to welcome you as a backer of the Wormworld Saga again!

This is just a short message to let everyone know that the kickstarter campaign for Volume 2 of the Wormworld Saga Book Edition has just been launched:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/daniellieske/the-wormworld-saga-book-edition-volume-2?ref=card
Also, you can now read Chapter 7 of the Wormworld Saga:

updates.update_userinfo: Volume 2 kickstarter coming up this weekend!

updates.update_content:
Dear backers, today I can announce that the fulfillment of the Wormworld Saga Book Edition - Volume 1 kickstarter campaign is completed. Today I've sent out a final batch of books to the fan artists and that pretty much wraps it up. 
I now hope that all rewards reach their destinations savely and in good shape. Of course I'm at your service at any time if there's any issue with your rewards. When you're sending out over a thousand packages you just have to anticipate a certain amount of cases in which something goes wrong. Fortunately we've got very few cases of wrong/missing items so far and even less cases of damaged books. And so far only one package returned to us because it didn't reach its recipient. By the way, if your reward contains more than one book, those items have most likely been sent out in seperate packages that don't necessarily arrive at the same time. So, if you receive a package and it doesn't include all the items you've expected, please give it a little bit more time (I'd say up to two weeks) before you contact me about missing items.

Phew, we've reached a major milestone in the fulfillment of this kickstarter campaign. As of Saturday, all physical rewards have been shipped. I'm very relieved to have reached this point. My wife and I have been packing each and every evening since mid-January and we're happy to finally have some free time again.
Now, there's still a bunch of backers who haven't provided their survey answer yet and of course those will be processed as they come in. Also we're currently collecting complaints about damaged or missing rewards and those will also be handled in a timely manner. But the main bulk of work for this campaign is now done and that's a very good feeling!

project_data.project_name: The Wormworld Saga Book Edition - Volume 1

campaign.story:
Update 8/7/14
 I am very excited to announce that Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab has created a new hand-blended perfume oil based on the "Scholars' Tower" artwork!     
 SCHOLARS' TOWER: 
"Gleaming amber spheres, polished cedar and mahogany, sweet parchment, inks of frankincense ash, and soft plumes of incense."
The "Scholars' Tower" perfume oil is presented in a 5ml amber apothecary vial, and is available as follows:
$45: BPAL "Scholar's Tower" perfume oil blend + one 11x14" print of Scholar's Tower (plus digital rewards)
$60: BPAL Scholar's Tower" perfume oil blend + one copy of Imagined Realms: Book 1 (plus digital rewards)
$65: BPAL Scholar's Tower" perfume oil blend + one Signed copy of Imagined Realms: Book 1 (plus digital rewards)
 (Note that the books and artwork will ship separately from the perfume.) If you've already pledged but would like to also purchase the Scholars' Tower perfume oil, you can either switch your pledge, or contact me through Kickstarter about adding it to your order. Deepest thanks to Elizabeth Barrial and Brian Constantine at Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab for their help and for collaborating with me on this!
Update 8/4/2014: 
We hit the 2nd stretch goal of $25,000!! That means everyone’s print orders will now come with an additional thank-you postcard, featuring an exclusive new picture that I’m making which will only be printed on the cards and never posted online. :)  More announcements to come!
Also: New Backer Reward! There were request for individual prints, so now there is a $20 option that lets you choose any two 11x14 prints. 
Update:  We've reached the first stretch goal at $20,000! Thank you so much!! Everyone will have an additional PDF book of process sketches of some of my older works added to their order. :)  More updates on the way; stay tuned! 
My name is Julie Dillon and I'm the creator of Imagined Realms: Book 1, which is the first in a series of annual art books that I am illustrating and self-publishing. Each book contains 10 all-new illustrations made exclusively for each book!
I got into art because I love to create, to see the world in new ways, and to stir the imagination of others. I have long wanted to start putting together my own books and work on more personal projects. "Imagined Realms" gives me the opportunity to spend more time creating my own illustrations and projects, and also gives me the chance to create more illustrations that feature positive and diverse representations of women. 
Each book will have it's own theme. The art in Book 1 is all fantasy themed, and Book 2 (which is currently in development) will be science fiction themed. 
I am launching this Kickstarter to pay for the cost of getting the books printed. It will also give me the ability to create the content for Book 2. Currently, the print book will be available exclusively through kickstarter.
The books will be 22-page 9.5" x 12" softcover books, each page printed on sturdy gloss-coated cardstock. Included in the book are the ten new illustrations, plus multiple sketches and progress shots for each illustration. In addition to the printed book, I'm also offering digital downloads, prints and giclees.
All the artwork will be available to license for use as cover art by independent authors and small publishers. With each book I produce, I'll be creating a larger library of available art for other creators to license for use, at a fraction of the cost of commissioning a custom piece. 
Here are the giclees available to choose from, featuring all the artwork from the book: 
The printed book and the two print packs are Kickstarter exclusives. If you want a copy of Imagined Realms: Book 1, or either of the print packs, please buy them now. The PDFs and process videos, will be made available for purchase on my website after the Kickstarter is complete. Any remaining limited edition giclees will also be available to purchase online as well. 
All the books, cardstock prints, and giclees will all be produced at local family-owned print shops. 
Stretch Goals: 
**We made it to 20,000!! :)** +If we reach $20,000, I will add an additional PDF of process sketches of some of my older works to everyone's order.
+At $25,000, I will add exclusive thank-you postcard to all print orders.
 +At $30,000, I will add a 2nd video download showing the process for the illustration "Downtime" to all orders $15 and up. 
 +At $50,000, I will add an additional new illustration to the book and print packs. 
+More to come! 
The artwork has been completed. I just need to get the books and art printed and into your hands! 
Special Thanks to SiriusBeatTV for letting me use their music on my video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the artwork is completed, the PDFs are formatted, the books laid out, and the videos made, so the greatest risk is a delay in production and shipping. To be on the safe side, I've accounted for potential delays in the estimated delivery dates. I've built my career on a foundation of delivering work on time, so I promise I will do everything I can to deliver the final product to you as quickly as I can.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
