updates.update_content:
The books finally arrived on the 17th, and as of this morning, everyone's books and artwork has been packaged and shipped! The workers at the post office were incredibly friendly and helpful, despite me dropping off three carloads of packages during their busiest season. Thank you, post office workers! 
My heartfelt thanks to everyone who supported Imagined Realms. You've given me the confidence to keep branching out and creating my own books and projects. I couldn't have done this without you. I hope you all like how the books turned out!

All international orders shipped last Monday, and a lot of people have received their packages! It's going faster than I thought, which is great. :) 
That said, I just wanted to remind US contributors that your orders will ship out as soon as the main shipment of books arrives on my doorstep. Again, I had expedited a small portion of the book order to make sure international customers got their books in time, and the rest of the book order will be arriving from the printer in 2-3 weeks. I will let you know the second they arrive, and I will ship them (as well as the book + print pack bundles) out as soon as possible, so that they will hopefully arrive in your mailboxes by early December. Thank you for your patience!

I got my first shipment Imagined Realms books in from the printer! They turned out gorgeous! As you can see below, the hardcover upgrade worked out great. Much thanks to PrintNinja! 
Note however that I only have 200 books in hand so far - I was worried about shipping times, so I expedited a portion of the total order to make sure I could get books out to international backers in time. International orders will be shipped out this weekend. The rest of the books (slated for domestic customers) will be arriving at my home in a few weeks, and I’ll have everything ready to get them shipped as soon as possible. I’ll keep you updated. I hope everyone likes them!

campaign.story:
UPDATE:
Goal met! In less than 24 hours even - you guys are brilliant and there'll be a volume 2 of Unsounded because of it! So let's talk about some stretch goals.
$35,000 (6/20 - CONQUERED) - A book-exclusive Duane mini-comic taking place in Sharteshane. Did you ever wonder what Sette's hometown looks like?
$45,000 (6/23 - DEFENESTRATED)- A book-exclusive guide to the Tainish language, and a few choice phrases you can use against enemies and friends alike.
$55,000 (7/1 - EATEN BY A ZOMBIE)- Every book will come with a free vinyl sticker and bookmark of Sette and Duane.
_______________________________________
Hi there!
My name's Ashley Cope and I'm the creator of Unsounded, an online graphic novel about a young thief with high aspirations, and the undead bodyguard suckered into protecting her. Unsounded is published online for free right now and you can read it for yourself at http://www.unsoundedcomic.com.
The comic stars Sette Frummagem, a streetwise young pickpocket eager to please her dad, the local King of Thieves. In order to prove her worth, Sette is sent across the continent to collect on a debt from her cousin, with no one to protect her but a mysterious man named Duane who... happens to be undead.
In the first book, Duane and Sette's trip was messily interrupted when they ran first into a man-eating tree-monster and then into a gang of human traffickers (and the cops hunting them). The pair overcame but not without Duane realizing Sette had led him far further west than he had ever offered to go, and not without Sette learning her bodyguard really is haunted by a zombie's desire to feast on the living.
In the second book, Sette has to avoid cops and robbers both and work her way into the mysterious country of Cresce, where her cousin lies in wait. If she ever wants her father's respect and his gang's obedience, she'll have to prove she's the toughest rogue around - all while trying to keep her attack zombie from losing his mind and making her his next meal.
Unsounded is rated PG-13 for occasional rough language and violence.
What's this Kickstarter for?
After the success of using Kickstarter to print the first volume, I'm back to try and print the second! Volume 2 will be a professionally printed, perfect-bound, softcover tome, and include chapters 4,5, and 6 of the comic, weighing in at 232 pages. All comic art will be edited and retouched, and there'll be new interior illustrations.
If you're new to Kickstarter, it's easiest to think of it as a tool that allows for preorder fundraising. If enough preorders are sold, the second volume of Unsounded will go to print and you will receive your copy! If enough preorders are not sold, no money ever changes hands and no books will be made.
Unsounded only continues to exist because of the support of its readers! When you support the comic you become a direct patron of a independent story delivered ad-free and unfiltered to your eyes, creator to reader, without any middlemen in-between. I hope you'll consider purchasing a PDF or a print volume. If you have any questions about the incentives that offer original content, feel free to contact me here or at murkoph@gmail.com.
A Note on Shipping for Canadians
Kickstarter's tools aren't terribly useful for tailoring shipping costs to each pledger's country. This is most problematic for Canadian friends. If you're in Canada, please only add half of the additional international shipping that's suggested ($7 if it suggests $15, $10 if $20) and if KS gives you guff on the pledge page, say you're in the US. Please only do this if you're in Canada - if you're elsewhere and don't pay enough shipping I cannot send you your stuff! :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm a one person organization. Everything is packed up and shipped out by me. Nevertheless, after the last Kickstarter every order was filled and every incentive delivered. I've now got book-shipping down to a science and I have my fingers crossed that volume 2 will run just as smoothly :)

So please pledge with confidence and know that I will do my very best to get you your books or other items in a timely manner. Thank you for believing in me!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey backers!
I wanted you to know that the third volume of Unsounded is running its Kickstarter at last. If you enjoyed the first two volumes and have been itching to have the cliffhanger at the end of the second resolved, you should love the third book. Go watch the video at least, I'm proud of it ;)
Check it out!

All right, my darlings, if you pledged for a physical reward you definitely should have filled out your survey by now. At the moment, across all tiers, there are still about 50 people who haven't answered. If you're one of those people you're probably not seeing this update either, since you're not checking whatever email account you use for Kickstarter! Everyone else, if you have a friend or even an enemy who you think might have some items coming, mention it to them. Maybe they're one of my missing address surveys!
In the next two weeks I'll be getting the very last of the orders out, mostly the $40 tier. I still have 7 watercolours left to do (in fact I'm about to do another right now) and the last of those will probably spill into January.

Most of you guys know this already since I've been sending out address surveys, but all the books have arrived from the printer and I'm in the process of getting them out :) As of this moment I've sent out address requests to everyone who pledged for an unsigned book, so if that's you make sure you get me your info!
Signed books will go out in a few weeks and be a slightly slower process since every order gets to pick which character they want sketched.

Well, y'all have some explaining to do, buying so many comics in this weak economy.
I sure appreciate it though.
So Unsounded Volume 2 is funded! To you it means print books - to me it means a solid year of making comics for you, and I'm so grateful that your support makes it possible for me to do what I love to do. But! rather than bawling all over you, I'm going to go get back to work! I should have the Volume 2 PDF ready to release next weekend. Everyone who pledged gets a copy of that, so pay attention to update emails from KS, as the next one should lead to a download link for you to grab it.

Well, I'm plainly blown away by how much we've managed to pull together in just one week. The goal didn't last but twenty-four hours before you guys demolished it, and now, a week later, we're almost double that, with two stretch goals met. Crazy! But very cool :)
I had a few people ask for a reward that was a copy of volume 2 plus the postcard set, so I've added a new tier for that now that the $40 signed bookplates have sold out. Those postcards are pretty neat. One will be an updated cast shot, and the other three will be set up like actual postcards that characters have written home, with a message on the back and an illustration on the front - one of Sette and Duane with a message home to Da from Sette, one of Toma and Elka with a message home from Toma, and one of Matty and Quigley with a message to Matty's friends from the short story Orphans. This way you get a little bit of story and also four cool illustrations to display.

campaign.story:
After the success of my first self-published book, Prologue, I am ready to release the next in the series.  Awakening: The Art of Michael C. Hayes, Volume Two will pick up where Prologue left off and chronicle my work from the last two years.
The new book will be built upon the same format as the original, yet will feature more pages, more art, more behind the scenes photos, and will now include a step by step glimpse of the painting process itself.
 The roughly 48 page softcover edition will be full color throughout, A4 size (8.27 × 11.69) and feature high quality thick paper stock. 
Thanks to the many requests for a hardcover version, a limited number of these will be available exclusively as a Kickstarter reward.
REWARDS:
STRETCH GOALS ADDED!
$7.5K 8.5" by 11" print included at all reward levels
$10k 6 pages and commentary added to the book
$12.5k A second 8.5" by 11" print included at all reward levels
$15k  All Hardcover editions will include a remarque, 6 pages added to the sketchbook, all packages with 12" by 18" prints will receive an extra 12" by 18" print.
$17.5k A third 8.5" by 11" print included at all reward levels
$20K  ?????
Softcover edition:  As described above.Each book will come signed.
Kickstarter exclusive hardcover edition. Only available to Kickstarter backers, there will be no other opportunity to purchase a hardcover edition. Features the same size and page count as the softcover.  Each book will come signed and numbered.
2014 Kickstarter exclusive sketchbook. 24 page, black and white, 5.5" by 8.5", staple bound book, featuring previously unpublished sketches, drawings, thumbnails and close-ups of the most popular drawings of my career.  Each book will come signed and numbered.
Prologue: The art of Michael C. Hayes Volume One.   Softcover, featuring works from 2008 to 2012. If haven't bought the first volume yet, there is no better time than now. Each book will come signed.
 12" by 18" Lustre finish print. Produced by me, on my own printers, using archival pigmented inks. Prints will come signed. (Images may be slightly cropped to fit the aspect ratio)
Available prints are shown below. (Larger versions are available for viewing at www.artofmike.com) Each Kickstarter backer will receive an email request for choice of prints when the project has been funded.
18" by 28"  Limited Edition canvas giclees. 1.5" deep gallery wraps, including hanging hardware, eliminates the need for a frame.  Editions will be strictly limited to 50 and come numbered and signed. Produced by me, on my own printers, using archival pigmented inks. (Images may be slightly cropped to fit the aspect ratio) 
Available giclees are shown below. (Larger versions are available for viewing at www.artofmike.com) Each Kickstarter backer will receive an email request for choice of prints when the project has been funded.
Available for shipping in the U.S. only.
Original oil paintings:Original. Oil. Paintings.
Oil paintings will ship within a few weeks of the project funding. Books will be shipped in June.
Adornment, 14″ x 22″ Oil on paper on board. Personal work 2010
 Siren of the Fanged Coast 16″ x 22″ oil on paper on board.  For the Magic: The Gathering card game 2013.
 The Crimson Rose 16″ by 24″ Oil on paper on board.  Cover to a novel by Sharon Pansky, 2013
 Antipathy. 24″ x 44″ Oil on paper on board.  Commissioned for Sign in Blood, a gaming accessories company. 2013
Add ons:
None of the combination packages are quite what you want? Feel free to create your own combo by adding any of these to your pledge:
·$10 2014 Kickstarter exclusive sketchbook
·$20 Softcover edition of Awakening or Prologue
·$45 Kickstarter exclusive hardcover edition of Awakening
·$25 12" x 18" lustre print
·$60 Three 12" x 18" prints
·$150 Ten 12" x 18" prints
·$200 18" x 28" limited edition canvas giclee
·$500 Three 18" x 28" limited edition canvas giclees
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges of trying to make it as a professional artist are too numerous to mention. This past year I have decided to pull away from freelance projects to focus on my own personal work and artistic growth. This, of course, makes that journey that much riskier. This book is one way I am funding my endeavor, thus your support is much more than just the production of a book.

As to the book itself? The first volume was very well received and I am confident I can do even better with this volume.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Book Three: Exodus is now live!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Just wanted to let everyone know that I just launched the campaign for book three!

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/500076908/exodus-the-art-of-michael-c-hayes-volume-three
It's pretty similar in format and rewards as book two.  But, as the video states,  this is the first art book that entirely consists of personal work.  I'm excited and hope this goes as well as the last one.

A good chunk of rewards went out on Thursday,  3 carloads went out yesterday, and I just got finished dropping off the last carload.  Aside from a small handful I am still awaiting emails from, this thing is done. (and only 8 days behind schedule!) Once again, thank you so, so much to everyone.

With 224 packages,  there is a decent chance that something, somewhere went wrong. So if your package doesn't show up in the next few weeks, or we sent you the wrong stuff.  Just shoot me an email at mike@artofmike and we will make it right.

So we ran into some obstacles with stamps.com not wanting to batch import any of our data from kickstarter.  Once we had resigned ourselves to copy/pasting each address, the payment system decided it didn't like me.  This was all after tech support hours had closed.
The good news is that, with the help of some very loyal friends who helped until midnight,  we got 99% of the packaging done .  Almost all of the rewards are boxed up and just need postage.

updates.update_userinfo: Everything has arrived! Fulfillment begins (and hopefully ends) on Monday
updates.update_content:
I just got back from the warehouse, where I loaded up my little Scion with 500 pounds of books.  Sketchbooks arrived a few weeks ago. About $400 worth of shipping supplies got delivered yesterday.  I'll be spending the next few days autographing books and printing out whichever 12 x 18 prints I don't have in stock. Amanda will be organizing all the addresses and putting together a game plan for the big day.
The plan is try and power through it in one, long Monday.  We will be having a few people coming by and lending a hand at various times throughout the day.  I have no idea if that will be plenty of time or nowhere near enough.  I'll report back Tuesday morning with an update.

And they look great!  You guys are gonna love this book (or at least I hope you do as much as I do!) 
Those of you who have Prologue know that I had it printed on very thick 200gsm paper.  Which is basically cover stock for interior pages.  It gave the book a nice, heavy feel.  But the downside was a very stiff binding that caused some worry.  As far as I know, nobodies copy has fallen apart,  but some folks felt they had to be very careful with it.

updates.update_userinfo: The book is at the printer!
updates.update_content:
or rather,  it went to the printer two weeks ago and should be in getting on a boat soon!
I am still working on the layout for the sketchbook, but production turnaround will be much shorter for that one.
My apologies for not keeping everyone updated in a more timely manner.  I could make all kinds of excuses about the busy life of a self-employed artist, but I'll just leave it at an apology and do better going forward.

Well that last minute surge and the overall total was certainly unexpected. I had thought, based on other Kickstarters from my peers, that I was probably going to get 10-12k  (and I would have been happy with much less)   Once again I just want to thank everyone for backing and sharing the project.
Going forward; the plan is to finish a few paintings I want to include, finish the layout and have it at the printer by the end of the month.  I'll be sending out a survey to everyone shortly to get any print choices and info on add-ons.

I am beyond thrilled at how well this project has been going,  thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who backed this.
In fact,  the amount raised has given me the confidence and financial cushion to move forward with a big, new personal project.  I can't talk much about it yet,  I'm still trying to get ducks in a row and contracts drawn up and signed. But I'll say it will be a big collaboration of sorts, and I will be at the helm.  I can't think of anyone else I would rather share it with first than you fine folks.  So when the dedicated Tumblr, FB page and so on go live in a few months,  you all will be the first to know.

Thanks to all of you we are now 128% funded and well on our way to hit my hopeful goal of $10k!
Stretch goals, based on the feedback I have received here, on Facebook and through emails have now been added to campaign.  I still haven't thought of a suitable 20K goal yet,  but we can cross that bridge if we get there.
$7.5K   8.5" by 11" print included at all reward levels

campaign.story:
WHAT IS IT?
Hey there! If you're reading this, you might know me from my professional work as a commercial illustrator, a creative director, a combat artist in the United States Marine Corps, a private school professor, or even an aspiring flight instructor. Over the years, I've worked under a lot names, hats, and clients—it's been nothing short of an incredible experience that has literally taken me all over the world.
Now, with your support, I can make the transition to something completely new: a published, serial collection of self-directed work.
Based in part on my own collection of journals, ANONMAL VOLUME I will be 150-200 pages, and be published for international distribution in a soft-cover, 8.25" x 6" format with full-bleed illustrations. It's a book sized for intimate, but readable, dimensions and slated for full release in April 2014.
I will be matching the money you pledge with funds I've set aside from my own business in order to make ANONMAL my primary professional focus for its five-month production period. This title will premier benjeremy.com, the online hub for the future of my independent work. If funded, your support will pave the way for other planned titles, like THE BLACK JUNGLE BOOK—a re-envisioned copy of Kipling's THE JUNGLE BOOKS with Sheri Groleau, STRANGERS—a guide to the apocalypse with Felix Kramer, print products, or even a line of prototype clothing.
OVER THE GOAL?
If funds go over the initial goal, every additional 2500USD will guarantee at least one more volume of ANONMAL, from VOLUME II (7,500USD; fall 2014) up to VOLUME III (10,000USD; early 2015).
THANKS AND MORE
Like this project, I could have never gotten this far without without the support of my family, friends, and peers.
To my mother and father, thank you for believing in your children and helping to build the foundations for my dreams and career with your continued love and support. To teej, because nothing beats a good letter; to Reagan, for the worlds; to Christina, for being a big girl; to Tyber and Ian, for being family; to James, for having been there; to Robert, for all the possibilities; to Jorge, professor-come-athiest-in-a-foxhole; to Sterling, for understanding; to Mark and Mary, for the way home; to Will and Leslie, for the memories; to Shawn, for the thought; to Derek and Sibelle, for the stranger days; to John, for the even stranger ones; to Josh, for keeping the peace; to Gregerson, for having my back; and to the Academy, for opening some of those first doors.
Like all of you and so many others, I wouldn't be where I am now without your letters, last-minute jobs, and faith in my abilities. Thank you all, and then some.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Though I've operated successfully under professional deadlines of all kinds, the unexpected can always be a challenge! Luckily, the proposed timeline for this project includes an ample buffer for just about anything just short of being activated for unexpected military deployment or detachment. For the production period of "Anonmal Volume I", I will not be actively seeking IA (Individual Augment) orders of any kind.

Otherwise, if this financial goal is met, many of the associated risks with production will be minimized - "Anonmal Volume I" will become my primary project focus until its release in April 2014.

If you have questions or concerns of any kind, please don't hesitate to contact me through this project's FAQ or "ben@benjeremy.com".
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Wrapping up: Anonmal Vol. III is out!
updates.update_content:
Per the publishing schedule, Anonmal III has been officially released. You can now find it on Amazon in print (link to product page), where it will be available until at least June 1, 2015, or continuously as a digital release on BenJeremy.com. Happy reading, everyone! 
Now what happens?
Everything in this post is still on schedule; with Volume III out, I'll be making overtures toward a hardcover edition that collects all three volumes at the end of this year, and then onwards towards re-releasing all the digital editions for free.

Hey everyone! BenJeremy.com, which was funded last year with this project, has been going great. Even with so many unplanned obligations when it came to my military duties, I was able to spend a lot of private time in the studio laying the ground work for the next two years of projects, including the future of the Anonmal series. Here's the scoop:

Hey everyone! We've finally reached April, so let's talk shipping:

campaign.story:
My name is Evan Dahm and I draw comics! I've completed the fantasy adventure stories Rice Boy and Order of Tales, and run Kickstarters to self-publish both of them. I've also made a few books with Benign Kingdom.
I've been working on an ambitious fantasy graphic novel called Vattu since 2010. This Kickstarter is to raise money to get the first book of the story printed. Its contents are already finished, and you can preorder it and get some other stuff through the Kickstarter!
The Story
Vattu is a fantasy comic that takes place in Overside, the setting full of strange creatures that I've developed throughout my work. It's about a girl from a nomadic society who is caught in the middle of a clash of cultures with an enormous, imperialistic civilization called Sahta. It's a story about culture and identity. It's ongoing and is being updated three times a week at rice-boy.com. You can read it there right now for free!
The first book of Vattu, called The Name & The Mark, covers its first 270 pages, and follows Vattu from the plains where she is born to the capital of Sahta.
The Books
Both versions of the book will have the same interiors: 270 pages of story, and extra material including world-internal maps and landscape art. I've tried to make the design as image-heavy and immersive as I can. The books are the same size and similar in design to the Rice Boy and Order of Tales books.
Both versions will be available also as Artist Editions, meaning they will be signed and have a small illustration on the title page.
The standard edition of Vattu: the Name & the Mark will be paperback and 6 by 9 inches. The cover will have a nice matte coating, and french flaps. The front cover features a full-bleed wordless image of Vattu in the plains.
The deluxe version of Vattu: the Name & the Mark will be hardcover and 6 by 9 inches. The cover will be in gray cloth over board, with screen printing in white and yellow ink. The front cover bears Vattu's mark, and the spine bears her name written in the world-internal script. Less of the deluxe version will be produced than the standard version, but they will not be limited and numbered as my previous hardcovers have been.
Because we reached 50,000, the hardcovers will have a partial book jacket. Here's a mockup of what that will probably look like:
Extras
In addition to the book, backers can get a set of six 6 x 9 inch prints featuring characters from Vattu. Here is what they look like:
There will also be TWO Kickstarter-exclusive 6 x 9 inch prints in addition to this set. These two prints will accompany every physical reward from this Kickstarter. Here's what one of them will look like (the type at the bottom won't be on the print, though!):
Several pledge levels also include copies of my previous Overside books, Rice Boy and Order of Tales, in both paperback and hardcover editions. The hardcover Rice Boy books are almost sold out, so only the last few are available through the Kickstarter! Here is what those books look like:
I have added two pledge levels which include the two pieces of original art shown below. These are the original drawings from which the six-print series made for this Kickstarter are being made. They are drawn in ink over pencil on 14 by 17 inch bristol board. There are some small mistakes and brush test marks around the edges!
This is the FLUTELANDS TRIPTYCH:
This is the EMPIRE TRIPTYCH:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The contents of the book are finished and a printer is already locked in to get started as soon as possible if the Kickstarter is a success! Setbacks with the printer working on big fancy books have happened for me in the past, but this should be my smoothest project yet.
The books will be printed overseas and should arrive in late September or October. They will be sent to backers as quickly as possible.
Commissions will take a bit longer depending on how many there are!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just so you're all up to date--
The carrier company has delayed this shipment several times over the past two weeks or so, but now they are DEFINITELY FINALLY arriving tomorrow morning. This is what they tell me.
The storage unit has been cleaned up and rearranged to fit all this new stuff. Finally finally.

updates.update_userinfo: I am very sorry this is taking so long.
updates.update_content:
Hello!
I've been receiving ever-more-specific updates about when this enormous shipment of Vattu books will be arriving, and it looks like LATE THIS WEEK I'll have them here in New York, any Port Authority setbacks notwithstanding. I'll make a post once they're here, or with any other update.
This means the Vattu books will be sent out as quick as possible right after that point. All of the shipping materials I'll need just arrived, and hopefully this will be quick and painless for all involved. I'm sorry they've taken longer to get here than possible, so I'll try to get them to you directly.

updates.update_userinfo: Books on their way to you you you
updates.update_content:
The last set of proofs have come in, and I have now seen exactly what the offset-printed colors will look like all the way through the Vattu book, and they look great! No matter how sure you are they'll look fine, it is always a relief to see.
One more hiccup, though-- The printer did not have an appropriate transparent paper to print the partial jacket for the hardcovers, as planned. Waiting for them to get a transparent paper would have added at least a month to an already-delayed schedule, so the jackets will instead be printed on opaque white paper. It still looks good! And the jacket was already an extra add-on, so I'm ok with the compromise. I hope this is ok with everyone.

Hey everybody!
There hasn't been much to report regarding the printing so far, but my THIRD proof of the Vattu book to check the colors came in, and some issues with ink density and contrast have finally been fixed, so the books are in production.
Because of this delay to get the color right, the estimated delivery time of the Vattu books to me is now EARLY DECEMBER. This is WAY LATER than I anticipated, and I apologize for that! But I think delays are worth it to me and you if it means the books will be made right!

campaign.story:
Update
Thank you, thank you, thank you! After just under 4 hours, Cucumber Quest Book Two has been fully funded! I'm so excited and grateful for everyone's support.
Since we've passed 100% funding, let's talk about stretch goals! All the money pledged past our initial funding goal will allow me to print nicer books, offer new rewards, and...even better things! Take a look:
(4/26) We've raised $15,000! Thank you! All book covers will get a lovely spot gloss, and the hardcover editions will get a ribbon bookmark.
(4/26) We've raised $17,500! Thank you! All softcovers will have french flaps.
(4/26) We've raised $20,000! Thank you so much!  All books will include a full-color foldout map of the Ripple Kingdom.
(4/27) We've raised $25,000! Thank you! An extra character will be added to the print set.
(4/27) We've raised $30,000! Thank you! The books will include 4 pages of concept art.
(4/28) We've raised $35,000! Thank you! The books will include a 4-page tour of the Ripple Kingdom starring Princess Nautilus.
(5/3) We did it--$45,000! Thank you so much! The books will include an exclusive, 10-page bonus story featuring some familiar characters.
(5/7) Wow, we've raised $50,000! Thank you! Pledges at the $35 tier and higher will receive a Cucumber Quest sticker sheet.
(5/14) We've raised $55,000! Thank you! Cucumber Quest will update three days a week from July through January 2014.
(5/22) We've raised $65,000! Thank you sooo much! Cucumber Quest will update four days a week from July through January 2014.
At $85,000, Cucumber Quest will update four days a week from July through May 2014.
(FYI! The $200 tier includes signed books! Sorry for the confusion.)
____________________
My name's Gigi D.G., and for the past two years, I've been writing and illustrating Cucumber Quest, a lighthearted fantasy webcomic for all ages.
Maybe! Last year, I launched a Kickstarter campaign to fund the publication of Cucumber Quest's first printed book. The project was a tremendous success, and with the aid of over 1,000 backers, I was able to print a very lovely book and work full-time on webcomic updates for six months.
(Book One is available in the shop, but you can also receive it as part of certain reward tiers this time around!)
One year since the previous Kickstarter campaign, I've created nearly 200 new pages of Cucumber Quest, and the next chapter of my story is complete and ready to be printed.
Giant squid monsters! Treacherous caverns! Mobster crabs! These are but a few of the perils awaiting our intrepid(ish) heroes as they set sail for the Ripple Kingdom. Picking up where the first volume left off, Book Two finds our unwilling "legendary hero," Cucumber, separated from his companions after a pretty gnarly shipwreck. Luckily, the cheerful and wise(ish) Princess Nautilus is on his side, so rescuing the kingdom from evil should be a snap! ...Right?
Cucumber Quest's second book will be about 220 full-color pages, featuring "Chapter 1: Disaster in Paradise" and the following 42-page interlude, as well as bonus comics and other new material from the website. Just like last year, we're planning to print both a softcover and a hardcover version. 
Since this book is considerably longer than the first volume, it will cost a bit more to print. The printing and shipping costs for a project of this scale will be at least $12,000. Provided we meet our goal, the books will be printed in fall 2013.
Thanks so much for your support!
____________________
About Rewards:
What's the print set? A collection of six postcard-sized (6"x4") prints, each featuring a character from the comic. Last year's print set is shown above. This year's print set will feature the Dream Oracle, Princess Nautilus, Chardonnay, Queen Cordelia, Splashmaster and Saturday.
For a pledge at the $250 you'll receive an original ink drawing (7"x10") of the Cucumber Quest character of your choice. At the $325 tier, you'll receive a gouache painting (9"x12") of the Cucumber Quest character of your choice. (This example is not signed, but yours definitely will be.)
At the $500 tier, you'll receive a complete digital illustration of whatever subject matter you like.
At the $1000 tier, you can choose from any of the previously mentioned illustration rewards, and you'll also receive a handcrafted paper cutout featuring the Cucumber Quest character of your choice. Naturally, I can only offer one of these!
____________________
Video Credits (Music)
Beach Party by Kevin MacLeod
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second publishing campaign on Kickstarter, so I've done all of this before. Last year, I was able to ship out over 1,000 orders over the course of about a month while keeping up with regular comic updates four days per week. This time around, I'll be dedicating a full week to packing and shipping orders to hurry the process along.

The comic portion of this book is complete, so all that remains is editing for print and completing bonus materials, which should take no longer than two months. Printing will be handled by the same reliable and timely company as last year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The Book Two Kickstarter has come to an end, and we've raised a grand total of $75,290! While we weren't able to reach our highest stretch goal, we've surpassed last year's funding total by over $12,000. I'm a broken record as always, but thank you so much for making this happen! It's a dream come true to be able to share this comic with you, and your support means everything to me.
I'm hard at work on bonus content for the book, and my estimate is that everything will be ready for printing by July 15th. Also, starting July 1st, CQ's update schedule will increase to , which I'm really looking forward to.

20 days since the Kickstarter's launch, we've passed our $55,000 stretch goal! This means one extra update per week for the last half of 2013. Thank you so much!
(You might notice that the time period for increased updates has changed from "June through December" to "July through January." This was due to a small error on my part. To give myself enough time to make the book as amazing as I possibly can, I've scheduled increased updates to start in July, like last year. Thanks for your understanding!)

Thanks so much, everyone! We've surpassed our eighth stretch goal of $50,000(!), which means all pledges of $35 and up will receive a sticker sheet.
As a reminder, our remaining stretch goals are for more frequent Cucumber Quest updates! At $55,000, CQ will update three pages a week from June through December 2013. At $65,000, that will increase to four pages a week. And, if we manage to raise $85,000 before funding ends, CQ will update four pages a week through April 2014!

We've raised over $40,000 in just a few days! As always, thank you so much!
Now that we've passed our sixth stretch goal, eight pages of bonus material will be added to the books, including concept art and a Ripple Kingdom tour. Also! If your pledge reward includes the print set, you'll now be receiving seven characters instead of six.
If we raise $5,000 more, the books will include an exclusive, 10-page comic about some characters we haven't seen in a little while. I think you'll enjoy it!

Just one day after launch, the CQ Book Two Kickstarter has surpassed its funding goal by over $16,000! Thank you so much for your overwhelming support. I'm so excited to print the best books I possibly can for you guys!
Please be sure to check the project page for more on our stretch goals. If we raise $30,000, the books will include 4 exclusive pages of Chapter 1 concept art.
Also, since the $45 reward tier (softcover + bookplate + prints + PDF) sold out so quickly, I've opened up 50 more spots. If you missed out earlier, now's your chance!

campaign.story:
The Reward?
The Reward is a nine-minute animated short directed by Mikkel Mainz Elkjær and Kenneth Ladekjær. It is their graduation film at the animation workshop. For more information, visit the short's BLOG.
"Courageous, exuberant animation. You sense the creators striving to top each other in each frame. This is a world bursting with life."
- David Hellman - Artist of "Braid"
"An epic journey beautifully compressed in a short!  While being wacky and fun, the film managed to address a more philosophical perspective toward what is truly most meaningful- the reward of achieving a goal or the experience of the journey."
- Mike Nguyen - Animation lead on Warner Bros' "The Iron Giant"
STRETCH GOALS!!
FIRST STRETCH GOAL REACHED!
We can now make the first episode of "The Tales of Alethrion". From now on the higher we reach the greater the quality of the first episode will be. Let's see how far we can get with these last days - Thank you!
FINAL EVENT: 05/04/2013
03:30 PM (New York Time)
Go here to learn more
EVENT #2 - DRAWING CONTEST: Winner Kalen Knowles! 

CHECK OUT THE UPDATE AND THE TOP 10 DRAWINGS HERE!
We need your help! Go HERE to learn more.
Due to popular demand we repost this video of The Dunes of Kahltofal:
Music by: Mathias Winum
- - The Reward game - -
~Click the image to play the game!~
Finally the game is online! Grab a friend, slay monsters and highfive your way to online glory! Play as the two main characters Vito and Wilhelm and test your friendship!


Things we will improve if we reach the Pledge goal!
More fine tuned and stable gameplay
A new enemy - "The slime tadpole"
1P / 2P version
New stages
New playable characters
Downloadable version for Mac, Windows and Linux
What happens to the map and the people involved after Wilhelm and Vito pass it on to a new generation? How did the map come to be, and what is the story of the great mirror and the treasure behind it? Who is the character amongst all the treasures at the end, and why is he holding the treasure chest so tightly?
Embark on a journey through a world filled with wonders. Experience the unexpected as we take you through different cultures and species found in these lands. Hear the story of the greatest hero of them all. The one who founded the era of heroes and valor but who's own story ends in grief and regret. This is "The Tales of Alethrion"
The first episode will tell the tale of the legend behind the mirror and why the map was created. Afterwards the story picks up just as Vito's and Wilhelm's epic quest has been concluded. They are now old and mighty heroes who wander the world. The next episodes will focus on new adventurers who travel out and explore the world. They will all be connected by the treasure map and influenced by the spirit of Alethrion.
What we would like to do with this series is to further develop the universe that we created during the making of "The Reward". There were so many possibilities which we didn't use in the short film and from the very beginning we wanted it to work like a pilot. In our opinion "The Reward" is a new take on the fantasy genre and has a spirit of wanderlust and fun and not the classic good versus evil. We want to focus on characters and their individual journeys and make stories that challenge the traditional ways of telling a story. It's important to us that the characters we create feel alive and full of personality. It is our belief that the story and humour will be best told with strong characters.
We want to make the series closely connected to the short film, but still have it's own appeal as well. It's important that it follows the spirit but delivers something new. We don't want to just copy the succes but we want to explore the same universe and feel of The Reward.
We love animation, we love fantasy and we love to make great stories. We see this as a possibility to take the fantasy genre in a direction that is mixed with the modern world and the values we have today. We hope you will help us get this project on it's feet so we can create something so magical, so epic, so insanely crazy... that you just might go blind...
Who are "Sun Creature studio"?
We are the three united beings of Bo Juhl, Mikkel Mainz and Kenneth Ladekjær. After we graduated from the animation workshop in Viborg we decided to make our own animation studio. We want to explore the 2D world of animation and try to push the boundaries and limitations that animation has today.
We want to keep a playful and experimenting animation style, but still with the most interesting look possible. We want to keep the industry moving forward, and work with talented and good people inside and outside of Denmark.
For now we are focusing on the series "Tales of Alethrion", based on the universe of the short film "The Reward", directed by Mikkel Mainz and Kenneth Ladekjær. Bo Juhl was the director of "Under the fold", another of the bachelor films of the Animation Workshop 2013.
We are looking for possible business partners and co-producers who would like to be a part of this epic series.
Our weapon of choice considering animation is Tv-Paint! Nice and easy program with lots of possibilities.
check out our website and showreel
The journey to make a series:
First we will produce the visual foundations and write the basis of the story line for the whole series. We will be setting the style, making animation tests, exploring and drawing lots of characters and environments, and much, much more.
This step will be about finalizing the script for the first episode. While writing this, we will also be making the storyboard for the episode. This is a very interesting point in the production since this is where the cinematography and the scenes and clips of the episode will be settled.
This is where we can start working on the animatic for the short. This will settle the editing and cutting of the episode. This is crucial for the tempo, drama and humour. With the animatic you will get a very accurate sense of how the episode is going to look like. Think of it as a moving comicbook. Moreover we will also work on finalizing many of the visual elements at this point.
This will be the point where we will grab ahold of our faveourite bardic talent Mathias Winum, creater of the OST of "The Reward". With the animatic done and therefore the timing done we can start working on the epic score and theme for the hero Alethrion!! Now we will also be drawing the Layouts for every shot. At this point we can also open up our trusty animation program Tv-paint and start animating actual scenes!
This step is the last effort to pull the dragon out of its tower. We will be coloring all of the animation scenes made in the previous step. We will be upgrading the layouts to actual painted backgrounds. Finally, every shot needs to be composited so they look nice and consistent. It's a long and hard process but it will be worth it when we look back.
Having reached the final goal, you have not only made us forever grateful, you have also made us able to finish the production of the first episode! We will be able to finish the animation, background painting, final editing and compositing. With the first episode of "The Tales of Alethrion" we have created the stepping stone of the series in the spirit and style we want. This will give us a lot more freedom when we take this project further. With the backup from you guys we will be able to convince future investors to give us artistic freedom so we can give you an epic fantasy series just like "The Reward".
The more support and funding you give us the better we can push the quality of the first episode and thereby the series!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The goal with the KS campaign is to produce the first episode. The better the funding goes the better the episode will be. The better the episode will be the easier it will be for us to take the project further and make the series a reality.

There are certain challenges financially, since we want to create a whole series. At the moment, we are planning on making 12 episodes of 7.5 minutes, but for now it can change since we haven't decided on what platform(s) it shall be published on - television, internet, mobile devices, etc.
As mentioned earlier, this is a step towards finding investors and funding for the entire series.

We have- and will invest a lot of our own time in this project, and will do our best to bring you the entire thing. It will be the best quality possible, and we will keep on exploring and playing in the style of The Reward. We will keep telling the best stories possible that are targeted at teenagers and adults.
The violence and irony might be an obstacle for finding the money for the project. Though, to be able to make this world believable, exciting and fresh we think that breaking concervative rules most be done. We want the viewer to expect the unexpected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dearest Backers! 
It’s been a while since you last heard the horn blow over the mountains.
Tales of Alethrion has been on a pause for more than a year… but now it is coming back! I, Mikkel Mainz, director of the series, researcher of Alethrion, have left Sun Creature and will be continuing the project in my new studio Skjald. campaign.story:
----------------------------------------------------
Stretch Goals and New Rewards!
----------------------------------------------------
JUST TO CLARIFY- tiers saying their backers will receive all the extras include the newly added rewards without additional cost. The t-shirt is NOT included with sets of extras, and is only available with a $35 pledge, and pledge above $100.
------
Original reward extras (available no matter the goal):
Two 13crowns stickers
Two 5 x 7 inch prints of illustrations from the book
The GhostBook decal
The GhostBook charm
- REACHED! $9,500 | 5 NEW ARTISTS IN THE BOOK!
- REACHED! $10,000 | New rewards available: A set of 4 new stickers by Shy Custis, a bookmark by Felix Kramer!
- REACHED! $10,200 | New rewards available: A PDF copy of the book for all pledges $60 and above.
- REACHED! $10,500 | New rewards available: A magnet by Reapersun, a memo pad by RJ Britton!
- REACHED! $11,000 | New rewards available: Antiqued-silver Ghostbook lapel pins, a memo pad by Coey!
- REACHED! $12,000 | KickStarter-exclusive embossed cover-sleeve for all physical copies of the book given to backers.
- REACHED! $14,000 | KickStarter-exclusive hard-cover copies of GhostBook. One copy for all pledges $300 and above, and a very limited amount at $120.
- REACHED$15,000 | KickStarter-exclusive GhostBook t-shirt available through a tier of its own, or with pledges of $100 and above.

Continuing our collection of themed compilation books, 13crowns is happy to announce GhostBook! 
Comprised of 60 artists, GhostBook features illustrations and short comics with a ghost theme. GhostBook will be sized 8.5 x 11 inches with over 80 pages of art, ranging from comical to gruesomely wonderful!
We were so happy having managed to gather such a large variety of talented people, both friends and those we would have never been able to find alone. This book was our biggest endeavor yet, with more than 5 time the artists we've collected to date, and more than double the pagecount! With as proud we are of it, we wanted to make a big to-do for its release- specialty decals, stickers and the like -but such a big book, alone, is expensive enough to make, let alone the extras. So we need your help!
To go a long with the book, we're hoping to raise the funds to make GhostBook charms, stickers and decals! These will be available for sale separately later, or as rewards for pledges here on KickStarter! 
Any additional funding will go to a special edition dust-jacket, only available to those who helped fund the project.
Featured artists, in alphabetical order:
Anissa Espinosa | Aramis September | Arden Powell | Ash Evans
Ashley Mackenzie | Casey Parris | Ciaran Gaffney | Coey Kuhn
D Marciniak | Dechanique | Derrewyn | Elda Thé | Fabio Barboni
Felicia Choo | Felix Kramer | Fyodor Pavlov | Jasmine Darnell 
Jemma Salume | Jon Carling | Joobr | Kanesha C Bryant
Kaysha Siemens | Kelly Bastow | Kevin Blasius | KR Mayer
Kristen Starlein | Kristen Nicole | Kylie DiOrio | Laura Croft | Liz Walcher  Llewellyn | Lyle Lynde | Mac Matthiesen | Margaret Hardy | Mari Costa 
Mariel Hester | Mia Maria | Mimi Stanton-Gullak | Ms Rosek 
Myra Bergsteinsdottir | NAAN | Nadia Enis | Natsuko Porcino
Papierteufel | Reapersun | Renee Britton | Rhapsodii | RJ Britton
Samantha Mash | Saprophilous | Sebastian Jordan | Shy Custis
Sloth | Stephanie Kao | Tanya Zolotareva | Tara Fernon
Tessa Lowe | Trungles | Wai | Zélie Bérubé
For information on past projects, or to keep up on upcoming ones, please visit the 13crowns studio site, Tumblr, and FaceBook page!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest foreseeable problem at this point is if something were to be delayed on our printer's end. We've used this self-publishing printing company for all of our books, and they have always been extremely reliable and fast. At this point, all our participants have turned their art in, and the book is already formatted and ready to go to print. All we need is funding to get them made!

We do many online sales and are regularly shipping orders out to customers, so any problems with lost items and delayed delivery will be handled with experience and quickly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I have a lot of apologies to issue- for the past week and a half we've been off the radar due to a loss in the family. Coey and I are both getting the ball rolling again finally.
I've been getting an outpouring of questions about the status of GhostBook, and I'm sorry I haven't replied to quite a few of you yet. It's taking a long time to get through everything with how much we're still trying to get back into the grove of things.
We were told that the slipcovers finished late last week/early this week but we still haven't heard about when they'll ship, or if they have. The sales rep for the company was supposed to call me yesterday, but I never heard from him and they aren't open on the weekends, unfortunately. I'm terribly sorry this delay has drawn on so long, its been extraordinarily frustrating having the hold up out of our hands with us unable to do much in speeding things up.

updates.update_userinfo: GhostBook up for general sale! (And PDF troubleshooting)
updates.update_content:
We've gotten a lot of questions from those getting only the extras when the book will be up for general sale- well here it is!
We've put a disclaimer on the sales page that orders of the book will not be shipped out for 2-3 weeks. This is because the backers here on KS who pledged to get a physical copy take priority. We are packaging and shipping all copies for KS backers before any general sale books go out. We felt this is only fair given how long it's taken for those to go out in the first place.

We are still waiting on the slip covers. We were originally quoted a 2-week turnaround, but then it took over a week of communication with the producer to get them to understand what exactly we were wanting them to make for us. Once that was finally established, we were given a 4-week turnaround, which means we should be getting them very soon, Though there still seems to be a bit of confusion about the ink colour choices, which Coey is sorting out with them now.
Everyone who pledged at the PDF level was sent the link to download their PDF. We've had a couple requests to send it through DropBox, so I will be trying to figure that out and set it up tonight, at which point that option will be sent to everyone as well.
We've started sending out all rewards which don't include a physical copy of the book. If you post photos, please let us know, or tag it as 13crowns on Tumblr; we'd love to post it on the !

Hello everyone!
It's been trudging along, but we're finally almost done! And in the next few days we're going to start shipping out packages for people who pledged to get the extras and shirts, as well as getting the PDF to everyone of the proper tier in the next week or so!
The books will be here tomorrow, but there was a lot of problems getting the slip cover sorted, and we're not sure when that will be in. We'll keep you updated as we get statuses on that. But because of the delay with slipcovers, the backers getting physical books will have to wait a while, unfortunately. Which is why we're releasing the PDF's shortly!

Hello, everyone!
Things are going slowly, but steadily!
The books got held up a bit- my bank kept declining the printer's charge, thinking it was ID fraud because of it being such an giNORmous amount. Even though I called them twice to tell them otherwise. But it finally went through so we should have them soon!
In the meantime, we've been getting everything else together and ready for the book's arrival. We'll probably begin shipping out stuff to people who are just getting the books- we'll let you know when that process starts!

campaign.story:
Thanks to everyone for a successful Kickstarter! If you missed out, I’m going to try and get as many of the individual books in this collection available for whatever you want to pay over at the-whole-story.com as soon as possible! We have lots more in store! You can follow us on Twitter, Facebook, or join our mailing list!
------------and now back to your regularly scheduled programming-------
The Whole Story is all about digital done right. We put our time and money into offering the best first-run comics, new translations, and high quality, complete versions of old favorites. We don’t force you to read them on certain devices or in certain apps, we let you download and keep your comics forever. We don’t force you to pay more than cover price, we let you name your own price.
Our books are bundled together in pay-what-you-want collections, and every book we bring you is a complete, stand-alone story. No cliffhangers that force you to pay more to find out what happens next! You can choose between Retina-resolution PDFs (for the highest quality), Web-resolution PDFs (for easy storage), or CBZs (in both resolutions, for use in comic-reading apps), all of which are DRM-free so you can download and keep them forever.
The success of our Summer 2012 collection showed that many people agree with us about how awesome digital can be! Now we’re back with our brand new Winter 2013 collection and we’re turning to Kickstarter to make it the best it can be!
THE WINTER 2013 COLLECTION
Four awesome brand new comics made just for this collection! You get all 300+ pages, no matter what you pledge!
This Was Our Pact is a brand new 78 page adventure from Ryan Andrews. It's about a group of kids who decide to ride farther than they've ever gone before. Those that stick to the rules find that there they be more truth to their town's legend than they thought.
The Dog's Sins is a new 22 page story from KC Green. Rachel knew her old dog Buster was a pain in the butt, but she didn’t know he was such a bad dog that a powerful being was coming to make sure his sins were paid for. Unfortunately for her, it was decided that she would be the one doing the paying. Someone’s got to scape that goat! Note: If you’re a backer, you can download your copy of this book right now! It’s in a backer’s only post!
Plagued by Ryan Estrada (that’s me!) is a 38 page book that tells the true story of a fake apocalypse. It chronicles the most terrifying (at the time) and hilarious (in retrospect) night of my life when a plague of locusts, a rain of frogs, and even more terrifying sights convinced me I was in the path of a tsunami. The book also includes a completely redrawn version of Looh’s Story, based word-for-word on an account from an amazing family who really did live through the 2004 tsunami. I’ve been waiting nine years to make this book and share these stories with you! Note: If you’re a backer, you can download your copy of this book right now! It’s in a backer’s only post!
Definition of Dead Body by Jang Young, is a brand new English translation of the 164 page South Korean graphic novel about the interconnecting stories of a late wife, a dead goldfish, and a lost stuffed animal. Jang Young is an amazing artist, and she uses a variety of art styles to illustrate the power of loss at different stages of a man's life.
...but that’s not all! To reward our awesome backers for supporting the new collection, we have lots more comics in store for you!
THE DOUBLE COMICS COLLECTION
To thank our backers who beat the Whole Story average and pay $13 or more, I’m putting together five more ebooks, featuring some of my favorite stories from our Whole Story artists. That brings you up to 800+ pages!
The Anime Club by KC Green, now in ebook format for the first time! Complete with all the extras and bonus stories from the print edition! It’s the hilarious story of a group of American kids who take their Japanese animation way too seriously. (140 pages)
Nothing is Forgotten by Ryan Andrews is the beautiful book whose print edition was tearing up Kickstarter the last time we released a bundle! It collects the stories Sarah and the Seed, Our Bloodstained Roof, Nothing is Forgotten, One Last Snowfall and The Tunnel. (192 pages)
Son of a Father is the first complete collection of Nam Dong Yoon’s strip about a boy trying hard to look up to his father. It’s also the strip’s first time in English! When I announced that the new collection featured a new South Korean artist, a number of Dong Yoon’s newfound fans lamented that there was no new comics from him! So I added them into the double comics collection to make up for it! MORE PAGES ADDED! (157 pages)
(Preview art only. Final will be translated.)
Freelancer Report by Nam Dong Yoon is a story about what it’s like being a freelance cartoonist in Bucheon, the city of cartoonists in South Korea. Spoiler: It’s not too different from being a freelancer anywhere else, but Nam Dong Yoon makes it much funnier. MORE PAGES ADDED! (27 pages)
There’s also been a fifth book added to this collection! 88 Blues is a Nam Dong Yoon story about college life in Korea! (24 pages)
THE SUMMER 2012 COLLECTION
If you beat the Kickstarter average and pay $26 or more, you can also get your hands on the entire original Whole Story collection! Many of these comics have not been available anywhere since! That brings you up to 1700+ pages!
Fusion Elementary and Fusion Future are chock full of beautiful art by Nam Dong Yoon that has been remixed into a series of intertwining stories by the best writers in indie comics, from Andrew Hussie to Zach Weiner!
That includes stories from:
Andrew Hussie, Anthony Clark,
Audra Furuichi, C. Spike Trotman, 
David Hellman,  David Malki !,
Don Hertzfeldt, Dorothy Gambrell,
Doug TenNapel, Erika Moen,
Gordon McAlpin, Jeffrey Brown,
Jessica Mcleod, Josh Fruhlinger,
Katie Cook, KC Green
Malachai Nicolle, Meredith Gran,
Michael “Mookie" Terracciano,
Nicholas Gurewitch, Rebecca Clements,
Ryan Estrada, Ryan North,
Shaenon Garrity, and Zach Weiner.
You Can Do It, Dong-Gu! is a Nam Dong Yoon story about a boy who decides to become Superman, even before he can wipe his own Bum. A Heart of Stone Work, Walk Like a Sumerian and The Great Disappointment are Box Brown books about religions, myths, ideas and cultures from all over the world. The Kind is a Ryan Estrada graphic novel about what werewolves do between full moons. You can see more previews by watching the original project video.
What if you already HAVE the original collection? Well, we just unlocked another seven books that will be added to every tier $26 or higher! It’s the KC Green Collection! Question Hound’s Puzzletorium! The Blood Cloud! Secret Midnite Duck Party! The 3 Minis! Midnite Surprise! Shrekless Abandon! Horribleville! All yours!
ADDITIONAL REWARDS
We’re so thankful for your support we’re putting together some other rewards that will be mailed out to backers!
mockup. final size of new book not yet determined.
The Learn to Read Korean Comics Collection was made in celebration of all the great South Korean comics we’ve translated for you! I did a comic a while back called Learn To Read Korean in 15 Minutes that went crazy-viral and taught millions of people Hangeul. I’m putting together a new travel-size print edition, and bundling it with a bunch of my Korean-language print comics. There’s the first volume Aki Alliance, and my Korea-exclusive collection of pocket-sized minis, Michingu (they feature simple words and Korean puns, so they’re great for learning.)
Prize packs I’ve got a giant pile of original art, hand-cut stickers, minicomics, bookmarks, magnetic poetry comic sets, sketchbooks with hand-drawn covers, hand-decorated paper lanterns and other handmade goodies, and I’m going to spend the month making more of them! Each prize pack will be different, and designed just for you, but all of them will be awesome.
We’ve even unlocked some additional rewards! Everyone who pledges $49 or more will get a 4-pack of exclusive pocket-sized minicomics, as well as a brand new print edition of Mystical Monkey, my story from Flight: Volume 4.
detail from bookmark design for Definition of Dead Body
What else? I’ve put together some prize packs to begin with, but since this is name-your-price, I’ll keep adding more as I see what people choose to pay! If you surprise me with your generosity, I will find a way to reward you!
Where is the money going?
from The Dog’s Sins
The amount we’re asking for covers the advances I’ve already given out, and the translation fees I’ve already paid. Anything above that is distributed among the artists. I am one of the artists, but all of the rewards come out of my share, and what’s left of my share goes right back into The Whole Story, to pay advances to the next batch of artists to make more great new comics!
Thank you so much for checking out this project.
I hope you like all the amazing comics we’ve put together for you. You can share this page with your friends easily! Just send them to the-whole-story.com I want everyone who loves comics as much as I do to have the chance to get all these super great books!
from This Was Our Pact
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This collection isn’t just an idea. It’s a massive undertaking that we’ve been hard at work for for the last six months. There are still some pages in the works, some translators to hire, and some finishing touches to do, but this is happening!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Our third Fortnightly comic Seomyeon John is running a little late because it's turning out really good so I went a little crazy and it ballooned from a 30 page short into a 67 page epic. It's one of my favorite things I've ever worked on, I think you're gonna like it. It will be hitting the inboxes of fortnightly subscribers ASAP.
Here's some preview art:

updates.update_userinfo: Last day for The Whole Story 2014!
updates.update_content: If you haven't checked out our new offerings for 2014, time is almost up! We're already fully funded, but there's still 20 hours left to pay as little as a dang dollar for 18 issues of Broken Telephone. That's just craaaazy cheap! Broken Telephone: The Whole Story 2014

Some people have been confused about their Korean ultra-minis, so if you got the “Korean Comics” collection delivered to your door, listen up!
In your package you got four bookmark-sized prints with goofy Korean characters on each side. Fold those in half so that the cover is on the front, and those are your minis! They’ll fit in your wallet so you can see weird Korean jokes you can’t understand any time!
I left them unfolded in the interest of getting them to you faster and safer!

Well, that’s that!
I’ve sent out all the digital rewards, and all the physical packages! There are of course still some FUTURE COMICS involved, so you all will be getting surprise bonus comics for some time as thanks for supporting this project, but everything from Whole Story Winter 2013 is done!
I made BFFs with staff of my local Korean Post-Office because I kept showing up with mountains of envelopes that got bigger and heavier and crazier with each trip. I had to borrow handcarts from the little old ladies in my neighborhood to transport them.

updates.update_userinfo: Your comics pages have been updated!
updates.update_content:
I’ve added plenty more comics to your download pages!
If you got the Double Comics Collection, you’ll now have access to Son of a Father and 88 Blues, by Nam Dong Yoon.
Even if you didn’t everybody now has lots of bonus materials now added to their pages! Plagued! The Musical, Road Comics, Z, and lots more!

As part of my quest to make up for the original-art-from-comics shortage, I’m drawing animals for backers. I’ve been Google Image searching animal types and drawing all the species that pop up. “Cool Looking Animals” “cute rodents” ‘cool monkeys” “just pugs” etc. 100 of 173 completed!

Every surface of my office is covered in books, prints, stickers, envelopes, sketches, and who knows what else! (I know) (but some of it is secret)
These suckers are going out soon, so if you’re waiting on a physical prize pack and haven’t filled out your backer survey, do it up!
This has been a crazy-fun challenge! Usually all my problem solving has involved getting rid of unsold stock. This went so crazy well I’ve been to every single art supply store in Busan to pick up enough of everything. An hour on a bus to clear two stores out of the four sketchbooks a piece they have, then back again the next day after they restock. But I got everything I needed!( I think I accidentally caused a run on black sketchbooks in Korea because every shop seems to have ordered a crate because of the brief spike in demand I caused.)

I just got a big old batch of Mystical Monkey books delivered!
I’ll be picking up a few more odds and ends this weekend in Seoul, then I’ll start sending out physical reward packages!
In the mean time, what do you think of the digital comics? What are your favorites? What would you like to see more of in the next bundle?

Your digital comics have been delivered!
Thank you so much everybody. I owe you a great big, huge blubbering mess of a grateful update post here, but I’ve been doing nonstop pdf exporting, translation rewriting, and lettering since this ended to make sure you had your comics before I had to catch my plane to Japan in-- oh crap, I kinda should have left by now.

campaign.story:
Benign Kingdom is a creator-owned publishing project designed to showcase the art of independent comic creators. It was founded by Evan Dahm (Rice Boy), Becky Dreistadt & Frank Gibson (Tiny Kitten Teeth), KC Green (Gunshow), and Yuko Ota & Ananth Panagariya (Johnny Wander), with assistance by George Rohac (GRohac). In the Spring of 2012 it released 4 high quality art books and a collected hardcover featuring Evan, Becky, KC, and Yuko’s work.  
In the Fall of 2012 they followed this up with another collection featuring the work of Emmy Cicierega (www.emmyc.com) Anthony Clark (Nedroid) Danielle Corsetto (Girls with Slingshots) Aaron Diaz (Dresden Codak). This, too, was well received. 
So we're pleased to debut -
Emily Carroll - emcarroll.com
Gigi D.G. - cucumber.gigidigi.com
Tyson Hesse - boxerhockey.com
Phil McAndrew - philintheblanks.com
As with the prior seasons our goal is to produce an individual art book for each artist but also manufacture a hardcover edition that collects all four of their individual books in one beautiful collection.
If you back this Kickstarter you're saving upwards of 34% off the regular retail price we will be selling them at.  
Since we met our goal we have a Push Scroll of new Goals to hit to make the books and rewards even better!
Additionally if we make our goal we intend to have -
If this is successful we will debut early copies of this collection at the EMERALD CITY COMICON March 1-3 in Seattle, WA. The quantities of Spring 2013 we will have at the show will be very limited, since the bulk shipment will not be delivered until Mid-Late March, so we cannot let backers pick up at the show. We feel bad about that so we'll have the backer list at the show and if you are a backer and swing by our booth we'll be giving away a special print JUST to backers as an added thank you!
Benign Kingdom would like to thank Hannah Lee Stockdale for making all the graphics on this Kickstarter page.
The music in the video was graciously supplied and performed by Brian Fukushima.

Thanks so much for supporting B9! We're super excited to announce that our art book series has returned to Kickstarter with a brand new set for 2016!
The 2016 B9 collection is now available on Kickstarter featuring new books by our brand new featured artists Meredith Gran and Dustin Harbin alongside first generation B9 artists Evan Dahm & Becky Dreistadt.
If you missed out on any of the other sets, we're offering those as part of package deals to so you can fill the gaps in your collection.
Your backing in previous years has allowed us to print thousands of art books at affordable prices, exposing huge numbers of new people to the fine art of comic artists. Thank you so much for your support and we hope you enjoy the new books,

Hello Everyone!
We just wanted to let you all know that the Spring 2013 collection is now available at our online store.
Since the Limited edition Hardcovers just shipped we aren't listing them just yet in case there are any problems with transit to the backers who supported us for the campaign.

Hi everyone, 
As we reported the other week the USPS lost the signed bookplates for a while as they were making their way between creators. We finally got in the fully signed bookplates RIGHT before we had to leave for TCAF. Travel took a little longer than expected and we didn't make it home until yesterday afternoon. 
We're now working on getting everything packed up and will have all tiers that included a limited bookplate edition out within a week. Thanks again for your support!

Just as we were just about to reprint and start from scratch they found and delivered them. They are now being worked on by the final member of the team and will soon be in our hands for processing.
What this means for everyone else is -

Hello everyone!
We've shipped out about half the rewards at this point. We're a little behind on the bookplate editions since the artists are so spread out for this season, but we still anticipate getting them all out by the end of the month. Woo!
In the next week or two we'll email everyone and make a backers only update with instructions on how to get your PDFs. Thanks!

Hi Everyone,
Ananth Panagariya and George Rohac went to the printer to do a press check to make sure the quality of the books was up to par. We posted a few short videos and images on our tumblr and twitter accounts.
We're also working through all the images to make a nice post here on kickstarter of the process of press checking a book and everything that went into it.

You've met yet another push goal. Amazing! Now all the prints are going to be all the larger for you to love. 
That's NINE prints total with one going to all backers receiving a physical shipment! We can't wait to get these all printed and out to you!

updates.update_userinfo: 45K Push Goal Met and an Hour Left!

campaign.story:
Robotpencil.org
Twitter
Facebook
HOORAY! We did it! Thanks so much for all the support guys! You have shown that the art community is a good one to be a part of, and I am glad I have backers like you! I have a new stretch goal of $40,000! 
Also the Video below has not been updated, Will update tomorrow Jan 18th 2013!
I've upgraded all the prizes so when you scroll down to see the images below, they will all have changed! The text to the right where you actually pledge cannot be changed since it has been already been backed by people so this is the only way I can let you know.  Thanks again and feel free to ask any more questions if you have any! I'll be making a FAQ soon for the bottom!
WHAT'S IN THE BOOK
128 pages. Print size 8.5x11. A little over half will be devoted to purely art and narrative, the rest will be instructional “The making of Heaven’s Hell.”
A brief insight into the narrative: Heaven's Hell takes place in the afterlife where humans reside alongside creatures assembled from foreign lands which are worlds apart. In the book you can expect a deep exploration of existence in Heaven’s Hell including character descriptions, weapon designs and story beats. I aim to showcase my work, give back to my fans, and inspire others to develop their skill and explore their own imaginations.  
GOALS(Why Kickstarter)-
Kickstarter will help me reach out to my fans in a way that traditional (behind-closed-doors) publishing falls short. I want you to be a part of this process – to see how it happens from inside the artist’s studio, and I can’t do that unless I get you involved from the beginning. My publisher Design Studio Press will allow me to craft the highest quality of art books for fans worldwide, and their favorable publishing agreement means that your contribution skips the middle man and goes straight towards the publication of this book. After release, all profits from Heaven’s Hell will go toward my next art or educational book so that I can continue doing what I love and giving back to my fans.
Thanks to all of my friends and family for all your support. And all of my fans who believe in me and have encouraged me to this point. I already feel accomplished, and it is mostly because of you all. I promise to get this art book done no matter what, as a personal thank you for all your faith in me.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Developing an Art book is no easy task and I will face obstacles along the way. I wouldn’t feel right giving you anything less than the highest quality of materials that I can deliver. My time is limited, but the success of this Kickstarter campaign will give me the extra freedom I need to devote my full focus toward the completion of Heaven’s Hell. I have already started about 80% of my content, and I will be spending the time you provide me with to flesh out the rest of the Heaven’s Hell universe. I will keep you updated with teasers along the way.

Rewarding those who back me is a high priority of mine. In order to guarantee that the rewards I offer are delivered in a timely matter, I have prepared to take off the time required to create my prizes once my funding goal has been reached. I have very limited amount of prizes, and kept them very practical, but at a high value to my fans.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Johnny Wander is a sweet charm-of-life comic by Yuko Ota and Ananth Panagariya. It's been published on the web since 2009 and you can read all of it for free at johnnywander.com! The comic encompasses life after college, growing up, and all the little things in between. In 2010 we self-published Johnny Wander Vol. 1: Don't Burn the House Down, followed by JW Vol. 2: Escape to New York in 2011.
We put this project together to help fund a print run of JW Vol. 3: Ballad of Laundry Cat, and to reprint JW Vol. 1. All three volumes are available through this Kickstarter, so you can get one, two, or all three of the books right here!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Ananth and Yuko have been working in webcomics since 2003. They began Johnny Wander in 2009. They have laid out and sent two of their own books to the print (JW Vol. 1 & JW Vol. 2). Ananth has also done layout and design for the Benign Kingdom project. He also freelances with a variety of clients doing the same work (bigger publishers, independent and webcomics), ensuring that books are delivered on time to the printer. 

Yuko and Ananth have also spent the past 5+ years designing merchandise, corresponding with various printers & manufacturers, and then shipping out the physical products to their readers directly. This includes a variety of items: books, t-shirts, tote bags, keychains, earrings, figurines, prints and more.
